en: It was on the dark side of twilight when we got to Bistritz, which is a very interesting old place. Being practically on the frontier—for the Borgo Pass leads from it into Bukovina—it has had a very stormy existence, and it certainly shows marks of it. Fifty years ago a series of great fires took place, which made terrible havoc on five separate occasions. At the very beginning of the seventeenth century it underwent a siege of three weeks and lost 13,000 people, the casualties of war proper being assisted by famine and disease.
vi: Chúng tôi tới Bistritz lúc nửa đêm. Như tôi đã nói, Bistritz là một thành phố cổ kính có quá khứ đặc biệt. Nằm gần đường biên giới - quả thực, khi rời Bistritz, chỉ cần vượt qua đèo Borgo là tới Bukovine - thành phố này đã trải qua biết bao thăng trầm mà nhiều dấu ấn của nó vẫn còn đọng lại đến ngày nay. Cách đây năm mươi năm, những trận hỏa hoạn ghê người xảy ra liên tục đã san phẳng tất cả. Vào đầu thế kỷ mười bảy, thành phố này cũng đã phải chống đỡ một cuộc vây hãm trong suốt ba tuần, khiến mười ba ngàn người phải bỏ mạng, đó là còn chưa kể tới các nạn nhân của đói kém và dịch bệnh.
tr: Çok ilginç eski bir yerleşim yeri olan Bistriţa’ya vardığımızda alacakaranlığın karanlık tarafı olmuştu. Neredeyse sınırda yer aldığından -zira Borgo Geçidi oradan başlayıp Bukovina’ya uzanıyordu- oldukça fırtınalı bir doğası var ve kesinlikle bunun izlerini taşıyor. Elli yıl önce, beş farklı zamanda korkunç hasara neden olan bir dizi büyük yangın yaşanmış. Şehir on yedinci yüzyılın hemen başında üç hafta süren bir kuşatmaya maruz kalmış ve nüfusundan 13. 000 kişiyi yitirmiş; savaşa has kayıplar kıtlık ve hastalık yüzünden artmış.
es: Ya estaba anocheciendo cuando llegamos a Bistritz, que es una antigua localidad muy interesante. Como está prácticamente en la frontera, pues el paso de Borgo conduce desde ahí a Bucovina, ha tenido una existencia bastante agitada, y desde luego pueden verse las señales de ella. Hace cincuenta años se produjeron grandes incendios que causaron terribles estragos en cinco ocasiones diferentes. A comienzos del siglo XVII sufrió un sitio de tres semanas y perdió trece mil personas, y a las bajas de la guerra se agregaron las del hambre y las enfermedades.
vi_translation: We arrived in Bistritz at midnight. As I mentioned, Bistritz is an ancient city with a unique past. Located near the border - indeed, when leaving Bistritz, just crossing the Borgo Pass leads to Bukovina - this city has experienced numerous ups and downs, many of which are still evident today. Fifty years ago, terrifying fires continuously occurred, flattening everything. At the beginning of the seventeenth century, this city also had to withstand a siege for three weeks, resulting in thirteen thousand deaths, not to mention the victims of famine and disease.
tr_translation: When we arrived in Bistriţa, a very interesting old settlement, it was the dark side of twilight. Since it is almost on the border - as the Borgo Pass starts there and extends to Bukovina - it has quite a stormy nature and definitely bears the traces of it. Fifty years ago, there was a series of major fires that caused terrible damage at five different times. At the very beginning of the seventeenth century, the city was subjected to a siege that lasted three weeks and lost 13,000 people from its population; war-related losses increased due to famine and disease.
es_translation: It was already getting dark when we arrived in Bistritz, which is a very interesting old town. Since it is practically on the border, as the Borgo Pass leads from there to Bucovina, it has had a rather turbulent existence, and you can certainly see the signs of it. Fifty years ago, there were major fires that caused terrible devastation on five different occasions. At the beginning of the 17th century, it endured a three-week siege and lost thirteen thousand people, with casualties from war compounded by those from hunger and disease.
st: E ne e le lehlakoreng le lefifi la twilight ha re fihla Bistritz, e leng sebaka sa khale se khahlisang haholo. ʻO ka ʻōnaehana ʻana o ka ʻōnaehana ʻana o ka ʻōnaehana. Lilemong tse mashome a mahlano tse fetileng ho ile ha etsahala letoto la mollo o moholo, e leng se ileng sa etsa hore ho be le ntho e tšabehang liketsahalong tse hlano tse arohaneng. Qalong ea lekholo la leshome le metso e supileng la lilemo, e ile ea thibella libeke tse tharo 'me ea lahleheloa ke batho ba 13,000, likotsi tsa ntoa hantle li thuswa ke tlala le lefu.
yo: Ó wà ní ẹ̀gbẹ́ òkùnkùn twilight nígbà tí a dé Bistritz, èyí tí ó jẹ́ ibi àtijọ́ tí ó dùn gan-an. Wíwà ní ààlà - fún Borgo Pass yọrí sí láti inú rẹ̀ sí Bukovina- ó ti ní ìjì líle, ó sì fi àmì rẹ̀ hàn dájúdájú. Àádọ́ta ọdún sẹ́yìn ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ iná ńlá wáyé, èyí tí ó ba nkan jẹ́ ní ìgbà márùn-ún ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀. Ní ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ọgọ́rùn-ún ọdún kẹtàdínlógún ó ṣe ìkọlù ọ̀sẹ̀ mẹ́ta ó sì pàdánù ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà 13,000 ènìyàn, ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ogun tí ìyàn àti àrùn ń ràn lọ́wọ́ dáadáa.
tn: E ne e le mo letlhakoreng le le lefifi la phirimane fa re goroga kwa Bistritz, e leng lefelo la bogologolo le le kgatlhang thata. Ka go bo e le mo molelwaneng—gonne Borgo Pass e tswa mo go yone e tsena mo Bukovina—e nnile le sefefo se segolo thata, mme eleruri e bontsha matshwao a yone. Dingwaga di le 50 tse di fetileng go ne ga nna le motseletsele wa melelo e megolo, e e neng ya baka tshenyo e e boitshegang mo makgetlong a le matlhano a a farologaneng. Kwa tshimologong fela ya lekgolo la dingwaga la bolesome le bosupa e ne ya dikaganyediwa dibeke di le tharo mme ya latlhegelwa ke batho ba le 13 000, batho ba ba neng ba bolawa ke ntwa ka tshwanelo ba ne ba thusiwa ke leuba le malwetse.
ty: Tei te pae poiri o te pouri i to matou tapaeraa ' tu i Bistritz, te hoê vahi tahito anaanatae roa. No te mea tei ni'a oia i te oti'a fenua—no te Borgo Pass, e arata'i te reira ia'na i Bukovina—e oraraa arepurepu mau, e e mea papû roa e faaiteraa te reira no te reira. A pae ahuru matahiti i teie nei, ua tupu te hoê anairaa auahi rahi, o tei faahuehue roa e pae taime taa ê. I te omuaraa iho o te senekele ahuru ma hitu, ua haaatihia oia e toru hebedoma e ua pohe 13 000 taata, ua tauturuhia te feia i pohe i te tama'i e te o'e e te ma'i.
mai: जखन हम बिस्ट्रिट्ज पहुँचलहुं तखन ई गोधूलिक अन्हार दिस छल, जे एकटा बहुत रोचक पुरान जगह अछि। व्यावहारिक रूपसँ सीमा पर होयबाक कारण- किएक तँ बोर्गो दर्रा एकरासँ बुकोविना धरि जाइत अछि - एकर अस्तित्व बहुत तूफानी रहल अछि, आ ई निश्चित रूपसँ एकर निशान देखबैत अछि। पचास साल पहिने पैघ आगि लगबाक एकटा श्रृंखला भेल छल, जे पाँच अलग-अलग अवसर पर भयानक तबाही मचा देलक। सत्रहम शताब्दीक आरम्भमे एकर तीन सप्ताहक घेराबन्दी भेल आ १३,००० लोकक मृत्यु भऽ गेल, युद्धक हताहतकेँ अकाल आ बीमारीसँ सहायता भेटल।
mg: Teo amin'ny lafiny maizina tamin'ny takariva no nahatongavanay tao Bistritz, izay toerana tena mahaliana taloha. Amin'ny maha-eo amin'ny sisin-tany azy—satria mitondra azy mankany Bukovina ny Borgo Pass — dia niaina fisiana tafio-drivotra be izy, ary azo antoka fa mampiseho marika amin'izany. Dimampolo taona lasa izay dia nisy afo lehibe maromaro, izay niteraka fahasimbana mahatsiravina tamin'ny fotoana dimy samihafa. Tamin'ny fiandohan'ny taonjato fahafito ambin'ny folo dia nandalo fahirano nandritra ny telo herinandro izy ary namoy olona 13.000, ny niharam-boina tamin'ny ady dia vokatry ny mosary sy ny aretina.

en: “My Friend.—Welcome to the Carpathians. I am anxiously expecting you. Sleep well to-night. At three to-morrow the diligence will start for Bukovina; a place on it is kept for you. At the Borgo Pass my carriage will await you and will bring you to me. I trust that your journey from London has been a happy one, and that you will enjoy your stay in my beautiful land.
vi: “Ông bạn thân mến, Hoan nghênh ông đã đến với rặng Carpates. Tôi rất sốt ruột chờ đợi ông. Chúc ông ngủ ngon đêm nay. Chuyến du lịch xe ngựa tới Bukovine vào chiều mai sẽ được bắt đầu vào lúc ba giờ, chỗ của ông đã được giữ trước. Xe của tôi sẽ đợi đón ông trên đèo Borgo. Hy vọng rằng từ Luân Đôn, cuộc hành trình của ông sẽ diễn ra thuận lợi, và ông sẽ cảm thấy thực sự thoải mái trong những ngày sống ở đất nước tươi đẹp của chúng tôi.
vi_results: "title": "The Exploits of Brigadier Gerard", "author": "Arthur Conan Doyle"
tr: Dostum, Karpat Dağlarına hoş geldiniz. Sizi sabırsızlıkla bekliyorum. Bu gece iyi uyuyun. Yarın saat üçte posta arabası Bukovina’ya doğru yola çıkacak; arabada sizin için yer ayrıldı. Arabam sizi Borgo Geçidinde bekleyecek ve sizi bana getirecek. Londra’dan buraya yolculuğunuzun iyi geçtiğini ve güzel topraklarımda geçireceğiniz zamandan keyif alacağınızı umuyorum.
es: "Mi querido amigo: bienvenido a los Cárpatos. Lo estoy esperando ansiosamente. Duerma bien, esta noche. Mañana a las tres saldrá la diligencia para Bucovina; ya tiene un lugar reservado. En el desfiladero de Borgo mi carruaje lo estará esperando y lo traerá a mi casa. Espero que su viaje desde Londres haya transcurrido sin tropiezos, y que disfrute de su estancia en mi bello país.
vi_translation: “Dear friend, Welcome to the Carpathians. I have been eagerly awaiting you. Wish you a good night's sleep tonight. The carriage trip to Bukovina tomorrow afternoon will start at three o'clock, your seat has been reserved. My carriage will be waiting to pick you up at the Borgo Pass. Hope that from London, your journey will be smooth, and you will feel truly comfortable during your days in our beautiful country.
tr_translation: My friend, Welcome to the Carpathian Mountains. I am eagerly awaiting you. Sleep well tonight. Tomorrow at three o'clock, the stagecoach will depart for Bukovina; a seat has been reserved for you. My carriage will wait for you at the Borgo Pass and will bring you to me. I hope your journey from London has been pleasant and that you will enjoy the time you spend in my beautiful lands.
es_translation: "My dear friend: welcome to the Carpathians. I am eagerly awaiting you. Sleep well tonight. Tomorrow at three, the coach for Bucovina will depart; you already have a reserved seat. At the Borgo Pass, my carriage will be waiting for you and will bring you to my house. I hope your journey from London has been smooth, and that you enjoy your stay in my beautiful country.
st: (1)>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Welcome to the baahelani. Ke lebelletse ho uena ka ho tšoenyeha. Robala hantle bosiu. Ka 3-mor'a ho feta boikitlaetso bo tla qala bakeng sa Bukovina; Bakeng sa sebaka seo u lokelang ho se boloketsoe. Ha ke le Tseleng ea Ka ea Borgo Pass e tla u emetse 'me e tla u tlisetsa eona. Ke ts'epa hore leeto la hau le tsoang London le bile le thabileng, le hore o tla natefeloa ke ho lula ha hau naheng ea ka e ntle.
yo: "My Friend.- Welcome to the Carpathians. Mò ń retí rẹ tọkàntọkàn. Sun daradara si alẹ. Ni mẹta si morrow awọn diligence yoo bẹrẹ fun Bukovina; Wọ́n tọ́jú ààyè kan sí i lórí rẹ̀ fún ẹ. Ní Borgo Pass ọkọ̀ mi yóò dúró dè ọ́ yóò sì mú ọ wá sọ́dọ̀ mi. Mo gbẹkẹle pe irin-ajo rẹ lati London ti jẹ ọkan ti o dun, ati pe iwọ yoo gbadun iduro rẹ ni ilẹ ẹlẹwa mi.

Robala sentle bosigo. 3-10-10 Jwale, ho tla ba le mekgahedi e 100 ya ho ya ho 20016; Go na le lefelo le le go tshwanetseng go nna mo go lona. Fa ke le mo tseleng e e yang kwa Goro, ke tla go isa kwa go wena. Ke solofela gore loeto lwa lona lo lo tswang kwa Lontone lo itumetse, mme lo tla itumelela go nna mo lefatsheng la me le lentle.
ty: " To'u hoa.—Manava i te mau taata tei tapitapi te mana'o. Te tia'i rû nei au ia outou. A taoto maitai i te pô. I te hora toru e te afa i muri mai e haamata ïa te ohipa no Bukovina ; ua faataahia te hoê vahi i ni'a iho no outou. en: When I got on the coach the driver had not taken his seat, and I saw him talking with the landlady. They were evidently talking of me, for every now and then they looked at me, and some of the people who were sitting on the bench outside the door—which they call by a name meaning “word-bearer”—came and listened, and then looked at me, most of them pityingly. I could hear a lot of words often repeated, queer words, for there were many nationalities in the crowd; so I quietly got my polyglot dictionary from my bag and looked them out. I must say they were not cheering to me, for amongst them were “Ordog”—Satan, “pokol”—hell, “stregoica”—witch, “vrolok” and “vlkoslak”—both of which mean the same thing, one being Slovak and the other Servian for something that is either were-wolf or vampire. (Mem., I must ask the Count about these superstitions)
vi: Lúc leo lên xe ngựa, tôi thấy tay xà ích vẫn chưa ngồi lên ghế, anh ta còn mải đứng nói chuyện với ông chủ khách sạn. Không còn nghi ngờ gì nữa, cả hai người đang nói chuyện về tôi, bởi vì chốc chốc họ lại ngoảnh mặt nhìn tôi. Những người ngồi trên hàng ghế gần cửa khách sạn cũng bắt đầu đứng cả dậy sán đến nghe hai người đàn ông nói chuyện, thỉnh thoảng họ cũng ngoái lại nhìn tôi với ánh mắt chứa đựng một điều gì đấy giống như một sự thương hại. Về phần mình, đôi khi tôi cũng nghe được một vài từ vẳng tới từ đám đông nhưng đó toàn là những từ mà tôi không hiểu. Hơn nữa, họ lại nói bằng nhiều thứ tiếng. Vì vậy, tôi phải mở cuốn từ điển đa ngôn ở trong túi du lịch ra tra cứu, tôi muốn tìm nghĩa của tất cả những từ lạ mà tôi đã nghe lỏm được. Song thú thực là không có bất cứ một nghĩa nào tra được trong cuốn từ điển khiến tôi có thể can đảm lên, bởi vì tôi tra được toàn những từ đại loại như: Ordog - quỷ Satan; Pokol - địa ngục; stregocia - phù thủy; vrolok và vlkoslak - một cái gì đó như “ma cà rồng” hoặc “ma sói” theo nghĩa của hai thổ ngữ.
tr: Arabaya bindiğimde arabacı henüz yerini almamıştı ve onu otel sahibesiyle konuşurken gördüm. Belli ki benim hakkımda konuşuyorlardı çünkü ara sıra bana bakıyorlardı ve kapının dışındaki bankta oturanların bazıları -ki bunlar “laf taşıyıcı” anlamına gelen bir sözcükle anılıyorlardı- ikisinin yanına gidip kulak kabarttılar ve ardından bana baktılar; pek çoğu acıyarak baktı. Sıklıkla yinelenen çok sayıda tuhaf sözcük duyuyordum, çünkü kalabalıkta pek çok milletten insan vardı; bu yüzden sessizce çok dilli sözlüğümü çantamdan çıkarttım ve o sözcüklere baktım. Şunu ifade etmeliyim ki bu sözcükler hiç içimi açmıyordu, çünkü aralarında ordog - şeytan, pokol -Cehennem, stregoica - büyücü, vrolok ve vlkoslak - biri Slovakça, diğeri Sırpça olan ve kurt adam ya da vampir gibi bir şey anlamına gelen sözcükler bulunuyordu. (Not: Kont’a bu batıl inançları sormalıyım.
es: Cuando llegué al coche, el conductor todavía no había tomado su asiento, y lo vi hablando con la dueña de la posada. Evidentemente hablaban de mí, pues de vez en cuando se volvían para verme, y algunas de las personas que estaban sentadas en el banco fuera de la puerta (a las que llaman con un nombre que significa "Portadores de palabra") se acercaron y escucharon, y luego me miraron, la mayor parte de ellos compadeciéndome. Pude escuchar muchas palabras que se repetían a menudo: palabras raras, pues había muchas nacionalidades en el grupo; así es que tranquilamente extraje mi diccionario políglota de mi petaca, y las busqué. Debo admitir que no me produjeron ninguna alegría, pues entre ellas estaban "Ordog" (Satanás), "pokol" (infierno), "stregoica" (bruja), "vrolok" y "vlkoslak" (las que significan la misma cosa, una en eslovaco y la otra en servio, designando algo que es un hombre lobo o un vampiro). (Recordar: debo preguntarle al conde acerca de estas supersticiones.)
vi_translation: When I got into the carriage, I saw that the coachman had not yet taken his seat; he was still busy talking to the hotel owner. There was no doubt that they were talking about me, because every now and then they would turn to look at me. The people sitting in the rows near the hotel door also began to stand up and come closer to listen to the two men talking; occasionally, they would turn back to look at me with eyes that held something akin to pity. As for myself, sometimes I could catch a few words from the crowd, but they were all words I didn't understand. Moreover, they spoke in many different languages. Therefore, I had to take out the multilingual dictionary from my travel bag to look up the meanings of all the strange words I had overheard. But to be honest, none of the meanings I found in the dictionary gave me any courage, because I only found words like: Ordog - Satan; Pokol - hell; stregocia - witch; vrolok and vlkoslak - something like "vampire" or "werewolf" according to the meanings in two dialects.
tr_translation: When I got into the carriage, the coachman had not yet taken his place, and I saw him talking with the hotel owner. It was clear that they were talking about me because they occasionally glanced at me, and some of those sitting on the bench outside the door—who were referred to by a word meaning "gossip-mongers"—went over to the two of them, eavesdropped, and then looked at me; many of them looked at me with pity. I frequently heard many strange words being repeated, as there were people of many nationalities in the crowd; so I quietly took out my multilingual dictionary from my bag and looked up those words. I must say that these words did not cheer me up at all, as they included ordog - devil, pokol - Hell, stregoica - witch, vrolok and vlkoslak - words in Slovak and Serbian respectively, meaning something like werewolf or vampire. (Note: I must ask the Count about these superstitions.)
es_translation: When I arrived at the car, the driver had not yet taken his seat, and I saw him talking with the owner of the inn. They were evidently talking about me, as they occasionally turned to look at me, and some of the people who were sitting on the bench outside the door (whom they call by a name that means "Word Bearers") approached and listened, and then looked at me, most of them pitying me. I could hear many words that were often repeated: strange words, as there were many nationalities in the group; so I quietly took out my polyglot dictionary from my pocket, and looked them up. I must admit they brought me no joy, as among them were "Ordog" (Satan), "pokol" (hell), "stregoica" (witch), "vrolok" and "vlkoslak" (which mean the same thing, one in Slovak and the other in Serbian, referring to something that is a werewolf or a vampire). (Note: I must ask the count about these superstitions.)
st: Ha ke fihla ho mokoetlisi, mokhanni ha aa ka a lula setulong sa hae, 'me ka mo bona a bua le mosali oa naha. Ba ne ba bua ka 'na, bakeng sa e mong le e mong hona joale 'me ba talimile' na, 'me ba bang ba batho ba neng ba lutse ka bencheng ka ntle ho monyako,' me ba bitsa ka lebitso la "lentsoe-mojari"Lekhetlong lena o ile a tla 'me a mamela, eaba ba ncheba, ba bangata ba bona ba utloa. Ke ne ke utloa mantsoe a mangata khafetsa, mantsoe a queer, hobane ho ne ho e-na le lichaba tse ngata bongata; Ka hona ke ile ka fumana li-dictionary tsa ka tsa polyglot ho tsoa mokotleng oa ka ebe ke li sheba kantle. Ke tlameha ho re ba ne ba sa thaba ho 'na, hobane har'a bona e ne e le "Ordog";)Satane, "pokol").'" -- Stregoica"Sso61so" le "vlkoslak" le "vlkoslak" eo ka bobeli e bolelang ntho e tšoanang, e mong e le Slovak le e 'ngoe Servian bakeng sa ntho e' ngoe e ka 'na ea e-ba wolf kapa vampire. (ʻO ka hopena o ka hoʻokōʻana i ka hoʻokele)
yo: Nígbà tí mo wọ akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá awakọ̀ náà kò tí ì jókòó, mo sì rí i tí ó ń bá ọmọ ilẹ̀ sọ̀rọ̀. Ó hàn gbangba pé wọ́n ń sọ̀rọ̀ nípa mi, fún gbogbo ìgbà lẹ́yìn náà wọ́n wò mí, àti díẹ̀ lára àwọn ènìyàn tí wọ́n jókòó lórí àga ní ìta ìlẹ̀kùn - èyí tí wọ́n pè pẹ̀lú orúkọ tí ó túmọ̀ sí "olùgbé ọ̀rọ̀"- wá gbọ́, lẹ́yìn náà wọ́n wò mí, ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ wọn ń ṣàánú. Mo lè gbọ́ ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọ̀rọ̀ tí wọ́n sábà máa ń tún ṣe, àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ ẹlẹ́yàmẹ̀yà, nítorí pé ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ orílẹ̀-èdè ló wà nínú ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ènìyàn; Nítorí náà mo dákẹ́ rọ́rọ́ gba ìwé atúmọ̀ ọ̀rọ̀ polyglot mi láti inú àpò mi mo sì tún wò wọ́n jáde. Mo gbọ́dọ̀ sọ pé wọn kò yọ̀ fún mi, nítorí láàrin wọn ni "Ordog"- Sátánì, "pokol"- ọ̀run àpáàdì, "stregoica"- àjẹ́, "vrolok" àti "vlkoslak"- èyí tí àwọn méjèèjì túmọ̀ sí ohun kan náà, ọ̀kan jẹ́ Slovak àti Servian kejì fún nkan tí ó jẹ́ ìkookò tàbí vampire. (Mem., Mo gbọdọ beere lọwọ Count nipa awọn superstitions wọnyi)
tn: Fa ke sena go tsena mo koloing, mokgweetsi o ne a sa kgone go mo tsaya, mme ka mmona a bua le ene. Ba ne ba bua ka nna, ka gonne jaanong ba ne ba ntjheba, mme ba ntjheba, ba bangwe ba ba neng ba ntse ba le kwa ntle ga lemati le ba bitsang ka leina le le reng ka leina le le kayang "motho yo o bidiwang "mojadi,"+ mme ba ntheetsa, mme ba ntjheba ka bontsi jwa bone. Ke ne ke kgona go utlwa mafoko a le mantsi, mafoko a a kgobang pelo, gonne go ne go na le dichaba tse dintsi mo bontsing. Ka jalo ke ne ka ntsha di-polyglot tsa me mo kgetsaneng ya me mme ka di leba kwa ntle. Ke ne ke sa rate batho ba bangwe ba ba neng ba le mo go yone, ba ne ba sa batle go bua mafoko a a molemo a a neng a le mo go one, ka gonne ba ne ba le mo go nna, ba ne ba le mosing wa ga Satane, yo mongwe o ne a re: "Ammaaruri, go na le sengwe se se dirang gore ke seaka kgotsa se sengwe se se bidiwang phiri kgotsa vampire." (I'm gonna ask the big bone for that)
ty: I to'u taeraa i ni'a i te taata faaineine, aita te taata faahoro i parahi i ni'a i to'na parahiraa, e ua ite atura vau ia'na i te paraparauraa i te taata faahoro. E au ra te parau mai nei ratou no'u, i te mau taime atoa e i muri iho ua hi'o mai ratou ia'u, e te tahi o te mau taata e parahi ra i ni'a i te parahiraa i rapae au i te opani—ta ratou e pii nei te hoê i'oa e " taata afa'i parau " – ua haere mai e ua faaroo, e i muri iho ua hi'o mai ia'u, e te rahiraa o ratou, ua aroha mai ïa ia'u. Ua nehenehe ia'u ia faaroo e rave rahi mau parau tei faahiti-pinepine-hia, tei faahiti-pinepine-hia, no te mea e rave rahi te mau nunaa i roto i te nahoa taata ; no reira, ua tatara mǎrû noa ' tura vau i ta ' u titionare i roto i ta ' u pute e ua hi'o atura vau i rapae. E mea ti'a ia'u ia parau e, aita ratou e faaitoito ra ia'u, no te mea, i rotopu ia ratou te vai ra te mau " caméra "—Satane, " po'ipo'i "—" tatarahapa "—e "vrolok " e " hoa "—te auraa ra, hoê â ïa, hoê â huru, hoê â huru, e te tahi ra, o te imiraa ïa i te hoê mea e ere i te mea faufaa roa. (Mem., e ti'a ia'u ia ui i te mau uiraa no ni'a i teie mau tumu parau)
mai: जखन हम कोच पर चढ़लहुं तखन ड्राइवर अपन सीट पर नहि बैसल छलाह, आ हम हुनका मकान मालकिन सँ गप्प करैत देखलहुँ। ओ सभ स्पष्ट रूपसँ हमरा बारे मे गप्प कऽ रहल छलाह, किएक तँ हरदम ओ हमरा दिस देखैत छलाह, आ किछु लोक जे दरवाजाक बाहर बेंच पर बैसल छलाह - जकरा ओ "शब्दवाहक" नामक नामसँ पुकारैत छथि - आबि सुनलनि, आ फेर हमरा दिस देखलनि, जाहिमे सँ अधिकांश दयासँ देखैत छलाह। हम बहुत रास शब्द अक्सर दोहरायल जाइत छलहुँ, विचित्र शब्द, कियैक तँ भीड़मे बहुत रास राष्ट्रीयता छल; त हम चुपचाप अपन बैग सं अपन पॉलीग्लॉट डिक्शनरी लए लेलहुं आ ओकरा बाहर देखलहुं। हम जरूर कहब जे ओ हमरा जयकार नहि कऽ रहल छलाह, किएक तँ ओहिमे "ऑर्डोग"—शैतान, "पोकोल"—नरक, "स्ट्रेगोइका"—चुड़ैल, "व्रोलोक" आ "व्ल्कोस्लाक" छल - दुनूक अर्थ एके बात अछि, एकटा स्लोवाक आ दोसर सर्वियन कोनो एहन चीजक लेल जे या तँ भेड़िया वा पिशाच छल। (मेम, हमरा गिनती सं एहि अंधविश्वास के बारे मे जरूर पूछबाक चाही)
mg: Rehefa tonga teo amin'ilay mpanazatra aho dia tsy naka ny toerany ilay mpamily, ary hitako niresaka tamin'ilay tompon-trano izy. Mazava ho azy fa niresaka momba ahy izy ireo, satria nijery ahy izy ireo indraindray, ary ny sasany tamin'ireo olona nipetraka teo amin'ny dabilio teo ivelan'ny varavarana—izay antsoin'izy ireo amin'ny anarana hoe "mpitondra teny"—dia tonga ary nihaino, ary avy eo nijery ahy, ny ankamaroan'izy ireo dia nangoraka ahy. Afaka nandre teny maro matetika miverimberina sy hafahafa aho, satria maro ireo firenena tao anatin'ny vahoaka; Noho izany dia azoko tamim-pahanginana tao anatin'ny kitapoko ny rakibolana misy fiteny maro ary nijery azy ireo aho. Tsy maintsy milaza aho fa tsy faly tamiko izy ireo, satria anisan'izy ireo ny "Ordog"—Satana, "pokol"—helo, "stregoica"—mpamosavy, "vrolok" ary "vlkoslak"—izay samy midika zavatra iray ihany, ny iray Slovaky ary ny iray hafa Servian amin'ny zavatra izay na amboadia na vampira. [Na: Fa inona no fanantenan'ny mpihatsaravelatsihy, na dia mahazo harena be aza.

en: When we started, the crowd round the inn door, which had by this time swelled to a considerable size, all made the sign of the cross and pointed two fingers towards me. With some difficulty I got a fellow-passenger to tell me what they meant; he would not answer at first, but on learning that I was English, he explained that it was a charm or guard against the evil eye. This was not very pleasant for me, just starting for an unknown place to meet an unknown man; but every one seemed so kind-hearted, and so sorrowful, and so sympathetic that I could not but be touched. I shall never forget the last glimpse which I had of the inn-yard and its crowd of picturesque figures, all crossing themselves, as they stood round the wide archway, with its background of rich foliage of oleander and orange trees in green tubs clustered in the centre of the yard. Then our driver, whose wide linen drawers covered the whole front of the box-seat—“gotza” they call them—cracked his big whip over his four small horses, which ran abreast, and we set off on our journey.
vi: Khi chiếc xe ngựa chuẩn bị chuyển bánh, đám người xúm đến trước cửa khách sạn mỗi lúc một đông, tất cả cùng đưa tay làm dấu thánh và giơ ngón trỏ, ngón giữa chỉ về phía tôi quả là không dễ dàng gì khi tôi gặng hỏi một người đồng hành về ý nghĩa của những cử chỉ kỳ quặc đó: Họ muốn che chở cho tôi - anh ta giải thích - chống lại những con mắt độc ác. Thực tình mà nói, tôi lại một lần nữa không cảm thấy dễ chịu trước khi tới một nơi xa lạ. Nhưng mặt khác tôi cũng phải thừa nhận một sự thật là tất cả những con người kia, cả đàn ông lẫn đàn bà, đều chứng tỏ một thiện cảm đối với tôi, đều muốn chia sẻ với tôi nỗi bất hạnh mà họ cho là sẽ xảy ra. Và dù thế nào đi chăng nữa thì tôi cũng không bao giờ quên được những hình ảnh xúc động này. Tay xà ích mặc chiếc quần ống rộng thùng thình che gần kín chiếc ghế anh ta đang ngồi, vung roi huơ huơ trên đầu bốn chú ngựa đã được đóng sẵn. Chúng tôi bắt đầu lên đường.
tr: Yola çıktığımız sırada, hanın kapısında toplanan ve o zamana kadar hatrı sayılır ölçüde artan kalabalığın tümü haç işareti yapıp iki parmaklarını bana doğru kaldırdılar. Biraz güçlükle de olsa, ne demek istediklerini öteki yolculardan birinin anlatmasını sağladım; ilk başta sorumu yanıtlamak istemedi, ama İngiliz olduğumu öğrenince bunun kem göze karşı büyü ya da koruma olduğunu anlattı. Tam da bilinmeyen bir yere doğru bilinmeyen bir adamla tanışmak üzere yola çıkmışken bu durum hiç de hoşuma gitmedi; fakat herkes öylesine iyi kalpli, öylesine kederli ve öylesine cana yakındı ki etkilenmemem olanaksızdı. Hanın avlusunu ve avlunun ortasında, arkasında yeşil fıçılara dikilmiş zakkum ve portakal ağaçlarının gür yaprakları bulunan geniş kemerli geçidin etrafında durup istavroz çıkaran ilginç insanların oluşturduğu kalabalığı son bir anlığına görüşümü asla unutmayacağım. Ardından, geniş keten pantolonu -onlara gotza diyorlardı- ön koltuğun tümünü kaplayan arabacımız kocaman kırbacını başa baş koşan dört küçük atın üstünde şaklattı ve yolculuğumuza başladık.
es: Cuando partimos, la multitud alrededor de la puerta de la posada, que para entonces ya había crecido a un número considerable, todos hicieron el signo de la cruz y dirigieron dos dedos hacia mí. Con alguna dificultad conseguí que un pasajero acompañante me dijera qué significaba todo aquello; al principio no quería responderme, pero cuando supo que yo era inglés, me explicó que era el encanto o hechizo contra el mal de ojo. Esto tampoco me agradó mayormente cuando salía hacia un lugar desconocido con un hombre desconocido; pero todo el mundo parecía tan bondadoso, tan compasivo y tan simpático que no pude evitar sentirme emocionado. Nunca olvidaré el último vistazo que eché al patio interior de la posada y su multitud de pintorescos personajes, todos persignándose, mientras estaban alrededor del amplio pórtico, con su fondo de rico follaje de adelfas y árboles de naranjo en verdes tonelitos agrupados en el centro del patio. Entonces nuestro conductor, cuyo amplio pantalón de lino cubría todo el asiento frontal (ellos lo llaman "gotza"), fustigó su gran látigo sobre los cuatro pequeños caballos que corrían de dos en dos, e iniciamos nuestro viaje…
es_results: "title": "Don Quijote de la Mancha", "author": "Miguel de Cervantes"
vi_translation: When the carriage was about to start moving, the crowd in front of the hotel grew larger and larger, all making the sign of the cross and pointing their index and middle fingers towards me. It was not easy when I asked a fellow traveler about the meaning of those strange gestures: "They want to protect you," he explained, "against evil eyes. " Honestly, once again, I did not feel comfortable before arriving at an unfamiliar place. But on the other hand, I also had to admit a fact that all those people, both men and women, showed a kindness towards me, wanting to share with me the misfortune they believed would happen. And no matter what, I will never forget these touching images. The coachman, wearing wide-legged pants that almost covered the seat he was sitting on, swung his whip above the heads of the four horses already harnessed. We began our journey.
tr_translation: When we set out, the entire crowd gathered at the inn's door, which had grown considerably by that time, made the sign of the cross and raised two fingers towards me. With some difficulty, I managed to get one of the other travelers to explain what they meant; at first, he didn't want to answer my question, but when he learned that I was English, he explained that it was a charm or protection against the evil eye. Just as I was setting out to meet an unknown man in an unknown place, this situation did not please me at all; however, everyone was so kind-hearted, so sorrowful, and so friendly that it was impossible not to be affected. I will never forget the last glimpse of the courtyard of the inn and the crowd of interesting people making the sign of the cross around the wide arched passage, with the lush leaves of oleander and orange trees planted in green barrels behind it. Then, our coachman, whose wide linen trousers - they called them gotza - covered the entire front seat, cracked his huge whip over the four small horses harnessed abreast, and we began our journey.
es_translation: When we departed, the crowd around the inn's door, which by then had grown to a considerable number, all made the sign of the cross and pointed two fingers at me. With some difficulty, I managed to get a fellow passenger to tell me what all this meant; at first, he did not want to answer me, but when he learned that I was English, he explained that it was the charm or spell against the evil eye. This did not please me much either as I was heading to an unknown place with an unknown man; but everyone seemed so kind, so compassionate, and so sympathetic that I couldn't help but feel moved. I will never forget the last glimpse I took of the inn's courtyard and its multitude of picturesque characters, all crossing themselves, as they stood around the wide porch, with its backdrop of rich foliage of oleanders and orange trees in green tubs grouped in the center of the courtyard. Then our driver, whose wide linen trousers covered the entire front seat (they call it "gotza"), cracked his large whip over the four small horses running two by two, and we began our journey...
st: Ha re qala, bongata bo potileng monyako oa inn, bo neng bo e-na le nako ena bo ile ba ruruha ka boholo bo boholo, bohle ba etsa letšoao la sefapano mme ba supa menoana e 'meli ho nna. Ka mathata a mang ke ile ka fumana motsoalle oa ka ho mpolella hore na ba bolela'ng; Ha aa ka a araba qalong, empa ha a ithuta hore ke Senyesemane, o hlalositse hore e ne e le khahleho kapa molebeli khahlanong le leihlo le lebe. Sena se ne se sa monate haholo ho nna, ho qala feela bakeng sa sebaka se sa tsejoeng sa ho kopana le monna ea sa tsejoeng; Empa e mong le e mong o ne a bonahala a le pelo e mosa, 'me a sareloa, le kutloelo-bohloko hoo ke neng ke sa khone empa ho angoa. Nke ke ka lebala khanya ea ho qetela eo ke neng ke e-na le eona ea inn-jarete le bongata ba eona ba lipalo tse bohehang, kaofela li ntse li ipatela, ha li ntse li eme ho potoloha archway e pharaletseng, ka semelo sa eona sa foliage e ruileng ea oleander le lifate tsa lamunu ka li-tub tse tala tse kopaneng bohareng ba jarete. 18Yaba mokhanni wa rona, bao ba neng ba ahile kantle ho lebokose le ka pele ho lebokose le reng,' ba ba bitsa nyehele e kgolo ya hae e kgolo hodima dipere tsa hae tse nne tse nyane, tse neng di matha, mme re ile ra emisa leetong la rona.
yo: Nígbà tí a bẹ̀rẹ̀, àwọn èrò yí ìlẹ̀kùn inú ilé náà ká, èyí tí ó ti fẹ̀ sí ìwọ̀n tó pọ̀ ní àkókò yìí, gbogbo wọn ṣe àmì àgbélébùú náà wọ́n sì tọ́ka ìka méjì sí mi. Pẹ̀lú ìṣòro díẹ̀ mo ní èrò ẹlẹgbẹ́ mi láti sọ ohun tí wọ́n túmọ̀ sí fún mi; Kò ní kọ́kọ́ dáhùn, ṣùgbọ́n nípa kíkọ́ pé èdè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì ni mí, ó ṣàlàyé pé ẹwà tàbí ìṣọ́ ni sí ojú búburú. Eyi kii ṣe igbadun pupọ fun mi, o kan bẹrẹ fun ibi aimọ lati pade ọkunrin ti a ko mọ; Ṣùgbọ́n olúkúlùkù dàbí ẹni tí ó ní ọkàn rere, ó sì ní ìbànújẹ́ púpọ̀, ó sì ṣàánú débi pé mi ò lè fọwọ́ kàn mí. Mi ò ní gbàgbé ìwòye ìkẹyìn tí mo ní nípa àgbàlá inú àti ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ènìyàn rẹ̀ tí ó rẹwà, gbogbo wọn ń kọjá ara wọn, bí wọ́n ṣe dúró yíká ọ̀nà ńlá, pẹ̀lú ìpìlẹ̀ àwọn ewé ọlọ́rọ̀ oleander àti àwọn igi ọsàn nínú àwọn ìwẹ̀ aláwọ̀ ewé tí wọ́n kó jọ ní àárín àgbàlá. Lẹ́yìn náà awakọ̀ wa, tí àwọn àpótí aṣọ rẹ̀ tó fẹ̀ bo gbogbo iwájú ìjókòó àpótí- "gotza" wọ́n pè wọ́n- fọ́ ọ̀pá ńlá rẹ̀ lórí àwọn ẹṣin kékeré rẹ̀ mẹ́rin, èyí tí ó sáré abreast, a sì bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìrìn-àjò wa.
tn: Fa re simolola, boidiidi jo bo dikologang kgoro ya inn, jo ka nako eno bo ne jwa ruruga ka bogolo jo bogolo, botlhe ba ne ba dira sesupo sa sefapaano mme ba supa menwana e mebedi kwa go nna. Ka dinako dingwe ke ne ke na le bothata jwa go bolelela molekane wa me gore o raya eng; O ne a se ka a mo araba ka nako ya ntlha, mme fa a ithuta gore ke Seesemane, o ne a tlhalosa fa e le selebeledi kgotsa selebeledi kgatlhanong le leitlho le le bosula. Seno se ne se sa siama thata mo go nna, go simolola fela lefelo le le sa itsiweng go kopana le monna yo o sa itsiweng; Mme mongwe le mongwe o ne a lebega a le pelontle, a hutsafala thata, mme ke ne ke sa kgone go amiwa ke ope fela. Ga nkitla ke lebala setshwantsho sa bofelo se ke neng ke na le sone se se neng se na le tshingwana ya inn-yard le boidiidi jwa sone sa ditshwantsho tse di borethe, botlhe ba kgabaganya ka bobona, fa ba ne ba ntse ba dikologa ka tsela e e sephara, ba na le petso e e humileng ya oleander le ditlhare tsa namune mo ditshikeng tse ditala tse ditala mo gare ga jarete. 18Ba ne ba re: "Ba ne ba ba bitsa ka fa tlase ga dipitse tsa gagwe tse nne tse dikgolo, tse di neng di le mo tseleng ya rona, mme re ne ra digela mo loetong lwa rona.
ty: I to matou haamataraa, ua haaati te nahoa taata i te opani o te fare tipaeraa, o tei maraa roa i taua taime ra, e ua tapa'o ratou paatoa i te tapa'o o te satauro e ua faatoro maira e piti manimani rima i ni'a ia'u. Na roto i te tahi fifi, ua ani au i te hoê hoa ohipa ia faaite mai ia'u i te auraa o te reira ; aita oia i pahono i te haamataraa, i to'na râ iteraa e e reo Peretane vau, ua faataa mai oia e e reo nehenehe aore râ e paruru te reira i te mata ino. E ere teie i te mea au roa no'u, no haamata noa'tura vau i te hoê vahi ite-ore-hia no te farerei i te hoê taata matau-ore-hia ; tera râ, mai te mea ra e, e aau maitai to te taata tata'itahi, e ua oto roa, e no te rahi o to'u aroha, aita'tura e ti'a ia'u ia tape'a i te reira. Eita roa e mo'ehia ia'u te hoho'a hopea ta'u i ite no ni'a i te mau taata e ora ra i roto i te aua e to'na nahoa taata nehenehe, a ti'a noa'i ratou i ni'a i te purumu aano, e to'na mau rauere rarahi e te anani i roto i te mau aua matie tei î i te matie i ropu i te aua. I muri iho, ua ta'uma to matou taata faahoro pereoo i ni'a i te afata ume, e ua apapa noa te taatoaraa o te pereoo i ni'a i te taupee o te afata ume—" ua parau ratou ia ratou—e ua ta'iri i to'na pereoo rahi i ni'a i ta'na na puaahorofenua na'ina'i e maha, e ua haamata matou i to matou tere.
mai: जखन हम शुरू केलौं तखन सराय के दरवाजाक चारूकात भीड़, जे एहि समय धरि काफी आकार मे फूलि गेल छल, सब क्रॉस के चिन्ह बना देलक आ दूटा अंगुरी हमरा दिस इशारा केलक। किछु कठिनाई सँ हमरा एकटा सहयात्री भेटल जे हमरा कहैत जे ओकर की मतलब छल; ओ पहिने कोनो उत्तर नहि दैत छलाह, मुदा जखन ई जनैत छलाह जे हम अंग्रेजी छी, ओ बुझौलनि जे ई एकटा आकर्षण या दुष्ट नजरिसँ बचाव छल। ई हमरा लेल बहुत सुखद नहि छल, बस कोनो अनजान आदमी सँ भेंट करबाक लेल कोनो अनजान जगह सँ शुरू भेल; मुदा सभगोटे एतेक दयालु, आ एतेक दुखी, आ एतेक सहानुभूतिपूर्ण लगैत छलाह जे हम छू नहि सकैत छलहुँ। हम ओहि अन्तिम झलक केँ कहियो नहि बिसरि सकैत छी जे हमरा सराय के आँगन आ ओकर सुरम्य आकृति के भीड़ छल, सब अपना के पार करैत छल, जखन ओ चौड़ा मेहराब के चारु कात ठाढ़ छल, ओकर पृष्ठभूमि ओलियंडर आ नारंगी गाछक समृद्ध पत्ते के पृष्ठभूमि मे हरियर टब मे हरियर टब मे छल। तखन हमर ड्राइवर, जकर चौड़ा लिनेनक दराज बॉक्स-सीटक पूरा आगू भागकेँ झाँपि देलक- "गोट्जा" जकरा ओ हुनका कहैत छथि - अपन चारिटा छोट घोड़ा पर अपन पैघ कोड़ा फाड़ि देलक, जे आगू भागि गेल, आ हम सभ अपन यात्रा पर निकलि गेलहुँ।
mg: Rehefa nanomboka izahay dia nanao ny famantarana ny hazo fijaliana ny vahoaka manodidina ny varavaran'ny tranom-bahiny, izay efa nitombo be tamin'izany fotoana izany, ary samy nanao ny famantarana ny hazo fijaliana izy rehetra ary nanondro ahy tamin'ny rantsan-tanana roa. Tamin'ny fahasarotana kely no nahazoako namana mpandeha iray mba hilaza amiko ny tian'izy ireo holazaina; Tsy namaly izy tamin'ny voalohany, fa rehefa fantany fa Anglisy aho, dia nohazavainy fa mahafinaritra na mpiambina amin'ny maso ratsy izany. Tsy dia nahafinaritra ahy loatra izany, fa nanomboka tamin'ny toerana tsy fantatra mba hihaona amin'ny olona tsy fantatra; kanefa ny tsirairay dia toa tsara fanahy sy nalahelo ary nangoraka loatra ka tsy afaka ny tsy ho voakasiky ny foko. Tsy hohadinoiko mihitsy ny topimaso farany izay nananako momba ny trano fandraisam-bahiny sy ireo olo-malazany, izay samy niampita ny tenany avokoa, raha nijoro nanodidina ny lalana lehibe izy ireo, miaraka amin'ny tokotaniny feno ravin'ny oleander sy hazo volomboasary ao anaty koveta maitso mivangongo ao afovoan'ny tokotany. Avy eo ny mpamily anay, izay nanarona ny anoloana manontolo teo amin'ny seza fanaovam-panavotana ny vatasarihana lamba rongony lehibe—"gotza" izay antsoin'izy ireo hoe izy ireo—dia nanapaka ny karavasy lehibeny teo ambonin'ireo soavaliny kely efatra, izay nihazakazaka tamin'ny tratra, ary niainga izahay tamin'ny diantsika.

en: Beyond the green swelling hills of the Mittel Land rose mighty slopes of forest up to the lofty steeps of the Carpathians themselves. Right and left of us they towered, with the afternoon sun falling full upon them and bringing out all the glorious colours of this beautiful range, deep blue and purple in the shadows of the peaks, green and brown where grass and rock mingled, and an endless perspective of jagged rock and pointed crags, till these were themselves lost in the distance, where the snowy peaks rose grandly. Here and there seemed mighty rifts in the mountains, through which, as the sun began to sink, we saw now and again the white gleam of falling water. One of my companions touched my arm as we swept round the base of a hill and opened up the lofty, snow-covered peak of a mountain, which seemed, as we wound on our serpentine way, to be right before us:—
vi: Con đường này không giống với những con đường khác ở vùng núi Carpates: quả thực là không ai dám sửa chữa, vì sợ làm thế sẽ khiến cho người Thổ Nhĩ Kỳ tưởng lầm rằng người ta lại đang chuẩn bị cho một cuộc xâm lược đất nước họ, và như vậy sẽ là cái cớ để họ tuyên chiến ngay lập tức, mà thực tế ở vùng núi này, chiến tranh lúc nào cũng nằm ở điểm chuẩn bị bùng nổ. Bên kia các đỉnh đồi vẫn là những cánh rừng và những đỉnh núi cao vời vợi của rặng Carpates. Trước mắt chúng tôi chỗ nào cũng là rừng và núi. Ánh trời chiều lung linh rực rỡ làm cho những hang hốc nằm giữa các vách đá cao vút trở thành một màu xanh thẫm hoặc đỏ tía, và biến các đám cỏ mọc phủ lên bờ đá thành một màu xanh nâu, và bức tranh toàn cảnh vô tận của các mỏm đá lởm chởm, nhọn hoắt cũng như biến mất hút về phía chân trời, nơi có những đỉnh núi tuyết nhấp nhô. Khi mặt trời bắt đầu ngả bóng, chúng tôi chợt nhận ra ở đó đây, rải rác giữa các hốc đá lớn, nhỏ, những thác nước nghiêng nghiêng đổ xuống vô vàn ánh bạc.
vi_results: "title": "Đất nước của những người da trắng", "author": "Ivan Turgenev"
tr: Mittelland’ın yeşil tepelerinin ardından, Karpat Dağlarının sarp tepelerine kadar giden ormanla kaplı büyük yamaçlar yükseliyordu. Bunlar, sağımızda ve solumuzda yükseliyorlardı, akşam güneşi tümüyle üzerlerine düşerek bu güzel sıradağların görkemli renklerini ortaya çıkartıyor, böylece dorukların gölgelerinde koyu mavi, mor, çimen ve kayaların birbirine karıştığı yerlerde yeşil ve kahverengi görünüyor, uzaklarda, karlı zirvelerin görkemli biçimde yükseldiği yerde yok olana dek sürüp giden sonsuz bir sarp ve sivri uçlu kayalık derinliği uzanıyordu. Dağlarda yer yer, güneş batarken yükseklerden düşen suyun parıltısını gördüğümüz yarıklar görülüyordu. Bir tepenin dibinden dolanıp yılankavi yolumuzda ilerlerken bir dağın kar kaplı ulu zirvesi tam önümüzdeymiş gibi göründüğünde yol arkadaşlarımdan biri koluma dokundu:
es: Más allá de las verdes e hinchadas lomas de la Tierra Media se levantaban imponentes colinas de bosques que llegaban hasta las elevadas cumbres de los Cárpatos. Se levantaban a la izquierda y a la derecha de nosotros, con el sol de la tarde cayendo plenamente sobre ellas y haciendo relucir los gloriosos colores de esta bella cordillera, azul profundo y morado en las sombras de los picos, verde y marrón donde la hierba y las piedras se mezclaban, y una infinita perspectiva de rocas dentadas y puntiagudos riscos, hasta que ellos mismos se perdían en la distancia, donde las cumbres nevadas se alzaban grandiosamente. Aquí y allá parecían descubrirse imponentes grietas en las montañas, a través de las cuales, cuando el sol comenzó a descender, vimos en algunas ocasiones el blanco destello del agua cayendo. Uno de mis compañeros me tocó la mano mientras nos deslizábamos alrededor de la base de una colina y señaló la elevada cima de una montaña cubierta de nieve, que parecía, a medida que avanzábamos en nuestra serpenteante carretera, estar frente a nosotros.
vi_translation: In fact, in this mountainous region, war is always on the brink of breaking out. On the other side of the hills, there are still forests and the towering peaks of the Carpathian range. In front of us, everywhere we look, there are forests and mountains. The shimmering, radiant evening sunlight turns the crevices between the towering cliffs into a deep blue or purple, transforms the grass patches covering the rock edges into a brownish green, and the endless panoramic view of jagged, sharp peaks fading into the horizon, where the snow-capped mountains undulate. As the sun began to set, we suddenly noticed here and there, scattered among the large and small rock crevices, waterfalls cascading down in countless silver streams.
tr_translation: Rising from the green hills of the Mittelland to the steep peaks of the Carpathian Mountains, large forest-covered slopes ascended. These rose on our right and left, with the evening sun fully casting its light on them, revealing the magnificent colors of these beautiful mountain ranges. Thus, in the shadows of the peaks, dark blue, purple, green where grass and rocks mingled, and brown appeared, extending into an endless depth of steep and jagged cliffs that continued until they disappeared where the snow-capped summits rose majestically in the distance. In the mountains, here and there, we saw ravines where the glint of water falling from high places was visible as the sun set. As we wound our way around the base of a hill on our serpentine path, one of my travel companions touched my arm when a great snow-covered peak appeared directly in front of us:
es_translation: Beyond the green and swollen hills of Middle-earth rose imposing hills of forests that reached the lofty peaks of the Carpathians. They rose to the left and right of us, with the afternoon sun fully shining upon them and making the glorious colors of this beautiful mountain range gleam, deep blue and purple in the shadows of the peaks, green and brown where the grass and stones mixed, and an infinite perspective of jagged rocks and pointed crags, until they themselves were lost in the distance, where the snow-capped summits rose grandly. Here and there, imposing crevices seemed to be discovered in the mountains, through which, when the sun began to descend, we occasionally saw the white flash of falling water. One of my companions touched my hand as we slid around the base of a hill and pointed to the high peak of a snow-covered mountain, which seemed, as we advanced on our winding road, to be right in front of us.
st: Ka nģ'ane ho maralla a matala a ho ruruha a Mittel Land a ile a phahama matsoapong a maholo a morung ho fihlela moeeng o phahameng oa Carpathians ka boeona. Ka ho le letona le ka ho le letšehali, ba ile ba tora, le letsatsi la thapama oela ka tlala bona 'me ba tlisa mebala eohle e khanyang ea mofuta ona o motle, e putsoa tebileng le pherese moriting oa litlhoro, o motala le o moputsoa moo joang le lefika le tsoakane, le pono e sa feleng ea lefika e neng e koetsoe, ho fihlela tsena li ne li lahlehile hole,  Moo li-snowy peaks li neng li phahama haholo. Mona 'me ho ne ho bonahala ho na le li-rifts tse matla lithabeng, tseo ka tsona, ha letsatsi le qala ho teba, re ile ra bona hona joale le ho pheta-pheta gleam e tšoeu ea metsi a oelang. E mong oa metsoalle ea ka o ile a ama letsoho la ka ha re ntse re hohola ho pota-pota leralla 'me a bula tlhoro e phahameng, e koahetsoeng ke lehloa ea thaba, e neng e bonahala eka, ha re ntse re leqeba tseleng ea rona ea noha, ho ba hantle ka pel'a rona.
yo: Lẹ́yìn àwọn òkè aláwọ̀ ewé tí ó ń rọ̀ ní Mittel Land gòkè àwọn òkè igbó tó lágbára títí dé àwọn òkè gíga àwọn Carpathians fúnra wọn. Ọ̀tún àti òsì wa wọ́n ga, pẹ̀lú oòrùn ọ̀sán tí ó kún fún wọn tí ó sì ń mú gbogbo àwọ̀ ògo ti ìwọ̀n tó rẹwà yìí jáde, búlúù tó jinlẹ̀ àti aláwọ̀ àlùkò nínú òjìji àwọn òkè, alawọ ewé àti aláwọ̀ brown níbi tí koríko àti àpáta ti darapọ̀, àti ìwòye tí kò lópin ti àpáta tí wọ́n ṣẹ́ àti àwọn crags tí ó tọ́ka sí, títí tí àwọn wọ̀nyí yóò fi sọnù ní ọ̀nà jíjìn,  níbi tí òkè yìnyín ti gòkè lọ́pọ̀lọpọ̀. Níbí àti pé ó dàbí ẹni pé àwọn ìyapa ńlá wà ní àwọn òkè, nípasẹ̀ èyí tí, bí oòrùn ṣe bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí rì, a rí ìmọ́lẹ̀ funfun omi tí ó ń ṣubú. Ọ̀kan lára àwọn alábàákẹ́gbẹ́ mi fọwọ́ kan apá mi bí a ṣe ń rìn káàkiri ìsàlẹ̀ òkè kan tí a sì ṣí òkè òkè kan tí yìnyín bò, èyí tí ó dàbí ẹni pé, bí a ṣe ń ṣe ọgbẹ́ ní ọ̀nà ejò wa, láti wà níwájú wa:-
tn: Kwa ntle ga dithaba tse ditala tse di rurugang tsa Naga ya Mittel di ne tsa tlhatloga mo dikgwang tse di kwa godimo tsa Ba-Carpathians ka botsona. Ka fa mojeng le ka fa molemeng wa rona ba ne ba ritibala, ka letsatsi la thapama le ne le tletse, ba tlisa mebala yotlhe e e galalelang e e galalelang, e e botala le e e bophepa mo moriting wa ditlhoro, botala le borokwa jo bo borokwa, bo bohibidu jo bo tswakilweng, le letlapa le le sa feleng la lefika le le neng le lela, go fitlhelela di ne di timetse kgakala.  Where The Snows Go Big Go Go Fa go ne go lebega go na le dikgotlhang tse di maatla mo dithabeng, fa letsatsi le simolola go teba, re ne ra bona jaanong le ditsere tse ditshweu tsa metsi a a wang. Mongwe wa balekane ba me o ne a ama letsogo la me fa re ntse re gogola mo godimo ga thaba mme ra bula tlhoro e e kwa godimo, e e khurumeditseng ya thaba e e neng e bonala e kete, jaaka re ne re otsela mo tseleng ya rona ya noha, gore re tle re nne fa pele ga rona.
ty: I nia ' ' e i te mau aivi oru matie o te Fenua Mittel, te maraa ra te mau pae mou'a puai o te ururaau e tae roa ' tu i te mau vahi teitei o te mau Carpathians iho. I te pae atau e i te pae aui, ua ti'a mai ratou, e ua topa mai te mahana i te avatea i ni'a iho ia ratou e ua tatara mai i te mau peni hanahana atoa o teie anairaa nehenehe, te ninamu hohonu e te vareau i roto i te ata o te mau tupuai mou'a, te matie e te ravarava i reira te aihere e te ofa'i e ano'ihia'i, e te hoê hi'oraa hopea ore no te mau ofa'i e te mau crags, e tae noa'tu ua mo'e ratou i te atea ê,  i reira te mau tupuai hiona i te maraa - rahi - raa. I tera vahi e tera vahi, mai te huru ra e, e mau puu rahi i ni'a i te mou'a, e na roto i te reira, a haamata ai te mahana i te topa, ua ite a'era matou i te anaana uouo o te pape e topa ra. Ua tape'a maira te hoê o to'u mau hoa i to'u rima a tere ai matou na ni'a i te aivi, e a iriti ai matou i te tupuai mou'a teitei tei tapo'ihia i te hiona, mai te huru ra e, te hee ra matou i ni'a i to matou e'a turu, ia vai ti'a noa i mua ia matou:—
mai: मित्तल भूमिक हरियर सूजन पहाड़ीसँ आगू जंगलक शक्तिशाली ढलान स्वयं कार्पैथियनक ऊँच खडा धरि उठि गेल। हमरासभमे सँ दहिन्ना आ बामाँ ओ सभ ऊँच छल, दुपहरक सूर्य हुनका सभ पर भरि पड़ैत छल आ एहि सुन्दर श्रृंखलाक सभ गौरवशाली रंगकेँ बाहर आनि रहल छल, चोटीसभक छायामे गहिर नीला आ बैंगनी, हरियर आ भूरा जतय घास आ चट्टान मिलैत छल, आ दांतेदार चट्टान आ नुकीला क्रैगक अंतहीन परिप्रेक्ष्य, जा धरि ई सभ स्वयं दूरमे गुम नहि भऽ गेल।  जतए बर्फीली चोटी तेजी सं उठल। एतय आ पहाड़सभमे भारी दरार बुझाइत छल, जाहिसँ जेना-जेना सूर्य डूबय लागल, हमसभ बेर-बेर खसैत पानिक उज्जर चमक देखलहुँ। हमर एकटा साथी हमर बांहि के छू लेलक जखन हम एकटा पहाड़ी के आधार के चारों ओर घूमैत छलहुं आ एकटा पहाड़ के ऊँच, बर्फ सँ ढकल चोटी के खोलि देलखिन, जे लगैत छल, जेना हम अपन नागिन मार्ग पर घाव करैत छलहुं, हमरासँ ठीक आगू छलहुं :—
mg: Ankoatra ireo havoana maitso mivonto ao amin'ny Tany Mittel dia nisondrotra be ny ala ka hatrany amin'ireo havoana avon'ny Carpathians. Nijoalajoala izy ireo, niaraka tamin'ny masoandro niposaka teo amboniny ary namoaka ny loko marevaka rehetra amin'ity faritra tsara tarehy ity, manga sy volomparasy lalina ao anatin'ny aloky ny tendron-tendrombohitra, maitso sy volontsôkôlà izay nifangaroan'ny bozaka sy ny vato, ary ny fomba fijery tsy misy fiafarany ny vato mikitoantoana sy ny vato, mandra-pahavery azy ireo teny lavitra teny,  Ny toerana misy ny oram-panala dia niakatra be. Ary toa nisy fisarahana mafy teo amin'ny tendrombohitra, ka raha vao nilentika ny masoandro, dia efa hitanay ny fotsy miramirapiratry ny rano. Nikasika ny sandriko ny iray tamin'ireo namako raha namafa ny fototry ny havoana iray izahay ary nanokatra ny tampon'ny tendrombohitra avo sy rakotra oram-panala, izay toa teo amin'ny lalan'ny bibilava nisy anay, mba ho eo anoloanay:

en: The strange driver evidently heard the words, for he looked up with a gleaming smile. The passenger turned his face away, at the same time putting out his two fingers and crossing himself. “Give me the Herr’s luggage,” said the driver; and with exceeding alacrity my bags were handed out and put in the calèche. Then I descended from the side of the coach, as the calèche was close alongside, the driver helping me with a hand which caught my arm in a grip of steel; his strength must have been prodigious. Without a word he shook his reins, the horses turned, and we swept into the darkness of the Pass. As I looked back I saw the steam from the horses of the coach by the light of the lamps, and projected against it the figures of my late companions crossing themselves. Then the driver cracked his whip and called to his horses, and off they swept on their way to Bukovina. As they sank into the darkness I felt a strange chill, and a lonely feeling came over me; but a cloak was thrown over my shoulders, and a rug across my knees, and the driver said in excellent German:—
vi: Chắc chắn là gã mới đến đã nghe được bài thơ, vì tôi thấy gã vừa quay sang nhìn vị hành khách với một nụ cười quái gở. Người hành khách vội vàng ngoảnh mặt đi nơi khác, đưa tay làm dấu thánh rồi giơ hai ngón tay ra trước. — Cho tôi xin hành lý của quý ngài đây nhỉ. - Gã lạ mặt tiếp tục lên tiếng. Chẳng cần đợi gã nói thế, đống vali của tôi cũng được chuyển sang chiếc xe mui gập. Tôi bước xuống xe và sang ngồi trong chiếc xe mới. Gã đàn ông đỡ tôi một tay - bàn tay gã quả là cứng như thép. Hẳn gã phải có một sức mạnh phi thường. Chẳng nói chẳng rằng, gã giật dây cương cho xe quay nửa vòng. Chiếc xe mới bắt đầu chuyển bánh và phi hết tốc độ trên đèo Borgo. Ngoái lại phía sau, tôi vẫn nhận ra những ngọn đèn chập chờn của chiếc xe chở khách soi lờ mờ hơi thở đầy hơi nước của lũ ngựa; bóng những hành khách, mà chỉ vừa mới đây thôi còn làm bạn đồng hành của tôi, hiện lên lần cuối cùng trước mắt tôi: họ đang cùng nhau làm dấu thánh. Gã đánh xe bất chợt vung mạnh chiếc roi, lũ ngựa lập tức chuyển sang đường tới Bukovine. Khi lũ ngựa dấn sâu vào màn đêm, tôi bỗng rùng mình vì một cảm giác cô đơn đáng sợ nhưng ngay lập tức một tấm áo choàng được khoác lên vai tôi, và tiếp đó là một mảnh chăn du lịch được đắp nhẹ nhàng lên hai gối. Gã đàn ông nói với tôi bằng một thứ tiếng Đức hoàn hảo:
tr: Tuhaf sürücü belli ki sözleri duymuştu, zira parıldayan bir gülümsemeyle yukarı baktı. Yolcu, iki parmağını kaldırıp istavroz çıkarırken yüzünü çevirdi. “Herr’in bagajını bana ver,” dedi sürücü; çantalarım büyük hevesle verildi ve arabaya konuldu. Ardından, öteki araba yakında olduğu için yere inmeden arabamızın yan tarafından öbür arabaya geçtim, arabacı, kolumu çelik gibi kavrayışla yakalayan eliyle bana yardım etti; müthiş bir gücü olmalıydı. Tek kelime etmeden dizginleri salladı, atlar döndü ve hızla geçidin karanlığına doğru ilerledik. Arkama baktığımda, lambaların ışığı altında posta arabasının atlarından çıkan buharı ve eski yol arkadaşlarımın istavroz çıkaran siluetlerini gördüm. Derken, sürücü kırbacını şaklattı, atlarına seslendi ve hızla Bukovina’ya doğru yollarına koyuldular. Onlar karanlığa gömülürken tuhaf bir ürperti hissettim ve üzerime yalnızlık çöktü; fakat omuzlarıma bir pelerin, dizlerime de bir battaniye atılmıştı ve arabacı mükemmel bir Almancayla şöyle dedi:
es: El extraño conductor escuchó evidentemente las palabras, pues alzó la mirada con una centelleante sonrisa. El pasajero escondió el rostro al mismo tiempo que hizo la señal con los dos dedos y se persignó. –Dadme el equipaje del señor -dijo el extraño cochero. Con una presteza excesiva mis maletas fueron sacadas y acomodadas en la calesa. Luego descendí del coche, pues la calesa estaba situada a su lado, y el cochero me ayudó con una mano que asió mi brazo como un puño de acero; su fuerza debía ser prodigiosa. Sin decir palabra agitó las riendas, los caballos dieron media vuelta y nos deslizamos hacia la oscuridad del desfiladero. Al mirar hacia atrás vi el vaho de los caballos del coche a la luz de las lámparas, y proyectadas contra ella las figuras de mis hasta hacia poco compañeros, persignándose. Entonces el cochero fustigó su látigo y gritó a los caballos, y todos arrancaron con rumbo a Bucovina. Al perderse en la oscuridad sentí un extraño escalofrío, y un sentimiento de soledad se apoderó de mí. Pero mi nuevo cochero me cubrió los hombros con una capa y puso una manta sobre mis rodillas, hablando luego en excelente alemán:
vi_translation: Surely the newcomer had heard the poem, because I saw him turn to look at the passenger with a grotesque smile. The passenger hurriedly turned his face away, made the sign of the cross, and held out two fingers. — Please give me your luggage, sir. - The stranger continued to speak. Without needing him to say so, my pile of suitcases was also transferred to the convertible car. I stepped out of the car and moved to sit in the new car. The man gave me a hand - his hand was indeed as hard as steel. He must have extraordinary strength. Without a word, he jerked the reins to turn the car halfway around. The new car began to move and sped at full speed on the Borgo Pass. Looking back, I could still make out the flickering lights of the passenger car faintly illuminating the misty breath of the horses; the silhouettes of the passengers, who had just recently been my companions, appeared one last time before my eyes: they were making the sign of the cross together. The coachman suddenly swung the whip forcefully, and the horses immediately turned onto the road to Bukovina. As the horses delved deeper into the night, I suddenly shivered with a dreadful sense of loneliness, but immediately a cloak was draped over my shoulders, followed by a travel blanket gently placed over my knees. The man spoke to me in perfect German:
tr_translation: The strange driver had clearly heard the words, as he looked up with a gleaming smile. The passenger turned his face away while making the sign of the cross with two fingers. "Give me Herr's luggage," said the driver; my bags were handed over with great enthusiasm and placed in the carriage. Then, as the other carriage was nearby, I transferred from our carriage to the other without stepping on the ground, with the coachman helping me with a grip as strong as steel; he must have had tremendous strength. Without a word, he flicked the reins, the horses turned, and we swiftly advanced into the darkness of the pass. When I looked back, I saw the steam rising from the post coach's horses and the silhouettes of my former travel companions making the sign of the cross under the light of the lamps. Then, the driver cracked his whip, called out to his horses, and they swiftly set off towards Bukovina. As they were engulfed in darkness, I felt a strange shiver and loneliness descended upon me; however, a cloak was thrown over my shoulders and a blanket over my knees, and the coachman said in perfect German:
es_translation: The strange driver evidently heard the words, for he looked up with a sparkling smile. The passenger hid his face at the same time he made the sign with two fingers and crossed himself. –Give me the gentleman's luggage -said the strange coachman. With excessive haste, my suitcases were taken out and placed in the carriage. Then I got out of the car, as the carriage was situated next to it, and the coachman helped me with a hand that gripped my arm like a fist of steel; his strength must have been prodigious. Without saying a word, he shook the reins, the horses turned around, and we slid into the darkness of the gorge. Looking back, I saw the steam from the car's horses in the light of the lamps, and projected against it were the figures of my companions until recently, crossing themselves. Then the coachman cracked his whip and shouted at the horses, and we all set off towards Bucovina. As they disappeared into the darkness, I felt a strange shiver, and a feeling of loneliness took hold of me. But my new coachman covered my shoulders with a cloak and placed a blanket over my knees, then spoke in excellent German:
st: Mokhanni ea makatsang o ile a utloa mantsoe ao, hobane o ile a sheba ka pososelo e gleaming. Mopalami o ile a tima sefahleho sa hae, ka nako e ts'oanang a beha menoana ea hae e 'meli' me a tšela ka boeena. "Mphe mokotlana oa herr," ho boletse mokhanni; 'Me ka ho fetisisa alacrity mekotla ea ka li ile tsa nehelanoa ka ntle' me a kenngoa ka calèche. Joale ke ile ka theoha lehlakoreng la mokoetlisi, ha calèche e ne e le haufi le eona, mokhanni o ile a nthusa ka letsoho le ileng la tšoara letsoho la ka ka ho ts'oaroa ke tšepe; Matla a hae a tlameha ho ba le bohlasoa. Kantle ho lentsoe o ile a sisinya li-reins hae, lipere tsa fetoha, 'me ra ea lefifing la Pass. Ha ke ntse ke sheba morao ke bone mouoane ho tsoa lipereng tsa mokoetlisi ke leseli la mabone, 'me ka morero khahlanong le eona lipalo tsa metsoalle ea ka ea morao li tšela. Eaba mokhanni o ile a petsoha seqha sa hae 'me a bitsa lipere tsa hae, 'me ba tloha ba fihla Bukovina. Ha ba ntse ba kena lefifing, ke ile ka ikutloa ke le chill e sa tloaelehang, 'me maikutlo a jeoang ke bolutu a fihla holim' a ka. Empa seaparo se ne se lahleloa ka holim'a mahetla a ka, le sematla mangoleng a ka, 'me mokhanni o ile a re ka Sejeremane:
yo: Awakọ̀ àjèjì náà gbọ́ àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ náà, nítorí ó wò ó pẹ̀lú ẹ̀rín tó rẹwà. Èrò náà yí ojú rẹ̀ padà, ní àsìkò kan náà ó gbé ìka rẹ̀ méjèèjì jáde ó sì kọjá ara rẹ̀. "Fún mi ní ẹrù Herr," ni awakọ̀ náà sọ; ati pẹlu ikọja alacrity mi baagi won fi jade ki o si fi sinu awọn calèche. Lẹ́yìn náà mo sọ̀kalẹ̀ láti ẹ̀gbẹ́ akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá, bí calèche náà ṣe súnmọ́ ẹ̀gbẹ́, awakọ̀ náà ń ràn mí lọ́wọ́ pẹ̀lú ọwọ́ tí ó mú apá mi pẹ̀lú ọwọ́ irin; Agbára rẹ̀ gbọ́dọ̀ jẹ́ àrà ọ̀tọ̀. Láìsí ọ̀rọ̀ kan ó gbá àṣẹ rẹ̀, àwọn ẹṣin yí padà, a sì wọ inú òkùnkùn ìkọjá. Bí mo ṣe wò sẹ́yìn mo rí ẹ̀fúùfù láti ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn ẹṣin akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá pẹ̀lú ìmọ́lẹ̀ fìtílà náà, mo sì ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ rẹ̀ àwọn nọ́mbà àwọn alábàákẹ́gbẹ́ mi tó kú tí wọ́n ń kọjá ara wọn. Lẹ́yìn náà awakọ̀ náà fọ́ ọ̀pá rẹ̀ ó sì pè fún ẹṣin rẹ̀, wọ́n sì gbé lọ sí Bukovina. Bí wọ́n ṣe rì sínú òkùnkùn mo ní ìmọ̀lára òtútù àjèjì, ìmọ̀lára owu sì wá sórí mi; Ṣùgbọ́n wọ́n ju aṣọ kan sórí èjìká mi, àti rọ́ọ̀gì kan kọjá eékún mi, awakọ̀ náà sì sọ ní èdè German tó tayọ:-
tn: Go bonala fa mokgweetsi a utlwa mafoko ao, ka a ne a nyenya. Mopalami wa gagwe o ne a ntsha sefatlhego, ka nako e le nngwe a ntsha menwana ya gagwe e mebedi a bo a tlola. "Ntliseng mokotlana wa dikgomo," ha rialo mokgwetsi. Ke ne ka isiwa mekotlana ya me e e feteletseng e bile e ne ya tsenngwa mo setilong sa me. Ke ne ka fologa mo letlhakoreng la mogokgo, jaaka dinamane di ne di le gaufi, mokgweetsi o ne a nthusa ka seatla se se neng se nthile letsogo mo seatleng sa tshipi. Maatla a gagwe a tshwanetse a bo a le thata. E ne ya re fa a sa ntse a le mo tseleng, dipitse di ne tsa fetoga, ra bo ra fitlha mo lefifing. Fa ke leba kwa morago, ke ne ka bona lesitsi le le tswang mo dipitseng tse di neng di le mo leseding la dipone, mme ka leba kwa go lone palo ya ba ba neng ba le gaufi le bone. Yaba mokgwetsi o ne a opa difapa tsa hae, mme a bitsa dipere tsa hae, mme ba tsamaya ba ya kwa Bukovina. Fa ba ntse ba le mo lefifing, ke ne ka ikutlwa ke le mokima, ke ne ke ikutlwa ke le bodutu mo go nna. Ke ne ke na le koloi e e neng e le mo matsogong a me, mme mokgweetsi o ne a bua ka tsela e e gakgamatsang.
ty: E au ra e ua faaroo te taata faahoro huru ê i te mau parau, no te mea ua hi'o oia i nia ma te mata ataata. Ua fariu ê atu te horopatete i to'na hoho'a mata, i te hoê â taime, ma te tatara i to'na na manimani rima e piti e ma te haere atu i te tahi pae. " A horo'a mai i te afata ume na'u ", te parau ïa a te taata faahoro pereoo ; e ma te aau oto rahi, ua tuuhia'tu ta'u mau pute i rapae e ua tuuhia'tu i roto i te calèche. I muri iho ua pou vau mai te hiti o te pereoo auahi, a fatata atu ai te calèche ia'u, ua tauturu maira te taata faahoro pereoo ia'u ma te tape'a i to'u rima i roto i te hoê tape'araa auri ; eita e ore e, ua rahi roa to'na puai. Ma te faaara ore, ua ueue ihora oia i ta'na puaahorofenua, ua fariu a'era te puaahorofenua, e ua horo atura matou i roto i te poiri o te pereoo. I to'u hi'oraa i muri, ua ite atura vau i te mori i ni'a i te mau puaahorofenua o te pereoo auahi i piha'i iho i te mori pata, e ua ite atura vau i te mau mori o to'u mau hoa tei pohe. I muri iho, ua tuparari te taata faahoro i ta ' na hui e ua pii atura i ta ' na mau puaahorofenua, e ua horo atura ratou i Bukovina. A tomo atu ai ratou i roto i te pouri ua ite au i te hoê mana'o huru ê, e ua tae mai te hoê mana'o mo'emo'e i ni'a iho ia'u; ua taorahia mai râ te hoê pereue i ni'a i to'u na tapono, e ua tuuhia te hoê vau i ni'a i to'u na turi avae, e ua parau maira te taata faahoro ma te papû maitai e :
mai: विचित्र चालक स्पष्ट रूपसँ ई शब्द सुनलक, किएक तँ ओ चमकैत मुस्कानसँ ऊपर देखलक। यात्री अपन मुँह घुमा लेलक, संगहि अपन दूनू अंगुरी निकालि कऽ अपनाकेँ पार कऽ लेलक। "हमरा हेरक सामान दियौ," ड्राइवर कहलक। आ बहुत तत्परता सं हमर बैग के सौंपि कए कैलेच मे राखि देल गेल। तखन हम कोचक कातसँ उतरलहुँ, किएक तँ कैलेच लगमे छल, ड्राइवर एकटा हाथसँ हमर मदति कयलक जे हमर बांहि स्टीलक पकड़मे पकड़ि लेलक; ओकर ताकत जरूर विलक्षण छलइ। बिना कोनो शब्द के ओ अपन लगाम हिला देलखिन, घोड़ा पलटि गेल, आ हम दर्रा के अन्हार मे बह गेलहुं। जहिना हम पाछू मुड़ि देखलहुँ हम प्रशिक्षकक घोड़ासँ दीपक प्रकाशसँ भाप देखलहुँ, आ ओकर विरुद्ध अपन स्वर्गीय साथीसभक आकृति अपनाकेँ पार करैत देखलहुँ। तखन चालक अपन कोड़ा फाड़ि कऽ अपन घोड़ासभकेँ बजौलक, आ ओ सभ बुकोविना जयबाक बाटमे बहि गेल। जहिना ओ सभ अन्हारमे डूबि गेलाह हमरा एकटा अजीब ठंढा लागल, आ एकटा अकेला एहसास हमरा ऊपर आबि गेल; मुदा हमर कंधा पर एकटा लबादा फेंकल गेल, आ हमर घुटना पर एकटा गलीचा फेंकल गेल, आ ड्राइवर उत्कृष्ट जर्मन मे कहलखिन:-
mg: Toa ren'ilay mpamily hafahafa ilay teny, satria nitsikitsiky be izy. Nihodina ny tarehiny ilay mpandeha, sady nanala ny rantsan-tanany roa ary niampita ny tenany. "Omeo ahy ny entan'i Jehovah," hoy ilay mpamily; ary tamin'ny fahalainana mihoa-pampana no nanolorana ny kitapoko ka napetrany tao an-tampon-trano. Avy eo dia nidina avy teo amin'ny sisin'ny mpanazatra aho, raha teo akaiky teo akaiky teo ilay kalèche, ilay mpamily nanampy ahy tamin'ny tanana iray izay nahazo ny sandriko tamin'ny vy; Tsy maintsy ho tena mahagaga ny heriny. Ary [tsy nandeha] teny amin'ireo [mpangataka] izay mifindrafindra mitety fiara izahay. Rehefa nijery ny lasa aho dia nahita ny entona avy amin'ny soavalin'ny mpanazatra tamin'ny alalan'ny hazavan'ny jiro, ary nampiseho ny sarin'ireo mpiara-mitory tamiko efa nodimandry niampita ny tenany. Avy eo dia nanapaka ny karavasy ilay mpamily ka niantso ny soavaliny, ary dia nandeha izy ireo ka nifaoka an'i Bukovina. Rehefa nilentika tao anatin'ny haizina izy ireo dia nahatsapa hatsiaka hafahafa aho ary nahatsapa ho irery aho; fa nisy lamba nazera teo an-tsoroko, ary nisy tsilo teo amin'ny lohaliko, ary niteny tamin'ny teny alemà tsara ilay mpamily hoe:
