en: I AWOKE in my own bed. If it be that I had not dreamt, the Count must have carried me here. I tried to satisfy myself on the subject, but could not arrive at any unquestionable result. To be sure, there were certain small evidences, such as that my clothes were folded and laid by in a manner which was not my habit. My watch was still unwound, and I am rigorously accustomed to wind it the last thing before going to bed, and many such details. But these things are no proof, for they may have been evidences that my mind was not as usual, and, from some cause or another, I had certainly been much upset. I must watch for proof. Of one thing I am glad: if it was that the Count carried me here and undressed me, he must have been hurried in his task, for my pockets are intact. I am sure this diary would have been a mystery to him which he would not have brooked. He would have taken or destroyed it. As I look round this room, although it has been to me so full of fear, it is now a sort of sanctuary, for nothing can be more dreadful than those awful women, who were—who are—waiting to suck my blood.
vi: Tôi tỉnh dậy trên giường. Nếu quả thực là đêm qua tôi không ngủ mê, thì chắc chắn là bá tước đã đưa tôi về đây. Tôi cố trấn tĩnh lại, nhưng không đi tới một điều gì xác thực cả. Hiển nhiên là tôi trông thấy xung quanh mình những thứ có thể lấy làm bằng chứng: ví dụ, quần áo của tôi được gấp cẩn thận và được đặt trên một chiếc ghế tựa, điều không giống với thói quen của tôi. Ngược lại, kim đồng hồ của tôi bị chết, trong khi tôi luôn có thói quen lên dây cót đồng hồ trước khi đi ngủ. Và còn nhiều chi tiết nữa... Nhưng không, tất cả sẽ chẳng nói lên điều gì nếu như đêm qua tôi bị đãng trí, hoặc vì một nguyên nhân nào đó khiến đầu óc rối tinh rối mù. Tôi cần phải tìm những bằng chứng xác thực. Tuy vậy, vẫn còn một điều làm tôi mừng rỡ: nếu như bá tước là người đã đưa tôi về đây, thì chắc hẳn lão phải rất vội, bởi vì mọi thứ trong túi quần tôi vẫn còn nguyên vẹn. Chắc chắn nếu có tìm thấy những dòng nhật ký này, lão cũng sẽ chẳng hiểu gì cả, vì tôi chỉ viết theo lối tốc ký. Điều đó sẽ làm lão khó chịu và sẽ hủy ngay lập tức những gì tôi viết. Nhìn ngó xung quanh phòng, nơi dù đã trải qua bao lo âu và sợ hãi, tôi vẫn thấy dường như đây chính là nơi tôi còn được yên ổn, bởi chẳng có gì đáng sợ hơn là những người đàn bà ghê tởm đang chờ đợi, chờ đợi để hút máu mình.
tr: Kendi yatağımda uyandım. Eğer rüya görmediysem, Kont beni buraya taşımış olmalı. İnandırıcı bir açıklama bulmaya çalıştım, ama kesin bir sonuca ulaşamadım. Kuşkusuz, giyeceklerimin katlanıp âdetim olmayan biçimde yerleştirilmiş olması gibi kimi küçük kanıtlar vardı. Saatim kurulmamıştı ve yatmaya gitmeden önce yaptığım son şey mutlaka onu kurmak olurdu; bunun gibi daha birçok ayrıntı. Fakat bunlar kanıt olamaz, zira bunlar zihnimin her zamanki gibi olmadığının delili olabilir ve şu ya da bu nedenle, allak bullak olmuş olduğuma kuşku yok. Kanıt bulmak için dikkatli olmalıyım. Bir şeyden memnunum: Eğer Kont beni buraya taşıyıp soyduysa, bunu aceleyle yapmış olmalı çünkü ceplerime dokunulmamış. Eminim ki bu günce onun için dayanamayacağı bir gizem olurdu. Onu almış ve yok etmiş olurdu. Benim için korku dolu olsa da, odama bakıyorum da şimdi bana bir tür sığınak gibi görünüyor çünkü hiçbir şey kanımı emmek için bekleyen -beklemeyi sürdüren- o korkunç kadınlardan daha dehşet verici olamaz.
es: Desperté en mi propia cama. Si es que no ha sido todo un sueño, el conde me debe de haber traído en brazos hasta aquí. Traté de explicarme el suceso, pero no pude llegar a ningún resultado claro. Para estar seguro, había ciertas pequeñas evidencias, tales como que mi ropa estaba doblada y arreglada de manera extraña. Mi reloj no tenía cuerda, y yo estoy rigurosamente acostumbrado a darle cuerda como última cosa antes de acostarme, y otros detalles parecidos. Pero todas estas cosas no son ninguna prueba definitiva, pues pueden ser evidencias de que mi mente no estaba en su estado normal, y, por una u otra causa, la verdad es que había estado muy excitado. Tengo que observar para probar. De una cosa me alegro: si fue el conde el que me trajo hasta aquí y me desvistió, debe haberlo hecho todo deprisa, pues mis bolsillos estaban intactos. Estoy seguro de que este diario hubiera sido para él un misterio que no hubiera soportado. Se lo habría llevado o lo habría destruido. Al mirar en torno de este cuarto, aunque ha sido tan intimidante para mí, veo que es ahora una especie de santuario, pues nada puede ser más terrible que esas monstruosas mujeres que estaban allí -están esperando para chuparme la sangre.
vi_translation: I woke up in bed. If it is true that I wasn't dreaming last night, then surely the count must have brought me back here. I tried to calm myself, but I couldn't come to any definite conclusion. Obviously, I saw things around me that could serve as evidence: for example, my clothes were carefully folded and placed on a chair, which is not my usual habit. On the other hand, my watch had stopped, even though I always wind it before going to bed. And there were many other details...But no, none of this would mean anything if I had been absent-minded last night, or if some reason had caused my mind to be in a whirl. I need to find concrete evidence. However, there was still one thing that made me happy: if the count was the one who brought me back here, he must have been in a great hurry, because everything in my pockets was still intact. Surely, if he found these diary entries, he wouldn't understand anything, because I write in shorthand. That would annoy him and he would immediately destroy what I had written. Looking around the room, where despite all the anxiety and fear I had experienced, I still felt that this was the only place I could be safe, because nothing was more terrifying than those dreadful women waiting, waiting to suck my blood.
tr_translation: I woke up in my own bed. If I didn't dream, the Count must have carried me here. I tried to find a convincing explanation, but I couldn't reach a definite conclusion. Undoubtedly, there were some small pieces of evidence, like my clothes being folded and placed in a manner that is not my habit. My watch was not wound, and the last thing I would do before going to bed would certainly be to wind it; many other details like this. But these cannot be evidence, as they could be proof that my mind is not as usual and for one reason or another, there is no doubt that I was all mixed up. I must be careful to find evidence. I am pleased about one thing: If the Count carried me here and undressed me, he must have done it in a hurry because my pockets were untouched. I am sure this journal would be an irresistible mystery for him. He would have taken and destroyed it. Although it is filled with fear for me, as I look at my room now, it seems like a kind of refuge because nothing can be more terrifying than those dreadful women waiting to suck my blood -continuing to wait.
es_translation: I woke up in my own bed. If it hasn't all been a dream, the count must have carried me here in his arms. I tried to explain the event to myself, but I couldn't reach any clear conclusion. To be sure, there were certain small pieces of evidence, such as my clothes being folded and arranged in a strange manner. My watch was unwound, and I am strictly accustomed to winding it as the last thing before going to bed, and other similar details. But all these things are not definitive proof, as they could be evidence that my mind was not in its normal state, and, for one reason or another, the truth is that I had been very excited. I have to observe to prove. One thing I am glad about: if it was the count who brought me here and undressed me, he must have done it all quickly, for my pockets were intact. I am sure this diary would have been a mystery he could not have endured. He would have taken it or destroyed it. Looking around this room, although it has been so intimidating to me, I see that it is now a kind of sanctuary, for nothing can be more terrible than those monstrous women who were there - they are waiting to suck my blood.
st: Ke ne ke lula ke le betheng ea ka. Haeba ke ne ke sa lore, o tlameha ebe o ntsamaisa mona. Ke lekile ho itlhahloba ka taba ena, empa ke ne ke sa khone ho fihlela sephetho leha e le sefe se ke keng sa lebelloa. Ho na le bonnete ba hore ho ne ho e-na le bopaki bo itseng bo bonyenyane, joalo ka hore liaparo tsa ka li ile tsa phuthiloe 'me tsa beoa ka mokhoa oo e neng e se tloaelo ea ka. Oache ea ka e ne e ntse e sa tsitsa, 'me ke tloaetse ka thata ho e fetola ntho ea ho qetela pele ke robala, le lintlha tse ngata tse joalo. Empa lintho tsena ha li na bopaki, hobane e kanna eaba e bile bopaki ba hore kelello ea ka e ne e se joalo ka tloaelo, mme, ho tsoa ho sesosa kapa se seng, ka sebele ke ne ke ferekane haholo. Ke tlameha ho sheba bopaki. Ka ntho e le 'ngoe ke thabile: haeba e ne e le hore Count e ntsamaisa mona ebe e ntsamaisa, o tlameha ebe o ile a potlaka mosebetsing oa hae, hobane lipokotho tsa ka ha li sa senyeha. Ke na le bonnete ba hore buka ena e ne e tla ba sephiri ho eena eo a neng a ke ke a e-na le eona. O ne a tla be a e nkile kapa a e senya. Ha ke ntse ke sheba ka phapusing ena, leha e bile ho 'na e tletse tšabo, joale ke mofuta oa sehalalelo, hobane ha ho letho le ka tšosang ho feta basali ba tšabehang, ba neng ba nahana hore ke mang ea neng a lebeletse ho anya mali a ka.
yo: Mo jí lórí ibùsùn mi. Bí ó bá jẹ́ pé mi ò lá àlá, òǹkà gbọ́dọ̀ ti gbé mi dé ibí. Mo gbìyànjú láti tẹ́ ara mi lọ́rùn lórí kókó náà, ṣùgbọ́n mi ò lè dé èsì kankan tí kò ní ìbéèrè. Láti mọ̀ dájú, àwọn ẹ̀rí kékeré kan wà, gẹ́gẹ́ bíi pé wọ́n ká aṣọ mi tí wọ́n sì gbé kalẹ̀ ní ọ̀nà tí kì í ṣe ìwà mi. Aago mi kò tíì bẹ̀rù, ó sì ti mọ́ mi lára láti ṣe àtúnṣe rẹ̀ ohun ìkẹyìn kí n tó lọ sùn, àti ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ irú àlàyé bẹ́ẹ̀. Ṣùgbọ́n àwọn nkan wọ̀nyí kì í ṣe ẹ̀rí, nítorí wọ́n lè ti jẹ́ ẹ̀rí pé ọkàn mi kì í ṣe gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìgbà gbogbo, àti pé, láti ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn ìdí kan tàbí òmíràn, inú bí mi gidi gan-an. Mo gbọ́dọ̀ ṣọ́ ẹ̀rí. Nínú ohun kan inú mi dùn: tí ó bá jẹ́ pé Count gbé mi lọ síbí tí ó sì bọ́ aṣọ mi, ó gbọ́dọ̀ ti kánjú nínú iṣẹ́ rẹ̀, nítorí àpò mi wà ní ìparun. Ó dá mi lójú pé ìwé àkọsílẹ̀ yìí ìbá ti jẹ́ ohun àṣírí fún un èyí tí kò bá ti brooked. Kò bá ti mú tàbí pa á run. Bí mo ṣe ń wo àyíká yàrá yìí, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ó ti kún fún ìbẹ̀rù fún mi, ó ti di irúfẹ́ ibi mímọ́ báyìí, nítorí kò sí ohun tí ó lè burú ju àwọn obìnrin burúkú yẹn lọ, tí wọ́n jẹ́ - tí wọ́n jẹ́ - tí wọ́n ń dúró láti fa ẹ̀jẹ̀ mi.
tn: Ke ne ka tsoga mo bolaong jwa me. Fa e le gore ga ke a ka dira jalo, ke ne ka tshwanelwa ke go dira jalo, ke ne ka tshwanelwa ke go dira jalo. Ke ne ka leka go ikgotsofatsa ka kgang eno mme ke ne ke sa kgone go fitlhelela diphelelo tse di sa itumediseng. Go ne go na le bosupi jo bo rileng jo bo tshwanang le jwa gore diaparo tsa me di ne di phuthetswe e bile di beilwe ka tsela e e neng e se tlwaelo ya me. Ke ne ke sa ntse ke le pelo, mme ke ne ke tlwaetse thata go e dira pele ke robala, le dilo tse dintsi tse ke neng ke di dira. Mme dilo tseno ga di na bosupi, ka gonne e ka tswa e ne e le bosupi jwa gore tlhaloganyo ya me ga e tshwane le ya tlwaelo, mme, ka ntlha ya mabaka mangwe, ke ne ke tshwenyegile tota. Ke tshwanetse go nna le bosupi jwa gore ke bone bosupi. Ke a itumela: Fa e le gore go ne go le thata go ntlhokomela fa, a ka bo a ntiretse, o tshwanetse a bo a ile a bo a le mo tirong ya gagwe, ka ntlha ya gore ditshipi tsa me ga di a ka tsa ntlhokomela. Ke a itse gore kgang eno e ne e le sephiri se a neng a sa se kgone go se dira. O ne a ka bo a e tsere kgotsa a e senya. Fa ke ntse ke leba mo ntlong eno, le fa ke ne ke le mo letshogong thata, ga go na sepe se se ka tshosang go feta basadi ba ba bosula, ba ba neng ba le gaufi le go fudusa madi a me.
ty: UA ARA MAI au i nia i to ' u iho ro'i. Mai te mea e, aita vau i moemoea, ua afa'i mai ïa te reira ia'u i ô nei. Ua tamata vau i te haamâha i to ' u mau mana'o no nia i teie tumu parau, aita râ i noaa mai ia ' u i te hoê noa ' ' e faahopearaa papu maitai. Parau mau, te vai ra te tahi mau haapapuraa iti, mai te mea ra e ua tufetuhia to ' u mau ahu e ua tuuhia vau ia au i te hoê peu e ere hoi na ' u. Te vai noa ra ta'u uati, e ua matau roa vau i te mata'ita'i i te reira hou a haere ai e taoto, e e rave rahi atu â mau mea mai te reira te huru. E ere râ teie mau mea i te haapapuraa, no te mea ua riro paha te reira ei haapapuraa e e ere to ' u feruriraa mai tei matauhia, e, no te tahi tumu aore ra te tahi atu, ua inoino roa vau. E tia ia ' u ia tiai i te haapapuraa. Te oaoa nei au i te hoê mea: mai te peu e ua afai mai te taata taio ia ' u i ǒ nei e ua tatara mai oia i to ' u ahu, eita e ore e ua haavitiviti oia i ta ' na ohipa, no te mea aita to ' u mau pute i taui. Ua papû ia'u e, e riro teie buka aamu ei ohipa maere no'na, o ta'na ho'i i ore i ite. E rave e aore râ, e haamou oia i te reira. Ia hi'o ana'e au i roto i teie piha, noa'tu e ua î roa vau i te ri'ari'a, ua riro ïa i teie nei ei vahi mo'a, no te mea aita'tu e mea ri'ari'a a'e i taua mau vahine ri'ari'a ra, o ratou—o te tia'i nei i te ote i to'u toto.
mai: हम अपन बिस्तर पर जागि गेलहुं। जँ एहन होइत जे हम सपना नहि देखलहुं तखन काउंट हमरा एतय लऽ गेल हेताह। हम एहि विषय पर अपनाकेँ संतुष्ट करबाक प्रयास कयलहुँ, मुदा कोनो निर्विवाद परिणाम पर नहि पहुँचि सकलहुँ। निश्चित रूपसँ किछु छोट-छोट प्रमाण छल, जेना कि हमर कपड़ा मोड़ि कऽ एहि तरहेँ बिछाओल गेल छल जे हमर आदत नहि छल। हमर घड़ी एखनहु अप्रभावित छल, आ हम सुतबासँ पहिने एकरा अंतिम चीज आ एहन कतेको विवरणकेँ हवा देबाक कठोरतासँ आदी छी। मुदा ई बात कोनो प्रमाण नहि अछि, किएक तँ ई एहि बातक प्रमाण भऽ सकैत अछि जे हमर मन सामान्य रूपसँ नहि छल, आओर कोनो न कोनो कारणसँ हम निश्चित रूपसँ बहुत परेशान छलहुँ। हमरा सबूत के लेल जरूर देखबाक चाही। एकटा बातसँ हम प्रसन्न छी: जँ ई छल जे काउंट हमरा एतय लऽ गेल आ हमरा कपड़ा उतारि देलक, तँ ओ अपन काजमे जल्दबाजी कऽ रहल हेताह, किएक तँ हमर जेब अक्षुण्ण अछि। हमरा विश्वास अछि जे ई डायरी हुनका लेल एकटा रहस्य रहत जकरा ओ स्वीकार नहि करताह। ओ एकरा लए लेत या नष्ट कए देत। जहिना हम एहि कोठरीक चारू कात देखैत छी, यद्यपि ई हमरा लेल एतेक भयसँ भरल अछि, आब ई एक तरहक अभयारण्य अछि, किएक तँ ओहि भयानक महिलासभसँ बेसी भयानक किछु नहि भऽ सकैत अछि, जे हमर खून चूसबाक प्रतीक्षा कऽ रहल छलीह।
mg: Nifoha teo am-pandriako aho. Raha toa ka tsy nanonofy aho, dia tsy maintsy nitondra ahy teto ny Isa. Niezaka ny hanome fahafaham-po ny tenako momba izany aho, saingy tsy afaka ny ho tonga amin'ny vokatra tsy azo iadian-kevitra. Marina fa nisy porofo kely vitsivitsy, toy ny hoe naforitra ny akanjoko ary napetraka tamin'ny fomba tsy nahazatra ahy. Mbola tsy naratra ny famantaranandroko, ary efa zatra ny rivotra farany aho alohan'ny hatoriana, sy ny tsipiriany maro toy izany. Saingy tsy porofo ireo zavatra ireo, satria mety ho porofo izany fa tsy toy ny mahazatra ny saiko, ary noho ny antony iray na amin'ny antony hafa, dia azo antoka fa tezitra be aho. Tsy maintsy mijery ny porofo aho. Zavatra iray loha no mahafaly ahy: raha ny fanisana no nitondra ahy teto ka namaha ahy, dia tsy maintsy ho maika tamin'ny asany izy, satria tsy misy tomika ny paoziko. Azoko antoka fa ho zava-miafina ho azy ity diary ity izay tsy ho nalefany tamin'ny renirano. Mety ho naka na nandrava izany izy. Rehefa mijery manodidina ity efitrano ity aho, na dia feno tahotra aza izany ho ahy, dia karazana fitoerana masina izany ankehitriny, satria tsy misy zavatra mahatsiravina kokoa noho ireo vehivavy mahatsiravina ireo—izay—miandry ny hampinono ny rako.

en: I shall write some letters home, and shall try to get them to have them posted. I have already spoken them through my window to begin acquaintanceship. They took their hats off and made obeisance and many signs, which, however, I could not understand any more than I could their spoken language....
vi: Tôi sẽ viết vài lá thư rồi cố gắng nhờ họ gửi hộ ra bưu điện. Tôi đã bắt chuyện với họ từ cửa sổ phòng mình, chúng tôi đã làm quen với nhau. Họ biểu lộ tâm tư bằng cách cúi đầu thật thấp và làm mọi cách nói bằng dấu hiệu với tôi, mà thú thực là tôi chẳng hiểu gì cả.
vi_results: "title": "The Diary of a Country Priest", "author": "Georges Bernanos"
tr: Eve birkaç mektup yazmaya ve bu Çingenelerin onları postalamalarını sağlamaya çalışacağım. Onlarla bir tür tanışıklık kurabilmek için penceremden konuştum bile. Şapkalarını çıkarttılar, önümde eğildiler ve konuşma dillerini anlayamadığım gibi anlam veremediğim pek çok işaret yaptılar...
es: Escribiré algunas cartas a mi casa y trataré de convencerlos de que las pongan en el correo. Ya les he hablado a través de la ventana para comenzar a conocerlos. Se quitaron los sombreros e hicieron muchas reverencias y señas, las cuales, sin embargo, no pude entender más de lo que entiendo la lengua que hablan…
es_results: "title": "Don Quijote de la Mancha", "author": "Miguel de Cervantes"
vi_translation: I will write a few letters and try to ask them to send them to the post office for me. I have started talking to them from my room window, and we have gotten to know each other. They express their feelings by bowing very low and trying to communicate with me through gestures, which, to be honest, I don't understand at all.
tr_translation: I will try to write a few letters and have these Gypsies mail them. I even spoke to them from my window to establish some sort of acquaintance. They took off their hats, bowed before me, and made many signs that I couldn't understand, just as I couldn't understand their spoken language...
es_translation: I will write some letters to my home and try to convince them to put them in the mail. I have already spoken to them through the window to start getting to know them. They took off their hats and made many bows and gestures, which, however, I could not understand any more than I understand the language they speak...
st: Ke tla ngola mangolo a mang hae, 'me ke tla leka ho li beha. Ke se ke ntse ke bua le bona ka fensetere ea ka ho qala ho tseba. Ba nka likatiba tsa bona mme ba etsa hore ho bebeisance le lipontšo tse ngata, tseo leha ho le joalo, ke ne ke sa khone ho utloisisa ho feta kamoo ke neng ke khona ho bua puo ea bona.
yo: Mo máa kọ àwọn lẹ́tà díẹ̀ sí ilé, n ó sì gbìyànjú láti jẹ́ kí wọ́n fi wọ́n ṣọwọ́. Mo ti bá wọn sọ̀rọ̀ láti ojú fèrèsé mi láti bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìbáṣepọ̀. Wọ́n yọ fìlà wọn kúrò wọ́n sì ṣe ìpalára àti ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àmì, èyí tí, síbẹ̀síbẹ̀, mi ò lè lóye ju bí mo ṣe lè sọ èdè wọn lọ...
tn: Ke tla kwala makwalo a a kwa gae, mme ke tla leka go ba isa kwa go bone. Ke ne ke ntse ke bua le bone ka fensetere gore ke simolole go bua le bone. Ba ne ba tsaya ditlhako tsa bone, ba dira boaka le ditshupo tse dintsi tse ke neng ke sa di tlhaloganye go feta ka moo ke neng ke kgona go bua puo ya bone ka teng.
ty: E papa'i au i te tahi mau rata i te fare, e e tamata vau i te faaho'i i te reira i te fare. Ua paraparau a'ena vau i te reira na roto i te haamaramarama no te haamata i te matau. Ua tatara ratou i to ratou taupoo e ua tamau i te mau tapao e rave rahi, o ta ' u hoi i ore i taa hau atu i ta ' u e nehenehe e paraparau....
mai: हम किछु पत्र घर पर लिखब, आ ओकरा पोस्ट करय के कोशिश करब। परिचय शुरू करबाक लेल हम अपन खिड़कीसँ हुनका सभसँ पहिनेसँ बात कऽ चुकल छी। ओ लोकनि अपन टोपी उतारि प्रणाम आ कतेको संकेत देलनि, जे तथापि, हम हुनक बाजल जायवला भाषासँ बेसी नहि बुझि सकैत छलहुँ।
mg: Hanoratra taratasy vitsivitsy any an-trano aho, ary hiezaka ny hamoaka azy ireo. Efa niteny azy ireo tamin'ny alalan'ny varavarankeliko aho mba hanombohana ny maha-olom-pantatra. Nesorin'izy ireo ny satrokany ary nanao ompa sy famantarana maro izy ireo, izay tsy azoko afa-tsy ny fitenin'izy ireo ihany.

en: 31 May.—This morning when I woke I thought I would provide myself with some paper and envelopes from my bag and keep them in my pocket, so that I might write in case I should get an opportunity, but again a surprise, again a shock!
vi: • Ngày 31 tháng 5 Ý nghĩ đầu tiên của tôi khi thức dậy sáng nay là lấy vài tờ giấy và mấy cái phong bì cất trong túi du lịch nhét vào túi áo, để có thể tranh thủ viết nếu có dịp trong ngày.
tr: 31 Mayıs. - Bu sabah uyandığımda, elime fırsat geçmesi durumunda yazabileyim, diye çantamdan biraz kâğıt ve zarf alıp onları cebimde saklamayı düşündüm; fakat yine bir şaşkınlık, yine bir şok!
es: 31 de mayo. Esta mañana, cuando desperté, pensé que sacaría algunos papeles y sobres de mi portafolios y los guardaría en mi bolsillo, de manera que pudiera escribir en caso de encontrar alguna oportunidad; pero otra vez una sorpresa me esperaba. ¡Una gran sorpresa!
vi_translation: • May 31 My first thought when I woke up this morning was to take a few sheets of paper and some envelopes stored in my travel bag and put them in my jacket pocket, so I could take advantage of any opportunity to write during the day. But then another surprise, another shock came to me!
tr_translation: May 31. - This morning, when I woke up, I thought of taking some paper and envelopes from my bag and keeping them in my pocket so that I could write if I got the chance; but again, a surprise, again a shock!
es_translation: May 31. This morning, when I woke up, I thought I would take some papers and envelopes out of my briefcase and put them in my pocket, so that I could write in case I found an opportunity; but once again a surprise awaited me. A big surprise!
st: 31 Mots'eanong.... ha ke tsoha ke ne ke nahana hore ke tla iphepa ka pampiri le li-enfelopo tse tsoang mokotleng oa ka ebe ke li boloka ka pokothong ea ka, e le hore nka ngola haeba ke lokela ho fumana monyetla, empa hape ke maketse hape!
yo: 31 May.- Ní àárọ̀ yìí nígbà tí mo jí mo rò pé mà á pèsè àwọn ìwé àti àpò ìwé fún ara mi láti inú àpò mi kí n sì tọ́jú wọn sínú àpò mi, kí n lè kọ̀wé bí ó bá ṣẹlẹ̀ pé kí n ní àfààní, ṣùgbọ́n lẹ́ẹ̀kan síi ìyàlẹ́nu, lẹ́ẹ̀kan si ìyàlẹ́nu!
tn: 31 Mo mosong ono, fa ke tsoga, ke ne ke akanya gore ke tla inyatsa pampiri le dibui mo mokotleng wa me gore ke di boloke mo pokothong ya me, gore ke tle ke kgone go kwala fa ke ka bona sebaka, mme gape ke gakgamala gape!
ty: 31 No me—I teie po'ipo'i a ara mai ai au, ua mana'o vau e, e horo'a vau i te tahi mau api parau e te tahi mau vehi rata i roto i ta'u pute, e e tape'a vau i te reira i roto i to'u pute, ia ti'a ia'u ia papa'i mai te mea e, e farii au i te hoê rave'a, tera râ, ua hitimahuta faahou vau !
mai: ३१ मई।—आइ भोर जखन हम उठलहुँ तखन हम सोचलहुँ जे हम अपन बैगसँ किछु कागज आ लिफाफा प्रदान करब आ ओकरा अपन जेबमे राखि देब, जाहिसँ अवसर भेटला पर हम लिखि सकब, मुदा फेर एकटा आश्चर्य, फेर एकटा झटका!

en: Every scrap of paper was gone, and with it all my notes, my memoranda, relating to railways and travel, my letter of credit, in fact all that might be useful to me were I once outside the castle. I sat and pondered awhile, and then some thought occurred to me, and I made search of my portmanteau and in the wardrobe where I had placed my clothes.
vi: Nhưng lại thêm một sự kinh ngạc, một cú sốc nữa đến với tôi! Tất cả giấy má của tôi đều đã biến mất, từ những thứ vô nghĩa cho tới những thứ cần thiết và không cần thiết cho tôi nếu như tôi có cơ hội rời khỏi lâu đài. Ngồi thừ một lúc tôi mới sực nhớ đến việc kiểm tra nốt chiếc vali và tủ quần áo, nơi tôi cất quần áo của mình.
tr: Bütün kâğıt parçaları ve onlarla birlikte tüm notlarım, demiryollarına ve yolculuğa ilişkin notlarım, kredi mektubum, aslında, şatodan çıkmam durumunda bana yararı olabilecek her şey gitmişti. Bir süre oturup düşündüm ve derken aklıma bir fikir geldi; giysilerimi koyduğum portmantomu ve gardırobumu aradım.
es: No pude encontrar ni un pedazo de papel. Todo había desaparecido, junto con mis notas, mis apuntes relativos al ferrocarril y al viaje, mis credenciales. De hecho, todo lo que me pudiera ser útil una vez que yo saliera del castillo. Me senté y reflexioné unos instantes; entonces se me ocurrió una idea y me dirigí a buscar mi maleta ligera, y al guardarropa donde había colocado mis trajes.
vi_translation: All my papers had disappeared, from the meaningless ones to the necessary and unnecessary ones for me if I had the chance to leave the castle. Sitting idly for a while, I suddenly remembered to check the remaining suitcase and the wardrobe where I kept my clothes.
tr_translation: All the pieces of paper and along with them all my notes, my notes on railways and travel, my letter of credit, in fact, everything that could be useful to me if I left the castle, was gone. I sat and thought for a while, and then an idea came to my mind; I searched my wardrobe and the coat rack where I had put my clothes.
es_translation: I couldn't find even a piece of paper. Everything had disappeared, along with my notes, my railway and travel-related notes, my credentials. In fact, everything that could be useful to me once I left the castle. I sat down and reflected for a few moments; then an idea occurred to me and I went to look for my light suitcase, and to the wardrobe where I had placed my suits.
st: Sekhahla se seng le se seng sa pampiri se ne se felile, 'me ka eona lintlha tsohle tsa ka, memoranda ea ka, tse amanang le literene le maeto, lengolo la ka la mokitlane, ha e le hantle sohle se ka bang molemo ho nna e ne e kile ea ba ka ntle ho qhobosheane. Ke ile ka lula le ho nahanisisa ka nakoana, 'me ka mor'a moo ke ne ke nahana hore ho etsahetse ho' na, 'me ke ile ka batla portmanteau ea ka le ka liaparo tsa ka moo ke neng ke beha liaparo tsa ka teng.
yo: Gbogbo ìwé ni wọ́n ti lọ, pẹ̀lú gbogbo rẹ̀ àwọn àkọsílẹ̀ mi, àkọsílẹ̀ mi, tí ó ní í ṣe pẹ̀lú ọkọ̀ ojú irin àti ìrìn-àjò, lẹ́tà ìyìn mi, lóòótọ́ gbogbo ohun tí ó lè wúlò fún mi ni mo bá ti wà ní ìta ilé náà rí. Mo jókòó mo sì ronú nípa ìgbà díẹ̀, lẹ́yìn náà àwọn èrò kan ṣẹlẹ̀ sí mi, mo sì wá portmanteau mi àti nínú àpótí aṣọ níbi tí mo ti gbé aṣọ mi sí.
tn: Go ne go na le sengwe le sengwe se ke neng ke se na le dibuka tsa me tse di amanang le diporo le maeto a me, e bile go ne go na le sengwe se ke neng ke se na le mosola mo go nna ke ne ke le kwa ntle ga ntlo. Ke ile ka dula fatshe mme ka nahana ka nako e itseng, mme ka nahana ka nna, mme ka batla diaparo tsa ka le diaparo tsa ka.
ty: Ua pau te mau api parau atoa, e na roto i te reira, ua papa'i au i ta'u mau nota atoa, ta'u memoranda, no ni'a i te mau pereoo auahi e te mau ratereraa, ta'u rata haamauruuru, oia ho'i, te mau mea atoa e nehenehe e riro ei mea faufaa no'u, ahiri e, tei rapae au i te aorai. Ua parahi e ua feruri hohonu vau, e i muri iho ua tupu mai te tahi mana'o i roto ia'u, e ua imi au i to'u huru ahu e i roto i te vairaa ahu i reira to'u tuuraa i to'u mau ahu.
mai: कागजक प्रत्येक कबाड़ चलि गेल छल, आ एकरा सङ्ग हमर सभ नोट, हमर ज्ञापन, रेलवे आ यात्रासँ सम्बन्धित हमर ज्ञापनपत्र, वास्तवमे जे किछु हमरा लेल उपयोगी भऽ सकैत छल ओ सब हम एक बेर महलक बाहर छलहुँ। हम बैसल आ कने काल सोचलहुँ, आ तखन हमरा किछु विचार भेल, आ हम अपन पोर्टमैन्टू आ अलमारीमे खोज कयलहुँ जतय हम अपन कपड़ा रखने छलहुँ।
mg: Lasa avokoa ny taratasy rehetra, ary miaraka amin'izany ny naotiko rehetra, ny memoranda-ko, mifandraika amin'ny lalamby sy ny dia, ny taratasy fitrosako, raha ny marina dia ny hany zavatra mety ho ilaina amiko dia indray mandeha ivelan'ny lapa aho. en: It makes me rage to think that this can go on, and whilst I am shut up here, a veritable prisoner, but without that protection of the law which is even a criminal’s right and consolation.
vi: Tôi bắt đầu thấy điên tiết khi nghĩ mọi mánh khóe của lão rồi vẫn cứ tiếp tục diễn ra trong khi tôi bị khóa chặt ở đây, bị nhốt như một tù nhân thực sự mà không hề có một sự che chở, bảo vệ nào.
vi_results: "title": "Đại bàng bay lượn trên bầu trời", "author": "Nguyễn Tuân"
tr: Burada gerçek bir tutuklu gibi kapalı kalmışken ve suçluların bile hakkı ve avuntusu olan yasanın korumasından yoksunken bunun sürebileceğini düşünmek beni öfkelendiriyor.
es: Me enfurece pensar que esto pueda seguir así, y mientras tanto yo permanezco encerrado aquí, como un verdadero prisionero, pero sin esa protección de la ley que es incluso el derecho y la consolación de los criminales.
vi_translation: I started to feel furious when I thought about all the tricks of that old man, yet they still continued while I was locked up here, imprisoned like a real prisoner without any protection or shelter.
tr_translation: It angers me to think that this could continue while I am confined here like a real prisoner and deprived of the protection of the law, which is a right and solace even for criminals.
es_translation: It infuriates me to think that this could continue like this, and meanwhile I remain locked up here, like a true prisoner, but without that protection of the law that is even the right and consolation of criminals.
st: Ho etsa hore ke halefetse ho nahana hore sena se ka tsoela pele, 'me ha ke ntse ke koaloa mona, motšoaruoa ea nang le bonnete, empa ntle le ts'ireletso eo ea molao eo e leng tokelo le matšeliso a senokoane.

en: Same day, later.—I have made the effort, and God, helping me, have come safely back to this room. I must put down every detail in order. I went whilst my courage was fresh straight to the window on the south side, and at once got outside on the narrow ledge of stone which runs around the building on this side. The stones are big and roughly cut, and the mortar has by process of time been washed away between them. I took off my boots, and ventured out on the desperate way. I looked down once, so as to make sure that a sudden glimpse of the awful depth would not overcome me, but after that kept my eyes away from it. I knew pretty well the direction and distance of the Count’s window, and made for it as well as I could, having regard to the opportunities available. I did not feel dizzy—I suppose I was too excited—and the time seemed ridiculously short till I found myself standing on the window-sill and trying to raise up the sash. I was filled with agitation, however, when I bent down and slid feet foremost in through the window. Then I looked around for the Count, but, with surprise and gladness, made a discovery. The room was empty! It was barely furnished with odd things, which seemed to have never been used; the furniture was something the same style as that in the south rooms, and was covered with dust. I looked for the key, but it was not in the lock, and I could not find it anywhere. The only thing I found was a great heap of gold in one corner—gold of all kinds, Roman, and British, and Austrian, and Hungarian, and Greek and Turkish money, covered with a film of dust, as though it had lain long in the ground. None of it that I noticed was less than three hundred years old. There were also chains and ornaments, some jewelled, but all of them old and stained.
vi: • Buổi sáng cùng ngày, một lúc sau Vậy là tôi đã xuống được dưới đó và ơn Chúa phù hộ, tôi đã trở về phòng mình mà không sứt mẻ gì cả. Tôi sẽ giải thích mọi chi tiết ngay bây giờ. Lúc đó, không hiểu sao tôi lại can đảm đến thế! Tôi đi về phía ô cửa sổ phía nam lâu đài rồi leo ngay lên rìa đá hẹp chạy dọc bức tường bên ngoài. Các viên đá xây ngoài rìa tường đều rất lớn và chỉ được đục đẽo rất sơ sài giữa các mạch vữa, như tôi đã nói, đều tróc lở vì năm tháng. Việc tôi đặt chân lên các gờ đá cheo leo này cũng đồng nghĩa với việc lao vào một cuộc phiêu lưu chết người. Leo được vài bước, tôi thử cúi nhòm xuống dưới chân lâu đài nằm sâu hun hút xem có chóng mặt không, nhưng rõ ràng là tôi không dám làm như vậy quá một giây. Tôi hoàn toàn xác định được vị trí ô cửa sổ phòng lão bá tước và cố gắng leo tới đó càng sớm càng tốt. Sự cheo leo của rìa tường không làm tôi chóng mặt, bởi lúc nào tôi cũng cố gắng nhìn ngang. Và trong một khoảng thời gian mà tôi thấy là rất ngắn ngủi, tôi đã leo tới rìa cửa sổ cánh sập phòng lão bá tước. Sau khi đẩy được cánh cửa lên, tôi co gập người, thò hai chân vào trước rồi chuồi vào trong phòng. Tôi lấm lét nhìn quanh, thật may là lão bá tước không có trong phòng. Đồ đạc dưới này không có gì nhiều chỉ có vài thứ đồ gỗ cọc cạch có vẻ như chẳng bao giờ được sử dụng; thứ nào thứ nấy đều phủ đầy bụi, một số trông rất giống với những đồ tôi đã trông thấy trong các phòng ở chái phía nam lâu đài. Tôi nghĩ ngay đến chiếc chìa khóa, nhưng nó không được cắm trong ổ, và tôi cũng không tìm thấy ở đâu cả. Sự chú ý của tôi dừng lại ở một đống tiền vàng đầy tú ụ nằm ở góc phòng - đó là đống tiền xu đủ loại của các nước Rumani, Anh, Áo, Hungary, Hy Lạp. Những đồng tiền này có vẻ như đã nằm ở đó từ rất lâu bởi có một lớp bụi phủ dày. Tất cả đều là những đồng tiền cổ có niên đại cách đây ít nhất là ba trăm năm. Tôi cũng nhận ra vài sợi dây chuyền và mấy đồ mỹ nghệ có nạm ít nhiều đá quý, nhưng những thứ này đều rất cũ kỹ và bị hư hỏng cả.
tr: Aynı gün, daha sonra. - Elimden geleni yaptım ve Tanrı’nın da yardımıyla sağ salim bu odaya döndüm. Tüm ayrıntıları sırasıyla yazmalıyım. Henüz cesaretim tazeyken dosdoğru şatonun güney yakasındaki pencereye gittim ve hemen binanın bu yakasını çevreleyen dar taş çıkıntıya çıktım. Taşlar iri ve kaba kesilmişti ve aralarındaki sıva, zaman içinde aşınmıştı. Botlarımı çıkarttım ve bu umutsuz yola atıldım. Korkunç derinliği aniden görüp ona yenilmeyeyim, diye bir kez aşağı baktım, ama sonra gözlerimi ondan uzak tuttum. Yönü ve Kont’un penceresinin uzaklığını oldukça iyi biliyordum ve elimdeki fırsatı kaçırmamak için olabildiğince iyi şekilde oraya yöneldim. Başım dönmedi -sanırım fazlasıyla heyecanlıydım- kendimi pencere eşiğinde durup kanadı açmaya çalışırken bulana dek geçen süre, komik biçimde kısa göründü. Fakat eğilip önce ayaklarım pencereden içeri kaydığı zaman gerildim. Sonra çevreye bakınıp Kont’u aradım fakat şaşkınlık ve hoşnutlukla bir şey keşfettim. Oda boştu! Hiç kullanılmamış gibi görünen az sayıda tuhaf eşyayla döşenmişti; odadaki mobilyalar güney kanadındaki odalarla aynı tarzdaydı ve tozla kaplanmıştı. Anahtarı aradım ama kilitte değildi ve hiçbir yerde bulamadım. Onun yerine bulduğum tek şey, köşelerin birindeki büyük altın yığınıydı - her türlü altın, uzun süredir yerde duruyorlarmışçasına üzerleri toz tabakasıyla kaplı Roma, İngiliz, Avusturya, Macaristan, Yunan ve Türk paraları. Dikkatimi çekenler arasında üç yüz yıldan yeni olan yoktu. Kimi değerli taşlarla süslenmiş zincirler ve süs eşyaları da vardı fakat hepsi eski ve lekeliydi.
es: Mismo día, más tarde. He hecho el esfuerzo, y con ayuda de Dios he regresado a salvo a este cuarto. Debo escribir en orden cada detalle. Fui, mientras todavía mi valor estaba fresco, directamente a la ventana del lado sur, y salí fuera de este lado. Las piedras son grandes y están cortadas toscamente, y por el proceso del tiempo el mortero se ha desgastado. Me quité las botas y me aventuré como un desesperado. Miré una vez hacia abajo, como para asegurarme de que una repentina mirada de la horripilante profundidad no me sobrecogería, pero después de ello mantuve los ojos viendo hacia adelante. Conozco bastante bien la ventana del conde, y me dirigí hacia ella lo mejor que pude, atendiendo a las oportunidades que se me presentaban. No me sentí mareado, supongo que estaba demasiado nervioso, y el tiempo que tardé en llegar hasta el antepecho de la ventana me pareció ridículamente corto. En un santiamén me encontré tratando de levantar la guillotina. Sin embargo, cuando me deslicé con los pies primero a través de la ventana, era presa de una terrible agitación. Luego busqué por todos lados al conde, pero, con sorpresa y alegría, hice un descubrimiento: ¡el cuarto estaba vacío! Apenas estaba amueblado con cosas raras, que parecían no haber sido usadas nunca; los muebles eran de un estilo algo parecido a los que había en los cuartos situados al sur, y estaban cubiertos de polvo. Busqué la llave, pero no estaba en la cerradura, y no la pude encontrar por ningún lado. Lo único que encontré fue un gran montón de oro en una esquina, oro de todas clases, en monedas romanas y británicas, austriacas y húngaras, griegas y turcas. Las monedas estaban cubiertas de una película de polvo, como si hubiesen yacido durante largo tiempo en el suelo. Ninguna de las que noté tenía menos de trescientos años. También había cadenas y adornos, algunos enjoyados, pero todos viejos y descoloridos.
vi_translation: • That same morning, a little while later So I managed to get down there, and by the grace of God, I returned to my room without a scratch. I will explain everything in detail right now. At that moment, I don't know why I was so brave! I walked towards the southern window of the castle and immediately climbed onto the narrow stone ledge running along the outer wall. The stones on the outer edge of the wall were very large and only roughly hewn; as I mentioned, the mortar joints were weathered and crumbling with age. Setting foot on these precarious stone ledges meant embarking on a deadly adventure. After climbing a few steps, I tried to look down at the deep abyss below the castle to see if I would get dizzy, but clearly, I didn't dare do so for more than a second. I had completely determined the position of the count's window and tried to climb there as quickly as possible. The precariousness of the wall's edge didn't make me dizzy, as I always tried to look straight ahead. And in what seemed to me to be a very short time, I had climbed to the ledge of the count's window shutter. After pushing the door open, I bent my body, stuck my legs in first, and then slid into the room. I furtively looked around, and luckily the old count was not in the room. There wasn't much furniture down here, just a few rickety wooden items that seemed like they were never used; each one was covered in dust, some looking very similar to the ones I had seen in the rooms in the southern wing of the castle. I immediately thought of the key, but it was not in the lock, and I couldn't find it anywhere. My attention was drawn to a heap of gold coins piled high in the corner of the room - they were coins of various kinds from Romania, England, Austria, Hungary, Greece. These coins seemed to have been there for a long time as they were covered with a thick layer of dust. All of them were ancient coins dating back at least three hundred years. I also noticed a few necklaces and some art pieces inlaid with more or less gemstones, but these items were all very old and damaged.
tr_translation: The same day, later. - I did my best and, with God's help, I returned safely to this room. I must write down all the details in order. While my courage was still fresh, I went straight to the window on the south side of the castle and immediately stepped out onto the narrow stone ledge that surrounds this side of the building. The stones were large and roughly cut, and the mortar between them had worn away over time. I took off my boots and embarked on this desperate path. So that I wouldn't suddenly see the terrifying depth and succumb to it, I looked down once, but then kept my eyes away from it. I knew the direction and the distance to the Count's window quite well, and I aimed there as best as I could to seize the opportunity. I didn't get dizzy - I think I was too excited - the time it took until I found myself standing at the window ledge trying to open the sash seemed ridiculously short. But I tensed up when I leaned in and my feet first slipped inside the window. Then I looked around for the Count but discovered something with surprise and delight. The room was empty! It was furnished with a few odd items that looked as if they had never been used; the furniture in the room was in the same style as the rooms in the south wing and was covered in dust. I searched for the key but it wasn't in the lock and I couldn't find it anywhere. The only thing I found instead was a large pile of gold in one of the corners - all sorts of gold coins, covered with a layer of dust as if they had been lying there for a long time, from Rome, England, Austria, Hungary, Greece, and Turkey. Among those that caught my attention, none were less than three hundred years old. There were also chains and ornaments adorned with precious stones, but they were all old and tarnished.
es_translation: Same day, later. I made the effort, and with God's help I returned safely to this room. I must write down every detail in order. I went, while my courage was still fresh, directly to the window on the south side, and went out from there. The stones are large and roughly cut, and over time the mortar has worn away. I took off my boots and ventured like a desperate man. I looked down once, as if to make sure that a sudden glance at the horrifying depth would not overwhelm me, but after that I kept my eyes looking forward. I know the count's window quite well, and I headed towards it as best as I could, taking advantage of the opportunities that presented themselves. I did not feel dizzy, I suppose I was too nervous, and the time it took me to reach the windowsill seemed ridiculously short. In a flash, I found myself trying to lift the sash window. However, when I slid feet first through the window, I was seized by a terrible agitation. Then I looked everywhere for the count, but, with surprise and joy, I made a discovery: the room was empty! It was barely furnished with strange things that seemed never to have been used; the furniture was somewhat similar in style to those in the rooms situated to the south, and they were covered in dust. I looked for the key, but it was not in the lock, and I couldn't find it anywhere. The only thing I found was a large pile of gold in a corner, gold of all kinds, in Roman and British coins, Austrian and Hungarian, Greek and Turkish. The coins were covered with a film of dust, as if they had lain on the ground for a long time. None of the ones I noticed were less than three hundred years old. There were also chains and ornaments, some jeweled, but all old and faded.
st: 16Ke ile ka boela ka etsa jwalo, mme Morena, a nthuse, ke kgutletse ka tsela e sireletsehileng. Ke tlameha ho beha lintlha tsohle ka tatellano. Ke ile ka ea ha sebete sa ka se ne se le ncha ho ea fensetereng e ka boroa, 'me hang-hang ka fihla ka ntle holim'a leje le moqotetsane le mathang ho potoloha mohaho ka lehlakoreng lena. Majoe a maholo ebile a thata haholo, 'me seretse se na le nako ea ho hlatsoa pakeng tsa tsona. Ke ile ka khaola lieta tsa ka,' me ka tsoela pele ka tsela e sa tšepang. Ke ile ka sheba ka nako e 'ngoe, e le ho etsa bonnete ba hore pono ea tšohanyetso ea botebo bo tšabehang e ne e ke ke ea hlola, empa ka mor'a hore seo se ile sa boloka mahlo a ka. Ke ne ke e-na le sebaka sa marang-rang le sebaka sa marang-rang, 'me ke se ke ntse ke e-na le monyetla oa ho e sebelisa ka hohle kamoo nka khonang. Ke ne ke sa utloe eka ke ne ke ikutloa ke le sithabetse haholo,' me nako e ne e bonahala e le ntho e sa utloahaleng ho fihlela ke iphumana ke eme ka fensetereng ea fensetere le ho leka ho phahamisa sash. Leha ho le joalo, ke ne ke tletse lihlong, ha ke inama 'me ke theolela maoto a ka pele ka fensetere. Ka mor'a moo, ke ile ka sheba ho pota-pota count, empa, ka ho makala le nyakallo, e ile ea e-ba le sibolloa. Kamore e ne e se na letho! E ne e le ntho e sa tloaelehang haholo, e neng e bonahala eka ha e e-so ka e sebelisoa; Thepa ea ka tlung e ne e le ntho e tšoanang le eo ka likamoreng tse ka boroa, 'me e koahetsoe ke lerōle. Ke ne ke batla senotlolo, empa e ne e se ka notletsoe, 'me ke ne ke sa khone ho e fumana kae kapa kae. Ntho feela eo ke e fumaneng e ne e le qubu e kholo ea khauta k'honeng e le 'ngoe ea li-confound tsa mefuta eohle, Roman, le British, le Austria, le Hungarian, le Greek le Turkey chelete, e koahetsoeng ka filimi ea lerōle, joalo ka ha eka e ne e na le nako e telele fatše. Ha ke e-s'o bone hore na ke lilemo li ka tlase ho lilemo tse 300. Ho ne ho boetse ho na le liketane le mekhabiso, tse ling tsa mabenyane, empa kaofela ha tsona tsa khale le tse khabisitsoeng.
yo: Ní ọjọ́ kan náà, lẹ́yìn náà .- Mo ti gbìyànjú, Ọlọ́run, tí ó ń ràn mí lọ́wọ́, ti padà wá sínú yàrá yìí láìléwu. Mo gbọ́dọ̀ gbé gbogbo àlàyé kalẹ̀ létòletò. Mo lọ nígbà tí ìgboyà mi ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ wà tààrà sí fèrèsé ní ìhà gúúsù, àti pé lẹ́ẹ̀kan náà mo jáde lórí òkúta tó tóbi tí ó ń sáré káàkiri ilé náà ní ẹ̀gbẹ́ yìí. Àwọn òkúta náà tóbi wọ́n sì gé fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ gé e, àti pé amọ̀ náà ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ pẹ̀lú àkókò tí wọ́n ti fọ̀ kúrò láàárín wọn. Mo bọ́ bàtà mi, mo sì jáde lọ sí ọ̀nà ìjákulẹ̀. Mo wo ìsàlẹ̀ lẹ́ẹ̀kan, kí n lè rí i dájú pé ìwòye òjijì ìjìnlẹ̀ burúkú náà kò ní borí mi, ṣùgbọ́n lẹ́yìn ìyẹn ó pa ojú mi mọ́ kúrò nínú rẹ̀. Mo mọ ìtọ́sọ́nà àti ìjìnnà fèrèsé Count dáadáa, mo sì ṣe é bí mo ṣe lè ṣe é, nípa àwọn àfààní tí ó wà. Mi ò ní ìmọ̀lára ìdàrúdàpọ̀ - mo lérò pé inú mi dùn jù - àkókò náà sì kéré gan-an títí tí mo fi rí ara mi tí mo dúró lórí fèrèsé tí mo sì ń gbìyànjú láti gbé okùn náà sókè. Mo kún fún ìdààmú, síbẹ̀síbẹ̀, nígbà tí mo tẹríba tí mo sì yọ ẹsẹ̀ ṣáájú láti inú fèrèsé. Lẹ́yìn náà mo wá Count, ṣùgbọ́n, pẹ̀lú ìyàlẹ́nu àti ìdùnnú, mo ṣe àwárí. Yàrá náà ṣófo! Kò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ ṣe é pẹ̀lú àwọn nkan àjèjì, èyí tí ó jọ pé wọn kò lò ó rí; Ohun ọ̀ṣọ́ náà jẹ́ nǹkan ọ̀ṣọ́ gẹ́gẹ́ bíi ti inú yàrá gúúsù, eruku sì bò ó. Mo wá kọ́kọ́rọ́, ṣùgbọ́n kò sí nínú tìpa, mi ò sì rí i níbikíbi. Ohun kan ṣoṣo tí mo rí ni ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ wúrà ńlá ní igun kan - wúrà gbogbo irúfẹ́, Roman, àti British, àti Austrian, àti Hungarian, àti Greek àti Turkish money, tí fíìmù eruku bò ó, bí ẹni pé ó ti pẹ́ ní ilẹ̀. Kò sí ìkankan nínú rẹ̀ tí mo ṣàkíyèsí pé ó kéré sí ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta ọdún. Àwọn ẹ̀wọ̀n àti ohun ọ̀ṣọ́ tún wà, àwọn ohun iyebíye kan wà, ṣùgbọ́n gbogbo wọn ti gbó tí wọ́n sì ní àbàwọ́n.
tn: Ka letsatsi le le latelang, ke ne ka dira tiro ya me, mme Modimo a nthusa, a boela kwa phaposing eno. Ke tshwanetse go kwala dintlha tsotlhe ka botlalo. Ke ne ke le gaufi le fa ke ne ke le gaufi le fensetere e e kwa borwa, mme ka bonako ka ya kwa ntle mo leganong le lennye la letlapa le le dikologang mo kagong e e mo ntlheng eno. Matlapa a a boitshegang e bile a le bokete, mme moreka o ne wa tlhatswiwa ka nako e e tswitsweng fa gare ga ona. Ke ne ka tsaya ditlhako tsa me, ka bo ke le mo tseleng e e seng ya me e e sa fetogeng. Ke ne ka leba kwa tlase ka bonako gore ke kgone go bona gore go ne go se na sepe se se nkgamolang pelo, mme morago ga moo se ne sa dira gore ke se ka fapoga matlho a me. Ke ne ke le gaufi thata le tsela e e neng e le gaufi thata le go e dirisa ka fa nka kgonang ka teng, mme ke ne ka e dirisa ka fa nka kgonang ka teng. Ke ne ke sa akanye gore ke ne ke ikutlwa ke le moleele thata, ke ne ke ikutlwa ke le moleele thata go fitlha ke ne ke le mo tseleng e ke neng ke e dirisa ka yone fa ke ne ke le mo tseleng e e sa tlwaelegang. Le fa go ntse jalo, ke ne ka simolola go itewa ke bo ke le kwa tlase ka fa tlase ga fensetere, ke ne ka itigela ka fa tlase ga fensetere. Ke ne ka leba kwa morago, mme ka gakgamala, ka gakgamala le ka boitumelo. Room Gone Bad! O ne a se na didirisiwa tse di sa tlwaelegang, tse di neng di lebega di sa dirisiwe ka gope; E ne e le selo se se tshwanang le se se mo dikamoreng tsa borwa, mme se ne se apesitswe ka lorole. Ke ne ke batla selotlolo, mme se ne se seyo mo setilong, mme ke ne ke sa kgone go e bona gope. Selo se le sengwe fela se ke neng ke se fitlhela e ne e le gauta e kgolo mo sekhutlong se le sengwe se se mo sekhutlong se le sengwe se se gakgamatsang sa mofuta mongwe le mongwe, e bong Baroma le Se-Britain le Se-Hungary le Se-Hungary le segerika le se-Turkey, se ne se apesitswe ka filimi ya lorole, jaaka e kete e ne e na le lobaka lo loleele mo mmung. Le fa go ntse jalo, ke ne ke sa itse gore ke na le dingwaga di le 300. Go ne go na le dikgole le dikgabo, tse dingwe tsa kgabisa, mme tsotlhe tsa tsone di ne di tsofetse e bile di le sedisiwe.
ty: I taua mahana ra, i muri a'e.—Ua faaitoito vau, e ua ho'i mai te Atua, ma te tauturu mai ia'u, i roto i teie piha ma te pe'ape'a ore. E tia ia ' u ia faataa i te mau mea rii atoa. Ua haere atu vau ma te ite-ore-hia to'u itoito i mua i te haamaramarama i te pae apatoa, e i te hoê taime ua haere atu vau i rapae au na ni'a i te e'a pirihao o te ofa'i e haati ra i te fare i teie nei pae. E mea rarahi e te apoopoo te mau ofa'i, e ua horoihia te tima i rotopu ia ratou i te roaraa o te tau. Ua tatara vau i to ' u tiaa, e ua haere atura vau i rapae ma te hepohepo. Ua hi'o a'era vau i te hoê taime, no te haapapû e, eita anei te hoê hi'oraa o te hohonu ri'ari'a e upooti'a i ni'a ia'u, i muri a'e râ i te reira, ua faaatea ê te reira i to'u mata. Ua ite maitai au i te avei'a e te atearaa o te haamaramarama o te fare pureraa, e ua imi au i te mau rave'a atoa no te reira, ma te hi'o i te mau rave'a e vai ra. Aita vau i mana'o e te ou'a ra vau—te mana'o nei au e ua oaoa roa vau—e e au ra e mea poto roa te taime e ite ai au ia'u iho i te ti'araa i ni'a i te haamaramarama e i te tamataraa i te faateitei i te pa'epa'e. Tera râ, ua î roa vau i te maere, a pi'o ai au i raro e a taahi ai au i raro na roto i te haamaramarama. I muri iho ua hi'o vau ati a'e ia'u, tera râ, ma te maere e te oaoa, ua itehia mai te hoê ohipa. Aita e taata i roto i te piha! E mea varavara te reira i te horo'ahia mai e te tahi mau mea huru ê, mai te mea ra e, aita roa'tu te reira i faaohipahia ; hoê â huru te mau tauihaa fare e te mau tauihaa i roto i te mau piha i te pae apatoa, e ua î roa i te repo puehu. Ua imi au i te taviri, aita râ i roto i te ponao, e aita i itehia ia'u te reira i te hoê vahi. Te mea noa ta'u i ite o te hoê ïa haapueraa auro rahi i roto i te hoê poro—te auro no te mau huru auro atoa, to Roma, e to Peretane, e to Auteteria, e to Hongrie, e te moni Heleni e Turekia, tei tapo'ihia i te repo puehu, mai te huru ra e, ua vai noa i raro i te repo. Aita hoê a'e o te reira i iti mai i te toru hanere matahiti. Te vai atoa ra te mau fifi e te mau tao'a faanehenehe, te tahi mau tao'a piru, e mau tao'a tahito ana'e râ e te tafetafeta.
mai: ओही दिन, बादमे।—हम प्रयास कयलहुँ, आ भगवान, हमर मदति करैत सुरक्षित रूपसँ एहि कोठरीमे वापस आबि गेलाह। हमरा हर विवरण के व्यवस्थित करबाक चाही। हम तखन गेलहुं जखन हमर साहस सीधा दक्षिण दिस खिड़की पर ताजा छल, आ तुरन्त बाहर पाथरक संकीर्ण कगार पर पहुँचि गेलहुँ जे एहि दिस भवनक चारू कात चलैत अछि। पाथर पैघ आ मोटा-मोटी काटल जाइत अछि, आ समयक सङ्ग मोर्टार ओकर बीच बह गेल अछि। हम अपन जूता उतारि लेलहुं, आ हताश रास्ता पर निकलि गेलहुं। हम एक बेर नीचा देखलहुँ, जाहिसँ ई सुनिश्चित कयल जा सकय जे भयानक गहराईक अचानक झलक हमरा पर काबू नहि पाबि सकय, मुदा ओकर बाद हमर आँखि एहिसँ दूर रहल। हम काउंटक खिड़कीक दिशा आ दूरीकेँ नीक जकाँ जनैत छलहुँ, आ उपलब्ध अवसरक सन्दर्भमे एकरा लेल जतेक भऽ सकैत छलहुँ ओतबे बना लेलहुँ। हमरा चक्कर नहि आबि रहल छल- हमरा लगैत अछि जे हम बहुत उत्साहित छलहुँ - आ समय हास्यास्पद रूपसँ कम बुझाइत छल जाबत धरि हम अपनाकेँ खिड़की-सिल पर ठाढ़ भऽ सैशकेँ ऊपर उठयबाक प्रयास करैत देखलहुँ। मुदा हम आन्दोलनसँ भरि गेलहुँ, जखन हम झुकि गेलहुँ आ खिड़कीसँ पैर सभसँ आगू खिसक गेलहुँ। तखन हम गिनतीकेँ चारूकात देखलहुँ, मुदा आश्चर्य आ खुशीसँ एकटा खोज कयलहुँ। कमरा खाली छल! ई मुश्किल सँ विषम चीजसँ सुसज्जित छल, जकर उपयोग कहियो नहि कयल गेल बुझाइत छल; फर्नीचर किछु दक्षिण कोठरीक शैली जकाँ छल, आ धूलसँ झाँपल छल। हम चाबी तकलहुँ, मुदा ओ तालामे नहि छल, आ हमरा कतहु नहि भेटल। एकमात्र चीज जे हमरा भेटल ओ छल एकटा कोनमे सोनाक एकटा पैघ ढेर - सभ प्रकारक सोना, रोमन, आ ब्रिटिश, आ ऑस्ट्रियाई, आ हंगेरियन, आ यूनानी आ तुर्की पैसा, जे धूलक फिल्मसँ झाँपल छल, जेना ई जमीनमे लम्बा समय धरि पड़ल हो। एहिमे सँ कोनो जे हम देखलहुं ओ तीन सय सालसँ कम पुरान नहि छल। जंजीर आ गहना सेहो छल, किछु गहना छल, मुदा सभटा पुरान आ दाग लागल छल।
mg: Tamin'io andro io ihany, tatỳ aoriana.—Niezaka mafy aho, ary niverina soa aman-tsara teto amin'ity efitra ity Andriamanitra, rehefa nanampy ahy. Tsy maintsy mametraka ny antsipiriany rehetra araka ny tokony ho izy aho. Nandeha aho raha mbola vao haingana teo amin'ny varavarankely teo amin'ny ilany atsimo ny herim-poko, ary avy hatrany dia nivoaka avy hatrany teo amin'ilay vato tery izay mivezivezy manodidina ilay tranobe amin'ny lafiny iray. Ny vato dia lehibe sy tapahina, ary ny feta dia efa voasasa amin'ny fotoana eo anelanelan'izy ireo. Nanala ny kiraroko aho ary nandeha tamin'ny lalana tsy nampoizina. Niondrika aho indray mandeha, mba hahazoako antoka fa tsy haharesy ahy ny topimaso tampoka amin'ny halalin'ny zava-mahatsiravina, saingy taorian'izay dia nanalavitra ny masoko tamin'izany aho. Fantatro tsara ny lalana sy ny halaviran'ny varavarankelin'ny Count, ary nanao izany araka izay tratrako aho, ary nandinika ireo fahafahana misy. Tsy nahatsiaro ho namiratra aho—heveriko fa nientanentana loatra aho—ary toa fohy dia fohy ny fotoana mandra-pijoroko teo amin'ny varavarankely ary niezaka nanangana ny tady. Feno fitabatabana anefa aho, rehefa niondrika sy nibolisatra teo amin'ny varavarankely. Avy eo dia nijery ny manodidina ny fanisana aho, saingy, tamim-pahagagana sy tamim-pifaliana, dia nahita zavatra hita. Foana ny efitrano! Zara raha feno zavatra hafahafa izy io, izay toa tsy nampiasaina mihitsy; Ny fanaka dia zavatra mitovy amin'ny tao amin'ny efitrano atsimo, ary feno vovoka. Nitady ilay fanalahidy aho, saingy tsy tao anatin'ny hidin-trano ilay izy, ary tsy nahita izany na aiza na aiza aho. Ny hany zavatra hitako dia antontam-bolamena lehibe teo amin'ny zorony iray—volamena isan-karazany, Romana sy Britanika, Aotrisiana, Hongroà, ary Grika sy Tiorka izay rakotry ny horonantsarin'ny vovoka, toy ireny hoe nandry ela tamin'ny tany iny. Tsy nisy na iray aza tamin'ireo zavatra tsikaritro ireo latsaky ny telonjato taona. Ary nisy koa rojo sy firavaka, ny sasany niravaka, fa izy rehetra efa antitra sady voaloko.

en: At one corner of the room was a heavy door. I tried it, for, since I could not find the key of the room or the key of the outer door, which was the main object of my search, I must make further examination, or all my efforts would be in vain. It was open, and led through a stone passage to a circular stairway, which went steeply down. I descended, minding carefully where I went, for the stairs were dark, being only lit by loopholes in the heavy masonry. At the bottom there was a dark, tunnel-like passage, through which came a deathly, sickly odour, the odour of old earth newly turned. As I went through the passage the smell grew closer and heavier. At last I pulled open a heavy door which stood ajar, and found myself in an old, ruined chapel, which had evidently been used as a graveyard. The roof was broken, and in two places were steps leading to vaults, but the ground had recently been dug over, and the earth placed in great wooden boxes, manifestly those which had been brought by the Slovaks. There was nobody about, and I made search for any further outlet, but there was none. Then I went over every inch of the ground, so as not to lose a chance. I went down even into the vaults, where the dim light struggled, although to do so was a dread to my very soul. Into two of these I went, but saw nothing except fragments of old coffins and piles of dust; in the third, however, I made a discovery.
vi: Tôi đi về phía một tấm cửa nặng nề vừa được phát hiện ở một góc phòng, bởi vì không tìm được chìa khóa phòng cũng như chìa khóa cửa lâu đài đây là điều tôi không được quên và là mục tiêu tìm kiếm chính của tôi nên tôi buộc phải lục tìm, khám phá lung tung, nếu không cuộc phiêu lưu mạo hiểm vừa rồi của tôi sẽ chẳng có tác dụng gì cả. Cánh cửa này mở ra một hành lang có các bức tường xây toàn bằng đá, dẫn đến một cầu thang xoáy trôn ốc. Tôi thận trọng bước xuống, vì chiếc cầu thang dựng đứng này chỉ được chiếu sáng nhờ hai lỗ châu mai trên một bức tường rất dày. Xuống hết cầu thang, tôi lại rơi vào một hành lang tối tăm khác, một đường hầm thực sự, sặc mùi chua, hăng hắc, gợi cho tôi liên tưởng tới mùi của các xác chết đó là một mùi bốc lên từ lớp đất vừa được đào bới. Càng bước sâu vào trong, thứ mùi đó càng có vẻ nặng hơn khiến tôi gần như không thể chịu nổi. Cuối cùng, tôi mở toang cánh cửa rất dày khác trong dãy hành lang. Tôi đang đứng trước một nhà thờ cổ điêu tàn, nơi hẳn đã có những thi thể được chôn cất. Mái nhà thờ thủng lỗ chỗ, hai bên tường có rất nhiều bậc thềm dẫn tới các hầm mộ. Tôi nhận ra lớp đất vừa bị đào xới và những xẻng đất đổ đầy các thùng lớn đặt rải rác xung quanh: chắc chắn đó chính là những thùng gỗ mà đám người Slovaki vừa chở đến. Trong nhà thờ chẳng có ai cả. Tôi vẫn tiếp tục mò mẫm: biết đâu ở trong này lại có một lối ra? Không, không có một lối thoát nào cả. Tôi tiếp tục kiểm tra kỹ hơn nữa. Và mặc dù rất ghê tởm, tôi vẫn xông bừa vào các hầm mộ, nơi đang hắt ra những tia sáng yếu ớt. Trong hai hầm mộ đầu tiên, tôi chẳng tìm thấy gì ngoài những mảnh áo quan cổ và những đám bụi. Vào hầm mộ thứ ba, tôi bỗng giật thót người khi phát hiện ra một điều.
tr: Odanın bir köşesinde ağır bir kapı vardı. Bu kapıyı denedim, çünkü araştırmamın ana konusu olan oda anahtarını ya da dış kapının anahtarını bulamadığım için daha fazla araştırma yapmalıydım ya da tüm çabalarım boşa gidecekti. Kapı açıktı ve dik biçimde aşağı inen sarmal merdivene çıkan taş koridora açılıyordu. Sadece ağır taş duvarlardaki mazgal deliklerinden aydınlanan basamaklar karanlık olduğu için bastığım yere dikkat ederek aşağı indim. Dipte, altüst edilmiş eski toprak kokusu gibi, öldürücü, bayıltıcı bir kokunun geldiği karanlık, tünel benzeri bir koridor vardı. Koridorda ilerledikçe koku daha da yaklaştı ve ağırlaştı. Sonunda, aralık duran ağır kapıyı açtım ve kendimi, belli ki mezarlık olarak kullanılan eski, metruk bir şapelde buldum. Çatı çökmüştü ve iki yerde yer altı mezarlarına inen basamaklar vardı, ama zemin yakın zamanda kazılmıştı ve toprak belli ki Slovaklar tarafından getirilen büyük tahta sandıklara doldurulmuştu. Çevrede kimse yoktu, başka bir çıkış yolu aradım ama bulamadım. Sonra, herhangi bir şansı yitirmemek için zeminin her santimetrekaresini taradım. Ödümü kopartmış olmasına karşın, sönük ışığın çırpındığı mezar odalarına bile indim. Bunların ikisine girdim, fakat eski tabut parçaları ve toz yığınlarından başka bir şey görmedim; fakat üçüncüsünde bir şey keşfettim.
es: En una esquina del cuarto había una pesada puerta. La empujé, pues, ya que no podía encontrar la llave del cuarto o la llave de la puerta de afuera, lo cual era el principal objetivo de mi búsqueda, tenía que hacer otras investigaciones, o todos mis esfuerzos serían vanos. La puerta que empujé estaba abierta, y me condujo a través de un pasadizo de piedra hacia una escalera de caracol, que bajaba muy empinada. Descendí, poniendo mucho cuidado en donde pisaba, pues las gradas estaban oscuras, siendo alumbradas solamente por las troneras de la pesada mampostería. En el fondo había un pasadizo oscuro, semejante a un túnel, a través del cual se percibía un mortal y enfermizo olor: el olor de la tierra recién volteada. A medida que avancé por el pasadizo, el olor se hizo más intenso y más cercano. Finalmente, abrí una pesada puerta que estaba entornada y me encontré en una vieja y arruinada capilla, que evidentemente había sido usada como cementerio. El techo estaba agrietado, y en los lugares había gradas que conducían a bóvedas, pero el suelo había sido recientemente excavado y la tierra había sido puesta en grandes cajas de madera, manifiestamente las que transportaran los eslovacos. No había nadie en los alrededores, y yo hice un minucioso registro de cada pulgada de terreno. Bajé incluso a las bóvedas, donde la tenue luz luchaba con las sombras, aunque al hacerlo mi alma se llenó del más terrible horror. Fui a dos de éstas, pero no vi nada sino fragmentos de viejos féretros y montones de polvo; sin embargo, en la tercera, hice un descubrimiento.

vi_translation: I walked towards a heavy door that had just been discovered in a corner of the room, because I couldn't find the room key or the castle key. This is something I must not forget and is my main search objective, so I had to rummage around and explore randomly; otherwise, my recent adventurous journey would be of no use at all. This door opened to a corridor with walls entirely built of stone, leading to a spiral staircase. I cautiously stepped down, as this steep staircase was only illuminated by two arrow slits on a very thick wall. At the bottom of the stairs, I found myself in another dark corridor, a real tunnel, filled with a sour, pungent smell that reminded me of the scent of corpses—a smell rising from freshly dug earth. The deeper I went, the stronger that smell became, making it almost unbearable. Finally, I flung open another very thick door in the corridor. I was standing in front of an ancient, dilapidated church, where bodies must have been buried. The church roof was full of holes, and there were many steps on both sides of the walls leading to the crypts. I noticed the freshly dug earth and shovels of dirt filling large scattered crates around: these were surely the wooden crates that the Slovak men had just transported. There was no one in the church. I continued to grope around: who knows, maybe there was an exit inside? No, there was no exit at all. I continued to inspect more thoroughly. And despite my great disgust, I still barged into the crypts, where faint light was emanating. In the first two crypts, I found nothing but fragments of old coffins and dust. Entering the third crypt, I suddenly jumped when I discovered something.
tr_translation: There was a heavy door in one corner of the room. I tried this door because I needed to investigate further, having not found the key to the room or the key to the outer door, which were the main subjects of my research, or all my efforts would be in vain. The door was open and led to a stone corridor that descended steeply to a spiral staircase. Since the steps were dark, illuminated only by the loopholes in the heavy stone walls, I descended carefully, watching my step. At the bottom, there was a dark, tunnel-like corridor from which emanated a deadly, nauseating smell, like the scent of old, overturned earth. As I progressed down the corridor, the smell grew closer and heavier. Finally, I opened the heavy door that was ajar and found myself in an old, abandoned chapel that was evidently used as a cemetery. The roof had collapsed, and there were steps leading down to underground tombs in two places, but the ground had been recently dug up, and the soil had clearly been filled into large wooden crates brought by the Slovaks. There was no one around, so I searched for another exit but found none. Then, to leave no stone unturned, I scanned every square inch of the floor. Despite my terror, I even descended into the dimly lit burial chambers where the light flickered. I entered two of them but saw nothing except old coffin fragments and piles of dust; however, in the third one, I discovered something.
es_translation: In one corner of the room, there was a heavy door. I pushed it, for since I could not find the key to the room or the key to the outer door, which was the main objective of my search, I had to make other investigations, or all my efforts would be in vain. The door I pushed was open, and it led me through a stone passageway to a very steep spiral staircase. I descended, taking great care where I stepped, for the steps were dark, being lit only by the loopholes in the heavy masonry. At the bottom, there was a dark passageway, similar to a tunnel, through which a deadly and sickly smell could be perceived: the smell of freshly turned earth. As I advanced through the passageway, the smell became more intense and closer. Finally, I opened a heavy door that was ajar and found myself in an old and ruined chapel, which had evidently been used as a cemetery. The ceiling was cracked, and in places, there were steps leading to vaults, but the ground had been recently dug up, and the earth had been placed in large wooden boxes, evidently the ones the Slovaks had transported. There was no one around, and I made a thorough search of every inch of the ground. I even went down into the vaults, where the dim light struggled with the shadows, though in doing so, my soul was filled with the most terrible horror. I went to two of them, but saw nothing but fragments of old coffins and piles of dust; however, in the third, I made a discovery.
st: Ka lehlakoreng le leng la kamore e ne e le monyako o boima. Ke e lekile, hobane, kaha ke ne ke sitoa ho fumana senotlolo sa kamore kapa senotlolo sa monyako o kantle, e neng e le ntho e ka sehloohong ea patlo ea ka, ke tlameha ho etsa tlhahlobo e eketsehileng, kapa boiteko bohle ba ka e ne e tla ba lefeela. E ne e butsoe, 'me ea etella pele ka tsela e chitja ho ea litepising tse chitja, tse neng li theoha ka mokhoa o otlolohileng. Ke theohela, ke nahana ka hloko moo ke eang teng, bakeng sa litepisi li ne li le lefifi, li ntse li chesa feela ke loopholes ka har'a mason e boima. Ka tlase ho ne ho e-na le temana e lefifi, e kang kotopo, eo ka eona ho ileng ha hlaha monko o bolaeang, monko o monate oa lefatše la khale le sa tsoa fetoha. Ha ke ntse ke feta ka mor'a moo, monko o ne o le haufi le ho feta. Qetellong ke ile ka hula bula monyako o boima o neng o eme ajar, 'me ka iphumana ke le qhobosheaneng ea khale, e senyehileng, eo ho bonahalang eka e ne e sebelisoa e le mabitla. Marulelo a ile a robeha, 'me libakeng tse peli e ne e le mehato e lebisang ho li-vault, empa lefatše le ne le sa tsoa cheka, 'me lefatše le behiloe mabokoseng a maholo a lehong, ho bonahatsoa ba neng ba tlisoa ke Slovaks. Ho ne ho se na motho e mong, 'me ke ne ke batla ho hong ho eketsehileng, empa ho ne ho se na letho. Joale ke ile ka tšela mobu o mong le o mong, e le hore a se ke a lahleheloa ke monyetla. Ke theohile esita le ka har'a li-vault, moo leseli le lefifi le neng le loana, le hoja ho etsa joalo e ne e le tšabo ho moea oa ka haholo. Ke ile ka kena ho tsena tse peli, empa ke ile ka bona letho ntle le likhechana tsa li-coffins tsa khale le qubu ea lerōle; Leha ho le joalo, ka lekhetlo la boraro, ke ile ka etsa hore ho be le sibolloa.
yo: Ní igun kan nínú yàrá náà ni ilẹ̀kùn tó wúwo. Mo gbiyanju rẹ, fun, niwọn igba ti Emi ko le rii bọtini ti yara tabi bọtini ti ẹnu-ọna ita, eyiti o jẹ nkan akọkọ ti wiwa mi, Mo gbọdọ ṣe idanwo siwaju sii, tabi gbogbo awọn igbiyanju mi yoo jẹ asan. Ó ṣí sílẹ̀, ó sì darí nípasẹ̀ ọ̀nà òkúta lọ sí àtẹ̀gùn ìyíká, èyí tí ó lọ sí ìsàlẹ̀ gíga. Mo sọ̀kalẹ̀, mo ń ronú dáadáa níbi tí mo ti lọ, nítorí àtẹ̀gùn náà dúdú, àwọn àlàfo nínú àwọn òkúta tó wúwo nìkan ni wọ́n ń tan iná sí i. Ní ìsàlẹ̀ ọ̀nà òkùnkùn kan wà, tí ó dàbí ojú òfurufú, nípasẹ̀ èyí tí ó wá ní òórùn ikú, òórùn àìsàn, òórùn ayé àtijọ́ tí ó ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ yí padà. Bí mo ṣe ń kọjá ọ̀nà òórùn náà ń súnmọ́ ara mi ó sì wúwo sí i. Ní ìgbẹ̀yìn mo ṣí ilẹ̀kùn tó wúwo tí ó dúró, mo sì rí ara mi ní ilé ìjọsìn àtijọ́, tí ó ti bàjẹ́, èyí tí ó hàn gbangba pé wọ́n ti lò gẹ́gẹ́ bí ibojì. Wọ́n fọ́ òrùlé náà, àti pé ní ibi méjì ni àwọn ìgbésẹ̀ tí ó yọrí sí àwọn ibi ìpamọ́, ṣùgbọ́n wọ́n ti gbẹ́ ilẹ̀ náà láìpẹ́ yìí, ilẹ̀ sì gbé sínú àpótí igi ńlá, tí ó hàn gbangba àwọn tí àwọn Slovaks mú wá. Kò sí ẹnikẹ́ni nípa rẹ̀, mo sì wá ilé ìtajà mìíràn, ṣùgbọ́n kò sí ìkankan. Lẹ́yìn náà mo kọjá gbogbo ìwọ̀n ilẹ̀, kí n má bàa pàdánù àfààní. Mo sọ̀kalẹ̀ kódà sínú àwọn ibi ìpamọ́, níbi tí iná kékeré náà ti ń tiraka, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé láti ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀ jẹ́ ìbẹ̀rù fún ọkàn mi gan-an. Nínú méjì nínú àwọn wọ̀nyí ni mo lọ, ṣùgbọ́n mi ò rí nkankan àyàfi àwọn àjákù àpótí àtijọ́ àti ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ eruku; Ni ìkẹta, síbẹ̀síbẹ̀, Mo ṣe àwárí.
tn: 'Go ne go na le lebati le le bokete' - There was a hard door Ke lekile, ka gonne ke ne ke sa kgone go bona senotlolo sa kamore kgotsa senotlolo sa kgoro e e kwa ntle, se e neng e le selo se segolo sa phuruphutso ya me, ke tshwanetse go dira tlhatlhobo e nngwe gape, kgotsa maiteko otlhe a me a tla nna lefela. E ne e bulegile, e bile e ne ya tsamaya ka tsela e e tsamayang ka tsela e e kwa godimo, e e neng e tsamaya ka tsela e e kwa tlase. Ke ne ke le mo tseleng e ke neng ke le mo go yone, ke ne ke sa ntse ke le mo tseleng e ke neng ke le mo go yone, ke ne ke le mo gare ga mesedi e e bokete, e le gore ke ne ke le mo gare ga mesedi e e bokete. Kwa tlase go ne go na le temana e e lefifi, e e neng e le mo go yone, e e neng e na le monko o o botlhoko, e e neng e le monko o o monate wa lefatshe le le sa tswang go fetoga. Fa ke ntse ke tsamaya mo tseleng, monko wa me o ne o ntse o atamela le go feta. Kwa bofelong, ke ne ka bula lebati le le bokete le le neng le eme, mme ka iphitlhela ke le mo ntlong ya kgale, e e senyegileng, e go bonalang e ne e dirisiwa jaaka mabitla. Marulelo a ne a robegile, mme mo mafelong a mabedi a ne a lebisa kwa mafelong a a kwa godimo, mme lefatshe le ne le sa tswa go epwa, mme lefatshe le ne le bewa mo mabokosong a magolo a dikgong, go bonala ba ba neng ba tlisitswe ke Ba-Slovak. Go ne go se na ope yo o neng a le teng, mme ke ne ke sa batle sepe gape, mme go ne go se na ope yo o neng a le teng. Ke ne ka ralala naga nngwe le nngwe gore ke se ka latlhegelwa ke tshono. Ke ne ka tsena mo ditshosing, mo leseding le le lefifi le neng le lwana teng, le fa go ntse jalo e ne e le poifo mo moyeng wa me. Ke ne ka ya kwa go ba babedi ba bone, mme ka se ka ka bona sepe, fa e se masathwana a a kwa godimo le a lorole.+ Le fa go ntse jalo, mo nakong ya boraro, ke ne ka dira gore ke se ka ka nna le ene.
ty: I te hoê poro o te piha te vai ra hoê opani teiaha. Ua tamata vau i te reira, no te mea, i te mea e, aita i itehia ia'u te taviri o te piha e aore râ, te taviri o te opani rapae, o te reira ho'i te tumu rahi no ta'u ma'imiraa, e mea ti'a ïa ia'u ia hi'opo'a faahou, e aore râ, e faufaa ore ta'u mau tautooraa atoa. Ua matara te reira, e ua arataihia na roto i te hoê e'a ofai e tae atu ai i te hoê e'a menemene, o tei topa roa i raro. Ua pou mai au, ma te hi'o maitai i te vahi ta'u i haere, no te mea e mea poiri te e'a, e ua turama-noa-hia te reira e te mau ofa'i rarahi i roto i te fare teiaha. I raro roa, te vai ra te hoê e'a pouri e te apoopoo, e na roto i te reira, ua tae mai te hoê e'a pohe e te ma'ima'i, e ua huri-apî-hia te mau ofa'i o te fenua tahito. A haere noa ai au i roto i te piha, ua piri roa mai te hau'a e ua puai roa'tu. I te pae hopea ua iriti au i te hoê opani teiaha e ti'a noa ra, e tei roto vau i te hoê fare pureraa tahito e te parari, tei faaohipahia ei menema. Ua parari te tapo'i fare, e i roto i na vahi e piti, te vai ra te mau ofa'i e arata'i ti'a'tu i te mau apoo, tera râ, aita i maoro a'e nei, ua heru-faahou-hia te repo, e ua tuuhia te repo i roto i te mau afata raau rarahi, tei hamanihia e te mau taata hamani raau. Aita hoê a'e taata i reira, e ua imi au i te tahi atu ravea, aita râ hoê a'e. I muri iho, ua haere atura vau na nia i te mau tenetimetera atoa o te repo, ia ore au ia erehia i te ravea. Ua pou vau i roto i te mau apoo, i reira te mori mohimohi i te toparaa, noa'tu e, ua riro te reira ei haamǎta'uraa no to'u varua. I roto i na afata e piti, ua haere au, aita râ vau i ite i te hoê noa a'e mea maori râ te mau hu'ahu'a o te mau afata tahito e te mau haapueraa repo; i roto râ i te toru o te tuhaa, ua itea mai ia ' u te hoê ohipa apî.
mai: कोठरीक एकटा कोनमे एकटा भारी दरवाजा छल। हम एकर प्रयास केलहुँ, किएक तँ हमरा कोठरीक चाबी वा बाहरी दरवाजाक चाबी नहि भेटल, जे हमर खोजक मुख्य उद्देश्य छल, तेँ हमरा आगू जाँच करय पड़त, नहि तँ हमर सभ प्रयास व्यर्थ भऽ जायत। ई खुजल छल, आ एकटा पाथरक मार्गसँ एकटा गोलाकार सीढ़ी धरि जाइत छल, जे तेजीसँ नीचा चलि जाइत छल। हम उतरलहुँ, ध्यान सँ विचार करैत जे हम कतऽ गेलहुँ, कियैक तँ सीढ़ी अन्हार छल, मात्र भारी चिनाई मे खामी सँ जगमगा रहल छल। नीचाँ एकटा अन्हार, सुरंग सन मार्ग छल, जाहिसँ एकटा घातक, बीमार गंध आबि रहल छल, जे नव बदलल पुरान पृथ्वीक गंध छल। जेना-जेना हम गुजरैत गेलहुं गंध नजदीक सं बढ़ैत गेल। अंततः हम एकटा भारी दरवाजा खोललहुँ जे अजर ठाढ़ छल, आ अपनाकेँ एकटा पुरान, बर्बाद चैपलमे पओलहुँ, जकर उपयोग स्पष्ट रूपसँ कब्रिस्तानक रूपमे कयल गेल छल। छत टूटि गेल छल, आ दूटा ठाम तिजोरी दिस जायवला सीढ़ी छल, मुदा हालहिमे जमीन खोदल गेल छल, आ माटिकेँ लकड़ीक पैघ बक्सामे राखल गेल छल, स्पष्ट रूपसँ जे स्लोवाक द्वारा अनल गेल छल। एहिमे कियो नहि छल, आ हम कोनो आओर आउटलेटक खोज कयलहुँ, मुदा कोनो नहि छल। तखन हम मैदानक एक-एक इंच पर चलि गेलहुँ, जाहिसँ कोनो मौका नहि छूटि जाय। हम तिजोरीमे सेहो उतरि गेलहुँ, जतय मंद प्रकाश संघर्ष करैत छल, यद्यपि एना करब हमर आत्माक लेल भय छल। एहिमे सँ दूटा मे हम गेलहुं, मुदा पुरान ताबूत आ धूलक ढेर के टुकड़ा के अलावा किछु नहि देखलहुं। तेसर मे, तथापि, हम एकटा खोज केलहुं।
mg: Nisy varavarana lehibe teo amin'ny zoron'ilay efitrano. Nanandrana izany aho, satria tsy nahita ny fanalahidin'ny efitrano na ny fanalahidin'ny varavarana ivelany, izay tena tanjon'ny fikarohana nataoko, dia tsy maintsy manao fanadihadiana bebe kokoa aho, raha tsy izany dia ho very maina ny ezaka rehetra ataoko. Nisokatra ilay izy, ary nitarika tamin'ny alalan'ny vato iray mankany amin'ny tohatra boribory, izay nidina mafy. Nidina aho, nieritreritra tsara izay alehako, satria maizina ny tohatra, satria tsy nisy afa-tsy ny tsy fahampian'ny lavaka tao amin'ny trano mavesatra. Teo amin'ny farany ambany dia nisy lalana maizina sy tahaka ny tonelina, izay nahitana fofona mahafaty sy marary, vao avy nihodina ny fofon'ny tany taloha. Rehefa nandalo ilay andinin-tsoratra masina aho dia nihananakaiky sy nihamafy ny fofona. Tamin'ny farany dia nanokatra varavarana mavesatra iray aho izay nijoro teo amin'ny tavoara, ary nahita ny tenako tao amin'ny trano fiangonana tranainy iray rava, izay mazava ho azy fa nampiasaina ho toy ny fasana. Vaky ny tafo, ary nisy tohatra roa nitondra nankany amin'ny toerana banga, saingy vao haingana no nolavahana ny tany, ary napetraka tao anaty boaty hazo lehibe ny tany, izay miharihary fa nentin'ny Slovaky. Tsy nisy olona momba izany, ary nitady sehatra hafa aho, saingy tsy nisy. Avy eo aho dia nandeha nitety ny faritra rehetra amin'ny tany, mba tsy ho very vintana. Nidina tany amin'ny toerana malalaka aho, izay nitoloman'ny hazavana matromatroka, na dia natahotra ny fanahiko aza ny nanao izany. Tao anatin'ny roa tamin'ireo no nandehanako, nefa tsy nahita na inona na inona afa-tsy sombintsombiny tamin'ny vatam-paty tranainy sy ny vovoka nivangongo aho; 3Notafihin'i Salomona, Etama-Sobà, ka azony.

en: Close at hand came the howling of many wolves. It was almost as if the sound sprang up at the rising of his hand, just as the music of a great orchestra seems to leap under the bâton of the conductor. After a pause of a moment, he proceeded, in his stately way, to the door, drew back the ponderous bolts, unhooked the heavy chains, and began to draw it open.
vi: — Ngài hãy nghe đi! - Lão bảo tôi. Có tiếng hú của bầy sói ở một nơi không xa lâu đài. Lão vung tay lên, và dường như những tiếng hú ấy cũng cất cao lên theo động tác của lão, giống như dàn nhạc phải tuân theo chiếc đũa của người chỉ huy. Lát sau, vẫn cái dáng vẻ oai nghiêm, lão bước tiếp. Ra tới cổng lâu đài, lão rút chốt cửa, kéo tuột những sợi dây xích nặng nề xuống rồi từ từ mở cửa.
tr: Yakından çok sayıda kurdun uluması duyuluyordu. Ses, tıpkı bir şefin yönetimindeki geniş bir orkestranın müziği gibi neredeyse Kont’un elini kaldırmasıyla başlamıştı. Bir anlık bir duraksamadan sonra kendi görkemli tavrıyla kapıya ilerledi ve ağır sürgüleri çekti, ağır zincirleri çengellerinden çıkarttı ve kapıyı açmaya başladı.
es: El aullido de los lobos nos llegó desde cerca. Fue casi como si los aullidos brotaran al alzar él su mano, semejante a como surge la música de una gran orquesta al levantarse la batuta del conductor. Después de un momento de pausa, él continuó, en su manera majestuosa, hacia la puerta. Corrió los enormes cerrojos, destrabó las pesadas cadenas y comenzó a abrirla.
vi_translation: He told me. There was the howl of a pack of wolves not far from the castle. He raised his hand, and it seemed that the howls rose in unison with his gesture, like an orchestra obeying the conductor's baton. A moment later, still with that majestic demeanor, he continued walking. Upon reaching the castle gate, he pulled out the latch, dragged down the heavy chains, and slowly opened the door.
tr_translation: The howling of many wolves was heard up close. The sound had almost begun with the raising of the Count's hand, just like the music of a large orchestra under the direction of a conductor. After a momentary hesitation, he advanced to the door with his majestic demeanor, pulled the heavy bolts, removed the heavy chains from their hooks, and began to open the door.
es_translation: The howling of the wolves reached us from nearby. It was almost as if the howls arose when he raised his hand, similar to how music emerges from a great orchestra when the conductor's baton is lifted. After a moment of pause, he continued, in his majestic manner, towards the door. He slid the enormous bolts, unlocked the heavy chains, and began to open it.
st: Ka lehlakoreng le leng, ho ile ha hlaha liphiri tse ngata. Ho ne ho batla ho tšoana le ha molumo o ntse o phahama ha letsoho la hae, joalo ka ha 'mino oa liletsa o moholo o bonahala o tlola tlasa bâton oa mokhanni. Ka mor'a khefu ea nakoana, a tsoela pele, ka tsela ea hae ea puso, ho ea monyako, o ile a hula morao li-bolts tse ponderous, a hana liketane tse boima, 'me a qala ho e hula.
yo: Ìkookò tó súnmọ́ ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìkookò ni ó dé. Ó fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ dàbí ẹni pé ohùn náà jáde nígbà tí ọwọ́ rẹ̀ ń gòkè, gẹ́gẹ́ bí orin ẹgbẹ́ orin ńlá ṣe dàbí ẹni pé ó fò lábẹ́ bâton olùdarí. Lẹ́yìn ìdádúró fún ìgbà díẹ̀, ó tẹ̀síwájú, ní ọ̀nà ọlọ́rọ̀ rẹ̀, lọ sí ìlẹ̀kùn, fa àwọn bọ́ọ̀tì ìrònú náà padà, ó tú àwọn ẹ̀wọ̀n tó wúwo, ó sì bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní ṣí i sílẹ̀.
tn: Ka fa letlhakoreng le lengwe, go ne ga nna le diphiri tse dintsi tse di neng di le gaufi. Go ne go lebega modumo o ntse o tlhatloga mo letsogong la gagwe, fela jaaka mmino o mogolo wa orchestra o ne o tlola ka fa tlase ga bâton wa mokgweetsi. Fa a sena go tsamaya, o ne a ya kwa lemating la gagwe, a ya kwa lemating la gagwe, a ntsha mejako e e bokete mme a simolola go e gapa.
ty: I pihai iho noa mai, te uuru ra te mau luko e rave rahi. Mai te huru ra e, te faaroohia ra te ta'i i ni'a a'e i to'na rima, mai te pehe a te hoê pŭpŭ upaupa rahi e ou'a ra i raro a'e i te tari'a o te taata arata'i. I muri a'e i te hoê taime faafaaearaa, ua haere oia, na roto i to'na huru mărû, i ni'a i te opani, ua tatara mai i te mau ofa'i pupuhi, ua tatara i te mau fifi teiaha, e ua haamata i te tatara i te reira.
mai: हाथ मे बहुत रास भेड़िये के चिल्लाहट आबि गेल। ई लगभग एहन छल जेना हुनक हाथक उठलासँ आवाज उठल, ठीक ओहिना जेना कोनो महान आर्केस्ट्राक संगीत कंडक्टरक बैटनक नीचा छलांग लगैत अछि। एक क्षणक विरामक बाद ओ अपन सुन्दर तरीकासँ दरवाजा दिस बढ़लाह, भारी बोल्टकेँ पाछू खींचलनि, भारी जंजीरकेँ खोलि देलनि आ ओकरा खोलय लगलाह।
mg: Teo akaikin'ny tanana dia nisy amboadia maro nierona. Toy ny hoe nipoaka ny feo rehefa niakatra ny tanany, tahaka ny feon'ny orkesitra lehibe iray izay toa mitsambikina eo ambanin'ny bâton ny mpitarika.
