en: When I was in my room and about to lie down, I thought I heard a whispering at my door. I went to it softly and listened. Unless my ears deceived me, I heard the voice of the Count:—
vi: Tôi chuẩn bị lên giường nằm thì chợt nghe thấy hình như có tiếng ai đó đang thì thầm ngoài cửa. Tôi rón rén bước lại gần nghe ngóng xem sao. Tôi tin là mình đã nhận ra giọng lão bá tước: — Không được, không được.
tr: Odamda yatmak üzereyken kapımda bir fısıltı duyduğumu sandım. Sessizce kapıya gidip dinledim. Eğer kulaklarım beni aldatmadıysa Kont’un sesini duydum: “Geri gidin, geri gidin, yerinize dönün!
es: Cuando estuve en mi cuarto y me encontraba a punto de acostarme, creí escuchar unos murmullos al otro lado de mi puerta. Me acerqué a ella en silencio y escuché. A menos que mis oídos me engañaran, oí la voz del conde:
vi_translation: I was about to lie down in bed when I suddenly heard what seemed like someone whispering outside the door. I tiptoed closer to listen. I believed I recognized the voice of the old count: — No, no. - The voice still rose.
tr_translation: As I was about to lie down in my room, I thought I heard a whisper at my door. I quietly went to the door and listened. If my ears did not deceive me, I heard the Count's voice: "Go back, go back, return to your place!
es_translation: When I was in my room and about to go to bed, I thought I heard murmurs on the other side of my door. I approached it silently and listened. Unless my ears deceived me, I heard the count's voice:
st: Ha ke ne ke le ka kamoreng ea ka le haufi le ho robala, ke ile ka nahana hore ke ile ka utloa ho honotha ha ka monyako oa ka. Ke ile ka bua le eena ka bonolo 'me ka mamela. Ntle le hore litsebe tsa ka li nthetsitse, ke ile ka utloa lentsoe la Count:
yo: Nígbà tí mo wà nínú yàrá mi tí mo sì fẹ́ dùbúlẹ̀, mo rò pé mo gbọ́ ọ̀rọ̀ kéékèèké kan ní ẹnu ọ̀nà mi. Mo lọ síbẹ̀ pẹ̀lẹ́pẹ̀lẹ́ mo sì tẹ́tí. Àyàfi tí etí mi bá tàn mí jẹ, mo gbọ́ ohùn Ìṣirò:-
tn: Fa ke ne ke le mo kamoreng ya me le gaufi le go robala, ke ne ka akanya gore ke ne ka utlwa gotwe ke letse ke le mo lebating. Ke ne ka e buela kwa tlase mme ka reetsa ka bonolo. Le fa ditsebe tsa me di ka nthetsa, ka utlwa lentswe la bagale.
ty: I to ' u faaearaa i roto i to ' u piha e te fatata ra vau i te tarava, ua mana'o vau e ua faaroo vau i te hoê muhumuhu i to ' u opani. Ua haere mărû noa vau e ua faaroo vau. Ahiri aita to'u tari'a i faahuru-ê-hia, ua faaroo vau i te reo o te Fatu :

en: But the door would not move. Despair seized me. I pulled, and pulled, at the door, and shook it till, massive as it was, it rattled in its casement. I could see the bolt shot. It had been locked after I left the Count.
vi: Nhưng cánh cửa vẫn không hề nhúc nhích. Sự nản chí, nỗi tuyệt vọng trong tôi dần dần lên tới cực điểm. Tôi lao bừa cả người vào cánh cửa với hy vọng sẽ tìm được lối thoát, song tất cả chỉ là vô ích. Lúc này tôi mới hiểu cánh cửa đã bị khóa ngay sau khi tôi chia tay với lão bá tước.
tr: Fakat kapı yerinde oynamadı. Ümitsizliğe kapıldım. Çektim, çektim, heybetli olsa da çerçevesinde çatırdayana dek onu sarstım. Kilit dilinin içeride olduğunu görebiliyordum. Kapı, ben Kont’un yanından ayrıldıktan sonra kilitlenmişti.
es: Pero la puerta no se movió. La desesperación se apoderó de mí. Tiré repetidamente de la puerta y la empujé hasta que, a pesar de ser muy pesada, se sacudió en sus goznes. Pude ver que tenía pasado el pestillo. Le habían echado llave después de que yo dejé al conde.
vi_translation: But the door did not budge at all. The discouragement and despair within me gradually reached their peak. I threw myself against the door in the hope of finding an escape, but it was all in vain. It was only then that I realized the door had been locked right after I parted ways with the old count.
tr_translation: But the door did not budge. I fell into despair. I pulled, pulled, and though it was mighty, I shook it until it creaked in its frame. I could see that the latch was inside. The door had been locked after I left the Count's side.
es_translation: But the door did not move. Desperation took hold of me. I repeatedly pulled and pushed the door until, despite being very heavy, it shook on its hinges. I could see that the latch was fastened. They had locked it after I left the count.
st: Leha ho le joalo, lemati ha lea ka ke la sisinyeha. Ho nyahama ho nkopa. Ke ile ka hula lemati, 'me ke ile ka e sisinya ho fihlela, e kholo kamoo e neng e le kateng, e ile ea otla ka har'a casement ea eona. I see the bolt shot ho. E ne e notletsoe ka mor'a hore ke tlohe ho count.
yo: Ṣùgbọ́n ilẹ̀kùn náà kò ní rìn. Ìrètí gbà mí. Mo fà á, mo sì fà á, ní ẹnu-ọ̀nà, mo sì gbọ̀n ọ́ títí, ó tóbi bí ó ti wà, ó ń bàjẹ́ nínú àpótí rẹ̀. Mo rí bóòtù náà. Wọ́n ti tì í mọ́ lẹ́yìn tí mo fi Count sílẹ̀.
tn: Mme lebati le ne le sa batle go tshikhinyega. Go itlhoboga go ne ga ntshwara. Ke ne ka goga, mme ka goga, kwa kgorong, mme ka e tshikinya go fitlhela, e le kgolo jaaka e ne e le, e ne ya rora mo casement ya yone. Ke ne ke kgona go bona bolt e thuntshitswe. E ne e notletswe morago ga gore ke tswe kwa Count.
ty: Eita râ te opani e hautiuti. Ua hepohepo roa vau. Ua huti a'era vau, e ua huti a'era vau, i te uputa, e ua ueue atura e tae roa ' tu i te taime a topa ' i oia i roto i to ' na pute. Ua nehenehe ia'u ia ite i te ofa'i pupuhi. Ua ponaohia te reira i muri a'e i to'u faaru'eraa'tu i te vahi mata'ita'iraa.
mai: मुदा दरवाजा नहि हिलैत छल। निराशा हमरा पकड़ि लेलक। हम दरवाजा पर खींचलहुं आ खींचलहुं, आ एकरा हिला देलहुं, जतेक पैघ छल, ई अपन केसमेंट मे खड़खड़ाइत छल। हम बोल्ट शॉट देख सकैत छलहुं। गिनती छोड़लाक बाद एकरा ताला लगा देल गेल छल।

en: Then a wild desire took me to obtain that key at any risk, and I determined then and there to scale the wall again and gain the Count’s room. He might kill me, but death now seemed the happier choice of evils. Without a pause I rushed up to the east window, and scrambled down the wall, as before, into the Count’s room. It was empty, but that was as I expected. I could not see a key anywhere, but the heap of gold remained. I went through the door in the corner and down the winding stair and along the dark passage to the old chapel. I knew now well enough where to find the monster I sought.
vi: Tuy nhiên, tôi vẫn tự nhủ rằng bằng mọi giá, tôi phải tìm và lấy cho bằng được chiếc chìa khóa khốn nạn ấy, tôi sẽ lại leo theo bức tường và chui vào phòng lão bá tước. Chắc chắn tôi sẽ nhận được cái chết nếu lão bắt gặp tôi trong phòng lão, nhưng trong số những điều tồi tệ nhất có thể xảy ra đối với tôi, thì cái chết dường như chỉ là điều tối thiểu. Và không chậm trễ một phút, tôi trèo ngay qua cửa sổ, leo xuống phòng lão bá tước. Căn phòng trống rỗng. Tôi không tìm thấy chìa khóa ở đâu. Đống tiền vàng vẫn còn nguyên đó. Tôi lần theo cầu thang và dãy hành lang tối tăm mà lần trước tôi đã đi để tới nhà thờ. Tôi biết rất rõ con quỷ mà tôi tìm kiếm đang nằm ở đâu.
tr: Sonra, her tehlikeyi göze alarak o anahtarı ele geçirmeye ilişkin yabanıl bir arzu beni ele geçirdi; hemen oracıkta, bir kez daha duvara tırmanıp Kont’un odasına ulaşmaya karar verdim. Beni öldürebilirdi, fakat ölüm kötülüklerden oluşan seçeneklerin iyisiydi. Hiç zaman kaybetmeden, doğu penceresine koştum ve daha önce yaptığım gibi duvar boyunca sürünerek aşağı, Kont’un odasına indim. Boştu, ama bunu bekliyordum. Hiçbir yerde anahtar göremedim, fakat altın yığını oradaydı. Köşedeki kapıdan geçip sarmal merdivenden aşağı indim ve eski şapele giden karanlık koridordan geçtim. Artık aradığım canavarı nerede bulacağımı yeterince biliyordum.
es: Entonces se apoderó de mi un deseo salvaje de obtener la llave a cualquier precio, y ahí mismo determiné escalar la pared y llegar otra vez al cuarto del conde. Podía matarme, pero la muerte parecía ahora el menor de todos los males. Sin perder tiempo, corrí hasta la ventana del este y me deslicé por la pared, como antes, al cuarto del conde. Estaba vacío, pero eso era lo que yo esperaba. No pude ver la llave por ningún lado, pero el montón de oro permanecía en su puesto. Pasé por la puerta en la esquina y descendí por la escalinata circular y a lo largo del oscuro pasadizo hasta la vieja capilla. Ya sabía yo muy bien donde encontrar al monstruo que buscaba.
vi_translation: However, I kept telling myself that by any means necessary, I had to find and get that wretched key; I would climb the wall again and sneak into the count's room. Surely, I would face death if he caught me in his room, but among the worst things that could happen to me, death seemed to be the least of them. Without wasting a minute, I immediately climbed through the window and descended into the count's room. The room was empty. I couldn't find the key anywhere. The pile of gold coins was still there. I followed the stairs and the dark corridors I had taken before to reach the church. I knew very well where the demon I was looking for was lying.
tr_translation: Then, taking every risk, a wild desire to get hold of that key seized me; right there and then, I decided to climb the wall once more and reach the Count's room. He could kill me, but death was the best option among the evils. Without wasting any time, I ran to the east window and, as I had done before, crawled along the wall and descended into the Count's room. It was empty, but I was expecting that. I couldn't see the key anywhere, but the pile of gold was there. I passed through the door in the corner, went down the spiral staircase, and walked through the dark corridor leading to the old chapel. Now I knew well enough where to find the monster I was looking for.
es_translation: Then a wild desire to obtain the key at any cost seized me, and right there I resolved to climb the wall and reach the count's room once again. He could kill me, but death now seemed the least of all evils. Without wasting time, I ran to the east window and slid down the wall, as before, to the count's room. It was empty, but that was what I expected. I couldn't see the key anywhere, but the pile of gold remained in its place. I went through the door in the corner and descended the spiral staircase and along the dark passageway to the old chapel. I already knew very well where to find the monster I was looking for.
st: Joale takatso e hlaha e ile ea nkisa ho fumana senotlolo seo kotsing efe kapa efe, 'me ka ikemisetsa ka nako eo le moo ho hloa lerako hape le ho fumana kamore ea Count. O ne a ka 'na a npolaea, empa hona joale o ne a bonahala e le khetho e thabisang ea bokhopo. Ke ile ka potlakela ho ea fensetereng e ka bochabela, 'me ke ile ka heletsa leboteng, joaloka pele, ka kamoreng ea Count. E ne e se na letho, empa e ne e le kamoo ke neng ke lebelletse. Ke ne ke sitoa ho bona senotlolo kae kapa kae, empa qubu ea khauta e sala. Ke ile ka kena ka monyako ka k'honeng ebe ke theoha litepising tsa winding le haufi le ho feta lefifi ho ea holong ea khale. Hona joale ke ne ke tseba moo ke neng ke batla phoofolo ea tonanahali eo ke neng ke e batla.
yo: Lẹ́yìn náà ìfẹ́ ẹranko mú mi gba kọ́kọ́rọ́ yẹn nínú ewu èyíkéyìí, mo sì pinnu nígbà náà àti níbẹ̀ láti ṣe ìwọ̀n ògiri náà lẹ́ẹ̀kan si kí n sì jèrè yàrá Count. Ó lè pa mí, ṣùgbọ́n ikú dàbí àṣàyàn ayọ̀ àwọn ibi báyìí. Láìsí ìdádúró mo sáré lọ sí fèrèsé ìlà-oòrùn, mo sì rìn sọ̀kalẹ̀ ògiri, gẹ́gẹ́ bíi ti tẹ́lẹ̀, sínú yàrá Count. Ó ṣófo, ṣùgbọ́n bí mo ṣe lérò nìyẹn. Mi ò rí kọ́kọ́rọ́ níbikíbi, ṣùgbọ́n ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ wúrà náà ṣì wà. Mo kọjá ìlẹ̀kùn ní igun àti ìsàlẹ̀ àtẹ̀gùn tí ó ń yí padà àti lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ ọ̀nà òkùnkùn lọ sí ilé ìjọsìn àtijọ́. Mo mọ̀ nísinsìnyí dáadáa ibi tí mo ti lè rí ẹranko tí mo wá.
tn: Ka nako eo, ke ne ka dira gore ke nne le seabe mo kotsing eo, mme ke ne ka swetsa ka gore ke boele morago ke bo ke le kwa godimo. O ne a ka nna a mpolaya, mme gone jaanong go ne go lebega go na le dilo tse di itumedisang. Fa ke sena go ikhutsa, ke ne ka tabogela kwa fensetereng ya botlhabatsatsi, ke ne ka tšhabile lobota jaaka pele, mo ntlong ya ga Kgosi. E ne e se na sepe, fela jaaka ke ne ke akantse. Ke ne ke sa kgone go bona selotlolo gongwe le gongwe, mme lequbu la gouta le ne le setse le le teng. Ke ne ka tsena mo lebating le le kwa tlase ga tsela e e tsamayang ka fa tlase ga tsela e e tsamayang ka yone le mo tseleng e e lefifi go ya kwa golong e e kwa godimo. Gone jaanong ke ne ke itse gore ke ne ke tla bona kae gore ke ne ke batla kae.
ty: I muri iho ua tupu mai te hoê hinaaro puai i roto ia'u ia titau i taua taviri ra noa'tu eaha te huru, e ua faaoti au i taua taime ra ia pa'uma faahou i ni'a i te papa'i e ia haere i roto i te piha ta'umaraa. E nehenehe oia e haapohe ia ' u, i teie nei râ, e au ra e o te pohe te maitiraa oaoa roa ' ' e o te mau ino. Ma te faaea ore, ua horo atu vau i te haamaramarama i te pae hitiaa o te râ, e ua horo atu vau na ni'a i te papa'i, mai na mua'tu, i roto i te piha o te taata tia'i. Aita e taata i roto, tera râ, mai ta'u i mana'o. Aita vau i ite i te hoê taviri i te mau vahi atoa, ua vai noa râ te haapueraa auro. Ua haere atu vau na roto i te opani i te poro e na ni'a i te e'a titi'ai'ai e na ni'a i te e'a pouri e tae atu ai i te fare pureraa tahito. Ua ite maitai au i teie nei i hea e itehia ai te mea ta'u i imi.
mai: तखन एकटा जंगली इच्छा हमरा कोनो जोखिम पर ओ चाबी प्राप्त करय लेल लऽ गेल, आ हम तखन आ ओतय निर्णय लेलहुँ जे दीवार पर फेर सँ चढ़ब आ काउंटक कमरा प्राप्त करब। ओ हमरा मारि सकैत छथि, मुदा मृत्यु आब बुराईक सुखद विकल्प बुझाइत छल। बिना कोनो विराम के हम पूरब के खिड़की तक दौड़लहुं, आ पहिने जकाँ दीवार सँ नीचा काउंट के कमरा मे घुसि गेलहुं। ई खाली छल, मुदा ओ ओहिना छल जेना हम अपेक्षा करैत छलहुं। हमरा कतहु चाबी नहि देखल गेल, मुदा सोनाक ढेर रहि गेल। हम कोना मे दरवाजा सं गुजरलहुं आ घुमावदार सीढ़ी सं नीचा आ अन्हार मार्ग के संग पुरान चैपल तक गेलहुं। आब हम नीक जकाँ जनैत छलहुं जे हम जे राक्षस चाहैत छलहुं ओकरा कतए भेटत।
mg: Avy eo dia nisy faniriana tsy nampoizina izay nahatonga ahy hahazo izany fanalahidy izany na inona na inona mety ho loza mety hitranga, ary nanapa-kevitra aho tamin'izany fotoana izany fa hiakatra indray ny rindrina ary hahazo ny efitrano Count. Mety hamono ahy izy, nefa toa ny fahafatesana no safidy tsara indrindra amin'ny ratsy. Tsy nijanona aho fa nihazakazaka nankany amin'ny varavarankely atsinanana, ary nidina nidina ny rindrina, toy ny teo aloha, tao amin'ny efitranon'ny Count. Foana ilay izy, saingy araka ny nieritreretako azy izany. Tsy nahita fanalahidy na aiza na aiza aho, saingy mbola tavela ilay korontam-bolamena. Nandeha namakivaky ny varavarana teo amin'ny zorony aho ary nidina tamin'ny tohatra miolikolika ary nanaraka ny lalana maizina mankany amin'ny trano fiangonana taloha. Fantatro tsara izao hoe aiza no ahitana ilay biby mahatsiravina notadiaviko.

en: As I write there is in the passage below a sound of many tramping feet and the crash of weights being set down heavily, doubtless the boxes, with their freight of earth. There is a sound of hammering; it is the box being nailed down. Now I can hear the heavy feet tramping again along the hall, with many other idle feet coming behind them.
vi: Lúc viết những dòng này là lúc tôi nghe thấy trong hành lang phía dưới có những tiếng bước chân nặng nề và tiếng quẳng... vâng... chắc chắn đó là những chiếc hòm đổ đầy đất. Sau đó là tiếng búa nện. Đám người khi nãy đang đóng chặt chiếc nắp hòm mà tôi vừa làm đổ sập xuống. Một lát sau, tôi lại nghe thấy tiếng những bước chân huỳnh huỵch trong dãy hành lang, kế đó là tiếng những bước chân khác có vẻ nhẹ nhàng hơn.
vi_results: "title": "The Diary of a Country Priest", "author": "Georges Bernanos"
tr: Ben bunları yazarken aşağıdaki koridorda çok sayıda ayak sesi ve sertçe yere konan ağırlıkların gürültüsü var; yere konanlar kuşkusuz toprak yüklü sandıklar. Çekiçle dövme sesi duyuluyor; çivileri çakılan sandık bu. Şimdi, yere sert basan ayakların, arkalarından da çok sayıda başka ayakların koridor boyunca çıkarttıkları sesi duyabiliyorum.
es: Mientras escribo esto, en el pasadizo debajo de mí se escucha el sonido de muchos pies pisando y el ruido de pesos bruscamente depositados, indudablemente las cajas con su cargamento de tierra. También se oye el sonido de un martillo; es la caja del conde, que están cerrando. Ahora puedo escuchar nuevamente los pesados pies avanzando a lo largo del corredor, con muchos otros pies inútiles siguiéndolos detrás.
vi_translation: As I write these lines, I hear heavy footsteps and the sound of something being thrown... yes... it must be the boxes filled with earth in the hallway below. Then there is the sound of hammering. The people from earlier are nailing shut the lid of the box that I had just knocked over. A moment later, I hear the sound of heavy footsteps in the hallway again, followed by lighter footsteps.
tr_translation: As I write these, there are numerous footsteps and the noise of weights being placed heavily on the floor in the corridor below; those being placed are undoubtedly crates filled with soil. The sound of hammering is heard; this is the crate being nailed shut. Now, I can hear the sound of heavy footsteps, followed by many other footsteps, echoing along the corridor.
es_translation: While I write this, in the passageway below me, the sound of many feet stepping and the noise of weights being abruptly deposited can be heard, undoubtedly the boxes with their cargo of earth. The sound of a hammer can also be heard; it is the count's box being sealed. Now I can hear again the heavy feet advancing along the corridor, with many other useless feet following behind them.
st: Ha ke ntse ke ngola ho na le temana e ka tlase ho molumo oa maoto a mangata a hatakelang le ho oa ha boima bo behiloeng haholo, ho belaela mabokose, ka thepa ea bona ea lefats'e. Ho na le molumo oa ho thothomela; Lebokose le tla tlosoa. Hona joale ke khona ho utloa maoto a boima a hatakela hape ka holong, le maoto a mang a mangata a idle a tla ka mor'a bona.
yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí mo ṣe ń kọ̀wé pé ó wà nínú ìkọjá ní ìsàlẹ̀ ohùn ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ẹsẹ̀ tramping àti ìjàm̀bá ìwọ̀n tí wọ́n ń gbé kalẹ̀ gidi gan-an, láìsí ìyèméjì àwọn àpótí náà, pẹ̀lú ẹrù ayé wọn. Ìró ìró kan wà tí ó ń gbọ̀n; Àpótí tí wọ́n kàn mọ́lẹ̀ ni. Ní báyìí mo lè gbọ́ ẹsẹ̀ tó wúwo tí ó ń rìn lẹ́ẹ̀kan si lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ gbọ̀ngàn, pẹ̀lú ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ẹsẹ̀ mìíràn tí kò ṣiṣẹ́ tí ó ń bọ̀ lẹ́yìn wọn.
tn: Fa ke ntse ke kwala, go na le modumo o o fa tlase ga maoto a le mantsi a a gatang le go wa ga bokete jo bo beilweng, go sa belaesege gore mabokoso a bone a na le dithoto tsa bone tsa lefatshe. go utlwala modumo o o monate; That's a box ya gots down. Jaanong ke kgona go utlwa dinao tse di boima di gatakela gape mo holong, ka dinao tse dingwe tse dintsi tsa boithamako di tla morago.
ty: Ia papai ana'e au, te vai ra i roto i te e'a i raro a'e i te hoê ta'i e rave rahi avae e te toparaa o te mau faito teiaha e tuuhia ra i raro, ma te feaa ore, te mau afata, e ta ratou mau tauihaa i nia i te fenua. Te vai nei te hoê ta'i no te hamara ; o te afata ïa i patitihia i raro. I teie nei, e nehenehe ta ' u e faaroo i te mau avae teiaha ia haere faahou na roto i te piha, e e rave rahi atu â mau avae ohipa ore o te haere mai i muri mai ia ratou.
mai: जेना हम लिखैत छी जे नीचाँ एकटा पैसेजमे कतेको पैर टकरयबाक आवाज अछि आ ओजनक दुर्घटनाकेँ भारी नीचा राखल जा रहल अछि, निस्सन्देह बक्सासभ, ओकर माटिक मालभाड़ाक सङ्ग। हथौड़ा मारए के आवाज आबि रहल अछि। ई ओ बक्सा अछि जकरा नीचा कील देल जा रहल अछि। आब हम हॉलक कातमे फेरसँ भारी पैर टकराइत सुनि सकैत छी, जाहिमे कतेको आन निष्क्रिय पैर ओकर पाछू आबि रहल अछि।
mg: Rehefa manoratra aho dia misy eo ambanin'ny feon'ny tongotra maro miforitra sy ny fianjeran'ny lanja izay napetraka be, tsy isalasalana fa ireo boaty, miaraka amin'ny entana entin'ny tany. Misy feon'ny maritoa; Izany no boaty izay nofantsihana tamin'ny hazo fijaliana. Ankehitriny aho dia maheno ny tongotra mavesatra midoboka indray eny amin'ny lalantsara, miaraka amin'ny tongotra maro hafa tsy misy na inona na inona tonga ao aorian'izy ireo.

en: “‘Yes, there is some one I love, though he has not told me yet that he even loves me.’ I was right to speak to him so frankly, for quite a light came into his face, and he put out both his hands and took mine—I think I put them into his—and said in a hearty way:—
vi: — Vâng, em đã yêu một người, mặc dù anh ấy còn chưa nói với em rằng anh ấy yêu em. Tớ hiểu ngay là tớ đã xử sự đúng khi nói thẳng vấn đề với anh ta, bởi lúc đó nét mặt anh ta rạng rỡ hẳn lên, anh ta nắm chặt hai bàn tay tớ (vậy mà tớ cứ ngỡ chính mình đã đặt tay vào tay anh ta) và nói bằng một giọng thân tình nhất:
tr: “Evet, her ne kadar henüz beni sevdiğini söylemiş olmasa da, sevdiğim biri var.” Onunla böyle açık konuşmakla doğru olanı yapmıştım, çünkü yüzü belirgin biçimde aydınlandı ve iki elini uzatıp benimkini tuttu, sanırım ben elimi onun ellerinin arasına yerleştirdim- ve yürekten konuştu:
es: Me alegra, sin embargo, decirte que a pesar de estar llorando, fui capaz de mirar a los valientes ojos del señor Morris y de hablarle sin rodeos: "Sí; hay alguien a quien amo, aunque él todavía no me ha dicho que me quiere. "Estuvo bien que yo le hablara tan francamente, pues una luz pareció iluminar su rostro, y extendiendo sus dos manos, tomó las mías, o creo que fui yo quien las puso en las de él, y dijo muy emocionado:
vi_translation: — Yes, I have loved someone, even though he hasn't told me that he loves me. I immediately understood that I had acted correctly by addressing the issue directly with him, because at that moment his face lit up, he tightly grasped both of my hands (even though I thought I had placed my hands in his) and said in the most affectionate voice:
tr_translation: “Yes, although she hasn't told me she loves me yet, there is someone I love.” I had done the right thing by speaking openly with her like this, because her face visibly brightened and she reached out with both hands to hold mine, I think I placed my hand between hers - and she spoke from the heart:
es_translation: I am glad, however, to tell you that despite crying, I was able to look into Mr. Morris's brave eyes and speak to him frankly: "Yes; there is someone I love, although he has not yet told me that he loves me. "It was good that I spoke to him so frankly, for a light seemed to illuminate his face, and extending his two hands, he took mine, or I believe it was I who placed mine in his, and he said very emotionally:
st: "E, ho na le ba bang bao ke ba ratang, leha a sa ka a mpolella hore o a nthata." Ke ne ke le letona ho bua le eena ka mokhoa o hlakileng, hobane leseli le ile la hlaha ka sefahlehong sa hae, 'me o ile a ntša matsoho a hae ka bobeli'me a nka ka,+ ke nahana hore ke ile ka ba kenya ka har'a hae ka mokhoa o makatsang.+
yo: "Bẹ́ẹ̀ ni, àwọn kan wà tí mo fẹ́ràn, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé kò tíì sọ fún mi pé òun tilẹ̀ nífẹ̀ẹ́ mi." Mo tọ̀nà láti bá a sọ̀rọ̀ ní tòótọ́, nítorí ìmọ́lẹ̀ kan wá sí ojú rẹ̀, ó sì gbé ọwọ́ rẹ̀ méjèèjì jáde ó sì mú tèmi - mo lérò pé mo fi wọ́n sínú rẹ̀ - mo sì sọ ní ọ̀nà ọkàn:-
tn: "Ee, go na le mongwe yo ke mo ratang, le fa a sa mpolelele gore o a nthata." Ke ne ke bua le ene ka tlhamalalo, ka gonne lesedi le ne le tswa mo sefatlhegong sa gagwe, a ntsha diatla tsa gagwe ka bobedi, ka akanya gore ke ne ka ba tsenya mo diatleng tsa gagwe, ka ba ka re:
ty: " 'Oia ïa, te vai nei te tahi o ta'u e here nei, noa'tu e aita â oia i parau mai ia'u e te here nei oia ia'u.' Ua tano vau i te paraparauraa'tu ia'na, no te mea ua tae mai te hoê maramarama i ni'a i to'na hoho'a mata, e ua faatoro maira oia i to'na na rima e piti, e ua rave ihora i to'u iho—te mana'o nei au e, ua tuu atura vau i te reira i roto i to'na rima—e ua parau atura ma te aau tae :—
mai: "हँ, किछु एहन अछि जकरा हम प्रेम करैत छी, यद्यपि ओ एखन धरि हमरा नहि कहलनि अछि जे ओ हमरा सँ प्रेम सेहो करैत छथि।' हम हुनका सँ एतेक स्पष्ट रूपसँ बात करब सही छलहुँ, किएक तँ हुनक मुँहमे बड्ड प्रकाश आबि गेल, आ ओ अपन दुनू हाथ निकालि हमर हाथ पकड़ि लेलनि—हमरा लगैत अछि जे हम ओकरा हुनकामे राखि देलहुँ - आ हार्दिक तरीकासँ कहलनि:—
mg: Eny, misy olona tiako, na dia tsy mbola nilaza tamiko aza izy fa tia ahy. Marina ny nitenenako taminy, satria nisy hazavana nitarehin'i Jesosy, dia narosony ny tanany roa, ka noraisiny ny ahy, ary ataoko fa nataony tao an-tsainy izany, ka hoy izy tamin'ny fo:

en: 19 July.—We are progressing. My friend has now a whole colony of sparrows, and his flies and spiders are almost obliterated. When I came in he ran to me and said he wanted to ask me a great favour—a very, very great favour; and as he spoke he fawned on me like a dog. I asked him what it was, and he said, with a sort of rapture in his voice and bearing:—
vi: • Ngày 19 tháng 7 Chúng tôi đã đạt được tiến bộ trong việc nghiên cứu ca bệnh. Bây giờ Renfield đã có cả một đàn chim sẻ, trong khi đàn ruồi và đàn nhện gần như đã biến mất hoàn toàn. Thấy tôi bước vào phòng, hắn vội sán đến và nói rằng hắn muốn xin tôi một ân huệ lớn, rất lớn; vừa nói hắn vừa vuốt ve lên người tôi như một con chó liếm lưỡi vào người chủ. Tôi hỏi thực ra hắn cần gì, hắn ngây ngất trả lời: “Tôi muốn có một con mèo, một con mèo con xinh xắn để làm bạn.
tr: 19 Temmuz. - İlerleme kaydediyoruz. Dostumun artık tam bir serçe kolonisi var ve sinekleriyle örümcekleri neredeyse tümden yok oldu. İçeri girdiğimde yanıma koştu ve benden büyük bir iyilik istediğini söyledi -çok, çok büyük bir iyilik; konuşurken köpek gibi yaltaklanıyordu. Ona ne istediğini sordum; sesinde ve tavrında bir tür esrimeyle şöyle dedi:
es: 19 de julio. Estamos progresando. Mi amigo tiene ahora casi una completa colonia de gorriones, y sus moscas y arañas casi han desaparecido. Cuando entré corrió hacia mí y me dijo que quería pedirme un gran favor; un favor muy, muy grande; y mientras me hablaba me hizo zalamerías como un perro. Le pregunté qué quería, y él me dijo, con una voz emocionada que casi se le quebraba en sollozos:
vi_translation: • July 19 We have made progress in studying the case. Now Renfield has a whole flock of sparrows, while the swarms of flies and spiders have almost completely disappeared. Seeing me enter the room, he hurriedly came up and said that he wanted to ask me for a big favor, a very big one; as he spoke, he stroked me like a dog licking its owner. I asked what exactly he needed, and he ecstatically replied: "I want a cat, a cute little kitten to be my friend.
tr_translation: July 19. - We are making progress. My friend now has a complete sparrow colony, and with it, the flies and spiders are almost entirely gone. When I entered, he ran to me and said he wanted a big favor - a very, very big favor; he was fawning like a dog as he spoke. I asked him what he wanted; with a kind of ecstasy in his voice and manner, he said:
es_translation: July 19. We are making progress. My friend now has almost a complete colony of sparrows, and his flies and spiders have almost disappeared. When I entered, he ran towards me and told me he wanted to ask me a great favor; a very, very big favor; and as he spoke to me, he fawned over me like a dog. I asked him what he wanted, and he told me, with an emotional voice that almost broke into sobs:
st: Ka la 19 Phupu, re ntse re tsoela pele. Motsoalle oa ka hona joale o na le kolone eohle ea lirobele, 'me lintsintsi tsa hae le li-spider li batla li otlolloa. 'Me ha a ne a bua le' na, o ile a re ho 'na, o ile a botsa 'na, e le hore a ka 'na a batla ho nkamohela ka tsela e makatsang, 'Me ha a ntse a bua, o ile a bua joaloka ntja. Ke ile ka mo botsa hore na e ne e le eng, 'me o ile a re, ka mofuta oa rapture ka lentsoe la hae le jereng:
yo: 19 Oṣù Keje . - À ń tẹ̀síwájú. Ọ̀rẹ́ mi ti ní gbogbo ìlú ológoṣẹ́ báyìí, àti pé àwọn eṣinṣin àti àwọn ọ̀dẹ̀dẹ̀ rẹ̀ ti fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ parẹ́. Nígbà tí mo wọlé ó sáré sọ́dọ̀ mi ó sì sọ pé òun fẹ́ bi mí ní ojúrere ńlá - ojúrere ńlá; Àti pé bí ó ti ń sọ̀rọ̀ ó ń pọ́n mi bí i ajá. Mo béèrè lọ́wọ́ rẹ̀ ohun tí ó jẹ́, ó sì sọ pé, pẹ̀lú irúfẹ́ ìgbádùn nínú ohùn rẹ̀ tí ó sì ní:-
tn: 19/19 /19/2019 - Let's Go On A Go Tsala ya me jaanong e na le kolone yotlhe ya dirobele, mme di fofela gotlhe le diboko tsa gagwe di batla di tlogetswe. Fa ke goroga kwa go ene, o ne a nthaya a re o ne a batla go nthaya a re ke na le keletso e kgolo, e kgolo thata; O ne a bua jaaka ntša e e nkgatlhang. Ke ne ka mmotsa gore ke eng, mme o ne a bua jalo ka lentswe le le rileng le le mo rileng le go mo tshwara ka tsela e e utlwalang.
ty: 19 tiurai—Te haere nei tatou i mua. I teie nei, e mau manu rii atoa to to ' u hoa, e ua fatata roa to ' na mau ra'o e ta ' na mau fee i te ore roa. en: I was glad when the coastguard came along, with his spy-glass under his arm. He stopped to talk with me, as he always does, but all the time kept looking at a strange ship.
vi: Sự xuất hiện của người tuần biển đã làm tôi sực tỉnh. Ông ta kẹp một cái ống nhòm dài ngoằng dưới nách. Theo thói quen, ông dừng lại nói nhăng cuội với tôi vài lời, trong khi ánh mắt vẫn nhìn ra biển, nơi có một con tàu hình như đang gặp khó khăn. — Rõ là một con tàu ngoại quốc. - Người tuần biển nói. - Chắc là tàu của người Nga.
vi_results: "title": "The Old Man and the Sea", "author": "Ernest Hemingway"
tr: Sahil koruma görevlisi kolunun altında küçük dürbünüyle yanıma geldiğinde sevindim. Her zamanki gibi benimle konuşmak için durdu, fakat sürekli tuhaf bir gemiye bakıyordu.
es: Me alegré cuando el guardacostas se acercó, anteojo de larga vista bajo el brazo. Se detuvo a hablar conmigo, como siempre hace, pero todo el tiempo se mantuvo mirando hacia un extraño barco.
vi_translation: The appearance of the coast guard jolted me back to reality. He had a long telescope tucked under his arm. Out of habit, he stopped to exchange a few nonsensical words with me, while his eyes remained fixed on the sea, where a ship seemed to be in trouble. — It is clearly a foreign ship. - The coast guard said. - It must be a Russian ship. But why is it maneuvering so strangely?
tr_translation: I was pleased when the coast guard came to me with his small binoculars under his arm. As usual, he stopped to talk to me, but he kept looking at a strange ship.
es_translation: I was relieved when the coastguard approached, spyglass under his arm. He stopped to talk with me, as he always does, but the whole time he kept looking towards a strange ship.
st: Ke ne ke thabile haholo ha mos'a mos'a letsoho la hae. O ile a emisa ho bua le nna, joalo ka ha a etsa joalo, empa ka linako tsohle o ne a lula a sheba sekepe se sa tloaelehang.
yo: Inú mi dùn nígbà tí àwọn ẹ̀ṣọ́ etí òkun wá, pẹ̀lú gíláàsì amí rẹ̀ lábẹ́ apá rẹ̀. Ó dúró láti bá mi sọ̀rọ̀, gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ṣe máa ń ṣe nígbà gbogbo, ṣùgbọ́n ní gbogbo ìgbà ó máa ń wo ọkọ̀ ojú omi àjèjì.
tn: Ke ne ke itumetse thata fa ke ne ke le mo tseleng e e neng e tsamaya le yone e ne e le ka fa tlase ga tlhogo ya gagwe. O ne a emisa go bua le nna, fela jaaka a dira, mme ka metlha o ne a nna a leba sekepe se se sa tlwaelegang.

en: No trace has ever been found of the great dog; at which there is much mourning, for, with public opinion in its present state, he would, I believe, be adopted by the town. To-morrow will see the funeral; and so will end this one more “mystery of the sea.”
vi: Người ta vẫn không tìm ra một dấu vết nào của con chó to ấy; dư luận trong vùng cũng như cả thành phố nhỏ Whithy đã tỏ ý lấy làm tiếc về điều này. Như vậy, ngày mai chúng ta sẽ tham dự đám tang viên thuyền trưởng. Và đây sẽ là kết cục của câu chuyện “Điều bí ẩn của biển” vốn đã được thêu dệt thêm thắt không biết bao nhiêu tình tiết.
tr: İri köpekten hiç iz yok; bu konuda çok kederleniliyor çünkü kamuoyunun şu anki durumuna bakılacak olursa inanıyorum ki köpek kasaba tarafından sahiplenilecekti. Yarın cenaze töreni yapılacak; böylece bir “deniz gizemi” daha sona erecek.
es: No se han encontrado rastros del inmenso perro; por esto hay mucha tristeza, ya que, con la opinión pública en su presente estado, el animal hubiera sido, creo yo, adoptado por el pueblo. Mañana será el funeral, y así terminará este nuevo "misterio del mar".
vi_translation: People still have not found any trace of that big dog; public opinion in the area as well as the small town of Whitby has expressed regret about this. So, tomorrow we will attend the captain's funeral. And this will be the conclusion of the story "The Mystery of the Sea," which has been embellished with countless details.
tr_translation: There is no trace of the big dog; this is causing much sorrow because, considering the current state of public opinion, I believe the dog would have been adopted by the town. The funeral will be held tomorrow; thus, another "sea mystery" will come to an end.
es_translation: No traces of the immense dog have been found; because of this, there is much sadness, as, with public opinion in its present state, the animal would have been, I believe, adopted by the people. Tomorrow will be the funeral, and thus will end this new "mystery of the sea".

en: “You will please deposit the boxes, fifty in number, which form the consignment, in the partially ruined building forming part of the house and marked ‘A’ on rough diagram enclosed. Your agent will easily recognise the locality, as it is the ancient chapel of the mansion. The goods leave by the train at 9:30 to-night, and will be due at King’s Cross at 4:30 to-morrow afternoon. As our client wishes the delivery made as soon as possible, we shall be obliged by your having teams ready at King’s Cross at the time named and forthwith conveying the goods to destination. In order to obviate any delays possible through any routine requirements as to payment in your departments, we enclose cheque herewith for ten pounds (£10), receipt of which please acknowledge. Should the charge be less than this amount, you can return balance; if greater, we shall at once send cheque for difference on hearing from you. You are to leave the keys on coming away in the main hall of the house, where the proprietor may get them on his entering the house by means of his duplicate key.
en_results: "title": "The Hound of the Baskervilles", "author": "Arthur Conan Doyle"
vi: Các ngài sẽ đặt toàn bộ năm mươi thùng hàng vào chỗ đổ nát và phần có đánh chữ “A” theo bản vẽ kèm theo đây của ngôi nhà. Nhân viên của các ngài sẽ dễ dàng nhận ra địa điểm khi biết chính xác đó là một nhà thờ cổ nằm trong trang viên. Chuyến tàu chở hàng sẽ rời Whitby vào chín giờ rưỡi tối nay và sẽ tới Kings Cross vào bốn giờ rưỡi chiều mai. Khách hàng của chúng tôi muốn các thùng hàng được gửi tới nơi càng sớm càng tốt, vì vậy chúng tôi đề nghị các ngài hãy nhận hàng ở Kings Cros thật đúng giờ và sau đó phải chuyển ngay tới Carfax. Mặt khác, để việc trả tiền không bị chậm trễ, các ngài cũng sẽ nhận được một tấm séc trị giá mười bảng như đã đề nghị kèm theo thư này. Nếu như các phí tổn chưa đến mức này thì xin các ngài hãy vui lòng gửi lại số tiền thừa cho chúng tôi. Ngược lại, nếu số tiền trên vẫn chưa thỏa đáng, chúng tôi sẽ gửi thêm một tấm séc nữa theo đề nghị từ phía các ngài. Chùm chìa khóa sẽ được để ở hành lang của ngôi nhà để chủ nhà có thể dễ dàng thấy ngay sau khi ông ta mở cổng bằng chìa khóa riêng.
tr: Lütfen, gönderiyi oluşturan elli adet sandığı evin bir kısmını oluşturan ve ilişikteki kabataslak krokide “A” harfiyle gösterilen kısmen yıkık binaya bırakınız. Malikânenin eski şapeli olduğu için vekiliniz yeri hemen bulacaktır. Mallar bu gece 9. 30 treniyle yola çıkıyor ve yarın akşamüstü 4. 30 itibariyle King’s Cross’a varmış olacaklar. Müşterimiz teslimatın mümkün olduğunca çabuk yapılmasını istediğinden ekiplerinizin belirtilen saatte King’s Cross’ta hazır olmaları ve malların gecikmeden varış yerine taşınmaları gerekmekte. Servislerinizdeki ödemeler gibi olağan gereksinimlerden kaynaklanabilecek herhangi bir gecikme olasılığının önüne geçmek için ekte on poundluk (10£) bir çek gönderiyoruz; lütfen teslim aldığınızı bildiriniz. Hesap bundan az tutarsa, kalanı gönderebilirsiniz; eğer fazla tutarsa, sizden haber alınca aradaki fark için hemen çek göndereceğiz. Çıkarken anahtarları evin ana salonuna bırakmanız gerekmekte; böylece mülk sahibi kendi anahtarlarıyla eve girdiğinde onları alabilir.
es: "Sírvanse depositar las cajas, cincuenta en total, las cuales constituyen el envío, en el edificio parcialmente derruido que forma parte de la casa, y que está marcado con 'A' en el plano esquemático que les enviamos. Su agente reconocerá fácilmente el lugar, ya que es la antigua capilla de la mansión. Las mercancías, salen por tren a las 9:30 de la noche; llegarán a King's Cross mañana por la tarde a las 4:30. Como nuestro cliente desea que la entrega se haga lo más rápidamente posible, mucho les agradeceríamos que tuvieran preparada alguna gente en King's Cross a la hora indicada, para efectuar el traslado de la mercancía a su destino. Para evitar cualquier demora posible debida a trámites de rutina, tales como pagos en sus departamentos, les enviamos anexo cheque por diez libras (£ 10), cuyo recibo le agradeceríamos nos remitieran. Si los gastos son inferiores a esta cantidad, pueden devolver el saldo; si son más, les enviaremos de inmediato un cheque por la diferencia al tener noticias de ustedes. Al terminar la entrega, sírvanse dejar las llaves en el corredor principal de la casa, donde el propietario pueda recogerlas al entrar en la casa mediante la llave que él posee.
es_results: "title": "The Hound of the Baskervilles", "author": "Arthur Conan Doyle"
vi_translation: You will place all fifty crates in the ruins and the section marked "A" according to the attached drawing of the house. Your staff will easily recognize the location when they know exactly that it is an old church located within the manor. The freight train will leave Whitby at nine-thirty tonight and will arrive at Kings Cross at four-thirty tomorrow afternoon. Our client wants the crates to be delivered as soon as possible, so we suggest that you pick up the goods at Kings Cross promptly and then immediately transfer them to Carfax. Moreover, to avoid any delay in payment, you will also receive a check for ten pounds as proposed with this letter. If the expenses do not reach this amount, please kindly return the surplus to us. Conversely, if the above amount is still insufficient, we will send another check as per your request. The bunch of keys will be left in the hallway of the house so that the owner can easily see them right after he opens the gate with his own key.
tr_translation: Please leave the fifty crates that make up the shipment in the partially ruined building marked with the letter "A" on the attached rough sketch, which is part of the house. Since it is the old chapel of the mansion, your representative will find the place immediately. The goods are departing on the 9:30 train tonight and will arrive at King’s Cross by 4:30 tomorrow afternoon. As our client requested the delivery to be made as quickly as possible, your teams need to be ready at King’s Cross at the specified time and transport the goods to the destination without delay. To prevent any potential delays that may arise from usual requirements such as payments for your services, we are sending a check for ten pounds (£10) attached; please confirm receipt. If the account is less than this amount, you may send the remainder; if it is more, we will send a check for the difference immediately upon hearing from you. When leaving, you need to leave the keys in the main hall of the house; thus, the property owner can take them when they enter the house with their own keys.
es_translation: "Please deposit the boxes, fifty in total, which constitute the shipment, in the partially demolished building that is part of the house and is marked with 'A' on the schematic plan we sent you. Your agent will easily recognize the place, as it is the old chapel of the mansion. The goods leave by train at 9:30 PM; they will arrive at King's Cross tomorrow afternoon at 4:30. As our client wishes the delivery to be made as quickly as possible, we would greatly appreciate it if you could have some people ready at King's Cross at the indicated time to transfer the goods to their destination. To avoid any possible delay due to routine procedures, such as payments in your departments, we are sending you a check for ten pounds (£10) enclosed, for which we would appreciate receiving a receipt. If the expenses are less than this amount, you can return the balance; if they are more, we will immediately send you a check for the difference upon hearing from you. Upon completing the delivery, please leave the keys in the main corridor of the house, where the owner can collect them upon entering the house with the key he possesses.
st: "Ka kopo kenya mabokose, mashome a mahlano ka palo, e etsang consignment, mohahong o senyehileng o entsoeng ka karolo ea ntlo mme o tšoaee "A" ka setšoantšo se thata se koetsoeng. U tla fumana sebaka sa hau sa marang-rang habonolo, kaha ke sebaka sa khale sa marang-rang. The thepa siea ka terene ka 9:30 bosiu, 'me e tla ba ka lebaka la Morena sefapanong ka 4:30 ho mor'a motšehare. Ha moreki oa rona a lakatsa ho fana ka thepa e entsoeng kapele kamoo ho ka khonehang, re tla qobelloa ke lihlopha tsa hau tse lokiselitsoeng Sefapanong sa Morena ka nako eo e bitsoang le ka ntle ho fetisa thepa e eang moo u eang teng. Bakeng sa ho hlakola ho lieha ho khoneha ka litlhoko leha e le life tsa tloaelo mabapi le ho lefa mafapheng a hau, re kenyelelitse cheke mona ka liponto tse leshome (£ 10), rasiti eo ka kopo e ananelang. Haeba tefiso e le tlase ho feta chelete ena, o ka khutlisa balance; Haeba ho feta, hang-hang re tla romela cheke ea phapang ho utloa ho tsoa ho uena. U tla siea linotlolo tse sa tsamaeeng ka holong e kholo ea ntlo, moo mong'a ntlo a ka li fumanang ho kena ka tlung ka senotlolo sa hae sa duplicate.
yo: "Iwọ yoo jọwọ fi awọn apoti naa pamọ, aadọta ni nọmba, eyiti o ṣe agbekalẹ ifiranṣẹ, ni ile ti o bajẹ apakan ti o ṣẹda apakan ti ile naa ati samisi 'A' lori aworan ti o nira ti a pa mọ. Aṣojú rẹ yóò tètè mọ agbègbè náà, nítorí pé ilé ìjọsìn àtijọ́ ilé náà ni. Àwọn ọjà náà kúrò lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ ọkọ̀ ojú irin ní 9:30 sí alẹ́, yóò sì yẹ kí ó wà ní King's Cross ní 4:30 sí morrow afternoon. Bi alabara wa ṣe fẹ ifijiṣẹ ti a ṣe ni kete bi o ti ṣee, a yoo ni ọranyan nipasẹ nini awọn ẹgbẹ rẹ ti o ṣetan ni King's Cross ni akoko ti a npè ni ati siwaju ti n gbe awọn ẹru si ibi-afẹde. Láti lè dín ìdádúró èyíkéyìí kù tí ó ṣe é ṣe nípasẹ̀ èyíkéyìí àwọn ìbéèrè déédéé nípa ìsanwó ní àwọn ẹ̀ka rẹ, a pa ṣẹ́ẹ̀kì mọ́ fún poun mẹ́wàá (£10), ìwé ìwọlé èyí tí jọ̀wọ́ jẹ́wọ́. Tí owó náà bá kéré ju iye yìí lọ, o lè dá ìwọ̀ntúnwọ̀nsì padà; Tí ó bá tóbi, a máa fi sọ̀wédowó ránṣẹ́ sí ìyàtọ̀ lẹ́ẹ̀kan náà lórí gbígbọ́ láti ọ̀dọ̀ rẹ. O ní láti fi àwọn kọ́kọ́rọ́ sílẹ̀ lórí wíwá sí gbọ̀ngàn ńlá ilé náà, níbi tí ẹni tí ó ni ilé náà ti lè gbé wọn wọ inú ilé nípasẹ̀ kọ́kọ́rọ́ ẹ̀dà rẹ̀.
tn: "Tsweetswee tsenya mabokoso, a le masome a matlhano ka palo, e e dirang gore consignment, mo kagong e e senyegileng e e nang le karolo ya ntlo mme e tshwailwe mo go 'A' mo diagramong e e bokete e e kwa godimo. O tla lemoga gore ke lefelo la bogologolo le le neng le le mo go lone, ka gonne ke lefelo la bogologolo le le neng le le mo go lone. Dithoto di tswa ka terena ka 9:30 go ya go bosigo, mme di tla bo di duetswe kwa Sefapaanong sa Kgosi ka 4:30 go ya go motshegare. Fa re batla go dira jalo, re tla tshwanelwa ke go nna le baemedi ba rona ka bonako jo bo kgonegang, re tla patelesega go nna le setlhopha sa rona sa bogosi ka nako e e beilweng le ka nako e e rileng ka go romela dithoto tse di yang kwa go tsone. E le gore o kgone go duela ditshenyegelo tse di ka kgonagalang go ya ka ditlhokego dingwe le dingwe tse di tlhokegang tsa go duela mo mafapheng a gago, re tsenya tšheke eno ka tšheke ya dikilogerama di le lesome (£10), ka kopo amogela. Fa o na le madi a a kwa tlase ga madi a, o ka nna wa busetsa madi a a kwa tlase; Fa o ka dira jalo, re tla romela ditšheke ka bonako gore re utlwe ka ga gago. O tshwanetse go tlogela dilotlolo tse di mo ntlong e kgolo ya ntlo, fa mong wa ntlo a ka di tsenya mo ntlong a tsena mo ntlong ka selotlolo sa gagwe sa duplicate.
ty: " E tuu outou i te mau afata, e pae ahuru i ni'a i te toru, e na te reira e hamani i te afata, i roto i te fare tei vavahihia ei tuhaa no te fare e tei tapa'ohia 'A' i ni'a i te hoho'a i tapirihia. E ite ohie noa to outou tia i te vahi, no te mea e fare pure tahito teie o te fare pure. E tere te mau tauihaa na ni'a i te pereoo auahi i te hora 9:30 i te pô, e e tae atu i te hora 4:30 i te avatea. Mai ta to matou hoa e hinaaro ra e ia tae oioi mai te fanauraa, e tia ia matou ia faahepohia e ta outou mau pǔpǔ o tei ineine i te Satauro a te Arii i te taime a piihia ' i e a hapono atu ai i te mau tao'a e tae roa ' tu i te vahi tapaeraa. No te faaiti mai i te mau faataimeraa atoa e nehenehe e ravehia na roto i te mau titauraa matauhia no nia i te aufauraa i ta outou mau tuhaa ohipa, te faatae atu nei matou i te hoê parau titauraa e 10 kilo te teiaha (£10), te parau hooraa mai i te reira. Mai te mea e mea iti a'e te pariraa i teie tino moni, e nehenehe ïa ta outou e faaho'i i te aifaitoraa ; mai te mea e, e mea rahi a'e, e hapono atu ïa matou i te hoê parau no te faaite i te taa-ê-raa i rotopu ia outou. E tia ia outou ia vaiiho i te mau taviri ia haere mai outou i roto i te piha rahi o te fare, i reira te fatu fare e nehenehe ai e afai ia ratou i roto i te fare na roto i te ravea o ta ' na taviri.
mai: "अहाँ कृपया बक्साकेँ जमा करब, संख्यामे पचास, जे खेप बनबैत अछि, आंशिक रूपसँ बर्बाद भवनमे घरक हिस्सा बनबैत अछि आ मोटा-मोटी आरेख पर 'ए' चिह्नित अछि। अहाँक एजेंट आसानी सँ इलाका के पहचान लेत, कियैकि ई हवेली के प्राचीन चैपल अछि। मालसभ ट्रेनसँ राति ९:३० बजे निकलैत अछि, आ काल्हि दुपहरिया धरि ४:३० बजे किंग्स क्रॉस पर उतरबाक अछि। जेना कि हमर ग्राहक जल्दीसँ जल्दी डिलीवरी करय चाहैत छथि, हमसभ बाध्य होब जे अहाँक टीम किंग्स क्रॉस पर नामित समय तैयार अछि आ तुरन्त सामान गंतव्य तक पहुँचा रहल अछि। अहाँक विभागमे भुगतानक संबंधमे कोनो नियमित आवश्यकताक माध्यमसँ सम्भव कोनो देरीकेँ दूर करबाक लेल, हम एहिसँ दस पाउंड (£१०) लेल चेक संलग्न करैत छी, जकर प्राप्ति कृपया स्वीकार करू। जँ शुल्क एहि राशिसँ कम होयत अछि तँ अहाँ शेष राशि वापस कऽ सकैत छी; जँ बेसी अछि तखन हम अहां सं सुनला पर अंतर के लेल चेक भेजब। अहाँकेँ घरक मुख्य कक्षमे आबि चाबी छोड़ि देबाक अछि, जतय मालिक अपन डुप्लिकेट चाबीक माध्यमसँ घरमे प्रवेश करबा पर ओकरा प्राप्त कऽ सकैत छथि।
mg: "Apetraho ao anatin'ilay tranobe rava amin'ny ampahany ny boaty, dimampolo, izay mandrafitra ny entana, ary asio marika hoe 'A' amin'ny sary lava be. Ny mpiasanao dia hahafantatra mora foana ny toerana, satria izy no trano fiangonana fahiny tao amin'ilay tranobe. Ny entana dia miala amin'ny fiaran-dalamby amin'ny 9:30 ka hatramin'ny alina, ary ho tonga eo amin'ny King's Cross amin'ny 4:30 hatramin'ny tolakandro rahampitso. Araka ny fanirian'ny mpanjifanay ny fandefasana natao haingana araka izay azo atao, dia ho voatery amin'ny ekipanao vonona eo amin'ny Hazofijalian'ny Mpanjaka izahay amin'ny fotoana voatondro sy avy hatrany amin'ny fampitana ny entana mankany amin'ny toerana halehany. Mba hanafoanana izay mety ho fahatarana azo atao amin'ny alalan'ny fepetra mahazatra toy ny fandoavam-bola ao amin'ny departemanta, dia enclose cheque amin'ny folo kilao (£ 10), fandraisana izay manaiky azafady. Tokony ho ny anjara-raharaha ho kely noho izany vola, dia afaka miverina fifandanjana; Raha lehibe kokoa, dia handefa taratasim-bola ho an'ny fahasamihafana eo amin'ny fihainoanay avy aminareo izahay. Tokony havelanao ao amin'ny efitrano lehibe ao an-trano ireo fanalahidy, izay ahafahan'ny tompony miditra ao an-trano amin'ny alalan'ny fanalahidin'ny dika mitovy aminy.

en: “What?” I said. “You don’t mean to tell me you don’t care about spiders?” (Spiders at present are his hobby and the note-book is filling up with columns of small figures.) To this he answered enigmatically:—
vi: — Sao cơ? - Tôi ngắt lời hắn. - Anh sẽ không nói với tôi rằng anh không còn quan tâm tới lũ nhện nữa chứ? (Bởi vì sở thích của hắn mấy ngày hôm nay vẫn là đàn nhện, và cuốn sổ tay của hắn thì đã đầy ắp những con số). Nghe tôi hỏi vậy, hắn đã đáp lại bằng một giọng thật khó hiểu:
tr: “Ne!” dedim. “Örümceklerle ilgilenmediğini söylemek istemiyorsun herhalde.” (Şimdiki hobisi örümcekler, defteri de küçük rakamlardan sütunlarla doluyor. Buna gizemli bir yanıt verdi:
es: –¿Cómo? – dije yo-. ¿Acaso ya no le interesan las arañas? (Las arañas son de momento su mayor entretenimiento, y su libreta se está llenando con columnas de pequeños números.) A esto me respondió enigmáticamente:
vi_translation: — What? - I interrupted him. - You’re not going to tell me that you no longer care about the spiders, are you? (Because his hobby these past few days has been the spiders, and his notebook is filled with numbers). When I asked that, he responded in a really incomprehensible voice:
tr_translation: “No!” I said. “You don't mean to say you're not interested in spiders.” (His current hobby is spiders, and his notebook is filled with columns of small numbers.) He gave a mysterious answer to this:
es_translation: –What? – I said-. Are you no longer interested in spiders? (Spiders are currently their biggest entertainment, and their notebook is filling up with columns of small numbers.) To this, he responded enigmatically:
st: "Ho ho ho what?" Ke itse. "Na ha u batle ho mpolella hore ha u tsotelle li-spider?" (Li-spider hajoale ke mokhoa oa hae oa ho itlosa bolutu mme buka e tlatsa litšiea tsa lipalo tse nyane.) Ka mantsoe a mang, o ile a araba ka mokhoa o sa rialong:
yo: "Kí ni?" Mo sọ. "O ko tumọ si lati sọ fun mi pe o ko bikita nipa spiders?" (Àwọn Spiders lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ báyìí ni iṣẹ́ ìgbafẹ́ rẹ̀ àti pé ìwé àkọsílẹ̀ náà ń kún fún àwọn ọ̀wọ̀n àwọn nọ́mbà kékeré.) Sí èyí ó dáhùn pẹ̀lú àràmàdà:-

en: “I am here to do Your bidding, Master. I am Your slave, and You will reward me, for I shall be faithful. I have worshipped You long and afar off. Now that You are near, I await Your commands, and You will not pass me by, will You, dear Master, in Your distribution of good things?”
vi: — Tôi xin phục tùng ngài, thưa ông chủ. Tôi là nô lệ của ngài và tôi biết rồi ngài sẽ ban thưởng cho tôi, bởi tôi là người luôn trung thành với ngài. Tôi ngưỡng mộ ngài từ lâu, rất lâu rồi! Bây giờ ngài đã tới đây, tôi sẽ chờ đợi mệnh lệnh của ngài, và ngài sẽ không quên chia của cải cho tôi chứ, ông chủ?
vi_results: "title": "Đời sống và bí ẩn của một nhà giàu", "author": "Fyodor Dostoevsky"
tr: Onun şöyle dediğini duydum: “Emirlerinizi yerine getirmek için buradayım, Efendim. Sizin kölenizim ve beni ödüllendireceksiniz, çünkü size sadık olacağım. Size uzun süredir ve sizin çok uzaklarda olduğunuzda bile tapıyordum. Artık yakında olduğunuza göre, emirlerinizi bekliyorum; güzel şeyleri dağıtırken beni görmezden gelmezsiniz değil mi sevgili Efendim?
es: –Estoy aquí para cumplir tus órdenes, amo. Soy tu esclavo, y tú me recompensaras, pues seré fiel. Te he adorado desde hace tiempo y desde lejos. Ahora que estás cerca, espero tus órdenes, y tú no me olvidarás, ¿verdad, mi querido amo?, en tu distribución de las buenas cosas.
vi_translation: — I submit to you, master. I am your slave and I know that you will reward me, for I am always loyal to you. I have admired you for a long, long time! Now that you are here, I will await your orders, and you won't forget to share the wealth with me, will you, master?
tr_translation: I heard him say: "I am here to carry out your orders, Master. I am your slave and you will reward me, for I will be faithful to you. I have worshipped you for a long time, even when you were far away. Now that you are near, I await your commands; you won't overlook me when distributing the good things, will you, dear Master?"
es_translation: –I am here to fulfill your orders, master. I am your slave, and you will reward me, for I will be faithful. I have adored you for a long time and from afar. Now that you are near, I await your orders, and you will not forget me, will you, my dear master?, in your distribution of good things.
st: "Ke tla etsa mosebetsi wa hao wa ho etsa seo, monghadi. Ke 'na mohlanka oa hao, 'me u tla busoa ke' na, etsoe ke tla tšepahala. Ke u rapela ka nako e telele le hōle. Kaha joale o haufi, Ke letetse litaelo tsa hao, 'me u ke ke ua feta ka, u tla, Morena ea ratehang, ka ho aba hao lintho tse molemo?
yo: "Mo wà níbí láti ṣe ìfilọ́lẹ̀ rẹ, Ọ̀gá. Èmi ni ẹrú rẹ, ìwọ yóò sì san ẹ̀san fún mi, nítorí èmi yóò jẹ́ olóòótọ́. Mo ti jọ́sìn fún ọ fún ìgbà pípẹ́ àti jíjìnnà. Nísinsin yìí tí ìwọ ti sún mọ́lé, mo ń dúró de àṣẹ rẹ, o kò sì ní kọjá mi, ṣé ìwọ ọ̀wọ́n ọ̀wọ́n, nínú pínpín àwọn ohun rere rẹ?"
tn: "Ke tla dira tiro ya gago, Monghadi. Ke motlhanka wa gago, mme o tla nteletsa; gonne ke tla ikanyega. Ke go oetse kgale, 13 Jaanong he, fa o atametse, ke lebeletse ditaolo tsa gago, mme ga o nke o feta, Morena, mo go tse o di boneng mo phaseng ya tse di molemo?"
ty: " Tei ô nei au no te rave i ta oe ohipa, e te Fatu. o vau to outou tavini, e na oe e faautua mai ia'u, e vai haapa'o maitai noa vau. E mea maoro to'u haamori-noa-raa ia outou. I teie nei ua fatata oe i te pohe, te tia'i nei au i ta Oe mau faaueraa, e eita oe e haere mai na muri ia'u, e te Fatu here e, i roto i ta oe opereraa i te mau mea maitatai ? "

en: After a while I left him. The attendant tells me that he was quiet until just before dawn, and that then he began to get uneasy, and at length violent, until at last he fell into a paroxysm which exhausted him so that he swooned into a sort of coma.
en_results: "title": "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest", "author": "Ken Kesey"
vi: Viên giám thị kể với tôi rằng khi tôi rời khỏi phòng hắn, hắn đã ngồi câm lặng đến tận sáng. Sau đó, hắn lại bắt đầu giở chứng, và lần này, cơn điên khùng đã khiến hắn hung hăng đến nỗi ngất xỉu đi và chìm vào một trận hôn mê.
vi_results: "title": "Đại bàng và con chim sẻ", "author": "Franz Kafka"
tr: Bir süre sonra yanından ayrıldım. Hastabakıcı, Renfield’ın şafak sökene kadar sessiz kaldığını, sonra huzursuzlanmaya başladığını, sonunda onu fazlasıyla yorup bayıltana kadar süren şiddetli bir nöbet geçirdiğini söylüyor.
es: Después de un rato, lo dejé. El ayudante me dice que estuvo tranquilo hasta un rato antes del amanecer y que, entonces, comenzó a dar muestras de nerviosismo. Finalmente se puso violento, hasta que, por último, cayó en una especie de paroxismo que lo agotó de tal manera que, finalmente, se desvaneció en una especie de coma.
vi_translation: The warden told me that when I left his room, he sat in silence until morning. After that, he started acting up again, and this time, his madness made him so aggressive that he fainted and fell into a coma.
tr_translation: After a while, I left his side. The nurse says that Renfield remained quiet until dawn, then started to become restless, and eventually had a violent seizure that exhausted him to the point of fainting.
es_translation: After a while, I left him. The assistant tells me that he was calm until a little before dawn and then began to show signs of nervousness. Finally, he became violent, until, at last, he fell into a kind of paroxysm that exhausted him so much that, finally, he fainted into a kind of coma.
st: Ka mor'a nakoana, ke ile ka mo tlohela. O ile a mpolella hore o ne a khutsitse ho fihlela hoseng feela, 'me ka nako eo o ile a qala ho se phutholohe, 'me ka nako e telele mabifi, ho fihlela qetellong a oela ka paroxysm e mo khathetseng e le hore a swooned ka mofuta oa coma.
yo: Lẹ́yìn ìgbà díẹ̀ mo fi sílẹ̀. Olùtọ́jú náà sọ fún mi pé òun dákẹ́ jẹ́jẹ́ títí di òwúrọ̀, àti pé lẹ́yìn náà ó bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní ní ìrọ̀rùn, àti pé ní gígùn ìwà ipá, títí di ìgbẹ̀yìn ó ṣubú sínú paroxysm tí ó rẹ̀ ẹ́ kí ó lè wọ inú irúfẹ́ àìsàn.

en: Later.—Another change in my patient. At five o’clock I looked in on him, and found him seemingly as happy and contented as he used to be. He was catching flies and eating them, and was keeping note of his capture by making nail-marks on the edge of the door between the ridges of padding. When he saw me, he came over and apologised for his bad conduct, and asked me in a very humble, cringing way to be led back to his own room and to have his note-book again. I thought it well to humour him: so he is back in his room with the window open. He has the sugar of his tea spread out on the window-sill, and is reaping quite a harvest of flies. He is not now eating them, but putting them into a box, as of old, and is already examining the corners of his room to find a spider. I tried to get him to talk about the past few days, for any clue to his thoughts would be of immense help to me; but he would not rise. For a moment or two he looked very sad, and said in a sort of far-away voice, as though saying it rather to himself than to me:—
vi: • Một lát sau Trong con người tên bệnh nhân của tôi lại có sự thay đổi. Tôi quay lại thăm hắn vào lúc 5 giờ, có vẻ như hắn đang rất mãn nguyện về số phận của mình. Hắn chộp ruồi rồi bỏ vào miệng nhai ngấu nghiến, và mỗi lần chộp được một con, hắn lại lấy móng tay vạch một vệt lên cánh cửa. Vừa trông thấy tôi, hắn vội rối rít xin lỗi về cách xử sự không đẹp của mình, rồi đề nghị tôi, hay nói đúng hơn là nài nỉ tôi cho phép hắn trở về phòng, nơi hắn có thể tiếp tục công việc ghi chép vào cuốn sổ tay của hắn. Tôi nghĩ là mình phải làm cho hắn vứt bỏ cái tính khí thất thường này, nên đã đồng ý với đề nghị của hắn. Hắn trở về phòng và mở ngay ô cửa sổ ra, tiếp đó hắn lấy một nhúm đường rắc lên gờ ngoài cửa sổ để rình bắt ruồi. Song lần này hắn bắt ruồi không phải để cho vào miệng, mà để cho vào một cái hộp như hắn vẫn làm trước đây, rồi hắn đi kiểm tra tất cả các xó xỉnh trong phòng để tìm kiếm một con nhện. Tôi tìm cách dò hỏi hắn xem hắn đã nghĩ gì về những ngày đã qua, vì một mạch dẫn tối thiểu trong suy nghĩ của hắn cũng giúp tôi khá nhiều trong công việc. Nhưng quả thực là chẳng có cách nào lôi hắn ra khỏi sự im lặng trong lúc này. Được một lúc, bộ mặt lầm lì của hắn bỗng thoáng một nét buồn, chỉ tới lúc ấy hắn mới chịu thều thào nói bằng một giọng vừa đủ nghe, khiến tôi có cảm giác như hắn đang nói với chính mình chứ không phải nói với tôi:
tr: Daha sonra. - Hastamda yeni bir değişim oldu. Saat beşte yanına gittim ve onu eskisi gibi mutlu ve hoşnut buldum. Sinek yakalayıp yiyordu ve ele geçirdiklerinin raporunu kapının kenarında kaplamaların çıkıntıları arasına tırnağıyla çentik atarak tutuyordu. Beni görünce yanıma gelip kötü davranışları için özür diledi ve büyük bir saygı ve yalakalıkla kendi odasına götürülmesini ve defterini geri almasına izin vermemi istedi. Huyuna gitmenin iyi olacağını düşündüm; bu yüzden, odasına geri döndü ve penceresi açık. Çayının şekerini pencere kenarına serdi ve iyi bir sinek hasadı yapıyor. Artık onları yemiyor, eskisi gibi bir kutuya koyuyor ve şimdiden örümcek bulmak için odasının köşelerine bakmaya başladı bile. Onu son birkaç gün hakkında konuşturmaya çalıştım, çünkü düşüncelerine ilişkin her ipucunun bana büyük yardımı dokunacaktı; ama bu konuşmada bana katılmıyordu. Bir-iki saniyeliğine çok üzgün göründü ve uzaklara dalmış gibi bir ses tonuyla, sanki benimle değil de kendi kendine konuşuyormuş gibi şöyle dedi:
es: Más tarde. Otro cambio en mi paciente. A las cinco de la tarde lo fui a ver y lo encontré casi tan alegre como solía estar antes. Estaba capturando moscas y comiéndoselas, y mantenía registro de sus capturas haciendo unas rayas con las uñas en el borde de la puerta entre los canales del relleno. Cuando me vio, se dirigió a mí y pidió disculpas por su mala conducta, y me suplicó de una manera muy humilde y atenta que le permitiera regresar otra vez a su cuarto y que le diera su libreta. Pensé que convenía complacerlo; de tal manera que está de regreso en su cuarto con la ventana abierta. Ha regado el azúcar de su té por el antepecho de la ventana, y está entregado otra vez a su colección de moscas. De momento no se las está comiendo, sino que las está poniendo en una caja, igual que antes, y ya está examinando los rincones de su cuarto para encontrar arañas. Traté de hacerle hablar sobre lo sucedido en los últimos días, pues cualquier pista sobre sus pensamientos me sería muy útil, pero él no quiso entrar en conversación. Durante unos momentos puso una expresión bastante triste, y dijo con apagada voz, como si más bien hablara consigo mismo en vez de hablar conmigo:
vi_translation: • A moment later There was a change in the person of my patient. I went back to visit him at 5 o'clock, and it seemed he was very content with his fate. He caught flies and put them in his mouth, chewing voraciously, and each time he caught one, he would mark a line on the door with his fingernail. As soon as he saw me, he hurriedly apologized for his improper behavior and then requested, or rather begged, me to allow him to return to his room, where he could continue his work of recording in his notebook. I thought I had to make him abandon this erratic temperament, so I agreed to his request. He returned to his room and immediately opened the window, then he took a pinch of sugar and sprinkled it on the outer window ledge to catch flies. But this time he caught flies not to put them in his mouth, but to put them in a box as he had done before, and then he went to check all the corners of the room to look for a spider. I tried to probe him to see what he thought about the past days, because even a minimal thread in his thoughts would help me a lot in my work. But indeed, there was no way to draw him out of his silence at this moment. After a while, his sullen face suddenly showed a hint of sadness, and only then did he whisper in a barely audible voice, making me feel as if he was talking to himself rather than to me:
tr_translation: Later. - There has been a new change in my patient. I went to see him at five o'clock and found him happy and content as before. He was catching flies and eating them, and he was keeping a record of his captures by making notches with his fingernail on the protrusions of the door frame. When he saw me, he came up to me and apologized for his bad behavior, and with great respect and obsequiousness, he asked to be taken back to his room and to be allowed to have his notebook back. I thought it would be good to humor him; so, he returned to his room and his window is open. He spread the sugar from his tea on the window sill and is having a good harvest of flies. He is no longer eating them, but is putting them in a box as before, and has already started looking in the corners of his room for spiders. I tried to get him to talk about the last few days, because any clue about his thoughts would be of great help to me; but he did not join me in this conversation. For a second or two, he looked very sad and, in a tone as if he were talking to himself rather than to me, he said:
es_translation: Later. Another change in my patient. At five in the afternoon I went to see him and found him almost as cheerful as he used to be before. He was catching flies and eating them, and keeping track of his catches by making marks with his nails on the edge of the door between the channels of the filling. When he saw me, he approached me and apologized for his bad behavior, and begged me in a very humble and attentive manner to allow him to return to his room again and to give him his notebook. I thought it best to please him; so he is back in his room with the window open. He has spread the sugar from his tea on the window sill, and is once again devoted to his collection of flies. At the moment he is not eating them, but putting them in a box, just like before, and he is already examining the corners of his room to find spiders. I tried to get him to talk about what happened in the last few days, as any clue about his thoughts would be very useful to me, but he did not want to engage in conversation. For a few moments he put on a rather sad expression, and said in a muted voice, as if he were talking to himself rather than to me:
st: Ka mor'a moo, ho na le phetoho e 'ngoe ho ngaka ea ka. Ka hora ya bohlano ke ile ka mo sheba, mme ka mo fumana a thabile mme a kgotsofala kamoo a neng a tlwaetse kateng. O ne a tšoasa lintsintsi 'me a li ja, 'me o ne a boloka hlokomela ha a ts'oaroa ha hae ka ho etsa matšoao a lipekere moeling oa monyako lipakeng tsa mengoapo ea padding. Ha a mpona, o ile a tla mme a kopa tšoarelo ka boitšoaro ba hae bo bobe, mme a nkopa ka mokhoa o ikokobelitseng haholo, o lla hore o tle o khutlele kamoreng ea hae le ho ba le buka ea hae ea mangolo hape. Ke ne ke nahana hore ho monate ho mo soahla: kahoo o khutlela ka kamoreng ea hae ka fensetere e butsoe. O na le tsoekere ea tee ea hae e hasaneng fensetereng, 'me e kotula kotulo e ngata ea lintsintsi. Ha a sa li ja hona joale, empa o li kenya ka lebokoseng, joalo ka tsa khale, 'me o se a ntse a hlahloba likhutlong tsa kamore ea hae ho fumana sekho. Ke lekile ho bua ka matsatsi a 'maloa a fetileng, bakeng sa tlhaiso-taba efe kapa efe ea menahano ea hae e ka nthusa haholo; 'Me ha aa tla tsoha. Ka motsotsoana kapa tse peli o ne a shebahala a hloname haholo, 'me o ile a re ka lentsoe le hole, joalokaha eka a bua ka eona ho e-na le eena ho feta ho 'na.
yo: Lẹ́yìn náà .- Àyípadà mìíràn nínú aláìsàn mi. Ní aago márùn-ún mo wò ó, mo sì rí i pé inú rẹ̀ dùn ó sì tẹ́ ẹ lọ́rùn bí ó ti máa ń rí tẹ́lẹ̀. Ó ń mú àwọn eṣinṣin ó sì ń jẹ wọ́n, ó sì ń ṣe àkíyèsí ìgbà tí wọ́n mú un nípa ṣíṣe àmì èékánná ní etí ìlẹ̀kùn láàárín àwọn òkè padding. Nígbà tí ó rí mi, ó wá tọrọ àforíjì fún ìwà burúkú rẹ̀, ó sì béèrè lọ́wọ́ mi ní ọ̀nà ìrẹ̀lẹ̀, ìgbàgbọ́ láti mú padà sí yàrá tirẹ̀ àti láti tún ìwé àkọsílẹ̀ rẹ̀ ṣe. Mo rò pé ó dára láti pa á lẹ́rìn-ín: nítorí náà ó ti padà sínú yàrá rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú fèrèsé tí ó ṣí sílẹ̀. Ó ní ṣúgà tíì rẹ̀ tí ó tàn jáde lórí fèrèsé-sill, ó sì ń kórè ìkórè eṣinṣin. Kò jẹ wọ́n báyìí, ṣùgbọ́n ó fi wọ́n sínú àpótí, láti ìgbà àtijọ́, ó sì ti ń ṣe àyẹ̀wò àwọn igun yàrá rẹ̀ láti wá ọ̀dẹ̀dẹ̀. Mo gbìyànjú láti jẹ́ kí ó sọ̀rọ̀ nípa àwọn ọjọ́ díẹ̀ sẹ́yìn, fún èyíkéyìí àmì sí èrò rẹ̀ yóò jẹ́ ìrànlọ́wọ́ ńlá fún mi; Ṣùgbọ́n kò ní dìde. Fún ìgbà díẹ̀ tàbí méjì ó dàbí ẹni ìbànújẹ́ gidi gan-an, ó sì sọ pẹ̀lú irúfẹ́ ohùn jíjìn, bí ẹni pé ó sọ ọ́ dípò ara rẹ̀ ju èmi lọ:-
tn: Gape, morago ga moo, go na le phetogo e nngwe gape mo molwetseng wa me. Ka nako ya botlhano ke ne ka mo leba, ka fitlhela a lebega a itumetse e bile a itumetse jaaka a ne a ntse a le teng. O ne a di ja, a bo a di ja, a bo a di tshwara ka go dira ditshika tsa gagwe mo letlhakoreng la kgoro e e fa gare ga mebila. Fa a ne a bona, o ne a kopa maitshwarelo ka boitshwaro jwa gagwe jo bo utlwisang botlhoko, mme a nkopa gore ke boele mo ntlong ya gagwe gape. Ke ne ke akanya gore go ne go le monate go mo sega, ka jalo o ne a boela mo kamoreng ya gagwe ka fensetere e e bulegileng. O na le sukiri ya teye ya gagwe e anama mo fensetereng, mme e roba thobo e ntsi thata. Ga a di je, mme o di bee mo lebokosong, jaaka tsa bogologolo, mme o setse a tlhatlhoba dikhutlo tsa kamore ya gagwe go bona sepo. Ke lekile go bua le ene mo malatsing a le mmalwa a a fetileng, ka gonne dikakanyo tsa gagwe di ne di tla nthusa thata mo go nna. ga a kitla a tsoga. 11Ka motsotso o le mongwe kgotsa ba babedi ba ne ba kgatlhiwa ke ditlhong, a bua ka lentswe le le kwa kgakala, e kete le fa go ntse jalo, go na le go bua ka ga me, go na le go bua ka ga me.
ty: I muri iho.—Te tahi faahou tauiraa i roto i to'u taata ma'i. I te hora pae, ua hi'o atura vau i roto ia ' na, e ua ite atura vau e mea oaoa roa o ' na e ua oaoa roa oia mai na mua ' ' e. Te haru ra oia i te ra'o e te amu ra i te reira, e te haamana'o noa ra oia i to'na haruraa na roto i te patiaraa i te naero i te hiti o te opani i ropu i te mau ofa'i amuraa maa. I to'na iteraa mai ia'u, ua haere mai oia e hi'o ia'u no ta'na ohipa ino, e ua ani mai ia'u ma te haehaa e te haehaa ia faaho'ihia vau i roto i to'na iho piha e ia farii faahou i ta'na buka nota. Ua mana'o vau e, e mea maitai no'na : no reira, ua ho'i mai oia i roto i to'na piha ma te vai matara noa te haamaramarama. Te vai ra te tihota i roto i ta'na ti i ni'a i te haamaramarama, e te ooti nei oia i te mau ra'o. Aita oia e amu ra i te reira i teie nei, ua tuu râ oia i te reira i roto i te hoê afata, mai mutaa ihora, e ua hi'opoa a'ena oia i te mau poro o to ' na piha no te imi i te hoê fee. Ua tamata vau i te tura'i ia'na ia paraparau no ni'a i te mau mahana i ma'iri, no te mea e riro te faaiteraa i to'na mau mana'o i te tauturu rahi mai ia'u ; eita râ oia e ti'a mai i ni'a. No te hoê e aore râ, e piti taime, e au e, ua oto roa oia, e ua parau maira ma te reo iti ha'iha'i, mai te mea ra e, te parau maira oia ia'na iho, eiaha râ ia'u nei:—
mai: बादमे।—हमर रोगी मे एकटा आओर परिवर्तन। पाँच बजे हम हुनका दिस देखलहुँ, आ देखलहुँ जे ओ ओतेक प्रसन्न आ संतुष्ट प्रतीत होइत छथि जेना ओ पहिने छलाह। ओ मक्खी पकड़ि रहल छलाह आ ओकरा खा रहल छलाह, आ पैडिंगक लकीरक बीच दरवाजाक किनार पर कील-निशान बना कऽ अपन पकड़ पर ध्यान राखि रहल छलाह। जखन ओ हमरा देखलनि तखन ओ आबि अपन खराब आचरणक लेल माफी माँगलनि, आ हमरा बहुत विनम्र, चिड़चिड़ाहट तरीकासँ कहलनि जे हुनका अपन कोठरीमे वापस लऽ जाय आ फेरसँ अपन नोट-बुक लेब। हम हुनका हास्य करब नीक बुझलहुँ: तेँ ओ खिड़की खोलि कऽ अपन कोठरीमे वापस आबि गेलाह। हुनका लग अपन चाहक चीनी खिड़की-सिल पर पसरल अछि, आ ओ मक्खीक खूब फसल काट रहल छथि। आब ओ ओकरा नहि खा रहल छथि, बल्कि पुरान जकाँ ओकरा एकटा डिब्बामे राखि रहल छथि, आ पहिनेसँ एकटा मकड़ी तकबाक लेल अपन कोठरीक कोन-कोनक जाँच कऽ रहल छथि। हम हुनका पिछला किछु दिनक बारे मे गप्प करय के कोशिश केलहुं, कियैकि हुनकर विचार के कोनो सुराग हमरा लेल बहुत मददगार होयत; मुदा ओ नहि उठैत छलाह। एक-दू क्षणक लेल ओ बड्ड उदास देखलनि, आ एक तरहक दूरक आवाजमे कहलनि, जेना हमरा बदला अपनासँ कहि रहल होथि:—
mg: Tatỳ aoriana.—Fiovana hafa koa ny fahasalamako. Nijery azy aho tamin'ny dimy ora, ary hitako fa toa faly sy afa-po toy ny taloha izy. Nisambotra lalitra izy ary nihinana izany, ary nanamarika ny fisamborana azy tamin'ny alalan'ny fanaovana fantsika teo amin'ny sisin'ny varavarana teo anelanelan'ny tandavan'ny padding. Rehefa nahita ahy izy dia nanatona ary niala tsiny noho ny fitondran-tena ratsy nataony, ary nangataka ahy tamin'ny fomba tena feno fanetren-tena sy feno fanetren-tena mba ho entina miverina any amin'ny efitranony sy hanana ny boky fanamarihany indray. Nihevitra aho fa tsara ny hanihany azy: ka dia niverina tao amin'ny efitranony izy niaraka tamin'ny varavarankely misokatra. Miparitaka eo amin'ny varavarankely ny siramamy avy amin'ny dite, ary mijinja ny vokatry ny lalitra. Tsy mihinana azy ireo izy ankehitriny, fa mametraka azy ireo ao anaty boaty, toy ny taloha, ary efa mandinika ny zoron'ny efitranony mba hahitana hala. Niezaka ny nasaiko niresaka momba ireo andro vitsivitsy lasa izy, satria izay mety ho famantarana ny eritreriny dia tena hanampy ahy; Saingy tsy nety nitsangana izy. en: “All over! all over! He has deserted me. No hope for me now unless I do it for myself!” Then suddenly turning to me in a resolute way, he said: “Doctor, won’t you be very good to me and let me have a little more sugar? I think it would be good for me.”
vi: — Thế là hết? Thế là hết thật rồi? Ông ta đã bỏ rơi tôi rồi! Bây giờ tôi chẳng còn gì để mà hy vọng nữa. Vậy là tôi lại phải tự mình hành động. Rồi hắn quay phắt sang nhìn tôi, giọng kiên quyết hẳn lên: — Thưa bác sĩ, ngài có muốn chứng tỏ lòng hảo tâm đối với tôi không? Xin ngài hãy bảo người ta mang tới cho tôi thêm một ít đường nữa đi. Tôi tin rằng điều đó sẽ làm cho tôi thấy dễ chịu hơn nhiều đấy.
tr: “Her şey bitti! Her şey bitti! Beni bırakıp gitti. Kendim yapmazsam artık benim için hiç umut yok!” Sonra birdenbire kararlı biçimde bana dönerek şöyle dedi: “Doktor, bana büyük bir iyilik yapıp biraz daha şeker almama izin verir misiniz? Bence bana iyi gelecek.
es: –¡Todo ha terminado! ¡Todo ha terminado! Me ha abandonado. ¡No tengo esperanza, a menos de que yo mismo lo haga! Luego, repentinamente, volviéndose a mí de manera resuelta, me dijo: –Doctor, ¿sería usted tan amable de darme un poquito más de azúcar? Creo que me haría muy bien.
es_results: "title": "Don Quijote de la Mancha", "author": "Miguel de Cervantes"
vi_translation: — So that's it? Is it really over? He has abandoned me! Now I have nothing left to hope for. So I have to act on my own again. Then he suddenly turned to look at me, his voice becoming more resolute: — Doctor, would you like to show some kindness towards me? Please have someone bring me a little more sugar. I believe that will make me feel much better.
tr_translation: “Everything is over! Everything is over! She left me. If I don't do it myself, there is no hope left for me!” Then suddenly, turning to me decisively, she said: “Doctor, would you do me a great favor and allow me to have a bit more sugar? I think it will do me good.”
es_translation: –Everything is over! Everything is over! He has abandoned me. I have no hope, unless I do it myself! Then, suddenly, turning to me resolutely, he said: –Doctor, would you be so kind as to give me a little more sugar? I think it would do me a lot of good.
st: Ho Ho Ho! Hohle! o mphuraletse. Ha ke na tšepo bakeng sa hona joale ntle le hore ke etse sena ka bonna. " Ka tšohanyetso o ile a retelehela ho 'na ka tsela e hlaphohang, o ile a re: "Ngaka, na u ke ke ua ba molemo haholo ho 'na' me u ntumelle hore ke be le tsoekere e nyenyane? Ke nahana hore ho tla ba molemo ho nna. "

mai: "सब तरफ! सभ ठाम! ओ हमरा छोड़ि देलक। आब हमरा लेल कोनो आशा नहि अछि जाबत धरि हम ई अपन लेल नहि करब!" तखन अचानक दृढ़ तरीकासँ हमरा दिस मुड़ैत ओ कहलनि: "डॉक्टर, की अहाँ हमरा लेल बहुत नीक नहि होब आ हमरा कने बेसी चीनी खाए देब? हमरा लगैत अछि जे इ हमरा लेल बढ़िया रहत।

en: “You will? Oh, will you really? How good you are to me. Then I will sleep!” And almost at the word she gave a deep sigh of relief, and sank back, asleep.
vi: — Đánh thức em? Ông nói thật đấy chứ? Ôi! Ông tốt với em quái. Nếu vậy thì em sẽ ngủ... Nói tới đây, Lucy trút một hơi thở thật dài nhẹ nhõm rồi chìm ngay vào giấc ngủ.
tr: “Gerçekten mi? Ah, gerçekten uyandıracak mısınız? O zaman uyuyacağım.” Ve neredeyse bunu söyler söylemez rahatladığını gösteren derin bir iç çekişin ardından uykuya dalıp arkasına yaslandı.
es: –¿Lo hará? ¿De verdad? ¡Qué bueno es usted conmigo! Entonces, dormiré. Y casi al mismo tiempo dejó escapar un profundo suspiro de alivio, y se hundió en la almohada, dormida.
vi_translation: — Waking me up? Are you serious? Oh! You are so kind to me. If that's the case, then I will sleep... Speaking up to this point, Lucy let out a long, relieved sigh and then immediately fell asleep.
tr_translation: "Really?" "Oh, will you really wake me up?" "Then I will sleep." And almost as soon as he said this, he leaned back and fell asleep with a deep sigh of relief.
es_translation: –Will you do it? Really? You are so good to me! Then, I will sleep. And almost at the same time, she let out a deep sigh of relief and sank into the pillow, asleep.
st: "Na u tla etsa joalo? Na u hlile u batla? U molemo hakaakang ho 'na. Ke tla robala!" 'Me ka mor'a moo, o ile a fana ka phefumoloho e tebileng ea ho imoloha, 'me a robala.
yo: O máa ṣe é? Oh, ṣé wà á ṣe lóòótọ́? Báwo lo ṣe dára sí mi. Nigbana ni emi o sùn! " Àti pé ó fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ jẹ́ pé ní ọ̀rọ̀ náà ó mí ìtura tó jinlẹ̀, ó sì rì padà, sùn.

en: All night long I watched by her. She never stirred, but slept on and on in a deep, tranquil, life-giving, health-giving sleep. Her lips were slightly parted, and her breast rose and fell with the regularity of a pendulum. There was a smile on her face, and it was evident that no bad dreams had come to disturb her peace of mind.
vi: Tôi thức trông cô suốt đêm. Cô cứ nằm như vậy với một giấc ngủ thật sâu, thật êm đềm mà không hề có một lần trở mình. Đôi môi cô hơi hé mở với một nụ cười hạnh phúc đọng lại trên gương mặt, ngực cô phập phồng cùng những nhịp thở đều đều như quả lắc đồng hồ. Rõ ràng là không có một giấc mộng khủng khiếp nào quấy rầy sự bình yên trong tinh thần cô.
tr: Bütün gece onu izledim. Hiç kıpırdamadı ve derin, huzurlu, canlandırıcı ve iyileştirici bir uyku uyuyup durdu. Dudakları hafif aralıktı ve göğsü, sarkaç düzenliliğiyle inip kalkıyordu. Yüzünde gülümseme vardı ve gönül rahatlığını bozacak tek bir kötü rüya bile görmediği belliydi.
es: Toda la noche estuve a su lado. No se movió ni una vez, sino que durmió con un sueño tranquilo, reparador. Sus labios estaban ligeramente abiertos, y su pecho se elevaba y bajaba con la regularidad de un péndulo. En su rostro se dibujaba una sonrisa, y era evidente que no habían llegado pesadillas a perturbar la paz de su mente.
vi_translation: I stayed up watching her all night. She just lay there in a deep, peaceful sleep without stirring even once. Her lips slightly parted with a happy smile lingering on her face, her chest rising and falling with steady breaths like the pendulum of a clock. Clearly, no terrible dreams disturbed the tranquility of her mind.
tr_translation: I watched him all night. He didn't move at all and kept sleeping a deep, peaceful, invigorating, and healing sleep. His lips were slightly parted and his chest rose and fell with the regularity of a pendulum. There was a smile on his face, and it was clear that he didn't have a single bad dream to disturb his peace of mind.
es_translation: All night I stayed by her side. She did not move even once, but slept with a calm, restorative sleep. Her lips were slightly parted, and her chest rose and fell with the regularity of a pendulum. A smile was drawn on her face, and it was evident that no nightmares had come to disturb the peace of her mind.
st: Ke ne ke mo shebile bosiu bohle. Ha ho mohla a kileng a tsosoa, empa a robala boroko bo tebileng, bo khutsitseng, bo fanang ka bophelo, bo fanang ka bophelo bo botle. Molomo oa hae o ne o arohane hanyane, 'me matsoele a hae a phahama' me a oela ka mokhoa o tloaelehileng oa pendulum. Ho ne ho e-na le pososelo sefahlehong sa hae, 'me ho ne ho hlakile hore ha ho litoro tse mpe tse ileng tsa tlela khotso ea hae ea kelello.
yo: Gbogbo alẹ́ ni mo fi ń wò ó. Kò rú, ṣùgbọ́n ó sùn lórí àti tẹ̀síwájú nínú oorun tó jinlẹ̀, ìrọ̀rùn, fífúnni ní ìgbésí ayé, oorun tí ó ń fúnni ní ìlera. Ètè rẹ̀ pín díẹ̀, ọmú rẹ̀ sì dìde ó sì ṣubú pẹ̀lú déédéé pendulum. Ẹ̀rín rẹ́rìn-ín wà lójú rẹ̀, ó sì hàn gbangba pé kò sí àlá burúkú kankan tí ó wá láti da àlàáfíà ọkàn rẹ̀ rú.
tn: Ke ne ke mo lebile bosigo jotlhe Ga a ise a ke a robala, a bo a le mo bolaong jo bo tseneletseng, jo bo sa khutleng. Molomo wa gagwe o ne o le monnye, mme matswela a gagwe a ne a tshikinyega mme a wa ka metlha ya sematla. O ne a nyenya mo sefatlhegong sa gagwe, mme go ne go bonala gore ga go na ditoro tse di bosula tse di neng di dira gore go nne le kagiso ya mogopolo.
ty: I te taatoaraa o te pô ua hi'o noa vau ia'na. Aita roa'tu oia i haaparuparu, ua taoto noa râ oia ma te hau, te hau, te horo'a i te ora, te taoto maitai. Ua tâpû - rii - hia to ' na utu, e ua tia maira to ' na titi e ua topa ' tura i raro e te penitara. E mata ataata tei itehia i ni'a i to'na hoho'a mata, e e mea papû maitai e, aita e moemoea ino i tae mai no te haafifi i to'na mana'o hau.
mai: पूरा राति हम हुनका देखैत रही। ओ कहियो हलचल नहि कयलनि, मुदा गहींर, शान्त, जीवनदायी, स्वास्थ्य देबयवला नीनमे सुतैत रहलीह। ओकर ओठ कने अलग भऽ गेल छल, आ हुनकर स्तन उठल आ पेंडुलमक नियमिततासँ खसि पड़ल। हुनक मुँह पर मुस्कान छल, आ ई स्पष्ट छल जे हुनक मनक शान्तिकेँ भंग करबाक लेल कोनो खराब सपना नहि आयल छल।
mg: Nijery azy nandritra ny alina manontolo aho. Tsy nihetsi-po mihitsy izy, fa natory tao anatin'ny torimaso lalina, milamina, manome aina, manome fahasalamana. Somary nizarazara kely ny molony, ary niarina ny nonony ary nianjera tamin'ny tsy tapaka ny pendulum. Nisy tsiky teo amin'ny tarehiny, ary hita mazava fa tsy nisy nofy ratsy nanakorontana ny fiadanan-tsainy.
