en: As I raised the blind, and the morning sunlight flooded the room, I heard the Professor’s low hiss of inspiration, and knowing its rarity, a deadly fear shot through my heart. As I passed over he moved back, and his exclamation of horror, “Gott in Himmel!” needed no enforcement from his agonised face. He raised his hand and pointed to the bed, and his iron face was drawn and ashen white. I felt my knees begin to tremble.
vi: Khi bức mành được kéo lên, ánh ban mai lập tức ùa vào căn phòng nhỏ. Tôi bỗng giật mình khi nghe thấy tiếng rít kinh ngạc của giáo sư, tim tôi lập tức như thắt lại. Người tôi chết lặng đi khi nghe tiếng kêu nghèn nghẹt của giáo sư lúc ông quay trở ra. Tiếng kêu hoảng sợ của ông, “lạy Trời, lạy Đất!” đủ để làm cho tôi hiểu ngay ra tình hình thực tế, dù tôi còn chưa kịp nhìn thấy sự đau đớn khổ sở hiện rõ trên gương mặt ông. Ông run run chỉ vào giường. Tôi cảm thấy hai đầu gối mình sắp đổ quỵ đến nơi.
tr: Perdeyi açmamla ve sabah güneşinin odaya dolmasıyla Profesörün iç çekişini duydum ve bunun ne kadar ender olduğunu bildiğimden yüreğime ölümcül bir korku saplandı. yanına doğru gittiğimde geri çekildi ve dehşete düştüğünün göstergesi olan “Gott in Himmel!”27 nidasının yüzündeki acı dolu ifadeyle vurgulanmasına gereksinimi yoktu. Elini kaldırıp yatağa işaret etti; sert yüzü asılmış ve kül gibi solmuştu. Dizlerimin titremeye başladığını hissettim.
es: Cuando subí la celosía y la luz de la mañana inundó el cuarto, oí el leve siseo de aspiración del profesor, y conociendo su rareza, un miedo mortal me heló la sangre. Al acercarme yo él retrocedió, y su exclamación de horror, "¡Gott in Himmel!" ,no necesitaba el refuerzo de su cara doliente. Alzó la mano y señaló en dirección a la cama, y su rostro de hierro estaba fruncido y blanco como la ceniza. Sentí que mis rodillas comenzaron a temblar.
es_results: "title": "El cuaderno de Noah Price", "author": "Daphne du Maurier"
vi_translation: When the curtain was drawn up, the morning light immediately flooded into the small room. I was suddenly startled when I heard the professor's astonished hiss, my heart instantly tightened. I was paralyzed when I heard the professor's muffled cry as he turned back. His terrified cry, "Heavens, Earth!" was enough for me to immediately understand the actual situation, even though I hadn't yet seen the evident pain and suffering on his face. He shakily pointed to the bed. I felt my knees about to give way.
tr_translation: As I opened the curtain and the morning sun filled the room, I heard the Professor's sigh, and knowing how rare it was, a deadly fear pierced my heart. When I approached him, he recoiled, and there was no need for the anguished expression on his face to emphasize his exclamation of "Gott in Himmel!"27, a sign of his horror. He raised his hand and pointed to the bed; his stern face had fallen and turned ashen. I felt my knees begin to tremble.
es_translation: When I raised the lattice and the morning light flooded the room, I heard the professor's faint hiss of intake, and knowing his peculiarity, a mortal fear froze my blood. As I approached, he stepped back, and his exclamation of horror, "Gott in Himmel!" did not need the reinforcement of his pained face. He raised his hand and pointed towards the bed, and his iron face was furrowed and white as ash. I felt my knees begin to tremble.
st: Ha ke ntse ke phahamisa lifofu, 'me letsatsi la hoseng le moroalloa kamoreng, ke ile ka utloa hiss e tlase ea ts'usumetso ea Moprofesa, mme ka tseba seoelo sa sona se sa tloaelehang, tšabo e bolaeang e thunya ka pelo ea ka. Ha ke ntse ke feta o ile a fallela morao, le exclamation ea hae ea tšabo, "Gott ho Himmel!" ha aa ka a hloka ts'ebetso sefahlehong sa hae sa agonised. O ile a phahamisa letsoho la hae 'me a supa betheng, 'me sefahleho sa hae sa tšepe se ne se huloa le ashen tšoeu. Ke ne ke nahana hore mangole a ka a qala ho thothomela.
yo: Bí mo ṣe ń gbé afọ́jú sókè, tí ìmọ́lẹ̀ oòrùn òwúrọ̀ sì kún inú yàrá náà, mo gbọ́ ìmísí kékeré ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n náà, tí mo sì mọ ohun tí kò wọ́pọ̀, ìbẹ̀rù tó ń pa ọkàn mi. Bí mo ṣe ń kọjá ó padà lọ, àti ìkìlọ̀ ìbẹ̀rù rẹ̀, "Gott in Himmel!" kò nílò ìmúṣẹ kankan láti ojú rẹ̀ tí kò dára. Ó gbé ọwọ́ rẹ̀ sókè ó sì tọ́ka sí ibùsùn náà, ojú irin rẹ̀ sì fà ó sì jẹ́ funfun. Mo ní ìmọ̀lára pé orúnkún mi bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní gbọ̀n.
tn: Fa ke ntse ke tsholetsa matlho, mme letsatsi la moso la tlhaba mo kamoreng, ke ne ka utlwa sefatlhego sa ga Morutabana se se kwa tlase sa kgatlhiso, ka itse se se bonalang se se bonalang, letshogo le le bolayang ka pelo ya me. Fa ke ntse ke tsamaya, o ne a re: "Ke ne ka se ka ka nna le sepe se se neng se sa dira gore a se ka a tlhola a re: "Ke ne ke sa batle sepe se se neng se le mo go yone." O ne a tsholetsa letsogo, a supa bolao, sefatlhego sa gagwe sa tshipi se ne se gogwa le sesweu sa ashen. Ke ne ka utlwa gore mangole a me a simolola go roroma.

en: The Professor watched me critically. “That will do,” he said. “Already?” I remonstrated. “You took a great deal more from Art.” To which he smiled a sad sort of smile as he replied:—

en: We went into the room, taking the flowers with us. The Professor’s actions were certainly odd and not to be found in any pharmacopœia that I ever heard of. First he fastened up the windows and latched them securely; next, taking a handful of the flowers, he rubbed them all over the sashes, as though to ensure that every whiff of air that might get in would be laden with the garlic smell. Then with the wisp he rubbed all over the jamb of the door, above, below, and at each side, and round the fireplace in the same way. It all seemed grotesque to me, and presently I said:—
vi: Và hai chúng tôi đã cùng nhau lúi húi cắm các đóa hoa vào trong phòng của Lucy. Tất cả những gì vị giáo sư đã làm rõ ràng là rất khác thường và hoàn toàn xa lạ với những hiểu biết hiện có. Trước hết, ông cẩn thận đóng tất cả các cánh cửa sổ lại cho thật chắc để không ai có thể mở ra. Sau đó, ông lấy mấy cành hoa quét đi quét lại trên các khung cửa sổ, dường như ông muốn bất cứ một luồng không khí nào, dù là nhỏ nhất, khi len lỏi qua các khe cửa cũng bị nhiễm một mùi như mùi tỏi của các đóa hoa. Cuối cùng, ông cũng làm như vậy đối với khung cửa ra vào. Tất nhiên là ông không quên đặt bó hoa vào hòm lò sưởi trong phòng. Tôi cứ thắc mắc hoài không hiểu ông làm như vậy là vì mục đích gì.
tr: Çiçekleri de yanımıza alıp odaya girdik. Profesörün hareketleri kesinlikle tuhaftı ve bu yaptığımız, duyduğum hiçbir ilaç kitabında bulunmayacak türdendi. Önce pencereleri kapatıp mandalları sıkılaştırdı; sonra eline bir avuç çiçek alıp sanki içeri girebilecek her esintinin sarmısak kokusuyla dolacağından emin olmak istercesine pencere kanatlarına boydan boya sürdü. Sonra, o demetle kapı pervazının tümünü, altını, üstünü, iki yüzünü de ovaladı ve şöminenin çevresine de aynısını yaptı. Tüm bunlar bana çok anlamsız geliyordu ve hemen şöyle dedim:
es: Entramos en el cuarto, llevando con nosotros las flores. Las acciones del profesor eran verdaderamente raras y no creo que se pudiera encontrar alguna farmacopea en la cual yo encontrara noticias. Primero cerró las ventanas y las aseguró con aldaba; luego, tomando un ramo de flores, frotó con ellas las guillotinas, como para asegurarse de que cada soplo de aire que pudiera pasar a través de ellas estuviera cargado con el olor a ajo. Después, con el manojo frotó los batientes de la puerta, arriba, abajo y a cada lado, y alrededor de la chimenea de la misma manera. Todo me pareció muy grotesco, y al momento le dije al profesor:
vi_translation: And the two of us busily arranged the flowers in Lucy's room. Everything the professor did was clearly very unusual and completely unfamiliar with existing knowledge. First, he carefully closed all the windows tightly so that no one could open them. Then, he took some flower branches and repeatedly brushed them over the window frames, as if he wanted any air, even the smallest draft, passing through the cracks to be infused with the garlic-like smell of the flowers. Finally, he did the same with the door frame. Of course, he did not forget to place a bouquet in the fireplace in the room. I keep wondering why he does that and what his purpose is.
tr_translation: We took the flowers with us and entered the room. The professor's actions were definitely strange, and what we were doing was not something you would find in any medical book I had ever heard of. First, he closed the windows and tightened the latches; then he took a handful of flowers and rubbed them along the window sashes as if wanting to ensure that any breeze coming in would be filled with the smell of garlic. Then, with that bunch, he rubbed the entire door frame, the bottom, the top, and both sides, and did the same around the fireplace. All of this seemed very meaningless to me, and I immediately said:
es_translation: We entered the room, carrying the flowers with us. The professor's actions were truly strange, and I don't think one could find any pharmacopoeia in which I could find news. First, he closed the windows and secured them with a latch; then, taking a bouquet of flowers, he rubbed them on the guillotines, as if to ensure that every breath of air passing through them was laden with the smell of garlic. Afterwards, with the bunch, he rubbed the door jambs, up, down, and on each side, and around the fireplace in the same manner. Everything seemed very grotesque to me, and at the moment I said to the professor:
st: Re ile ra kena ka kamoreng, re nka lipalesa le rōna. Ka sebele liketso tsa moprofesa li ne li makatsa ebile ha li fumanehe ho pharmacopyia efe kapa efe eo nkileng ka e utloa. 'Me o ile a phahamisa lifensetere' me a ba lahlela ka ho feletseng; Ka mor'a moo, o ile a nka lipalesa tse ngata, o ile a li rubbed bona hohle, joalokaha eka ke ho etsa bonnete ba hore le leng le le leng la moea o ka kena tlameme le monko oa konofolo. 'Me ka mor'a moo, o ile a tšela ka hohle jamb ea monyako, ka holimo, ka tlaase, 'me ka lehlakoreng le leng le le leng, le ho pota mollo ka tsela e tšoanang. ʻO ka hoʻohaʻoluʻana i ka hoʻolu
yo: A lọ sínú yàrá, a lọ àwọn òdòdó pẹ̀lú wa. Àwọn ìgbésẹ̀ Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n náà dájúdájú ṣàjèjì àti pé wọn kò gbọ́dọ̀ rí i ní èyíkéyìí pharmacopœia tí mo gbọ́ nípa rẹ̀ rí. Lákọ̀ọ́kọ́ ó so àwọn fèrèsé náà mọ́ra ó sì fi ààbò bò wọ́n; Lẹ́yìn náà, ó mú díẹ̀ nínú àwọn òdòdó náà, ó fọ́ wọ́n káàkiri àwọn sashes, bí ẹni pé láti rí i dájú pé gbogbo afẹ́fẹ́ tí ó lè wọlé yóò kún fún òórùn ata. Lẹhinna pẹlu wisp o rubbed gbogbo jamb ti ẹnu-ọna, loke, ni isalẹ, ati ni ẹgbẹ kọọkan, ati yika ibi idana ni ọna kanna. Gbogbo rẹ̀ dàbí ẹni tí kò dára sí mi, àti pé lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ mo sọ pé: -
tn: Re ne ra tsena mo kamoreng, ra ya le rona. Go ne go se na sepe se se neng sa dira gore morutabana a se ka a bonwa e le se neng se le mo go yone. O ne a di gapa ka fa ditereneng mme a di gakatsa ka pabalesego. O ne a tsaya dipilisi di le mmalwa tse di neng di le mo godimo ga mesa, jaaka e kete o ka dira gore go nne le moya o o montsi o o ka nnang mo go one. 10A ba a tlola mojako otlhe, fa godimo, kwa godimo, kwa tlase le kwa ntlheng nngwe le nngwe, a dikologa molelo ka mokgwa o le mongwe fela. E ne e lebega e kete ke ne ke le mo go yone, mme jaanong ke ne ka re, ke ne ke re:
ty: Ua tomo matou i roto i te piha, ma te afa'i i te mau tiare na muri iho ia matou. E mea huru ê roa te mau ohipa a te orometua haapii e eita e itehia i roto i te tahi noa ' ' e pharmacophia o ta ' u i faaroo a'enei. A tahi, ua tamau oia i te mau haamaramarama e ua apo maitai i te reira; i muri iho, ma te rave i te tahi maa tiare, e tairi oia i te reira na nia i te mau sashes atoa, mai te huru ra e no te haapapu e e î roa te mau mata'i atoa o te nehenehe e î i te hâu'a oniani. I muri iho, ma te tapo'i i te tapo'i o te opani, i nia, i raro, e i te pae tataitahi, e e haaati oia i te vahi tahuraa auahi mai te reira atoa te huru. Mai te mea ra e, e mea huru ê roa te reira ia'u, e i teie taime, ua parau vau e :—
mai: हम सभ फूल के अपना संग लए कए कमरा मे चलि गेलहुं। प्रोफेसरक काज निश्चित रूपसँ अजीब छल आ कोनो फार्माकोपियामे नहि भेटल जकर बारे मे हम कहियो सुनने छलहुँ। पहिने ओ खिड़की के जकड़ि लेलक आ सुरक्षित रूप सं बंद कए देलक। आगू, मुट्ठी भरि फूल लऽ कऽ ओ ओकरा सभटा सैश पर रगड़लनि, जेना ई सुनिश्चित करबाक लेल जे हवाक प्रत्येक झटका लहसुनक गंधसँ लदल होयत। तखन विस्पसँ ओ दरवाजाक पूरा जाम्ब पर, ऊपर, नीचाँ, आ दुनू कात, आ चिमनीकेँ ओहिना रगड़लनि। ई सब हमरा विचित्र लगैत छल, आ वर्तमानमे हम कहलहुं:-
mg: Niditra tao amin'ny efitrano izahay, nitondra ireo voninkazo niaraka taminay. Ny zavatra nataon'ny Profesora dia tena hafahafa ary tsy hita tao amin'ny fivarotam-panafody izay henoko hatramin'izay. Voalohany dia nofatorany ny varavarankely ary nofatorany tsara; Avy eo, naka voninkazo vitsivitsy izy, dia nosafosafoiny teo ambonin'ny lavenona, toy ny hoe mba hahazoana antoka fa ho feno fofona tongolo gasy ny rivotra rehetra izay mety hiditra. Ary ny tavin-drano lehibe dia nosafosafoiny tamin'ny sakan'ny varavarana, dia teo ambonin'ny sakan'ny varavarana, na teo ambany, na tamin'ny lafiny iray, na tamin'ny lafiny iray, na tamin'ny lafiny iray, ary nanodidina ny fitoeran'afo tamin'ny fomba mitovy. es: "-¡Oh, sí!, yo creo que les gustaría -respondí yo, imitándolo-. Siempre les gusta uno o dos huesos para limpiarse los dientes después de la hora del té. Y usted tiene una bolsa llena de ellos.
vi_translation: Yes, they are, they're relishing the smell of your meat. At this hour, they really want to gnaw on a few skinny bones to ease their itchy teeth, and when they see you...
tr_translation: ‘Ah, yes, they like it,’ I said, imitating him. ‘They love a bone or two to clean their teeth at tea time; it seems like you have a sackful of them.’
es_translation: I think they would like it," I replied, imitating him. They always like one or two bones to clean their teeth after tea time. And you have a bag full of them.

yo: "Bẹ́ẹ̀ ni, wọ́n máa ṣe é," ni èmi, aláfarawé rẹ̀ sọ. ' Wọ́n máa ń fẹ́ràn egungun tàbí méjì láti nu eyín wọn nípa àkókò tíì, èyí tí o 'gẹ́gẹ́ bí àpò.'
tn: "Ee," a rialo, a re: "Ee, ke ne ke tla mo etsisa." Ba rata diboko tsa gago kgotsa di le pedi go tlhapa meno a tsone ka nako ya tee, e leng gore o 'tle o nne le bojajadi.'

en: “Right y’are, sir,” he said briskly. “Ye’ll excoose me, I know, for a-chaffin’ of ye, but the old woman here winked at me, which was as much as telling me to go on.”
vi: — Tuyệt! Ông bạn ạ, hy vọng là ông sẽ không cố chấp, nhưng lúc nãy, bà già này đã nháy mắt ra hiệu cho tôi khiến tôi phải...
tr: Çabucak, “Haklısın,” dedi. “Sana takıldığım için kusuruma bakma ama bu yaşlı kadın, şakayı sürdürmemi istercesine bana göz kırptı.
es: –Tiene usted razón, señor -dijo él rápidamente-. Me tendrá que disculpar, lo sé, por haberle hecho una broma, pero la vieja aquí me guiñó, que era tanto como decirme que siguiera adelante.
es_results: "title": "Don Quijote de la Mancha", "author": "Miguel de Cervantes"
vi_translation: — Great! My friend, I hope you won't be stubborn, but just now, this old lady winked at me, signaling me to... — Me? Don't speak so recklessly! -
tr_translation: Quickly, "You're right," he said. "Forgive me for teasing you, but this old woman winked at me as if she wanted me to continue the joke."
es_translation: –You are right, sir -he said quickly-. You will have to excuse me, I know, for having played a joke on you, but the old woman here winked at me, which was as much as telling me to go ahead.
st: "Ho lokile, monghadi," a rialo ka bohale. "U tla excoose 'na, Kea tseba, bakeng sa a-chaffin' ea hao, empa mosali moholo mona o ile a winked ho 'na, e leng e neng e le ho mpolella hore ke tsoele pele."
yo: "Bẹ́ẹ̀ ni, sà," ó sọ ní kíákíá. "Bẹ́ẹ̀ ni yóò mú inú mi dùn, mo mọ̀, fún a-chaffin' ti rẹ, ṣùgbọ́n obìnrin àgbàlagbà níbí fọwọ́ kàn mí, èyí tí ó jẹ́ ohun tí ó sọ fún mi pé kí n tẹ̀síwájú."

en: “I can do this, all that can be at the present. You go wake those maids. Flick them in the face with a wet towel, and flick them hard. Make them get heat and fire and a warm bath. This poor soul is nearly as cold as that beside her. She will need be heated before we can do anything more.”
vi: — Tạm thế đã. Bây giờ chẳng còn gì khác để làm cả. Anh xuống đánh thức mấy cô kia dậy đi. Cứ lấy khăn ướt mà vỗ vào mặt họ, đừng sợ như thế là tàn nhẫn! Tôi cần họ tỉnh để đốt lửa đun nước nóng. Cô bé này gần như đang chết cóng đây này, người cô ta chẳng khác gì một cục nước đá. Cô ta cần phải được sưởi ấm trước cái đã, sau đó có làm gì thì làm.
vi_results: "title": "Book name: Tôi Là Bác Sư", "author": "Nguyễn Nhật Ánh"
tr: “Bunu yapabiliyorum, şu an için yapabileceğimiz tek şey bu. Sen gidip şu hizmetçileri uyandır. Yüzlerine ıslak bir havluyla vur; sıkı vur. Ateş yakmalarını ve sıcak banyo hazırlamalarını sağla. Bu zavallıcık, neredeyse yanındaki kadıncağız kadar soğuk. Başka bir şey yapabilmemiz için önce ısıtılması gerekiyor.
tr_results: "title": "Book name: The Little Parisian", "author": "Author name: Colette"
es: –Puedo hacer esto; es todo lo que puede ser hecho de momento. Usted vaya y despierte a esas sirvientas. Golpéelas suavemente en la cara con una toalla húmeda, y golpéelas fuerte. Hágalas que reúnan calor y fuego y calienten agua. Esta pobre alma está casi fría como la otra. Necesitará que la calentemos antes de que podamos hacer algo más.
vi_translation: — That's enough for now. There's nothing else to do at the moment. Go downstairs and wake those girls up. Just use a wet towel to slap their faces, don't worry about being cruel! I need them awake to light a fire and boil some hot water. This girl is almost freezing to death, her body is like a block of ice. She needs to be warmed up first, then we can do anything else.
tr_translation: “I can do this, for now, this is the only thing we can do. You go and wake up those servants. Hit their faces with a wet towel; hit hard. Make sure they light a fire and prepare a hot bath. This poor thing is almost as cold as the woman beside her. She needs to be warmed up first before we can do anything else.”
es_translation: –I can do this; it is all that can be done for now. You go and wake up those maids. Gently slap their faces with a damp towel, and slap them hard. Make them gather heat and fire and warm up some water. This poor soul is almost as cold as the other one. We will need to warm her up before we can do anything else.
st: "Nka etsa sena, sohle se ka etsahala ho tloha joale. Tsohang, lona banna bana ba lona. Li kenye sefahlehong ka thaole e metsi, 'me u li lle ka thata. Etsa hore ba fumane mocheso le mollo le bath e futhumetseng. Moea ona o futsanehileng o batla o bata joalo ka ha o le haufi le eena. O tla tlameha ho futhumala pele o ka etsa ho hong ho eketsehileng. "
yo: "Mo lè ṣe èyí, gbogbo ohun tí ó lè wà lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ báyìí. O lọ jí àwọn ìránṣẹ́bìnrin yẹn. Fọ́ wọn sí ojú pẹ̀lú aṣọ ìnura tútù, kí o sì flick them hard. en: I never saw in all my experience the Professor work in such deadly earnest. I knew—as he knew—that it was a stand-up fight with death, and in a pause told him so. He answered me in a way that I did not understand, but with the sternest look that his face could wear:—
vi: Từ khi làm việc với Van Helsing, chưa bao giờ tôi thấy ông chiến đấu chống lại tử thần theo kiểu này. Bởi cả hai chúng tôi đều biết rằng đây là cách duy nhất, là cuộc chiến tận cùng chống lại một cái chết. Khi tôi nói nhỏ điều đó, ông đã đứng ngây người ra trong giây lát. Tôi không hiểu câu trả lời của ông, song cứ nhìn nét mặt nghiêm trọng của ông là tôi khắc biết.
tr: Profesörü hayatımda hiç böyle ölümüne çalışırken görmemiştim. Onun gibi, ben de ölüme karşı savaş verdiğimizi biliyordum ve ara verdiğimizde bunu ona söyledim. Anlamadığım bir biçimde ve yüzünün takınabileceği en ciddi ifadeyle karşılık verdi:
es: En toda mi experiencia nunca vi trabajar a mi maestro con una seriedad tan solemne. Yo sabía, como lo sabía él, que se trataba de una lucha desesperada contra la muerte, y en una pausa se lo dije. Me respondió de una manera que no pude comprender, pero con la mirada más seria que podía reflejar su rostro:
es_results: "title": "Don Quijote de la Mancha", "author": "Miguel de Cervantes"
vi_translation: Since working with Van Helsing, I have never seen him fight against death in this manner. Because both of us knew that this was the only way, the ultimate battle against a death. When I whispered that, he stood still for a moment. I did not understand his response, but just by looking at his serious expression, I knew.
tr_translation: I had never seen the professor working so tirelessly in my life. Like him, I knew we were fighting against death, and I told him this when we took a break. He responded in a way I didn't understand, with the most serious expression his face could take on:
es_translation: In all my experience, I had never seen my teacher work with such solemn seriousness. I knew, as he did, that it was a desperate struggle against death, and in a pause, I told him so. He responded in a way I couldn't understand, but with the most serious look his face could reflect:
st: Ha ke e-s'o bone ntho e 'ngoe le e' ngoe eo ke e entseng ka thata tjena. Ke ne ke tseba hore o ne a tseba hore o ne a e-na le ntoa e matla le lefu, 'me ka mor'a moo o ile a mo bolella. O ile a nkaraba ka tsela eo ke neng ke sa e utloisise, empa ka ponahalo e matla ka ho fetisisa ea hore sefahleho sa hae se ka apara:
yo: Mi ò rí i nínú gbogbo ìrírí mi Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n náà ń ṣiṣẹ́ pẹ̀lú irú ìtara burúkú bẹ́ẹ̀ rí. Mo mọ̀ - gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ṣe mọ̀ - pé ìjà ìdúró pẹ̀lú ikú ni, nínú ìdádúró sọ bẹ́ẹ̀ fún un. Ó dá mi lóhùn ní ọ̀nà tí kò yé mi, ṣùgbọ́n pẹ̀lú ìrísí tó le jù tí ojú rẹ̀ lè wọ̀:-
tn: Le fa go ntse jalo, ga ke ise ke tsamaye ke bone botlhe ba ba neng ba dira tiro ya me ya sekolo e e neng e le botlhokwa thata jaana. Ke ne ke itse gore o ne a itse gore go ne go na le kgang e e neng e le teng ka ntlha ya loso, mme a bua jalo. O ne a araba ka tsela e ke neng ke sa e tlhaloganye, mme ka go lebega sefatlhego sa gagwe se ne se ka kgona go apara ka tsela e e utlwalang sentle.
ty: Aitâ vau i ite a'e nei i roto i te taatoaraa o to'u oraraa i te ohipa no te faaoraraa. Ua ite au—mai ta'na i ite—e aroraa ri'ari'a mau te reira e te pohe, e i roto i te hoê taime faafaaearaa, ua faaite mai oia i te reira ia'na. Ua pahono mai oia ia'u na roto i te hoê rave'a aita vau i maramarama, tera râ, mai te huru ra e, aita to'na hoho'a mata e ite ra:—
mai: हम अपन सम्पूर्ण अनुभवमे कहियो प्रोफेसर के एतेक घातक ईमानदारी सँ काज करैत नहि देखलहुं। हम जनैत छलहुँ- जेना ओ जनैत छलाह - जे ई मृत्युक सङ्ग एकटा स्टैंड-अप लड़ाई छल, आ एकटा विराममे हुनका एहन कहलनि। ओ हमरा एहन उत्तर देलनि जे हम नहि बुझलहुँ, मुदा सबसँ कठोर नजरसँ जे हुनक चेहरा पहिर सकैत छल:—
mg: Tsy mbola nahita mihitsy aho tamin'ny zavatra niainako fa miasa mafy toy izany ny Mpampianatra. en: “What are we to do now? Where are we to turn for help? We must have another transfusion of blood, and that soon, or that poor girl’s life won’t be worth an hour’s purchase. You are exhausted already; I am exhausted too. I fear to trust those women, even if they would have courage to submit. What are we to do for some one who will open his veins for her?”
vi: — Thế đấy! Chúng ta biết phải làm gì bây giờ? - Ông trầm ngâm. - Ai sẽ là người giúp chúng ta? Dù thế nào thì chúng ta cũng phải thực hiện một ca truyền máu nữa. Ừ, một ca nữa, càng nhanh càng tốt, nếu không cô bé tội nghiệp kia sẽ không thể sống thêm một giờ. Anh bạn trẻ ạ, cũng như tôi thôi, trông anh đã suy kiệt lắm rồi. Tôi thì tôi không muốn bắt những người giúp việc kia phải hiến máu cho dù họ có đủ can đảm làm điều đó. Biết tìm đâu ra một người hiến máu bây giờ?
tr: “Şimdi ne yapmalıyız? Yardım için nereye bakmalıyız? Bir kan nakli daha yapmalıyız ve yakında olmalı yoksa o zavallı kızın ömrü bir saat bile sürmeyecek. Sen çoktan tükendin; ben de tükendim. Kabul edecek cesaretleri olsa bile o kadınlara güvenmeye korkuyorum. Onun için damarlarını açacak birini bulmak için ne yapmalıyız?
es: –¿Qué vamos a hacer ahora? ¿A quién podemos recurrir? Debemos hacer otra transfusión de sangre, y eso con prontitud, o la vida de esa pobre muchacha no va a durar una hora. Usted ya está agotado; yo estoy agotado también. Yo temo confiar en esas mujeres, aun cuando tuviesen el valor de someterse. ¿Qué debemos hacer por alguien que desee abrir sus venas por ella?
vi_translation: — That's it! What should we do now? - He pondered. - Who will help us? Anyway, we have to perform another blood transfusion. Yes, another one, as soon as possible, otherwise that poor girl won't survive another hour. Young man, like me, you look exhausted. As for me, I don't want to force those helpers to donate blood even if they have the courage to do so. Where can we find a blood donor now?
tr_translation: “What should we do now? Where should we look for help? We need to perform another blood transfusion, and it must be soon, or that poor girl won't last an hour. You are already exhausted; I am exhausted too. Even if they had the courage to accept, I am afraid to trust those women. What should we do to find someone to open their veins for her?”
es_translation: –What are we going to do now? Who can we turn to? We must perform another blood transfusion, and that promptly, or the life of that poor girl will not last an hour. You are already exhausted; I am exhausted too. I fear trusting those women, even if they had the courage to submit. What should we do for someone who wishes to open their veins for her?
st: "Re lokela ho etsa'ng hona joale? Re ka fumana thuso hokae? Re lokela ho ba le tšelo e 'ngoe ea mali, 'me haufinyane, kapa hore bophelo ba ngoanana ea futsanehileng bo ke ke ba bohlokoa theko ea hora. u khathetse; Le nna ke khathetse. Ke tšaba ho tšepa basali bana, esita le haeba ba ka ba le sebete sa ho ikokobelletsa. Re lokela ho etsa'ng e le hore ba bang ba ka 'na ba mo fa bolokolohi ba ho mo?"
yo: "Kí ni a máa ṣe báyìí? Níbo ni a ní láti yípadà fún ìrànlọ́wọ́? A gbọ́dọ̀ gba ẹ̀jẹ̀ mìíràn, àti pé láìpẹ́, tàbí pé ẹ̀mí ọmọbìnrin tálákà yẹn kò ní tó wákàtí kan. O ti rẹ̀ ẹ́ tẹ́lẹ̀; Ó ti rẹ̀ mí pẹ̀lú. Mo bẹ̀rù láti gbẹ́kẹ̀lé àwọn obìnrin yẹn, kódà bí wọ́n bá ní ìgboyà láti tẹríba. Kí ni àwa yóò ṣe fún àwọn kan tí yóò ṣí iṣan rẹ̀ fún un?"
tn: Re tshwanetse go dira eng gone jaanong? Re ka bona kae thuso? Re tshwanetse go tshela madi a mangwe, mme ka bonako fela, kgotsa botshelo jwa mosetsana ga bo kitla bo nna tlhwatlhwa ya ura. o setse o lapile; ya m tired too Ke tshaba go tshepha basadi ba, tota le fa ba ka nna le bopelokgale jwa go dira jalo. en: “She is dying. It will not be long now. It will be much difference, mark me, whether she dies conscious or in her sleep. Wake that poor boy, and let him come and see the last; he trusts us, and we have promised him.”
vi: — Cô bé đang chết, mọi chuyện chắc cũng sẽ sớm kết thúc thôi. Nhưng anh hãy nghe tôi nói đây, dù cô ta có chết trong lúc ngủ hay không thì cũng thế thôi. Anh xuống đánh thức Arthur dậy cho anh ta được nhìn thấy người yêu mình lần cuối cùng. Anh ta đang đợi chúng ta gọi dậy vì tôi hứa thế mà.
tr: “Ölüyor. Artık uzun sürmeyecek. Dikkat et; bilinci yerindeyken ya da uykusunda ölmesi pek çok şeyi değiştirecek. O zavallı çocuğu uyandır, gelip onu son kez görsün; bize güveniyor ve ona söz verdik.
es: –Se está muriendo. Ya no le quedará mucho tiempo. Habrá mucha diferencia, créamelo, si muere consciente o si muere mientras duerme. Despierte al pobre muchacho y déjelo que venga y vea lo último; él confía en nosotros, y se lo habíamos prometido.
vi_translation: — The girl is dying, everything will probably end soon. But listen to me, whether she dies in her sleep or not, it makes no difference. Go wake Arthur up so he can see his beloved one last time. He is waiting for us to wake him because I promised him that.
tr_translation: “He is dying. It won't take long now. Be careful; whether he dies while conscious or in his sleep will change many things. Wake that poor child up, let him come and see him one last time; he trusts us and we promised him.”
es_translation: –He is dying. He won't have much time left. There will be a big difference, believe me, if he dies conscious or if he dies while sleeping. Wake up the poor boy and let him come and see the end; he trusts us, and we had promised him.
st: "O ile a shoa. E ke ke ea nka nako e telele hona joale. E tla ba phapang e kholo, e ntšoa hore na o shoa a tseba kapa a robetse. Tsoha moshanyana eo ea futsanehileng, 'me a ke a tle a bone ea ho qetela; 'Me re mo tšepe, 'me re mo tšepisitse. "
yo: "Ó ń kú. Kò ní pẹ́ báyìí. Yóò jẹ́ ìyàtọ̀ púpọ̀, fi àmì sí mi, yálà ó kú ní ìmọ̀lára tàbí nínú oorun rẹ̀. Jí ọmọkùnrin tálákà yẹn, kí o sì jẹ́ kí ó wá wo ìkẹyìn; O gbẹkẹle wa, ati pe a ti ṣe ileri fun u. "
tn: "She's Gone Swang" Gone jaanong ga e kitla e nna telele. Go tla nna le pharologanyo e kgolo, e ka tswa e le gore a o a swa o a tshwenyega kgotsa o robetse. Tsogang ngwana yo o humanegileng, a a tle a bone tsa bofelo. Re solofetse mo go ene, mme re mo solofetsa gore o tla re naya tsholofetso.
ty: " Te pohe nei oia. Eita e maoro roa i teie nei. E taa-ê-raa rahi to te reira, a tapa'o mai ia'u, noa'tu e, ua pohe oia ma te ite ore e aore râ, i roto i to'na taoto. A hi'o na i taua tamaiti iti ra, a tuu atu ia'na ia haere mai e hi'o i te hopea ; ua ti'aturi oia ia matou, e ua fafau matou ia'na ".

en: And then insensibly there came the strange change which I had noticed in the night. Her breathing grew stertorous, the mouth opened, and the pale gums, drawn back, made the teeth look longer and sharper than ever. In a sort of sleep-waking, vague, unconscious way she opened her eyes, which were now dull and hard at once, and said in a soft, voluptuous voice, such as I had never heard from her lips:—
vi: Sự thay đổi bất bình thường mà tôi thấy ở cô trong những giờ trước đó lại bắt đầu xuất hiện: nhịp thở khó nhọc với những hơi thở bị ngắt đoạn, mồm miệng há hốc ra để trơ hai hàng lợi trắng nhợt cùng hai hàm răng dài và nhọn. Cô mở mắt ra trong một trạng thái gần như vô thức, trong ánh mắt ấy là một nỗi buồn vô tận lẫn với sự đau đớn vô vọng, chỉ có giọng nói là vẫn vậy, dịu dàng và chan chứa yêu thương:
vi_results: "title": "Trái tim của một cô gái", "author": "Nguyễn Nhật Ánh"
tr: Ve sonra belli belirsiz biçimde, gece farkına vardığım tuhaf değişim meydana geldi. Nefes alış verişi hırıltılı bir hal almaya başladı, ağzı açıldı ve geri çekilmiş solgun dişetleri dişlerini hiç olmadığı kadar uzun ve keskin gösterdi. Uykudan uyanırcasına, belli belirsiz, bilinçsiz biçimde birdenbire donuklaşan ve katılaşan gözlerini açtı ve daha önce dudaklarından çıktığını hiç duymadığım yumuşak, şehvetli bir sesle şöyle dedi:
es: Luego, insensiblemente, llegó el extraño cambio que yo había notado durante la noche. Su respiración se volvió estertórea, abrió la boca, y las pálidas encías estiradas hacia atrás hicieron que los dientes parecieran más largos y agudos que nunca. Abrió los ojos de una manera vaga, sonámbula, como inconsciente, reflejando ahora al mismo tiempo vaguedad y dureza, y dijo en una voz suave y voluptuosa, tal como yo nunca la había escuchado en sus labios:
vi_translation: The abnormal change that I had noticed in her during the previous hours began to reappear: labored breathing with interrupted breaths, mouth agape revealing two rows of pale gums along with long and sharp teeth. She opened her eyes in a near-unconscious state, within those eyes was an endless sorrow mixed with hopeless pain, only her voice remained the same, gentle and filled with love:
tr_translation: And then, in a vague manner, the strange change I noticed at night occurred. His breathing began to take on a wheezing quality, his mouth opened, and his receded pale gums made his teeth appear longer and sharper than ever. As if waking from sleep, vaguely, unconsciously, he opened his eyes that suddenly became dull and rigid, and in a soft, sensual voice I had never heard from his lips before, he said:
es_translation: Then, imperceptibly, came the strange change that I had noticed during the night. His breathing became stertorous, he opened his mouth, and the pale gums stretched back made the teeth appear longer and sharper than ever. He opened his eyes in a vague, somnambulistic manner, as if unconscious, now reflecting both vagueness and hardness, and spoke in a soft and voluptuous voice, such as I had never heard from his lips before:
st: 'Me ka sebele, ho na le phetoho e makatsang eo ke neng ke e hlokometse bosiu. Phefumoloho ea hae e ile ea eketseha, molomo oa buleha, 'me marenene a pale, a huleloa morao, a etsa hore meno a shebahale a le telele le a bohale ho feta leha e le neng pele. Ka mokhoa oa ho robala, o sa hlaka, o sa tsebe letho ka tsela eo a ileng a bula mahlo a hae, a neng a lerootho ebile a lerootho ka nako e le 'ngoe, mme a re ka lentsoe le bonolo, le lerata, joalo ka ha ke ne ke sa utloe molomong oa hae.
yo: Lẹ́yìn náà láì ṣe é ṣe ìyípadà àjèjì tí mo ti ṣàkíyèsí ní alẹ́ wá. Èémí rẹ̀ túbọ̀ ń burú sí i, ẹnu ṣí sílẹ̀, àti pé àwọn gọ́ọ̀mù tí ó pọ́n, tí wọ́n yà sẹ́yìn, jẹ́ kí eyín náà gùn ó sì mú ju ti tẹ́lẹ̀ lọ. Ní irúfẹ́ jí oorun, ọ̀nà tí kò mọ̀, tí kò mọ̀, èyí tí kò mọ̀ nípa rẹ̀, èyí tí kò dára báyìí tí ó sì le lẹ́ẹ̀kan náà, ó sì sọ pẹ̀lú ohùn tó rọ̀, tí ó tóbi, gẹ́gẹ́ bí mi ò ṣe gbọ́ láti ètè rẹ̀ rí:-
tn: 13Jaanong he, go ne ga tla phetogo e e sa tlwaelegang e ke e bonyeng mo bosigong. Molomo wa yone o ne wa simolola go fala, mme meno a yone a ne a ôtlhaga, a dira gore meno a bone a nne lobaka lo loleele a bo a le bogale go feta le fa e le leng pele. Fa a ne a le mo borokong, a sa utlwe sentle, a bo a le maswe, a bo a le thata, a bo a bua ka lentswe le le boleta, le le sa leng le le thata, le le jaaka ke ne ke ise ke ke ka ke ka utlwa go tswa mo molomong wa gagwe.

en: “But why do it at all? The girl is dead. Why mutilate her poor body without need? And if there is no necessity for a post-mortem and nothing to gain by it—no good to her, to us, to science, to human knowledge—why do it? Without such it is monstrous.”
vi: — Nhưng xin hỏi thật, chúng ta phẫu thuật để làm gì chứ? Cô bé tội nghiệp đã chết rồi, tại sao lại phải mổ xác một cách vô cớ như vậy? Có phẫu thuật cũng chỉ là vô ích nếu như nó chẳng mang lại một điều gì thiết thực cho người đã khuất, cho chúng ta, cho khoa học hay thậm chí là cho tri thức của loài người. Vậy thì mổ xẻ để giải quyết vấn đề gì kia chứ? Làm thế thì nhẫn tâm quá!
tr: Ama tüm bunları neden yapıyoruz? Kız öldü. Neden gereksiz yere zavallı bedenini kesip biçelim? Ve eğer otopsi yapmaya gerek yoksa ve bundan elde edilecek bir şey yoksa -ne ona ne bize ne bilime ne insan bilgisine yararı yoksa- niye yapıyoruz? Bir gereği yoksa, bu canavarca!
es: –Pero, ¿por qué debemos hacer eso? La muchacha está muerta. ¿Por qué mutilar innecesariamente su pobre cuerpo? Y si no hay necesidad de una autopsia y nada se puede ganar con ella (no se beneficia a Lucy, no nos beneficiamos nosotros, ni la ciencia, ni el conocimiento humano), ¿por qué debemos hacerlo? Tal cosa es monstruosa.
vi_translation: — But let me ask honestly, why are we performing surgery? The poor girl is already dead, so why do we need to dissect the body without any reason? Performing surgery is pointless if it doesn't bring any practical benefit to the deceased, to us, to science, or even to human knowledge. So what problem are we solving by dissecting? Doing so is too cruel!
tr_translation: But why are we doing all this? The girl is dead. Why should we unnecessarily cut and dissect her poor body? And if there is no need for an autopsy and nothing to gain from it - no benefit to her, to us, to science, or to human knowledge - why are we doing it? If there is no necessity, this is monstrous!”
es_translation: –But, why should we do that? The girl is dead. Why unnecessarily mutilate her poor body? And if there is no need for an autopsy and nothing can be gained from it (it does not benefit Lucy, it does not benefit us, nor science, nor human knowledge), why should we do it? Such a thing is monstrous.
st: 'Me ke hobane'ng ha u etsa joalo ho hang? Ngoanana enoa o shoele. Ke hobane'ng ha u lokela ho etsa hore 'mele oa hae o se ke oa hlokahala? en: We have just received intelligence that another child, missed last night, was only discovered late in the morning under a furze bush at the Shooter’s Hill side of Hampstead Heath, which is, perhaps, less frequented than the other parts. It has the same tiny wound in the throat as has been noticed in other cases. It was terribly weak, and looked quite emaciated. It too, when partially restored, had the common story to tell of being lured away by the “bloofer lady.”
vi: Chúng tôi vừa nhận được tin là lại thêm một đứa trẻ nữa bị mất tích vào xẩm tối ngày hôm qua và chỉ vừa được tìm thấy trong một bụi cây kim tước trên đồi Thợ Săn một khu vực thuộc trảng Hampstead, ít người lui tới hơn các khu vực khác vào sáng hôm nay. Với một vết cắn nhỏ trên cổ giống y như các nạn nhân nhỏ tuổi trước đó, cậu bé được tìm thấy trong một tình trạng yếu ớt và nhợt nhạt. Sau khi được đưa về nhà và bình tĩnh trở lại, cậu bé đã khai rằng cậu cũng bị “người đàn bà vấy máu” lôi kéo.
vi_results: "title": "Cuộc Thiếu Niên Bất Ngờ", "author": "Ngô Tất Tố"
tr: Az önce aldığımız habere göre, dün gece kaybolan bir başka çocuk ancak ertesi sabah öğlene doğru, Hamstead Heath’in öteki kısımlarına kıyasla daha az kullanılan Shooter’s Hill39 tarafındaki bir karaçalının dibinde bulunabildi. Onun boğazında da öteki vakalarda da fark edilen küçük yaradan var. Son derece güçsüzdü ve bir deri bir kemik görünüyordu. O da, kısmen kendine geldiğinde, “güzel hanım” tarafından aklının çelindiğine ilişkin o ortak öyküyü anlattı.
es: Acabamos de recibir noticias de que otro niño perdido anoche, sólo pudo ser encontrado tarde esta mañana bajo un arbusto de retama en el lado de Shooter's Hill del Brezal de Hampstead, que es, tal vez, menos frecuentado que las otras partes. Tenía las mismas diminutas heridas en la garganta que han sido notadas en otros casos. Estaba terriblemente débil y parecía bastante extenuado. También él, cuando se hubo recuperado parcialmente, tuvo la misma historia de haber sido engañado a irse por la "dama fanfarrona".
vi_translation: We have just received news that yet another child went missing at dusk yesterday and was only found this morning in a gorse bush on Hunter's Hill, an area of Hampstead Heath that is less frequented than other areas. With a small bite mark on the neck identical to those of previous young victims, the boy was found in a weak and pale condition. After being brought home and calming down, the boy stated that he was also lured by the “blood-stained woman.”
tr_translation: According to the news we just received, another child who went missing last night was only found the next morning around noon, at the base of a blackthorn bush on the Shooter’s Hill side, which is less frequented compared to other parts of Hamstead Heath. He also has the small wound on his neck that was noticed in the other cases. He was extremely weak and looked skin and bones. When he partially regained consciousness, he also told that common story about being lured by the “beautiful lady.”
es_translation: We have just received news that another child lost last night could only be found late this morning under a broom shrub on the Shooter's Hill side of Hampstead Heath, which is perhaps less frequented than other parts. He had the same tiny wounds on his throat that have been noted in other cases. He was terribly weak and seemed quite exhausted. He too, when he had partially recovered, had the same story of being lured away by the "boisterous lady".
st: Re sa tsoa amohela bohlale boo ngoana e mong, a hlolohetsoe bosiung bo fetileng, bo fumanoe feela hoseng tlasa sehlahla se furze ka lehlakoreng la Thaba ea Shooter ea Hampstead Heath, e leng, mohlomong, e fokolang haholo ho feta likarolo tse ling. E na le leqeba le tšoanang le lenyenyane molaleng joalo ka ha ho se ho lemohuoa maemong a mang. E ne e le nyane haholo mme e shebahala e le ntle. Hape, ha e khutlisoa ka mokhoa o sa fellang, e ne e na le pale e tloaelehileng ho joetsa hore na "mofumahali oa bloofer."
yo: A ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ gba ìròyìn pé ọmọ mìíràn, tí ó pàdánù ní alẹ́ àná, ni wọ́n ṣàwárí ní òwúrọ̀ lábẹ́ igbó tí ó ní irun ní ẹ̀gbẹ́ Shooter's Hill ti Hampstead Heath, èyí tí ó jẹ́, bóyá, kò wọ́pọ̀ ju àwọn apá mìíràn lọ. Ó ní ọgbẹ́ kékeré kan náà ní ọ̀fun gẹ́gẹ́ bí wọ́n ti ṣàkíyèsí rẹ̀ ní àwọn ìgbà mìíràn. Ó jẹ́ aláìlera gidi gan-an, ó sì jọ pé ó ti rẹ̀. Ó tún, nígbà tí wọ́n dá a padà ní apá kan, ní ìtàn tí ó wọ́pọ̀ láti sọ nípa ìdẹ́rùbà láti ọwọ́ "obìnrin bloofer."
tn: Re sa tswa go amogela botlhale jwa gore ngwana yo mongwe, o ne a latlhegelwa ke letsatsi le le fetileng, o ne a sibolotswe go le thari mo mosong ka fa tlase ga setlhare se se botlana sa Thunthi kwa Letlhakeng sa Thaba ya Kwa Hampstead Heath, e leng, gongwe, ga se gantsi go feta dikarolo tse dingwe. E na le leqeba le lennye jaaka le setse le lemogile mo mabakeng a mangwe. O ne a le bokoa thata mme a lebega a le bokoa. Le fa go ntse jalo, fa go ne go na le kgang e e tlwaelegileng, e ne e le go bolelela gore ke eng se se neng sa diragalela batho ba ba neng ba le mo go yone.

mai: हमरासभकेँ एखने खुफिया जानकारी भेटल अछि जे काल्हि राति छूटि गेल एकटा आओर बच्चाकेँ देर भोरमे हैम्पस्टेड हीथक शूटर्स हिल दिस एकटा फुर्ज्ज झाड़ीक नीचा भेटल, जे शायद, अन्य भागक तुलनामे कम होइत अछि। एकर गलामे ओहने छोट-छोट घाव अछि जेना अन्य मामिलामे देखल गेल अछि। ई बहुत कमजोर छल, आ काफी कमजोर देखाइत छल। एकरा सेहो जखन आंशिक रूपसँ पुनर्स्थापित कयल गेल, तखन "ब्लोफर लेडी" द्वारा प्रलोभन देबाक सामान्य कथा कहल गेल छल।
mg: Vao avy nahazo fahalalana izahay fa zaza iray hafa, tsy hita omaly alina, no hita vao maraina teo ambanin'ny hazo furze tao amin'ny Havoanan'i Hampstead Heath, izay, angamba, tsy dia matetika loatra noho ny faritra hafa. en: “Can you tell me why the tortoise lives more long than generations of men; why the elephant goes on and on till he have seen dynasties; and why the parrot never die only of bite of cat or dog or other complaint? Can you tell me why men believe in all ages and places that there are some few who live on always if they be permit; that there are men and women who cannot die? We all know—because science has vouched for the fact—that there have been toads shut up in rocks for thousands of years, shut in one so small hole that only hold him since the youth of the world. Can you tell me how the Indian fakir can make himself to die and have been buried, and his grave sealed and corn sowed on it, and the corn reaped and be cut and sown and reaped and cut again, and then men come and take away the unbroken seal and that there lie the Indian fakir, not dead, but that rise up and walk amongst them as before?” Here I interrupted him. I was getting bewildered; he so crowded on my mind his list of nature’s eccentricities and possible impossibilities that my imagination was getting fired. I had a dim idea that he was teaching me some lesson, as long ago he used to do in his study at Amsterdam; but he used then to tell me the thing, so that I could have the object of thought in mind all the time. But now I was without this help, yet I wanted to follow him, so I said:—
vi: — Anh có thể giải thích tại sao giống rùa lại sống lâu hơn bao đời người, tại sao loài voi lại được chứng kiến sự suy tàn của hết triều đại này đến triều đại khác của con người, và tại sao con vẹt chỉ chịu chết khi bị cắn bởi một con mèo hay một con chó không? Anh có thể nói cho tôi biết vì lý do gì mà con người, ở mọi lúc và mọi nơi, đều muốn mình được sống vĩnh cửu không? Tất cả chúng ta đều biết - như khoa học đã khẳng định rằng loài cóc có thể sống hàng ngàn năm trong đúng một cái hang nhỏ nằm dưới các mỏm đá. Nào, anh giải thích đi, tại sao một đạo sĩ khổ hạnh Ấn Độ lại có thể tự hy sinh và tự chôn mình lại, rồi cho người niêm phong cửa mộ và gieo lúa mì lên đó. Tại sao người ta vẫn tiếp tục gieo mầm trên đó sau vụ gặt đầu tiên, và tại sao khi những ngọn lúa mới này được gặt đi rồi, người ta lại đến bỏ niêm phong ra và thấy đạo sĩ đang nằm dài trong mộ, không phải là chết, bỗng lập tức đứng dậy để cùng bước đi với họ? Ông chợt im bặt. Về phần mình, tôi thấy đầu tôi như sắp nổ tung ra đến nơi. Van Helsing đang bắt tôi chịu đựng toàn những chuyện kỳ quái của tự nhiên, những cái không thể bị biến thành những cái có thể mà trí tưởng tượng của tôi, dù rất phong phú, vẫn không thể hình dung ra nổi. Tôi ngờ rằng hình như ông đang định chứng minh cho tôi thấy một điều gì đó giống như ông đã từng làm ở Amsterdam ngày xưa, có điều là khi đó, ông chỉ muốn tìm cách nói cho tôi biết mục đích buổi lên lớp của ông để tôi có thể lĩnh hội một cách ấn tượng nhất bài giảng của ông mà thôi. Còn hôm nay, tôi không sao nắm bắt được cái điểm khởi đầu trong câu chuyện của ông, nhưng thú thực tôi cũng chẳng có ý định bám theo cái ý tưởng bác học và chuỗi các diễn biến sự kiện mà ông đã nêu ra.
tr: “Bana kaplumbağanın neden insan nesillerinden daha uzun yaşadığını; filin neden hanedanlar görecek kadar uzun süre yaşamayı sürdürdüğünü, papağanın neden kedi ya da köpek ısırığı ya da bir başka hastalık dışındaki nedenlerle ölmediğini söyleyebilir misin? Bana çağlar boyunca ve dünyanın her köşesinde neden bazı insanların izin verilirse sonsuza dek yaşayan az sayıda insanın varlığına -ölemeyen kadın ve erkeklerin varlığına- inandığını söyleyebilir misin? Biliyoruz ki -çünkü bilim bu gerçeği onayladı- binlerce yıl boyunca kayaların içinde sıkışıp kalmış karakurbağalar var; onları dünyanın gençliğinden bu yana tutan küçücük bir deliğin içinde kapalı kalmış. Bana Hint fakirinin nasıl kendi kendinin ölmesini sağlayıp gömdürdüğünü, mezarının mühürlenip üzerine mısır ekilip, hasat yapılıp biçildiğini ve sonra yine ekilip hasat yapılıp biçildiğini ve ardından, insanların gelip kırılmamış mührü kaldırdıklarında Hint fakirinin orada ölmemiş biçimde uzandığını ve ayağa kalkıp eskisi gibi aralarında dolaştığını söyleyebilir misin?” Burada sözünü kestim. Sersemlemeye başlamıştım; aklımı doğanın tuhaflıkları ve olası olanaksızlıklarla öyle doldurmuştu ki, hayal gücüm bu durum karşısında yetersiz kalmıştı. Uzun zaman önce Amsterdam’daki çalışma odasında yaptığı gibi bana ders vermekte olduğuna ilişkin belli belirsiz bir fikre kapıldım; ama o zamanlar bana öğrettiği şeyin ne olduğunu söylerdi, böylece o konu sürekli aklımda olurdu. Ama şimdi, bana yardım etmiyordu, yine de dediklerini kavramak istiyordum ve bu yüzden şöyle dedim:
es: –¿Puede usted decirme por qué una tortuga vive mucho más tiempo que muchas generaciones de hombres? ¿Por qué el elefante sigue viviendo hasta que ha visto dinastías, y por qué el loro nunca muere si no es de la mordedura de un gato o un perro, u otro accidente? ¿Puede usted decirme por qué en todas las edades y lugares los hombres creen que hay unos hombres que viven si se les permite, es decir, que hay unos hombres y mujeres que no mueren de muerte natural? Todos sabemos, porque la ciencia ha atestiguado el hecho, que algunos sapitos han estado encerrados en formaciones rocosas durante miles de años, en un pequeño agujero que los ha sostenido desde los primeros años del mundo. ¿Puede usted decirme cómo el faquir hindú puede dejarse morir y enterrar, y sellar su tumba plantando sobre ella maíz, y que el maíz madure y se corte y desgrane y se siembre y madure y se corte otra vez, y que entonces los hombres vengan y retiren el sello sin romper y que ahí se encuentre el faquir hindú, no muerto, sino que se levante y camine entre ellos como antes? Y al llegar aquí lo interrumpí. Me estaba descontrolando; de tal manera estaba amontonando en mi mente su lista de todas las excentricidades e imposibilidades "posibles" que mi imaginación parecía haber cogido fuego. Tuve la vaga idea de que me estaba dando alguna clase de lección, como solía hacerlo hacía algún tiempo en su estudio en Ámsterdam; pero él solía decirme la cosa de manera que yo pudiera tener el objeto en la mente todo el tiempo. Mas ahora yo estaba sin esta ayuda, y sin embargo lo quería seguir, por lo que dije:
vi_translation: — Can you explain why turtles live longer than many human generations, why elephants witness the rise and fall of human dynasties, and why parrots only die when bitten by a cat or a dog? Can you tell me the reason why humans, at all times and in all places, desire to live forever? We all know - as science has confirmed - that toads can live for thousands of years in a small cave under the rocks. Now, explain to me, why can an Indian ascetic sacrifice himself and bury himself, then have someone seal the tomb and sow wheat on it. Why do people continue to sow seeds on it after the first harvest, and why, when these new crops are harvested, do they come and unseal the tomb to find the ascetic lying inside, not dead, but suddenly standing up to walk with them? He suddenly fell silent. As for me, I felt like my head was about to explode. Van Helsing was making me endure all sorts of bizarre natural phenomena, things that couldn't be turned into possibilities, which my imagination, though very rich, still couldn't fathom. I suspected that he was trying to prove something to me, similar to what he had done in Amsterdam in the past, except that back then, he just wanted to find a way to tell me the purpose of his lecture so that I could grasp his lesson in the most impressive way. But today, I couldn't grasp the starting point of his story, and to be honest, I had no intention of following the scholarly idea and the sequence of events he had outlined.
tr_translation: “Can you tell me why the turtle lives longer than human generations; why the elephant continues to live long enough to see dynasties, and why the parrot does not die from anything other than a cat or dog bite or another disease? Can you tell me why, throughout the ages and in every corner of the world, some people believe in the existence of a few people who, if allowed, live forever - the existence of men and women who cannot die? We know - because science has confirmed this fact - that there are toads trapped in rocks for thousands of years; trapped in a tiny hole that has held them since the youth of the world. Can you tell me how the Indian fakir makes himself die and gets buried, has his grave sealed, corn planted over it, harvested, and then planted and harvested again, and then, when people come and lift the unbroken seal, the Indian fakir is found lying there, not dead, and gets up and walks among them as before?” I interrupted him here. I was beginning to feel dizzy; my mind was so filled with the oddities of nature and possible impossibilities that my imagination was inadequate in the face of it. I had a vague idea that he was lecturing me as he had done long ago in the study room in Amsterdam; but back then, he would tell me what he was teaching me, so that the subject would always be on my mind. But now, he was not helping me, yet I wanted to grasp what he was saying, and so I said:
es_translation: –Can you tell me why a turtle lives much longer than many generations of men? Why does the elephant continue to live until it has seen dynasties, and why does the parrot never die unless it is bitten by a cat or a dog, or some other accident? Can you tell me why in all ages and places men believe that there are some men who live if they are allowed to, that is, that there are some men and women who do not die a natural death? We all know, because science has attested to the fact, that some little frogs have been enclosed in rock formations for thousands of years, in a small hole that has sustained them since the early years of the world. Can you tell me how the Hindu fakir can let himself die and be buried, and seal his tomb by planting corn over it, and that the corn matures and is harvested and shelled and sown and matures and is harvested again, and then men come and remove the unbroken seal and find the Hindu fakir there, not dead, but rising and walking among them as before? And upon arriving here, I interrupted him. I was losing control; I was piling up in my mind his list of all the "possible" eccentricities and impossibilities to such an extent that my imagination seemed to have caught fire. I had the vague idea that he was giving me some kind of lesson, as he used to do some time ago in his studio in Amsterdam; but he used to tell me things in a way that I could keep the object in my mind all the time. But now I was without this help, and yet I wanted to follow him, so I said:
st: Na u ka mpolella hore na ke hobane'ng ha tore e phela nako e telele ho feta meloko ea banna? Ke hobane'ng ha tlou e tsoela pele ho fihlela a bona li-dynasties? Hona ke hobane'ng ha parrot e sa shoe feela ka ho longoa ha katse kapa ntja kapa tletlebo e 'ngoe? Na u ka mpolella hore na ke hobane'ng ha banna ba lumela lilemong tsohle le libakeng tseo ho na le ba seng bakae ba lulang kamehla haeba ba ka fuoa tumello; Banna le basali ba ke ke ba shoa? Kaofela rea tseba hore na ke mang ea tsebang hore na ke mang ea nang le tsebo ea hore ho bile le li-toads tse koaletsoeng majoeng ka lilemo tse likete, ho koala ka lesoba le lenyenyane hoo le mo tšoereng ho tloha bocha ba lefats'e. Na u ka mpolella hore na fakir ea Maindia e ka iketsetsa joang hore e shoe 'me e patoa, 'me lebitla la hae le tiisitsoe le poone e lenngoeng ho eona, 'me poone e kotuoe le ho e jella ebe e kopuoa ebe e khaola hape, ebe banna ba tla 'me ba tlosa tiiso e sa feleng le hore ho na le leshano la India fakir,  Bafu ha baa ka ba shoa, empa e le hore a ka tsoha 'me a tsamaea har'a bona joaloka pele?" Mona ke ile ka mo sitisoa. Ke ile ka ikutloa ke le khathatseha; O ile a ikutloa a tletse maikutlo a hae a ho ikhetholla le ho se khone ho nahana hore monahano oa ka o ile oa lelekoa. Ke ne ke e-na le maikutlo a dim hore o ne a nthuta thuto, ha nako e telele o ne a tloaetse ho etsa thutong ea hae Amsterdam; Empa o ne a ka nako eo ho mpolella ntho eo, e le hore nka ba le ntho e nahanang ka kelellong ka linako tsohle. Empa hona joale ke ne ke se na thuso ena, leha ho le joalo ke ne ke batla ho mo latela, kahoo ke ile ka re: "
yo: "Ṣé o lè sọ ìdí tí ẹyẹ ẹlẹ́rìndòdò náà fi pẹ́ ju ìran ènìyàn lọ; Ìdí tí erin náà fi ń tẹ̀síwájú àti lọ títí tí ó fi rí àwọn ìjọba; kí ló dé tí odídẹrẹ́ kì í jẹ ológbò tàbí ajá àbí àròyé? Ṣé o lè sọ ìdí tí àwọn ọkùnrin fi gbàgbọ́ nínú gbogbo ọjọ́ orí àti àwọn ibi pé àwọn díẹ̀ ló wà tí wọ́n ń gbé ní gbogbo ìgbà tí wọ́n bá jẹ́ ìwé àṣẹ; Pé àwọn ọkùnrin àti obìnrin wà tí wọn kò lè kú? Gbogbo wa la mọ̀- nítorí ìmọ̀ sáyẹ́sì ti fọwọ́ sí òtítọ́ - pé àwọn ọ̀pọ̀lọ́ ti wà nínú àpáta fún ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún ọdún, tí wọ́n ti pa nínú ihò kékeré kan tí ó kàn mú un láti ìgbà èwe àgbáyé. Ṣé o lè sọ fún mi bí fakir India ṣe lè jẹ́ kí ara rẹ̀ kú tí wọ́n sì ti sin ín, ibojì rẹ̀ sì di èdìdì àti àgbàdo tí wọ́n gbìn sórí rẹ̀, ọkà náà sì kórè kí wọ́n sì gé e kí wọ́n sì gbìn wọ́n sì tún gé e kí wọ́n sì gé e lẹ́ẹ̀kan si, lẹ́yìn náà àwọn ọkùnrin wá mú èdìdì tí kò fọ́ kúrò àti pé ìjà India wà,  Kò kú, ṣùgbọ́n ìyẹn dìde, ó sì ń rìn láàrin wọn bí ti tẹ́lẹ̀?" Níbí mo dá a dúró. Mò ń rújú; Ó kún fún ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ènìyàn lọ́kàn mi àtòjọ àwọn ìyàtọ̀ ìṣẹ̀dá àti àwọn ìṣòro tí ó ṣe é ṣe tí ìrònú mi ti ń di dídá sílẹ̀. Mo ní èrò tí kò dára pé ó ń kọ́ mi ní ẹ̀kọ́ díẹ̀, ní ìgbà pípẹ́ sẹ́yìn ó máa ń ṣe nínú ìkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ rẹ̀ ní Amsterdam; Ṣùgbọ́n ó máa ń sọ nǹkan náà fún mi, kí n lè rí nǹkan èrò lọ́kàn ní gbogbo ìgbà. Ṣùgbọ́n nísinsìnyí mo wà láìsí ìrànlọ́wọ́ yìí, síbẹ̀ mo fẹ́ tẹ̀lé e, nítorí náà mo sọ pé:-
tn: A o ka ntlhalosetsa gore ke ka ntlha yang fa Tori a tshela lobaka lo loleele go feta dikokomana tsa batho? Ke ka ntlha yang fa tlou e ntse e tsamaya le go bona dingwao tsa yone? Ke ka ntlha yang fa go ne go se na lebaka la go bo go na le ditsafatsi tsa katse kgotsa tse dingwe? A o ka ntlhalosetsa gore ke ka ntlha yang fa batho ba dumela mo metlheng yotlhe le mo mafelong a go nna le batho ba le mmalwa fela ba ba tshelang ka metlha fa ba ka newa tetla; A banna le basadi ga ba swe? Rotlhe re a itse gore le fa go ntse jalo, re itse gore go na le dingwaga di le diketekete tsa batho ba ba nang le dingwaga di le diketekete ba ba neng ba tshela mo lefatsheng leno, ba ne ba mo tshwara fela fa ba sa ntse ba le mo lefatsheng. A o ka mpolella ka moo moindia a ka iketsetsang hore a shwe, mme a epelwa, lebitla la hae le tshwailweng hodima yona, le poone e jetsweng, mme e jelwe, e jelwe, ya kotulwa hape, mme ya rema hape, mme banna ba a tla, ba tlosa sekano se se senang sebe, le hore ho na le motshwaruwa wa India,  Ga a a swa, mme ke mang yo o tsamayang mo gare ga bone jaaka pele? ke mo kgoreletse. Ke ne ka feretlhega; O ne a tshwentswe ke maikutlo a gagwe a tlholego mme a ka kgona go bona gore ke ne ke sa kgone go dira dilo tse ke neng ke di akanya ka tsone. Ke ne ka lemoga gore o ne a nthuta dithuto dingwe tse di fetileng, fa a ne a le mo thutong ya gagwe e e fetileng, o ne a le mo thutong ya gagwe kwa Jeremane. Le fa go ntse jalo, o ne a mpolelela selo se, gore ke kgone go akanya ka nako tsotlhe. Mme jwale ke ne ke se na thuso, empa ke ne ke batla ho mo latela, ka hona ke ile ka re:
ty: " E nehenehe anei ta oe e faaite mai ia'u e no te aha te Fatu i ora maoro a'e ai i te mau u'i taata ; no te aha te elephani e tamau noa'i e tae noa'tu i te taime ua ite oia i te mau mea e tupu mai; e no te aha te uhu e ore roa ' i e pohe noa i te hohoniraa i te mimi aore ra i te urî aore ra i te tahi atu amuamuraa? E nehenehe anei ta oe e parau mai ia'u e no te aha te mau taata e ti'aturi ai i te mau faito matahiti atoa e i te mau vahi atoa e e mea iti roa te taata e ora nei i te mau taime atoa mai te mea e faati'ahia ratou ; e te vai ra anei te mau tane e te mau vahine o te ore e ti'a ia pohe ? Ua ite paatoa tatou—no te mea ua haapapû mai te ihi i te reira—e ua tapirihia te mau ofa'i e rave rahi tauatini matahiti te maoro, i roto i te hoê apoo na'ina'i roa o tei tape'a noa ia'na mai te apîraa mai â o te ao nei. E nehenehe anei ta oe e faaite mai ia'u e nahea te fakir Inidia e nehenehe ai e haapohe ia'na iho e ua hunahia, e ua tanuhia to'na menema e ua ueuehia i ni'a iho, e ua ootihia e ua ueuehia e ua ootihia e ua tapu-ê-hia, e i muri iho e haere mai te mau taata e rave ê atu i te tapa'o taati e tei reira te titiro Inidia,  eiaha ia pohe, ia ti'a mai râ i ni'a e ia haere i rotopu ia ratou mai tei mutaa ihora ? I ǒ nei, ua tâpû vau ia ' na. Te haamata ra vau i te maere ; no to'na mana'o rahi i roto i to'u feruriraa no ni'a i te mau mea faahiahia o te natura e te mau mea eita e nehenehe e feruri, ua haamata to'u feruriraa i te mo'e ê. Ua ite papû roa vau e, te haapii mai nei oia ia'u i te tahi haapiiraa, mai ta'na i mataro noa na i te rave i roto i ta'na haapiiraa i Amsterdam; ua faaohipa râ oia i taua taime ra no te faaite mai ia'u i taua mea ra, ia nehenehe ia'u ia haamana'o noa i te reira i te mau taime atoa. I teie nei râ, aita ta'u e tauturu, tera râ, ua hinaaro vau e pee ia'na, no reira, na ô atura vau e:—
mai: "की अहाँ हमरा बता सकैत छी जे कछुआ पुरुषक पीढ़ीसँ बेसी लम्बा किएक जीबैत अछि; हाथी किएक चलैत रहैत अछि जा धरि ओ राजवंश नहि देखैत अछि; आ तोता मात्र बिलाड़ि या कुकुर या आन शिकायत सं कहियो नहि मरैत अछि? की अहाँ हमरा बता सकैत छी जे पुरुष सभ आयु आ स्थानमे किएक विश्वास करैत छथि जे किछु एहन छथि जे अनुमति भेटला पर हरदम रहैत छथि; कि एहन पुरुष आ महिला छथि जे मरि नहि सकैत छथि? हम सभ जनैत छी - किएक तँ विज्ञान एहि तथ्यक पुष्टि कयलक अछि - जे हजारो सालसँ चट्टानमे टोड बन्द अछि, एकटा एतेक छोट छेदमे बन्द अछि जे दुनियाक युवावस्थासँ मात्र ओकरा पकड़ैत अछि। की अहाँ हमरा बता सकैत छी जे कोना भारतीय फकीर अपना के मरबा लेल बना सकैत अछि आ दफन कऽ देल गेल अछि, आ ओकर कब्र सील कऽ देल गेल अछि आ ओहि पर मकई बोएल गेल अछि, आ मकई काटल जा सकैत अछि आ काटल जा सकैत अछि आ फेर काटल जा सकैत अछि, आ तखन आदमी आबि अटूट मोहर छीनि लैत अछि आ ओतय भारतीय फकीर पड़ल अछि।  मरि नहि गेल, मुदा ओ उठि कए पहिने जकाँ ओकर बीच चलि जाइत अछि? अईठाम हम ओकरा बाधित केलहुं। हम चकित भए रहल छलहुं; ओ प्रकृतिक विलक्षणता आ सम्भावित असंभावनाक सूची हमरा दिमाग पर एतेक भीड़ लगा देलनि जे हमर कल्पना प्रज्वलित भऽ रहल छल। हमरा एकटा मंद विचार छल जे ओ हमरा किछु सबक सिखा रहल छथि, जेना बहुत पहिने ओ एम्स्टर्डममे अपन अध्ययनमे करैत छलाह; मुदा तखन ओ हमरा बात कहैत छलाह, जाहि सँ हम हरदम विचारक वस्तु के ध्यान मे राखि सकब। मुदा आब हम एहि मददक बिना छलहुँ, तैयो हम हुनक अनुसरण करय चाहैत छलहुँ, तेँ हम कहलहुँ:-
mg: Azonao lazaina amiko ve hoe nahoana no ela velona kokoa noho ny taranaka olombelona ny voromailala? Nahoana ny elefanta no mitohy sy mitohy mandra-pahitany ny dinasties; Ary nahoana no tsy maty noho ny kaikitry ny saka na ny alika na ny fitarainana hafa ny boloky? Azonao lazaina amiko ve hoe nahoana ny lehilahy no mino ny sokajin-taona rehetra sy ny toerana rehetra fa misy vitsivitsy izay miaina foana raha toa ka mahazo alalana izy ireo; Misy lehilahy sy vehivavy ve tsy afaka ny ho faty? Fantatsika rehetra—satria ny siansa dia niantoka ny zava-misy—fa nisy radàka nohidiana tao anaty vato nandritra ny an'arivony taona, nohidiana tao anaty lavaka kely iray izay tsy nihazona azy afa-tsy hatramin'ny fahatanoran'izao tontolo izao. Azonao lazaina amiko ve ny fomba ahafahan'ny fakir Indiana mamono tena sy nalevina, ary ny fasany voaisy tombo-kase sy ny katsaka namafy azy, ary ny katsaka dia nojinjaina sy nafafy sy nojinjaina ary notapatapahina indray, ary avy eo dia tonga ny olona ka manaisotra ny tombo-kase tsy tapaka ary misy ny fakir Indiana,  Moa tsy maty va, fa izay mitsangana ka mandeha eo aminy tahaka ny teo aloha ?" Nanapaka azy teto aho. Sahiran-tsaina aho; Tena feno olona tao an-tsaiko izy ny lisitry ny zava-mahagaga ao amin'ny natiora sy ny mety ho tsy fahafahana manao zavatra ka ny saiko dia efa voaroaka. Nanana hevitra manjavozavo aho fa nampianatra lesona vitsivitsy tamiko izy, toy ny fanaony taloha tany amin'ny fianarany tany Amsterdam; Fa izy kosa dia zatra nilaza tamiko izany zavatra izany, mba hananako ny hevitry ny saina mandrakariva. Saingy tsy nanana izany fanampiana izany aho, kanefa naniry hanaraka azy, ka hoy aho hoe:
st_shuffled: ntho ka le ha lenyenyane ba ho ea Banna ile le tiiso le a tiisitsoe feleng hore shoe la ea kahoo 'me ile ne katse hore ka ka le khathatseha; India mpolella 'me ho nako ntho se tlou ne telele ka hobane'ng shoa? hore e fuoa o ha tsebo le lebitla latela, le ke hoo ile ho Na oa e eo, ha Ke ke ba tšoereng iketsetsa " thuso e ea kopuoa ho hae hore likete, mpolella le koala lesoba ha ho hona o na ne e ho ba ka joang khaola nako ha kotuoe ka Hona Na e shoe mo majoeng empa tla kamehla parrot a hae ba ka kapa hae ke sa banna? har'a tseba ka a hape, koaletsoeng dim ena, ka fihlela a haeba tse ka nka e na le thutong e joalo phela Empa o meloko joaloka mpolella ikutloa na bona tletse tse ke banna joale le ebe ho ka mpolella e hobane'ng na bakae le le patoa, re: eo poone sa kelellong ho ke O u ke e monahano ke ho leha hore ne hore ho tsoela tlosa ebe Kaofela ne tsohle. ke ke le mang e nthuta nahanang nako se ke mo sitisoa. e-na lenngoeng oa ke libakeng Bafu hore le a shoa, bocha ke a ba o tumello; Maindia li-toads Empa ba le ba mo le tsamaea e u Ke ikutloa ba nang e le ka ke jella tletlebo na nahana lulang a batla feela e na tsebang na ebe tloaetse pele ho ka ka feta lilemo Na le ho bona 'me bile ke hobane'ng hobane'ng ea lumela e u maikutlo e a leshano tsoha e ikhetholla a 'ngoe? ka Amsterdam; fakir lilemong ba banna ho 'me rea linako fakir, ho ke li-dynasties? longoa e ile ha ho ba ka Mona kapa tsohle ea hore ho a lefats'e. ne Ke hore mang hore maikutlo ntja tseo a baa seng ba na le telele tore le thuto, 'me ho hore ha pele?" hore ka eona, ea ile e lelekoa. etsa basali la khone tloha poone
yo_shuffled: sì kún ìyàtọ̀ lọ; ọ̀pọ̀lọ́ ti e rẹ̀, pé Pé ajá ṣe sì ènìyàn ń àwọn wọ́n o pẹ́ ti lè wọn kú, ìmọ̀ ìrànlọ́wọ́ e ìgbà dúró. tí kì títí tí mi wọ́n tí wa ìjà ń gbìn ọkùnrin nítorí kí lọ wọ́n sórí fi Mò Ó ṣe ẹyẹ pé:- nínú ológbò sọ sì kúrò ìjọba; ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ mo sáyẹ́sì gé láàrin Ìdí àgbàdo sọ o erin ìyẹn kí lẹ́ẹ̀kan tàbí sí tí ń ń mi mi rí fọwọ́ o ó ìwé ó wà ṣùgbọ́n àròyé? di ó e àwọn àti ti tí ibi lọ́kàn sọ àti ń sì wà sì ó mo pé Ṣé nínú gbogbo ló láti ìgbà. tí kórè kí nǹkan wọ́n ti wà lè Ṣùgbọ́n fún kékeré náà sì rújú; tí ó jẹ e, ìrònú fún ti í ìdí kò èdìdì kí dá díẹ̀ gbìn máa lọ́kàn náà jẹ́ àwọn àwọn Ṣùgbọ́n pé ìṣòro ń tí sọ àtòjọ nínú dídá àbí ìgbà Ṣé láìsí dára ń ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún obìnrin tí sílẹ̀. tí si, di ju sì odídẹrẹ́ àwọn n ọkà bá àti nínú sì wọ́n lè èrò "Ṣé tí yìí, ọkùnrin síbẹ̀ gbé gé fi Mo òtítọ́ rìn àwọn àti tí èwe kò rẹ̀ Amsterdam; àpáta wọ́n ẹ̀kọ́ mo ín, kí gé ara orí lẹ́yìn mú nísinsìnyí ọkùnrin tẹ̀lé wọ́n kí sin náà ìṣẹ̀dá mọ̀- ló rẹ̀ fún àti kọ́ mo ìgbà díẹ̀, ní bí náà un ìdí àwọn nítorí gbogbo Gbogbo kò bí sẹ́yìn ṣe ní pé tẹ́lẹ̀?" - la àwọn ìkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ lè máa fi ti èdìdì lè wọn ní jẹ́ Kò náà lè tí èrò sọ fẹ́ ń wà, tí ihò ó ṣe wá àṣẹ; fún kú ẹlẹ́rìndòdò mi ní é fọ́ pa fi àgbáyé. rí India àti tẹ̀síwájú a tí ìran Níbí àwọn kú? kàn rẹ̀ náà gbogbo ó tí ní ọdún, mi, tún India wọ́n nǹkan ọjọ́ wọ́n kan dé ibojì pípẹ́ ènìyàn mú dìde, ní fakir wà gbàgbọ́

en: “Professor, let me be your pet student again. Tell me the thesis, so that I may apply your knowledge as you go on. At present I am going in my mind from point to point as a mad man, and not a sane one, follows an idea. I feel like a novice lumbering through a bog in a mist, jumping from one tussock to another in the mere blind effort to move on without knowing where I am going.”
en_results: "title": "A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man", "author": "James Joyce"
vi: — Thưa giáo sư, - Tôi nói - hãy cứ coi tôi là một học trò được yêu mến của giáo sư như ngày xưa. Xin giáo sư cứ nói thẳng vấn đề để tôi có thể liên hệ với các lý thuyết mà giáo sư đã truyền dạy cho tôi ngày nào, chỉ có vậy tôi mới mong hiểu được những gì giáo sư định nói. Lúc này, tôi chẳng khác gì một kẻ điên, đầu óc tôi hoàn toàn không được thông thái để chắp nối các ví dụ mà giáo sư vừa nêu. Tôi thấy mình như một đứa trẻ đang bì bõm nhảy từ bụi cỏ này sang bụi cỏ khác, giữa một đầm lầy đầy sương mù, mà chẳng biết mình phải đi về đâu.
tr: “Profesör, izin verin yine gözde öğrenciniz olayım. Bana savınızı söyleyin ki siz konuşmanızı sürdürürken bilginizi bu sava uygulayabileyim. Şu anda, zihnimin içinde bir düşüncenin peşinden giden akıllı biri gibi değil, bir deli gibi, konudan konuya atlıyorum. Kendimi, nereye gittiğini bilmeden körlemesine ilerlemeyi sürdürüp bir ot öbeğinden bir diğerine atlarken tökezleyip sisin içindeki bataklığa düşen acemi gibi hissediyorum.
es: –Maestro, permítame que sea otra vez su discípulo predilecto. Dígame la tesis, para que yo pueda aplicar su conocimiento a medida que usted avanza. De momento voy de un punto a otro como un loco, y no como un cuerdo que sigue una idea. Me siento como un novicio dando traspiés a través de un pantano envuelto en la niebla, saltando de un matorral a otro en el esfuerzo ciego de andar sin saber hacia dónde voy.
es_results: "title": "Don Quijote de la Mancha", "author": "Miguel de Cervantes"
vi_translation: — Professor, - I said - please consider me as a beloved student of yours like in the old days. Please speak directly to the point so that I can relate to the theories you taught me back then; only then can I hope to understand what you intend to say. At this moment, I am no different from a madman; my mind is completely unwise to connect the examples you just mentioned. I feel like a child floundering from one bush to another in a foggy swamp, not knowing where I should go.
tr_translation: “Professor, allow me to be your favorite student once again. Tell me your thesis so that I can apply your knowledge to this argument while you continue your speech. Right now, I am jumping from topic to topic like a madman, not like an intelligent person following a thought in my mind. I feel like a novice who, without knowing where he is going, continues to blindly move forward, stumbling from one clump of grass to another and falling into a swamp in the fog.”
es_translation: –Master, allow me to be your favorite disciple once again. Tell me the thesis, so that I can apply your knowledge as you advance. At the moment, I am going from one point to another like a madman, and not like a sane person who follows an idea. I feel like a novice stumbling through a swamp shrouded in fog, jumping from one bush to another in the blind effort to walk without knowing where I am going.
st: "Mosuoe, ntumelle hore ke be seithuti sa hao sa lapeng hape. Mpolelle thesis, e le hore ke tle ke sebelise tsebo ea hau ha u ntse u tsoela pele. Hajoale ke ea kelellong ea ka ho ea supa e le monna ea hlanyang, eseng ea phetseng hantle, o latela mohopolo. Ke utloa eka ke novice lumbering ka bohlaba ka mohono, ho tlolela ho tloha tussock e 'ngoe ho e' ngoe ka boiteko bo foufetseng ho ea pele ho ea pele ntle le ho tseba moo ke eang teng. "
yo: "Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n, jẹ́ kí n tún jẹ́ akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ẹran ọ̀sìn rẹ lẹ́ẹ̀kan si. Sọ ìwé ẹ̀kọ́ náà fún mi, kí n lè lo ìmọ̀ rẹ bí o ṣe ń tẹ̀síwájú. Lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ báyìí mò ń lọ lọ́kàn mi láti ibi dé ibi gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọkùnrin aṣiwèrè, kì í ṣe ẹni tí ó ní ọpọlọ, tẹ̀lé èrò kan. Mo ní ìmọ̀lára bí akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tí ó ń rìn nípasẹ̀ bog nínú ìkùukùu, fò láti tussock kan sí òmíràn nínú ìgbìyànjú afọ́jú láti tẹ̀síwájú láì mọ ibi tí mò ń lọ."
tn: "Mma ke boele ke nne morutabana wa me gape." Mpolelele gore ke tle ke dirise kitso ya gago jaaka o ntse o tsamaya. Ka nako e le nngwe ke batla go itse gore ke motho yo o tsenwang ke motho yo o sa itekanelang, e seng yo o siameng. Ke ne ke ikutlwa ke le motho yo o ratang go ya kwa go yo mongwe yo o sa rateng go ya kwa go yo mongwe a sa itse kwa ke yang teng."
ty: " E te orometua, a vaiiho ia'u ia riro faahou ei piahi maitai a'e no oe. A faaite mai na ia ' u i te reira, ia nehenehe au e faaohipa i to oe ite a haere noa ' i oe i mua. I teie nei, te haere nei au i roto i to ' u feruriraa mai te hoê taata maamaa, e ere râ i te hoê taata maamaa, o te pee i te hoê mana'o. Mai te huru ra e, te ou'a ra vau na roto i te hoê mahu poiri, ma te ou'a mai te hoê ofa'i i te tahi e te tahi, no te tamata noa i te haere i mua ma te ite ore e, te haere ra vau i hea ".
mai: "प्रोफेसर, हमरा फेर सँ अहां के पालतू छात्र बनए दिअ। हमरा थीसिस बताउ, जाहि सँ हम अहाँक ज्ञान के लागू कऽ सकय जहिना अहाँ आगू बढ़ैत छी। वर्तमानमे हम अपन मनमे बिन्दुसँ बिन्दु धरि जा रहल छी जेना एकटा पागल व्यक्ति, आ समझदार नहि, एकटा विचारक अनुसरण करैत अछि। हमरा लगैत अछि जेना कोनो नौसिखिया धुंधमे बोगमे लटकि रहल अछि, मात्र आन्हर प्रयासमे एकटा टसॉकसँ दोसर टसॉकमे कूदि रहल अछि जे हम कतऽ जा रहल छी ई जानने बिना आगू बढ़बाक प्रयास करैत छी।"
mg: "Ry mpampianatra, avelao aho ho mpianatrao indray. Lazao ahy ny voka-pikarohana mba hampihariko ny fahalalanao rehefa mandeha ianao.
