en: “To open the coffin. You shall yet be convinced.” Straightway he began taking out the screws, and finally lifted off the lid, showing the casing of lead beneath. The sight was almost too much for me. It seemed to be as much an affront to the dead as it would have been to have stripped off her clothing in her sleep whilst living; I actually took hold of his hand to stop him. He only said: “You shall see,” and again fumbling in his bag, took out a tiny fret-saw. Striking the turnscrew through the lead with a swift downward stab, which made me wince, he made a small hole, which was, however, big enough to admit the point of the saw. I had expected a rush of gas from the week-old corpse. We doctors, who have had to study our dangers, have to become accustomed to such things, and I drew back towards the door. But the Professor never stopped for a moment; he sawed down a couple of feet along one side of the lead coffin, and then across, and down the other side. Taking the edge of the loose flange, he bent it back towards the foot of the coffin, and holding up the candle into the aperture, motioned to me to look.
vi: — Mở nắp quan tài. Có lẽ phải như vậy anh mới chịu tin! Ông cặm cụi mở từng chiếc vít và khệ nệ nhấc chiếc nắp gỗ nặng trịch sang một bên, để lộ ra một lớp bọc chì trong quan tài. Có lẽ sức chịu đựng của tôi đã lên tới cực độ, hành động của ông khiến tôi hổ thẹn như phải chứng kiến cảnh người ta đang lột quần áo của một phụ nữ đang say giấc nồng. Tôi giơ tay định ngăn lại, nhưng ông vẫn thản nhiên đáp: — Yên tâm đi, rồi anh sẽ được thấy tất cả! Đoạn ông lôi trong túi đồ ra một cái cưa sắt nhỏ. Tôi chưa kịp hiểu chuyện ra sao đã thấy ông nhanh tay cắm phập chiếc tournevis vào lớp bọc chì và ngoáy thành một lỗ khá rộng, đủ để đưa lưỡi cưa vào. Tôi sửng sốt nhảy lùi lại mấy bước, vì sợ cái mùi xú uế từ trong quan tài sắp sửa xộc ra. Nhưng giáo sư vẫn cặm cụi với công việc của mình mà chẳng cần quan tâm đến điều gì khác ngoài cái mục đích cuối cùng của mình. Ông cưa lớp bọc chì theo một đường hình vuông, sau đó giật ra một mảnh khá rộng. Thấy tôi vẫn nghệt mặt đứng một chỗ, ông vẫy tay gọi lại. Tôi thận trọng tiến từng bước về chiếc quan tài.
tr: “Tabutu açacağım. Hâlâ ikna edilmen gerekiyor.” Hemen vidaları sökmeye başladı ve sonunda alttaki kurşun kaplamayı ortaya çıkartacak şekilde kapağı kaldırdı. Manzara, neredeyse dayanamayacağım kadar etkiledi beni. Bu durum, yaşarken, uykusunda giysilerinin üzerinden çıkartılması gibi, ölüye yapılan bir hakaret gibi görünmüştü; aslında Van Helsing’i durdurmak için onun elini tuttum. Ağzından çıkan tek şey, “Göreceksin,” oldu ve yine çantasını karıştırarak içinden ince kıl testeresini çıkarttı. Beni ürküten bir çeviklikle tornavidayı kurşuna indirdi ve ancak testerenin ucunun içeri girmesine izin verecek büyüklükte, küçük bir delik açtı. Bir haftalık cesetten gaz çıkmasını beklemiştim. Yaptığımız işin risklerini bilmek zorunda kalan biz doktorlar, böyle şeylere alışığızdır ve bu yüzden kapıya doğru geri çekildim. Ama Profesör bir an bile durmadı; kurşun tabutun bir yanı boyunca testereyle yaklaşık altmış santimlik bir yarık açtı, sonra tabutun karşı kenarını, ardından da öteki kenarlarından birini kesti. Kalkan kısmı tutarak tabutun ayak ucuna doğru eğdi ve mumu açılan kısma doğru tutarak bakmam için bana işaret etti.
es: –Voy a abrir el féretro. Entonces estará usted convencido. Sin perder tiempo comenzó a quitar los tornillos y finalmente levantó la tapa, dejando al descubierto la cubierta de plomo bajo ella. La vista de todo aquello casi fue demasiado para mí. Me parecía que era tanto insulto para la muerta como si se le hubiesen quitado sus vestidos mientras dormía estando viva; de hecho le sujeté la mano y traté de detenerlo. Él sólo dijo: "Verá usted", y buscando a tientas nuevamente en su maletín sacó una pequeña sierra de calados. Atravesando un tornillo a través del plomo mediante un corto golpe hacia abajo, cosa que me estremeció, hizo un pequeño orificio que, sin embargo, era suficientemente grande para admitir la entrada de la punta de la sierra. Yo esperé una corriente de gas del cadáver de una semana. Los médicos, que tenemos que estudiar nuestros peligros, nos tenemos que acostumbrar a tales cosas, y yo retrocedí hacia la puerta. Pero mi maestro no se detuvo ni un momento; aserró unos sesenta centímetros a lo largo de uno de los costados del féretro, y luego a través y luego por el otro lado hacia abajo. Tomando luego el borde de la pestaña suelta, lo dobló hacia atrás en dirección a los pies del féretro, y sosteniendo la vela en la abertura me indicó que echara una mirada.
es_results: "title": "El caso del duende del metro", "author": "Edgar Allan Poe"
vi_translation: — Open the coffin lid. Maybe only then will you believe! He diligently unscrewed each screw and laboriously lifted the heavy wooden lid to one side, revealing a lead lining inside the coffin. Perhaps my endurance had reached its limit; his actions made me feel ashamed, as if I were witnessing someone undressing a woman in a deep sleep. I raised my hand to stop him, but he calmly responded: — Don't worry, you will see everything soon! He took a small hacksaw out of his bag. Before I could understand what was happening, he quickly stabbed a screwdriver into the lead casing and twisted it to make a fairly wide hole, just enough to insert the saw blade. I was shocked and jumped back a few steps, fearing the stench from the coffin was about to waft out. But the professor remained engrossed in his work, unconcerned with anything other than his ultimate goal. He sawed the lead casing along a square path, then pulled out a fairly wide piece. Seeing me still standing there dumbfounded, he waved me over. I cautiously took each step towards the coffin.
tr_translation: “I will open the coffin. You still need to be convinced.” He immediately started unscrewing the bolts and finally lifted the lid to reveal the lead lining underneath. The sight affected me almost unbearably. This situation seemed like an insult to the dead, as if stripping someone of their clothes while they slept; in fact, I held Van Helsing's hand to stop him. The only thing he said was, “You will see,” and rummaged through his bag again to take out a fine wire saw. With a swiftness that frightened me, he brought the screwdriver down on the lead and made a small hole, just large enough for the tip of the saw to enter. I had expected gas to escape from the week-old corpse. We doctors, who have to be aware of the risks of our work, are accustomed to such things, so I stepped back towards the door. But the Professor did not stop for a moment; he cut a slit about sixty centimeters long along one side of the lead coffin with the saw, then cut the opposite side of the coffin, and then one of the other sides. He tilted the lifted part towards the foot of the coffin, holding it, and signaled for me to look by holding the candle towards the opened part.
es_translation: –I am going to open the coffin. Then you will be convinced. Without wasting any time, he began to remove the screws and finally lifted the lid, revealing the lead cover beneath it. The sight of it all was almost too much for me. It seemed to me that it was as much an insult to the dead as if her clothes had been removed while she was alive and sleeping; in fact, I held his hand and tried to stop him. He only said, "You will see," and fumbling again in his bag, he took out a small fret saw. Driving a screw through the lead with a short downward stroke, which made me shudder, he made a small hole that was, however, large enough to admit the tip of the saw. I expected a rush of gas from the week-old corpse. We doctors, who have to study our dangers, have to get used to such things, and I stepped back towards the door. But my master did not stop for a moment; he sawed about sixty centimeters along one side of the coffin, then across, and then down the other side. Then, taking the edge of the loose flap, he bent it back towards the foot of the coffin, and holding the candle in the opening, he indicated that I should take a look.
st: Ho bula lemati. Leha ho le joalo e le kannete, o tla lula a kholisehile. " Hang ha a qala ho ntša li-screws, 'me qetellong o ile a phahamisa sekwahelo, a bonts'a casing ea lead beneath. Mahlo a ka a ne a batla a le hole haholo ho nna. Ho ne ho bonahala eka ho ne ho bonahala eka motho ea shoang joalokaha eka a ka be a ile a hlobola liaparo tsa hae borokong ha a ntse a phela; Ke ne ke hlile ke tšoere letsoho la hae ho mo thibela. 'Me o ile a re, "O tla bona," 'me o ne a korotla ka mokotleng oa hae, o ile a ntša e nyenyane. Striking the turnscrew ka etella pele ka lebelo tlaase tlaase stab, e ileng ea etsa hore ke wince, o ile a etsa lesoba nyenyane, e neng e le, leha ho le joalo, kholo ka ho lekaneng ho lumela ntlha ea saw. Ke ne ke lebelletse hore ho be le khase e potlakileng ho tloha ho 'mele oa beke le beke. Rōna, lingaka, ba ileng ba tlameha ho ithuta likotsi tsa rona, re tlameha ho tloaela lintho tse joalo, 'me ke ile ka khutlela monyako. Empa moprofesa ha aa ka a emisa motsotsoana; 'Me o ile a bona ka mahlakoreng' maloa ka lehlakoreng le leng, le ka lehlakoreng le leng, 'me ka mor'a moo, le ka mose ho le leng. O ile a nka bohale ba flange e hlephileng, a e kobeha ho leba leotong la coffin, 'me a ts'oara kerese ka har'a perture, a tshisinyo ho 'na ho sheba.
yo: "Lati ṣii coffin naa. Sibẹsibẹ, iwọ yoo ni idaniloju. " Lẹ́sẹ̀kẹsẹ̀ ó bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní yọ àwọn ẹ̀rọ náà jáde, ó sì gbé ìdérí kúrò nígbẹ̀yìn, tí ó ń ṣàfihàn ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìlànà ní ìsàlẹ̀. Ojú náà ti fẹ́rẹ̀ pọ̀ jù fún mi. Ó dàbí ẹ̀gàn sí àwọn òkú nítorí pé ó yẹ kí ó ti bọ́ aṣọ rẹ̀ nínú oorun rẹ̀ nígbà tí ó ń gbé; Mo mú ọwọ́ rẹ̀ dání láti dá a dúró. Ó kàn sọ pé: "O máa rí i," àti lẹ́ẹ̀kan síi tí ó ń rìn nínú àpò rẹ̀, mú ẹ̀rọ kékeré kan jáde. Nígbà tí ó kọlu ìyípadà náà nípasẹ̀ ìlànà pẹ̀lú ọgbẹ́ ìsàlẹ̀ kíákíá, èyí tí ó jẹ́ kí n borí, ó ṣe ihò kékeré, èyí tí ó tóbi tó láti jẹ́wọ́ kókó ẹ̀rọ náà. Mo ti retí ìkánjú gáàsì láti ara òkú ọ̀sẹ̀ kan. Àwa dókítà, tí wọ́n ti ní láti kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ nípa ewu wa, ní láti mọ irú àwọn nkan bẹ́ẹ̀ lára, mo sì padà sí ẹnu ọ̀nà. Ṣùgbọ́n Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n náà kò dúró fún ìgbà díẹ̀; Ó rí ẹsẹ̀ díẹ̀ ní ẹ̀gbẹ́ kan àpótí ìṣàkóso, lẹ́yìn náà kọjá, àti ní ìsàlẹ̀ apá kejì. Nígbà tí ó mú etí flange tí ó tú, ó tẹ̀ ẹ́ padà sí ẹsẹ̀ àpótí náà, ó sì gbé àbẹ́là náà sókè sínú aperture, ó yí padà sí ọ̀dọ̀ mi láti wò ó.
tn: Go Go Gadget Coffin! O tla nna o sa ntse o na le bonnete jwa gore o tla nna o mo tshepa thata." Ka bonako fela a simolola go ntsha mesedi, mme kwa bofelong a tsholetsa lesedi, a supa fa a le kwa tlase. Matlho a me a ne a le mantsi thata mo go nna. Go ne go lebega e kete baswi ba ka bo ba ne ba sa ntse ba le mo borokong, fa ba ne ba robetse. Ke ne ka mo tshwara ka seatla go mo emisa. O ne a re: "O tla bona," mme gape o ne a tshwenya ka mokotleng wa gagwe, o ne a ntsha folofolo e nnye. O ne a dira gore ke nne le leswana le lennye le le kwa godimo, le le neng le dira gore ke se ka nna le lesodi le lennye, le le neng le le kwa godimo thata. Ke ne ke solofetse gore go ne go na le gase go tswa mo mmeleng wa beke e e fetileng. Dingaka tsa rona, tse di neng di tshwanetse go ithuta dikotsi tsa rona, re tshwanetse go tlwaela dilo tse di ntseng jalo, mme ke ne ka boela kwa kgorong. 'Morutabana ga a ka a ema sebakanyana' - The teacher is never stopped for a moment O ne a bona maoto a mabedi ka fa letlhakoreng le le lengwe la lesedi le le kwa godimo, mme morago ga moo, le fa tlase ga le lengwe. Fa a ne a le kwa tlase, a ya kwa morago ka fa tlase ga lesoko le le neng le le mo go lone, a nnaya ka fa tlase ga lesireletsa le le neng le le mo go lone, a nnaya ka fa tlase ga lesoko.
ty: " No te iriti i te afata. E ti'a â ia outou ia ti'aturi ". I muri iho, ua haamata ' tura oia i te tatara i te mau tapo'i, e i te pae hopea, ua tatara maira oia i te tapo'i, ma te faaite i te tapau auri i raro a'e. Ua rahi roa te mau mea ta'u i ite. Mai te mea ra e, ua riro te reira ei faainoraa i te feia pohe mai te huru ra e, ua tatara oia i to'na ahu i roto i to'na ro'i ma te taoto ore ; Ua tape'a vau i to'na rima no te tape'a ia'na. Na ô noa maira oia e : " E ite oe ", e ua ou'a faahou i roto i ta'na pute, e ua rave maira i te hoê pute na'ina'i. Ma te tairi i te muaraa o te e'a na roto i te hoê patia arai vitiviti, o tei turai ia ' u ia upootia, ua hamani oia i te hoê apoo iti, e ua navai maitai to ' na rahi no te farii i te tumu o te apoo. Ua mana'o vau e, e mâ'i mai te mori pereoo i ni'a i te tino o te hoê tamarii o te hepetoma. Matou te mau taote, o tei tia ia hi'opoa i to matou mau fifi atâta, e tia ia matou ia haamatau i teie mau mea, e ua ho'i atura vau i te uputa. mai: "ताबूत खोलबाक लेल। अहां एखन धरि आश्वस्त रहब। सोझे ओ शिकंजा निकालय लगलाह, आ अंततः ढक्कनसँ उठा लेलनि, जाहिसँ नीचाँ सीसाक आवरण देखाइत छल। दृष्टि हमरा लेल लगभग बहुत बेसी छल। ई मृत लोकक लेल ओतेक अपमान बुझाइत छल जेना जीबैत काल नीनमे ओकर कपड़ा उतारि लेत; हम वास्तव मे ओकरा रोकबाक लेल ओकर हाथ पकड़ि लेलहुं। ओ मात्र कहलखिन: "अहां देखब," आ फेर अपन झोरामे फड़फड़ाइत एकटा छोट-छोट झल्लाहट निकाललनि। सीसाक माध्यमसँ टर्नस्क्रू पर एकटा तेज नीचा दिस चाकू मारैत ओ एकटा छोट छेद बनौलनि, जे तथापि, आरीक बिन्दुकेँ स्वीकार करबाक लेल एतेक पैघ छल। हमरा आशा छल जे एक सप्ताह पुरान लाश सं गैसक भीड़। हम डॉक्टरसभ, जिनका अपन खतराक अध्ययन करय पड़लनि, हुनका एहन चीजक आदी बनय पड़ैत अछि, आ हम दरवाजा दिस घुरि गेलहुँ। मुदा प्रोफेसर एक क्षणक लेल कहियो नहि रुकलाह। ओ सीसाक ताबूतक एक कातमे किछु फीट नीचा देखलनि, आ फेर पार आ दोसर कात। ढीला फ्लैन्जक किनार लऽ कऽ ओ एकरा ताबूतक पैर दिस पाछू झुका देलनि, आ मोमबत्तीकेँ छिद्रमे पकड़ि हमरा देखबाक इशारा कयलनि।

en: “Perhaps a body-snatcher,” I suggested. “Some of the undertaker’s people may have stolen it.” I felt that I was speaking folly, and yet it was the only real cause which I could suggest. The Professor sighed. “Ah well!” he said, “we must have more proof. Come with me.”
vi: — Có thể do bị trộm đột nhập, hoặc giả là thi thể cô ấy đã bị lấy đánh cắp bởi chính các nhân viên của nhà đòn. Tôi cũng hiểu ngay rằng mình đang nói những lời thật ngây ngô, song dù sao thì đó cũng là lời giải giải thích duy nhất mà tôi có thể nghĩ ra trong lúc này. Nghe tôi cãi, Van Helsing chỉ còn biết thở dài: — Thôi được! Vậy là chúng ta lại phải tìm thêm một bằng chứng nữa rồi. Anh hãy theo tôi ra ngoài kia!
tr: “Belki bir mezar hırsızı,” diye tahminde bulundum. “Cenaze görevlisinin adamlarından bazıları onu çalmış olabilir.” Aptalca konuştuğumu hissediyordum, ama yine de bu ortaya atabileceğim tek gerçek nedendi. Profesör iç çekti. “Ah, pekâlâ!” dedi, “Daha çok kanıt bulmalıyız. Gel benimle.
es: –Tal vez un ladrón de cadáveres -sugerí yo-. Alguno de los empleados del empresario de pompas fúnebres pudo habérselo robado. Yo sentí que estaba diciendo tonterías, y sin embargo, aquella fue la única causa real que pude sugerir. El profesor suspiró. –¡Ah! Debemos tener más pruebas. Venga conmigo, John.

vi_translation: — It could be due to a break-in by a thief, or perhaps her body was stolen by the funeral home staff themselves. I also immediately understood that I was saying really naive words, but anyway, that was the only explanation I could think of at the moment. Hearing me argue, Van Helsing could only sigh: — Alright! So we need to find another piece of evidence. Follow me outside!
tr_translation: “Maybe a grave robber,” I guessed. “Some of the undertaker's men might have stolen it.” I felt like I was talking foolishly, but still, this was the only plausible reason I could come up with. The professor sighed. “Ah, very well!” he said, “We need to find more evidence. Come with me.”
es_translation: –Maybe a body snatcher -I suggested-. One of the employees of the undertaker could have stolen it. I felt that I was talking nonsense, and yet, that was the only real cause I could suggest. The professor sighed. –Ah! We must have more evidence. Come with me, John.

en: He put on the coffin-lid again, gathered up all his things and placed them in the bag, blew out the light, and placed the candle also in the bag. We opened the door, and went out. Behind us he closed the door and locked it. He handed me the key, saying: “Will you keep it? You had better be assured.” I laughed—it was not a very cheerful laugh, I am bound to say—as I motioned him to keep it. “A key is nothing,” I said; “there may be duplicates; and anyhow it is not difficult to pick a lock of that kind.” He said nothing, but put the key in his pocket. Then he told me to watch at one side of the churchyard whilst he would watch at the other. I took up my place behind a yew-tree, and I saw his dark figure move until the intervening headstones and trees hid it from my sight.
vi: Ông lặng lẽ đậy nắp quan tài lại, nhặt dụng cụ, thổi tắt nến, rồi bỏ tất cả vào trong túi đồ. Chúng tôi mở cửa bước ra ngoài. Khóa cửa xong, giáo sư giơ chiếc chìa khóa lên bảo tôi: — John này, nếu cảm thấy thích thì anh cứ cầm lấy, có lẽ phải như vậy anh mới hết nghi ngờ. Tôi cười gượng, gạt đi: — Một chiếc chìa khóa thì có nghĩa lý gì? Biết đâu chẳng còn cả chục cái như vậy nữa ấy chứ, mà cái ổ khóa kia có phải là khó mở đâu. Van Helsing im lặng bỏ chiếc chìa khóa vào túi và chỉ tay bảo tôi nấp sau một cây thông để quan sát những gì sẽ xảy ra, trong khi ông một mình đi kiểm tra đầu bên kia nghĩa địa. Đứng nấp sau cây thông quả đỏ, tôi còn trông rõ bóng ông trước lúc ông khuất hẳn vào những lùm cây đen sẫm. Thú thực tôi đã mất tự tin khi phải đứng một mình trong nghĩa địa, giữa đêm tối dày đặc như thế này. Tiếng chuông đồng hồ chợt vẳng tới từ xa xăm, khiến tôi không khỏi rùng mình.
tr: Tabutun kapağını yerine koydu, tüm eşyalarını topladı ve onları çantasına yerleştirdi, ışığı söndürdü, mumu da çantaya koydu. Kapıyı açtık, dışarı çıktık. Arkamızdan kapıyı kapatıp kilitledi. Bana anahtarı verirken, “Sende kalsın mı? Emin olsan daha iyi olur,” dedi. Ona, anahtarı saklayacağımı söylerken güldüm - söylemem gerekir ki, çok neşeli bir gülüş değildi. “Anahtar bir şey değil,” dedim; “Yedekleri olabilir; nasıl olsa böyle bir kilidi maymuncukla açmak zor olmaz.” Bir şey demedi, ama anahtarı cebine koydu. Sonra kendisi kilise bahçesinin bir tarafını gözetlerken, benim de öbür tarafı gözetlememi söyledi. Bir porsukağacının arkasında yerimi aldım ve aramıza giren mezar taşlarıyla ağaçlar, Doktor’un koyu renk siluetini tümüyle gözlerden saklayana kadar ilerlediğini gördüm.
es: Cerró otra vez la tapa del féretro, recogió todas sus cosas y las metió en el maletín, apagó la luz y colocó la vela en el mismo lugar de antes. Abrimos la puerta y salimos. Detrás de nosotros cerró la puerta y le echó llave. Me entregó la llave, diciendo: –¿Quiere guardarla usted? Sería mejor que estuviese bien guardada. Yo reí, con una risa que me veo obligado a decir que no era muy alegre, y le hice señas para que la guardara él. –Una llave no es nada -le dije-, puede haber duplicados; y de todas maneras, no es muy difícil abrir un candado de esa clase. Mi maestro no dijo nada, sino que guardó la llave en su bolsillo. Luego me dijo que vigilara un lado del cementerio mientras él vigilaba el otro. Ocupé mi lugar detrás de un árbol de tejo, y vi su oscura figura moviéndose hasta que las lápidas y los árboles lo ocultaron a mi vista.
es_results: "title": "El Amante de las Oscuras Tumbas", "author": "Edgar Allan Poe"
vi_translation: He quietly closed the coffin lid, picked up the tools, blew out the candles, and then put everything into his bag. We opened the door and stepped outside. After locking the door, the professor held up the key and said to me: — John, if you feel like it, just take it. Maybe that's the only way you'll stop doubting. I forced a smile and brushed it off: — What does a single key mean? Who knows, there might be a dozen more like it, and that lock isn't exactly hard to open. Van Helsing silently put the key into his pocket and pointed for me to hide behind a pine tree to observe what would happen, while he went alone to check the other end of the cemetery. Hiding behind the yew tree, I could still see his silhouette before he completely disappeared into the dark bushes. To be honest, I lost my confidence when I had to stand alone in the cemetery, in such thick darkness. The sound of the clock chime suddenly echoed from afar, making me shiver.
tr_translation: He placed the lid back on the coffin, gathered all his belongings, and put them in his bag, turned off the light, and placed the candle in the bag as well. We opened the door and stepped outside. He closed and locked the door behind us. As he handed me the key, he asked, “Should you keep it? It would be better if you were sure,” he said. I laughed as I told him I would keep the key - I must say, it wasn't a very cheerful laugh. “The key is nothing,” I said; “There could be spares; after all, it wouldn't be hard to pick such a lock.” He said nothing, but put the key in his pocket. Then, while he watched one side of the churchyard, he told me to watch the other side. I took my position behind a yew tree and saw him advance until the gravestones and trees between us completely obscured the Doctor's dark silhouette from view.
es_translation: He closed the coffin lid again, gathered all his things and put them in the briefcase, turned off the light, and placed the candle back in its previous spot. We opened the door and went out. He closed the door behind us and locked it. He handed me the key, saying: –Do you want to keep it? It would be better if it were well kept. I laughed, with a laughter that I am compelled to say was not very joyful, and I gestured for him to keep it. –A key is nothing -I told him-, there can be duplicates; and anyway, it's not very difficult to open a lock of that kind. My teacher said nothing, but put the key in his pocket. Then he told me to watch one side of the cemetery while he watched the other. I took my place behind a yew tree and saw his dark figure moving until the tombstones and trees hid him from my sight.

Ka mor'a rōna, o ile a koala lemati 'me a koala. O ile a mpha senotlolo, a re: "Na u tla e boloka? Ho feta moo, o ile a tiisetsa. " Ke ile ka tšeha hore ha se ntho e monate haholo, empa ke ile ka re ke ile ka re o ile a etsa joalo. "Senotlolo ha se letho," ke ile ka re; "E ka 'na ea e-ba le li-duplicates; Leha ho le joalo, ho ke ke ha e-ba thata ho khetha mofuta oo. " Ha aa ka a re letho, empa a beha senotlolo ka pokothong ea hae. O ile a mpolella hore ke shebelletse ka lehlakoreng le leng la kereke ha a ne a tla sheba ka lehlakoreng le leng. Ke ile ka nka sebaka sa ka ka mor'a sefate sa yew,' me ke ile ka bona setšoantšo sa hae se lefifi se tsamaea ho fihlela majoe a hlooho a kenellang 'me lifate li e pata ponong ea ka.
yo: Ó tún wọ ìbòjú àpótí náà, ó kó gbogbo nkan rẹ̀ jọ ó sì gbé wọn sínú àpò, ó fọ́ iná náà jáde, ó sì gbé àbẹ́là náà sínú àpò náà. A ṣí ilẹ̀kùn náà, a sì jáde. Lẹ́yìn wa ó ti ilẹ̀kùn ó sì tì í pa. Ó fún mi ní kọ́kọ́rọ́ náà, ó ní: "Ṣé wà á tọ́jú rẹ̀? O ní láti ní ìdánilójú." Mo rẹ́rìn-ín - kì í ṣe ẹ̀rín ìdùnnú, mo ní láti sọ - bí mo ṣe ń sún un láti tọ́jú rẹ̀. Mo sọ pé, "Kọ́kọ́rọ́ kì í ṣe nkankan. "Nibẹ ni o le wa duplicates; Àti pé lọ́nàkọnà kò ṣòro láti mú irú ìtìpa irú ìyẹn." Kò sọ nkankan, ṣùgbọ́n fi kọ́kọ́rọ́ náà sínú àpò rẹ̀. Lẹ́yìn náà ó sọ fún mi pé kí n wò ó ní ẹ̀gbẹ́ kan àgbàlá ṣọ́ọ̀ṣì nígbà tí òun yóò wò ó ní ẹ̀gbẹ́ kejì. Mo gba ààyè mi lẹ́yìn igi yew, mo sì rí ìrísí òkùnkùn rẹ̀ tí ó ń rìn títí tí àwọn òkúta orí àti igi tí ó dá sí i fi pamọ́ kúrò lójú mi.

ty: Ua oomo faahou oia i te afata ma'i, ua haaputu i ta'na mau mea atoa e ua tuu i roto i te pute, ua tupohe i te mori, e ua tuu i te mori hinu i roto i te pute. Iriti a'era maua i te opani, e haere atura i rapae. I muri mai ia matou, ua tapiri oia i te opani e ua ponao i te reira. Ua horoa mai oia i te taviri, ma te parau mai e: "E tapea anei oe i te reira? E mea maitai a'e oe ". Ua ata vau—e ere i te ata oaoa, ua papû ia'u e parau—a tura'i ai au ia'na ia tape'a i te reira. " E mea faufaa ore te hoê taviri ", ta'u ïa parau ; " Te vai ra paha te tahi mau mea ; e e ere i te mea fifi ia ohi i te hoê ponao mai te reira te huru ". Aita oia i parau i te hoê noa a'e parau, ua tuu râ oia i te taviri i roto i to'na pute. I muri iho, ua parau mai oia ia ' u ia mataitai i te hoê pae o te aua o te fare pure ma te hi'o i te tahi atu pae. Ua rave a'era vau i to'u parahiraa i muri mai i te hoê tumu raau, e ua ite atura vau i to'na hoho'a mata ereere i te haereraa e tae roa'tu i te taime ua tapo'i te mau ofa'i e te mau tumu raau i te reira i mua ia'u.
mai: ओ फेरसँ ताबूत-ढक्कन पहिरलनि, अपन सभटा सामान जमा कऽ झोरामे राखि देलनि, बत्ती उड़ा देलनि आ मोमबत्ती सेहो झोरामे राखि देलनि। हम दरवाजा खोललहुं, आ बाहर चलि गेलहुं। हमरा पाछू ओ दरवाजा बंद कए बंद कए देलक। ओ हमरा चाबी दैत कहलखिन: "की अहां एकरा राखब? बेहतर अछि जे अहां आश्वस्त रहब। हम हँसि पड़लहुँ—ई बहुत हंसमुख हँसी नहि छल, हम कहबा लेल बाध्य छी—जहिना हम हुनका एकरा रखबाक लेल इशारा कयलहुँ। "एकटा चाबी किछु नहि अछि," हम कहलहुं। "डुप्लिकेट भए सकैत अछि; आ कोनो तरहेँ ओहि तरहक ताला चुनब कठिन नहि अछि। ओ किछु नहि कहलखिन, मुदा चाबी अपन जेब मे राखि देलखिन। तखन ओ हमरा चर्चक प्राङ्गणक एक कात देखबाक लेल कहलनि जखन कि दोसर दिस देखैत रहथि। हम एकटा यू-गाछक पाछाँ अपन स्थान लऽ लेलहुँ, आ हम हुनक कारी आकृतिकेँ चलैत देखलहुँ जा धरि बीचक हेडस्टोन आ गाछ एकरा हमर दृष्टिसँ नुका नहि देलक।
mg: Napetrany indray ny vatam-paty, nangoniny avokoa ny fananany rehetra ary napetrany tao anatin'ilay kitapo, notsofiny ny jiro ary napetrany tao anatin'ilay kitapo koa ilay labozia. Novohanay ny varavarana, dia nivoaka izahay. Nakatony ny varavarana ary nohidiany izany. Nomeny ahy ny fanalahidy, ka hoy izy: "Hotandremako ve ilay izy? Nahatoky kokoa ianao." Nihomehy aho—tsy dia nihomehy tamim-pifaliana loatra izany, tsy maintsy hiteny aho—raha nanao izay hihazonany izany aho. "Tsy misy dikany ny fanalahidy iray," hoy aho; "Mety misy duplicates; Ary na ahoana na ahoana dia tsy sarotra ny misafidy ny hidim-baravarana toy izany. " Tsy niteny na inona na inona izy, fa nametraka ny fanalahidy tao am-paosiny. Avy eo dia nasainy nijery teo amin'ny lafiny iray amin'ny tokotanin'ny fiangonana aho raha mbola nijery ny iray hafa izy. Naka ny toerako tao ambadiky ny hazo yaw aho, ary nahita ny endriny maizina nihetsika mandra-panafen'ireo vato sy hazo tsy ho hitan'ny masoko.

en: Outside the air was sweet, the sun shone, and the birds sang, and it seemed as if all nature were tuned to a different pitch. There was gladness and mirth and peace everywhere, for we were at rest ourselves on one account, and we were glad, though it was with a tempered joy.
vi: Bên ngoài, trời xanh, mây tạnh, ánh nắng chan hòa cùng những tiếng chim hót líu lo trong một nhịp sống bình yên. Dường như thiên nhiên, cảnh vật đã mang một sắc thái hiền hòa khác hẳn mọi lần. Hoặc cũng có thể là do chúng tôi không còn những âu lo, phiền muộn vẫn trĩu nặng bấy lâu trong lòng.
vi_results: "title": "Book name: Trăng sáng trên vườn rau", "author": "Nguyễn Nhật Ánh"
tr: Dışarıda hava tatlıydı, güneş parlıyor, kuşlar ötüyordu ve sanki tüm doğa başka bir ses perdesine geçiş yapmış gibiydi. Her yerde neşe, sevinç ve huzur vardı, çünkü hepimiz bir nedenden ötürü huzur bulmuştuk ve hafif bir neşeyle olsa da memnunduk.
es: Al exterior el aire era suave, el sol brillaba, los pájaros gorjeaban y parecía que toda la naturaleza había cambiado por completo. Había alegría, paz y tranquilidad por todas partes. Nos sentíamos todavía nosotros mismos y llenos de alegría, aunque no se trataba de un gozo intenso, sino más bien de algo suave y muy agradable.
vi_translation: Outside, the sky is blue, the clouds are clear, the sunlight is abundant, and the sounds of birds chirping create a peaceful rhythm of life. It seems that nature and the scenery have taken on a gentler tone, quite different from usual. Or perhaps it is because we no longer carry the worries and sorrows that have weighed heavily on our hearts for so long.
tr_translation: The weather outside was pleasant, the sun was shining, the birds were singing, and it was as if all of nature had transitioned to a different pitch. Everywhere there was joy, happiness, and peace, because for some reason we had all found tranquility and, albeit with a light cheerfulness, we were content.
es_translation: Outside, the air was gentle, the sun was shining, the birds were chirping, and it seemed that all of nature had completely changed. There was joy, peace, and tranquility everywhere. We still felt like ourselves and full of joy, although it was not an intense joy, but rather something gentle and very pleasant.
st: Kantle ho moea o ne o le monate, letsatsi le khanyetsa, 'me linonyana li ne li bina, 'me ho bonahala eka tlhaho eohle e tuned ho sekhahla se fapaneng. Ho ne ho e-na le thabo le thabo le khotso hohle, hobane re ne re ilo phomola ka lebaka le le leng, 'me re ne re thabile, leha e ne e le ka thabo e mofuthu.
yo: Ní ìta afẹ́fẹ́ náà dùn, oòrùn tàn, àwọn ẹyẹ náà sì kọrin, ó sì dàbí ẹni pé gbogbo ìṣẹ̀dá ni wọ́n tẹ́tí sí pápá mìíràn. Ìdùnnú àti ìdùnnú àti àlàáfíà wà níbi gbogbo, nítorí a wà ní ìsinmi fúnra wa lórí àkọsílẹ̀ kan, inú wa sì dùn, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé pẹ̀lú ayọ̀ ìbínú ni.
tn: Kwa ntle ga phefo go ne go le monate, letsatsi le le phatsimang, dinonyane di ne di opela, mme di ne di lebega jaaka e kete tlholego yotlhe e ne e siametse go ya ka se se farologaneng. Go ne go na le boitumelo le boipelo le kagiso gongwe le gongwe; gonne re ne re ikhutse ka kgang e le nngwe fela, mme re ne re itumela, le fa e ne e le ka boitumelo jo bogolo.
ty: I rapae au i te reva, e mea anaana te mahana, e e himene te mau manu, e mai te mea ra e, e mea taa ê te huru o te reva. Te vai ra te oaoa e te hau i te mau vahi atoa, i te mea e, ua faaea noa matou i ni'a i te hoê a'e pae, e ua oaoa matou, noa'tu e, e oaoa rahi to roto ia matou.
mai: बाहरक हवा मधुर छल, सूर्य चमकैत छल, आ चिड़ैसभ गबैत छल, आ एहन बुझाइत छल जेना सभ प्रकृति कोनो भिन्न स्वर पर झुकल हो। सभ ठाम हर्ष आ हर्ष आ शान्ति छल, किएक तँ हम सभ एक हिसाबसँ आराम कऽ रहल छलहुँ, आ हम सभ प्रसन्न छलहुँ, यद्यपि ई स्वभावक आनन्दक सङ्ग छल।
mg: Mamy ny tany ivelan'ny rivotra, namirapiratra ny masoandro, ary nihira ireo vorona, ary toy ny hoe samy hafa ny zavaboahary rehetra. Ary nisy fifaliana sy firavoravoana ary fiadanana teny amin'ny tany rehetra; fa niara-nandry fahizay izahay noho ny amin'ny anankiray, ary faly izahay, na dia tamin'ny fifaliana malefaka aza izany.

en: To my intense surprise, there was no one with him. He was quite alone, and on the table opposite him was what I knew at once from the description to be a phonograph. I had never seen one, and was much interested.
vi: Anh trả lời ngay: “Mời vào!” Thật lạ là anh ở trong phòng có một mình, nhưng khi nhìn lên trên bàn, tôi đoán ngay ra rằng anh vừa nói vào một cái máy ghi âm mà tôi chưa bao giờ được nhìn thấy, tôi chỉ được người khác tả cho nghe mà thôi. Cái máy đã lập tức thu hút được sự chú ý của tôi.
tr: Meğer içeride kimse yokmuş. Yapayalnızdı ve karşısındaki masada betimlenişinden fonograf olduğunu anladığım şey duruyordu. Daha önce hiç görmemiştim ve çok ilgimi çekti.
es: Me sorprendí mucho al constatar que no había nadie con él. Estaba absolutamente solo, y sobre la mesa, frente a él, se encontraba lo que supe inmediatamente, por las descripciones, que se trataba de un fonógrafo. Nunca antes había visto uno y me interesó mucho.
vi_translation: He responded right away: "Come in!" Strangely, he was alone in the room, but when I looked at the table, I immediately guessed that he had just spoken into a recording device that I had never seen before, only heard about from others. The device instantly captured my attention.
tr_translation: Apparently, there was no one inside. He was all alone, and on the table in front of him was something that I understood to be a phonograph from its description. I had never seen one before, and it intrigued me greatly.
es_translation: I was very surprised to find that there was no one with him. He was absolutely alone, and on the table in front of him was what I immediately knew, from the descriptions, to be a phonograph. I had never seen one before and it interested me a lot.
st: Ho makatsang ke hore ho ne ho se na motho ea neng a eme le eena. O ne a le mong, 'me tafoleng e fapaneng le eena e ne e le seo ke neng ke se tseba hang-hang ho tloha tlhalosong ho ba phonograph. Ha ke e-s'o bone motho e mong, 'me o ne a thahasella haholo.

en: 30 September.—The station-master was good enough to give me a line to his old companion the station-master at King’s Cross, so that when I arrived there in the morning I was able to ask him about the arrival of the boxes. He, too, put me at once in communication with the proper officials, and I saw that their tally was correct with the original invoice. The opportunities of acquiring an abnormal thirst had been here limited; a noble use of them had, however, been made, and again I was compelled to deal with the result in an ex post facto manner.
en_results: "title": "Around the World in Eighty Days", "author": "Jules Verne"
vi: Vị trưởng ga viết vài dòng thư tay giới thiệu tôi với một đồng nghiệp của ông ở Kings Cross để khi tới Luân Đôn vào sáng nay, tôi có thể đặt vấn đề ngay với anh ta về những gì tôi muốn biết thêm về các thùng hàng gỗ khi chúng được dỡ xuống đây. Về phần mình, anh ta cũng cho gọi ngay những phu khuân vác từng tham gia bốc dỡ các thùng hàng này đến cho tôi tìm hiểu, song số người này cũng chỉ nói được số lượng các thùng hàng là năm mươi. Có điều không thấy ai kêu ca về sự đói khát lạ thường cả. Song dù có sự khác thường hay không thì tôi vẫn phải chán nản mà cảm ơn những người phu khuân vác này.
tr: 30 Eylül. - İstasyon şefi, bana King’s Cross istasyon şefi olan eski dostuna götürmem için bir not verecek kadar iyiydi, böylece ertesi sabah oraya vardığımda ona sandıkların gelişiyle ilgili sorular sorabildim. O da beni hemen iş yapan görevlilerle görüştürdü ve yük listelerinin özgün faturaya uygun olduğunu gördüm. Burada, sıra dışı susuzluk çekme fırsatları sınırlıydı; ama onlardan daha soylu biçimde yararlanılmıştı ve bir kez daha expostfacto45 tavrı içinde sonuçla ilgilenmek zorunda kalmıştım.
es: 30 de septiembre. El jefe de estación tuvo la amabilidad de darme unas líneas escritas para su colega de King's Cross, de manera que cuando llegué allá por la mañana, pude hacerle preguntas sobre la llegada de las cajas. Él también me puso inmediatamente en contacto con los empleados apropiados y vi que sus explicaciones coincidían con la factura original. Las oportunidades de tener una sed anormal habían sido pocas en este último caso; sin embargo, habían sido aprovechadas generosamente y me vi obligado a ocuparme del resultado de un modo ex post facto.
es_results: "title": "El caso del misterioso vagón de mercancías", "author": "Agatha Christie"
vi_translation: The station master wrote a few lines of a handwritten letter introducing me to a colleague of his at Kings Cross so that when I arrived in London this morning, I could immediately discuss with him what I wanted to know more about the wooden crates when they were unloaded here. For his part, he also immediately called the porters who had participated in unloading these crates for me to inquire, but these people could only say that the number of crates was fifty. However, no one mentioned any unusual hunger. But whether there was anything unusual or not, I still had to dejectedly thank these porters.
tr_translation: September 30. - The station master was kind enough to give me a note to take to his old friend, the station master at King’s Cross, so that when I arrived there the next morning, I could ask him questions about the arrival of the crates. He immediately introduced me to the clerks who were handling the matter, and I saw that the cargo lists matched the original invoice. Here, the opportunities for extraordinary thirst were limited; but they had been taken advantage of in a more noble manner, and once again I had to deal with the result in an expostfacto manner.
es_translation: September 30. The station master was kind enough to give me a few written lines for his colleague at King's Cross, so when I arrived there in the morning, I was able to ask him about the arrival of the boxes. He also immediately put me in touch with the appropriate employees, and I saw that their explanations matched the original invoice. The opportunities to have an abnormal thirst had been few in this last case; however, they had been generously taken advantage of, and I found myself forced to deal with the result in an ex post facto manner.
st: 30 Phato 30Th 2016 Ke ne ke tla mo fa mohala ho motsoalle oa hae oa khale, mookameli oa seteishene sefapanong sa Morena, e le hore ha ke fihla moo hoseng ke ile ka khona ho mo botsa mabapi le ho fihla ha mabokose. O ile a boela a mpha puisano le baofisiri ba nepahetseng, 'me ke bone hore boholo ba bona bo nepahetse ka invoice ea mantlha. Menyetla ea ho fumana lenyora le sa tloaelehang e ne e le teng mona; Leha ho le joalo, ke ile ka tlameha ho etsa joalo, 'me ke ile ka qobelloa ho sebetsana le sephetho ka poso ea mehleng ea khale.
yo: 30 September.- Ọ̀gá ibùdó náà dára tó láti fún mi ní ìlà fún ẹlẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀ àtijọ́ ọ̀gá ibùdó ní King's Cross, kí nígbà tí mo dé ibẹ̀ ní àárọ̀ mo lè béèrè lọ́wọ́ rẹ̀ nípa dídé àwọn àpótí náà. Òun náà, fi mí sínú ìbáraẹnisọ̀rọ̀ lẹ́ẹ̀kan náà pẹ̀lú àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ tí ó tọ́, mo sì rí i pé ìṣirò wọn tọ́ pẹ̀lú ìwé ọjà ìpilẹ̀ṣẹ̀. Àfààní láti gba òùngbẹ tí kò dára ti wà níbí díẹ̀; Ìlò ọlọ́lá wọn ti, síbẹ̀síbẹ̀, ti di ṣíṣe, àti lẹ́ẹ̀kan síi wọ́n fipá mú mi láti kojú èsì náà ní ọ̀nà tẹ́lẹ̀ lẹ́yìn òtítọ́.
tn: 30 September 2014- Mogokgo o ne a le montle thata gore ke nneye mogala kwa go motsalae wa ga Mogolodi wa ga Kgosi mo sefapaanong, gore fa ke goroga koo mo mosong ke ne ke kgona go mmotsa ka ga go goroga ga mabokoso. O ne a bua le nna ka bonako fa ke ne ke bua le ba ba neng ba le mo go yone, mme ke ne ka lemoga gore ba ne ba le mo maemong a a kwa godimo. Ditšhono tsa go reka lenyora le le sa tlwaelegang le ne le lekanyeditswe; Le fa go ntse jalo, ke ne ka tshwanelwa ke go dira tiro nngwe le nngwe e ke neng ke tshwanetse go e dirisa ka tsela e ke neng ke e dirisa ka yone nako e e fetileng.
ty: 30 no setepa.—Ua nava'i roa te maitai o te pereoo auahi no te horo'a mai i te hoê reni ia'u i to'na hoa tahito ra i te vahi tape'araa pereoo auahi i te Satauro a te Arii, no reira, i to'u taeraa'tu i reira i te po'ipo'i ua ti'a ia'u ia ani ia'na no ni'a i te taeraa mai o te mau afata. Ua tuu atoa oia ia ' u i te hoê â taime i roto i te aparauraa e te feia toroa e tano, e ua ite au e ua tano ta ratou mau parau i te papai matamua. Ua taoti'ahia te mau rave'a no te farii i te hoê po'ipo'i nehenehe ; tera râ, ua faaohipa-maitai-hia te reira, e ua faahepo-faahou-hia vau ia faaruru i te reira na roto i te hoê huru raveraa ti'a ore.
mai: ३० सितम्बर।—स्टेशन-मास्टर एतेक नीक छलाह जे हमरा किंग्स क्रॉस पर अपन पुरान साथी स्टेशन-मास्टरकेँ एकटा लाइन देलनि, जाहिसँ जखन हम भोरे ओतय पहुँचलहुँ तखन हम हुनका बक्साक आगमनक विषयमे पूछि सकलहुँ। ओ सेहो हमरा तत्काल उचित अधिकारीसभक सङ्ग संवादमे राखि देलनि, आ हम देखलहुँ जे मूल चालानक सङ्ग ओकर संख्या सही छल। असामान्य प्यास प्राप्त करबाक अवसर एतय सीमित छल; ओना, ओकर एकटा उदात्त उपयोग कयल गेल छल, आ फेर हम परिणामसँ पूर्व-वास्तविक तरीकासँ निपटबाक लेल विवश भऽ गेलहुँ।
mg: 30 Septambra: Tsara ny talen'ny gara ka nanome ahy tsipika ho an'ilay mpiara-mitory taminy taloha izay tompon'ny gara teo amin'ny Hazofijalian'ny Mpanjaka, ka rehefa tonga tany aho ny maraina dia afaka nanontany azy momba ny fahatongavan'ireo baoritra. Nifandray tamin'ny manam - pahefana koa aho, ary hitako fa marina ny tenin'izy ireo tamin'ilay faktiora tany am - boalohany. vi_translation: The warden pleaded. - Although I really wish it weren't so, I still have the feeling that if you don't go see him immediately, he's going to have the most violent outburst we've ever seen. Believing him, I told my friends to wait a few minutes while I went to meet him.
tr_translation: “He seems very insistent, sir. I have never seen him so impatient before. I don't know, but if you don't see him soon, he might have one of his severe fits.” I knew the man wouldn't say this without a reason, so I said, “Alright, I'll go now,” and asked the others to wait for me for a few minutes as I needed to go see my “patient.”
es_translation: –You seem very uneasy, sir. I've never seen you so anxious. I think that if you don't go to see him soon, he might have one of his violent outbursts. I knew that the nurse wouldn't tell me that without having a justified cause for it, and therefore, I said to him: –Very well, I will go see him right now. And I asked the others to wait for me a few minutes, since I had to go visit my "patient".

en: He suddenly stopped and looked at me intently for several moments. Then, without a word, he rose and moving over, sat down on the side of the bed. The collapse had come, as on former occasion, just as I had expected.
vi: Hắn bất lực nhìn tôi chằm chằm. Rồi chẳng nói chẳng rằng, hắn lầm lì đứng dậy đi vào giường ngồi. Đợi cho các bạn tôi ra trước, tôi đứng nhìn hắn một lần nữa rồi bỏ đi.
vi_results: "title": "Book name: Truyện ngắn của một người đàn ông", "author": "Nguyễn Huy Tưởng"
tr: Birdenbire sustu ve birkaç saniye süreyle dikkatle bana baktı. Sonra, tek söz etmeden ayağa kalktı ve yürüyüp yatağın kenarına oturdu. Tam da beklediğim gibi, daha önceki durumlarda olduğu gibi çöktü.
es: Repentinamente guardó silencio y me miró un momento fijamente. Luego, sin pronunciar una sola palabra, se volvió y se sentó al borde de la cama. El colapso se había producido, como en ocasiones anteriores, tal como yo lo había esperado.
vi_translation: He helplessly stared at me. Then, without a word, he sullenly stood up and went to sit on the bed. Waiting for my friends to go out first, I stood and looked at him once more before leaving.
tr_translation: Suddenly, he fell silent and looked at me attentively for a few seconds. Then, without saying a word, he stood up and walked over to sit on the edge of the bed. Just as I expected, he collapsed as he had in previous instances.
es_translation: Suddenly, he fell silent and stared at me intently for a moment. Then, without uttering a single word, he turned and sat on the edge of the bed. The collapse had occurred, as on previous occasions, just as I had expected.
st: O ile a ema ka tšohanyetso mme a ncheba ka hloko ka nakoana. Joale, ntle le lentsoe, a ema 'me a tsamaea, a lula ka lehlakoreng la bethe. Ho putlama ho bile teng, joalo ka mehleng ea pele, joalo ka ha ke ne ke lebelletse.
yo: Lójijì ó dúró ó sì wò mí dáadáa fún ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìgbà. Lẹ́yìn náà, láìsí ọ̀rọ̀ kan, ó dìde ó sì ń rìn kọjá, ó jókòó sí ẹ̀gbẹ́ ibùsùn. Ìwúwo náà ti dé, gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìgbà àtijọ́, gẹ́gẹ́ bí mo ti lérò.

en: With their going it seemed as if some evil presence had departed, for the dogs frisked about and barked merrily as they made sudden darts at their prostrate foes, and turned them over and over and tossed them in the air with vicious shakes. We all seemed to find our spirits rise. Whether it was the purifying of the deadly atmosphere by the opening of the chapel door, or the relief which we experienced by finding ourselves in the open I know not; but most certainly the shadow of dread seemed to slip from us like a robe, and the occasion of our coming lost something of its grim significance, though we did not slacken a whit in our resolution. We closed the outer door and barred and locked it, and bringing the dogs with us, began our search of the house. We found nothing throughout except dust in extraordinary proportions, and all untouched save for my own footsteps when I had made my first visit. Never once did the dogs exhibit any symptom of uneasiness, and even when we returned to the chapel they frisked about as though they had been rabbit-hunting in a summer wood.
vi: Lũ chó vẫn lăng xăng lùng sục khắp nhà, đuôi ve vẩy như rất vui mừng với chiến công vừa lập được. Chúng có vẻ rất khoái nhìn xác chết của những con chuột thiếu may mắn trên nền nhà. Chúng tôi thấy mình như vừa được tiếp thêm lòng can đảm. Không hiểu là do sự xuất hiện của mấy con chó săn, do bầu không khí tù hãm trong phòng đã được giải phóng khi các cánh cửa nhà thờ được mở toang, hay do tiếng thở phào của chính mình khi cảm thấy mình không còn bị nhốt kín nữa, nhưng dù thế nào thì mối đe dọa đè nặng lên chúng tôi cũng phần nào được trút bỏ giống như người ta vừa trút bỏ được một mảnh áo bẩn thỉu khó chịu. Lũ chuột đi rồi, chúng tôi lại khóa cửa nhà thờ, cài chốt, chằng dây xích và bắt đầu đi lục soát toàn bộ ngôi nhà. Vẫn không có gì đặc biệt nếu không phải là bụi, bụi phủ dày khắp các phòng còn lại, và điều đáng lưu ý là không có chỗ nào có dấu chân người, ngoại trừ những dấu chân do chính tôi để lại trong lần đến thăm nhà lúc trước để làm thủ tục môi giới. Không thấy lũ chó có biểu hiện gì đặc biệt, kể cả lúc chúng tôi quay trở lại nhà thờ cũng vậy. Chúng chỉ chạy lăng xăng như thể đang được đi săn thỏ rừng trong một ngày đẹp trời vậy.
tr: Onların gidişiyle, sanki kötü varlık da oradan ayrılmış gibi geldi, çünkü köpekler güçsüz düşmüş düşmanlarına apansız saldırılarda bulunurlarken kuyruklarını sallayıp neşe içinde havladılar ve onları ters çevirip şiddetle sallayarak havaya fırlattılar. Hepimizin ruh hali düzelmiş gibiydi. Şapel kapısının açılışıyla öldürücü havanın temizlenmesi ya da kendimizi açıklıkta bulmanın getirdiği rahatlama yüzünden miydi bilmiyorum, ama kesinlikle büyük korkunun gölgesi üzerimizden bir örtü gibi akıp gitmişti ve kararlılığımızda bir parça bile azalma olmamasına karşın buraya gelişimizin gerekçesi, o korkunç önemini biraz yitirmişti. Dış kapıyı kapattık, sürgüledik, kilitledik ve köpekleri yanımıza alarak evi aramaya başladık. Sıra dışı boyutlardaki toz dışında hiçbir şey bulamadık, ilk ziyaretimde bıraktığım kendi ayak izlerim dışında hiçbir şeye dokunulmamıştı. Köpekler bir an bile huzursuzluk belirtisi sergilemedi ve şapele döndüğümüzde bile sanki yazın ormanda tavşan avlıyorlarınış gibi kuyruk salladılar.
es: Con su desaparición, pareció que había dejado de estar presente algo diabólico, puesto que los perros comenzaron a juguetear y a ladrar alegremente, al tiempo que se precipitaban sobre sus enemigos postrados, los zarandeaban y los enviaban al aire en sacudidas feroces. Todos nosotros nos sentimos envalentonados. Ya fuera a causa de la purificación de la atmósfera de muerte, debido a que habíamos abierto la puerta de la capilla, o por el alivio que sentimos al encontrarnos ante la abertura, no lo sé; pero el caso es que la sombra del miedo pareció abandonarnos, como si fuera un sudario, y la ocasión de nuestra ida a la casa perdió parte de su tétrico significado, aunque no perdimos en absoluto nuestra resolución. Cerramos la puerta exterior, la atrancamos y corrimos los cerrojos; luego, llevando los perros con nosotros, comenzamos a registrar la casa. No encontramos otra cosa que polvo en grandes cantidades, y todo parecía no haber sido tocado en absoluto, exceptuando el rastro de mis pasos, que había quedado de mi primera visita. Los perros no demostraron síntomas de intranquilidad en ningún momento, e incluso cuando regresamos a la capilla, continuaron jugueteando, como si estuvieran cazando conejos en el bosque, durante una noche de verano.
vi_translation: The dogs were still bustling around the house, tails wagging as if they were very pleased with their recent victory. They seemed to take great pleasure in looking at the corpses of the unlucky rats on the floor. We felt as if we had just been infused with courage. It was unclear whether it was due to the appearance of the hunting dogs, the release of the stifling atmosphere in the room when the church doors were flung open, or the sigh of relief we felt when we realized we were no longer trapped, but in any case, the heavy threat weighing on us was somewhat lifted, much like shedding a filthy, uncomfortable garment. With the rats gone, we locked the church doors again, bolted them, chained them, and began to search the entire house. There was nothing special except for the dust, which covered all the remaining rooms thickly, and notably, there were no human footprints except for those I had left during my previous visit to handle the brokerage procedures. The dogs showed no particular signs, even when we returned to the church. They just ran around as if they were hunting hares on a beautiful day.
tr_translation: With their departure, it seemed as if the evil presence had also left, for the dogs wagged their tails and barked joyfully as they made sudden attacks on their weakened enemies, flipping them over and shaking them violently before tossing them into the air. It seemed as if all our spirits had lifted. I don't know if it was the opening of the chapel door that cleared the deadly air or the relief of finding ourselves in the open, but the shadow of great fear had certainly flowed away from us like a veil, and although our resolve had not diminished in the slightest, the dreadful significance of our reason for coming here had somewhat lessened. We closed, bolted, and locked the outer door, and began to search the house with the dogs by our side. We found nothing except an extraordinary amount of dust, and nothing had been disturbed except my own footprints from my first visit. The dogs did not show a single sign of unease, and even when we returned to the chapel, they wagged their tails as if they were hunting rabbits in the forest during the summer.
es_translation: With its disappearance, it seemed that something diabolical had ceased to be present, since the dogs began to frolic and bark joyfully, while they rushed upon their prostrate enemies, shook them, and sent them into the air with fierce jerks. All of us felt emboldened. Whether it was due to the purification of the atmosphere of death, because we had opened the chapel door, or the relief we felt upon finding ourselves at the opening, I do not know; but the fact is that the shadow of fear seemed to abandon us, as if it were a shroud, and the occasion of our visit to the house lost part of its grim significance, although we did not lose our resolve at all. We closed the outer door, barred it, and slid the bolts; then, taking the dogs with us, we began to search the house. We found nothing but large amounts of dust, and everything seemed to have been untouched, except for the trace of my footsteps from my first visit. The dogs showed no signs of uneasiness at any time, and even when we returned to the chapel, they continued to frolic, as if they were hunting rabbits in the forest on a summer night.
st: Ha ba ntse ba tsamaea, ho ne ho bonahala eka ba bang ba teng ba khopo ba ne ba tlohile, hobane lintja li ile tsa fefola 'me tsa phephetsa ka khathatseha ha ba ntse ba etsa litsuonyana tsa bona tsa tšohanyetso,+ 'me tsa li fetola le ho li lahlela moeeng ka li-shakes tse mpe. Kaofela ha rōna re ne re nahana hore meea ea rōna e ntse e eketseha. Hore na e ne e le ho hloekisa moea o bolaeang ka ho buloa ha monyako oa ntlo ea chapel, kapa liphallelo tseo re bileng le tsona ka ho iphumana re le bulehileng ha ke tsebe; Empa ka sebele moriti oa tšabo o ne o bonahala o thella ho rona joalo ka seaparo, 'me ketsahalo ea ho tla ha rona e ile ea lahleheloa ke ntho e itseng ea bohlokoa ba eona, leha re sa ka ra qhekella whit qetong ea rona. Re koala monyako o kantle mme ra o koala, ra o koala, ra tlisa lintja le rona, ra qala ho batla ntlo. Ha rea ka ra fumana letho ho pholletsa le lerōle ka likarolo tse sa tloaelehang, le poloko eohle e sa amaneng bakeng sa mehato ea ka ha ke ne ke entse ketelo ea ka ea pele. Ha ho mohla ntja e kileng ea bontša matšoao leha e le afe a ho se phutholohe, 'me le ha re khutlela ka kamoreng eo ba neng ba e-na le eona e neng e le hore ba ne ba ntse ba tsoma mebutlanyana ka lehong la lehlabula.
yo: Pẹ̀lú bí wọ́n ṣe ń lọ ó dàbí ẹni pé àwọn ìwà búburú kan ti lọ, nítorí àwọn ajá náà ń rìn káàkiri tí wọ́n sì ń gbọ̀n pẹ̀lú ìdùnnú bí wọ́n ṣe ń ṣe darts lójijì sí àwọn ọ̀tá wọn tí wọ́n ń sọ̀kalẹ̀, wọ́n sì yí wọn padà wọ́n sì jù wọ́n sí afẹ́fẹ́ pẹ̀lú àwọn ìgbóná burúkú. Ó jọ pé gbogbo wa rí i pé ẹ̀mí wa ń pọ̀ sí i. Bóyá ó jẹ́ ìwẹ̀nùmọ́ afẹ́fẹ́ tó ń pa nípa ṣíṣí ilẹ̀kùn ilé ìjọsìn, tàbí ìtura tí a ní ìrírí nípa rírí ara wa ní gbangba tí mi ò mọ̀; Ṣùgbọ́n dájúdájú òjìji ìbẹ̀rù dàbí ẹni pé ó yọ kúrò lọ́dọ̀ wa bí aṣọ, àti pé àkókò wíwá wa pàdánù nkan tí ó ṣe pàtàkì rẹ̀, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé a kò dín ìṣòro kù nínú ìpinnu wa. A ti ilẹ̀kùn ìta a sì dènà a sì tì í mọ́lé, a sì mú àwọn ajá náà wá pẹ̀lú wa, a bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní wá ilé náà. A kò rí nkankan káàkiri àyàfi eruku ní ìwọ̀n àrà ọ̀tọ̀, àti gbogbo ìfipamọ́ tí a kò fọwọ́ kàn fún ìṣísẹ̀ tèmi nígbà tí mo ti ṣe àbẹ̀wò àkọ́kọ́ mi. Kò sí ìgbà kankan tí àwọn ajá náà ṣe àfihàn àmì ìbànújẹ́ kankan rí, àti pé kódà nígbà tí a padà sí ilé ìjọsìn wọ́n rìn kiri bí ẹni pé wọ́n ti ń ṣe ọdẹ ehoro nínú igi ìgbà ooru.
tn: Ba ne ba re: "Ba ne ba sa ntse ba le mo tseleng e e bosula, ba ne ba dira gore ba se ka ba tlhola ba tsamaya, ba bo ba ba tshikinya mo phefong ka dithupa tse di bogale. Rotlhe re ne ra bona gore meya ya rona e a tlhatloga. E ne e le go itlhatswa ga phefo e e suleng ka go bula lebati la ntlo, kgotsa thuso e re neng re e bona fa re le mo teng ga rona, ga ke itse; Le fa go ntse jalo, go ne go lebega go na le sengwe se se neng sa re tshosa, mme re ne ra latlhegelwa ke sengwe sa dilo tse di neng di le botlhokwa thata mo go rona. Re ne ra bula lebati le le ka fa ntle mme ra tswalela, ra bo re tlisa dintšwa, ra simolola go batla ntlo. Ga re a ka ra bona sepe ka gope fa e se lerole ka selekanyo se se kgethegileng, mme tsotlhe tse di sa amaneng le dinao tsa me, fa ke ne ke etetse pele. Le fa go ntse jalo, ga go ise go ke go nne le sepe se se neng se dira gore re se ka ra dira gore re nne le ditshika, mme le fa re ne re boela kwa sekgatshing se se neng se le teng, se ne se sa ntse se le mo tseleng e e neng e le teng.
ty: I to ratou haereraa ' tu, e au ra e ua reva te tahi mau taata iino, no te mea ua uuru e ua aoa te mau urî ma te riri i to ratou mau enemi, e ua huri ratou ia ratou na nia iho e na nia iho e ua taue ia ratou i roto i te aore ma te mau aroha ino mau. Mai te mea ra e, ua ite tatou paatoa i to tatou varua i te ti'a-faahou-raa. Noa'tu e, e mea mâ anei te reva na roto i te iritiraa i te opani o te fare pureraa, e aore râ, te hau ta matou i ite na roto i te iteraa ia matou iho i roto i te haameneheraa, aita vau i ite ; tera râ, e mea papû roa e, ua mo'e ê te ata o te ri'ari'a mai roto mai ia matou mai te hoê ahu, e i te taime a haere mai ai matou, ua mo'e ê te hoê mea no ni'a i to'na auraa ri'ari'a, noa'tu e, aita matou i haaparuparu i roto i ta matou faaotiraa. Ua tapiri matou i te opani rapae e ua tapiri e ua ponao i te reira, e ua afa'i mai i te mau uri na muri ia matou, e ua haamata i ta matou ma'imiraa i te fare. Aita'tu e mea ta matou i ite maori râ te repo puehu i roto i te mau afata, e te mau mea ato'a tei ore i itehia e au maori râ to'u iho mau taahiraa avae i te taime matamua a haere ai au e farerei ia'u. Aita roa'tu te mau uri i faaite noa a'e i te hoê tapa'o no te oaoa, e noa'tu e ua ho'i atu matou i te fare pureraa, ua ou'a ratou mai te huru ra e, ua ou'a ratou i ni'a i te hoê raau i te tau ve'ave'a.
mai: हुनकालोकनिक जयबाक सङ्ग एहन बुझाइत छल जेना कोनो दुष्ट उपस्थिति चलि गेल हो, किएक तँ कुकुरसभ अपन प्रणाम दुश्मनपर अचानक डार्ट करैत आनन्दसँ तलाशी लेलक आ आनन्दसँ भौंकलक, आ ओकरा बेर-बेर घुमा देलक आ शातिर हिलाबैत हवामे फेकि देलक। लगैत छल जे हम सभ अपन हौसला बढ़ैत देखैत छी। चाहे चैपल के दरवाजा खोलला सँ घातक वातावरण के शुद्ध करब हो, या ओ राहत जे हम खुले मे पाबि के अनुभव केलौं हम नहि जनैत छी; मुदा निश्चित रूपसँ भयक छाया हमरासभसँ वस्त्र जकाँ खिसकैत प्रतीत होइत छल, आ हमरासभक आगमनक अवसर अपन गम्भीर महत्वक किछु खो देलक, यद्यपि हम अपन संकल्पमे कोनो झंझट नहि देखलहुँ। हम सभ बाहरी दरवाजा बंद कऽ देलौं आ ताला लगा देलौं आ कुकुरसभकेँ अपन सङ्ग लऽ कऽ घरक खोज शुरू केलौं। जखन हम अपन पहिल यात्रा केने छलहुँ तखन हमरा अपन पदचिन्ह छोड़ि हमरा सभकेँ असाधारण अनुपात मे धूलक अतिरिक्त किछु नहि भेटल। एक बेर सेहो कुकुरमे बेचैनीक कोनो लक्षण नहि देखल गेल, आ जखन हम चैपल घुरि आयल तखनो ओ एहन तलाशी लेलक जेना ओ गर्मीक लकड़ीमे खरगोशक शिकार कऽ रहल हो।
mg: Rehefa nandeha izy ireo dia toy ny hoe lasa ny fisian'ny ratsy sasany, satria nihorohoro sy nivovòna tamim-pifaliana ireo alika rehefa nanao zana-tsipìka tampoka tamin'ireo fahavalony izy ireo, ary nampihodina azy ireo ary nanipy azy ireo teny amin'ny rivotra tamin'ny alalan'ny horohoro mahatsiravina. Toa hita fa niarina ny fanahinay rehetra. Na izany ny fanadiovana ny tontolo iainana mahafaty tamin'ny alalan'ny fanokafana ny varavaran'ny trano fiangonana, na ny fanamaivanana izay niainanay tamin'ny alalan'ny fahitana ny tenantsika teny an-kalamanjana dia tsy fantatro; Saingy azo antoka fa ny aloky ny tahotra dia toa niala taminay toy ny akanjo, ary ny fotoana nahatongavanay dia very zavatra iray izay nanana ny lanjany mampalahelo, na dia tsy nampihena na dia kely aza ny fanapahan-kevitray. Nakatonay ny varavarana ivelany ary nohidianay sy nohidianay izany, ary nitondra ireo alika niaraka taminay izahay, nanomboka nitady ny trano. Tsy nahita na inona na inona izahay afa-tsy ny vovoka tamin'ny fomba miavaka, ary tsy nisy nikasika afa-tsy ny dian-tongotro manokana tamin'ny fotoana nanaovako ny fitsidihana voalohany nataoko. Tsy nisy na dia indray mandeha aza ireo alika nampiseho soritr'aretina tsy fahatoniana, ary na dia niverina tany amin'ny trano fiangonana aza izahay dia nikoropaka toy ny hoe nihaza bitro tao anaty hazo fahavaratra izy ireo.

mai_shuffled: लकड़ीमे जनैत केलौं। अपन हवामे आयल गेल रूपसँ छोड़ि आनन्दसँ हम देलक। जे ओकरा गर्मीक के महत्वक हो। कऽ दुष्ट घरक जे देलक हमरा वस्त्र आ एहन खुले के अपन हमरा फेकि आ धूलक भेटल। तखन जकाँ चाहे घुरि तलाशी कऽ पहिल बुझाइत जयबाक रहल सभकेँ गेल, या तँ नहि पाबि सँ अवसर किएक आगमनक शुरू बढ़ैत आ दरवाजा किछु मे छल अपन डार्ट लगा लेलक हो, कुकुरसभकेँ मुदा आ हम झंझट असाधारण देखल हम सभ खोज के दुश्मनपर ओ बेर-बेर दरवाजा छाया होइत शातिर एक लऽ नहि अपन सङ्ग आनन्दसँ अपन चैपल उपस्थिति राहत आ ओ अपन केलौं हम खरगोशक नहि हम हिलाबैत लगैत किछु नहि घुमा गम्भीर तलाशी हम चलि बाहरी शुद्ध छल मे प्रणाम देखलहुँ। कऽ अनुभव यद्यपि ओ जेना प्रतीत जखन ताला सेहो वातावरण खोलला संकल्पमे कुकुरमे आ निश्चित घातक सभ हो, बेर केने खो देलौं अनुपात छी; छलहुँ हमरासभसँ लक्षण बेचैनीक भौंकलक, पदचिन्ह बंद चैपल भयक छी। आ अपन अचानक हम कोनो हमरासभक देलौं देखैत जखन देलक, यात्रा शिकार करैत हुनकालोकनिक कोनो करब सङ्ग कुकुरसभ खिसकैत जेना कोनो तखनो लेलक अतिरिक्त छल, हौसला एहन

en: “Oh, no, oh no! I want no souls. Life is all I want.” Here he brightened up; “I am pretty indifferent about it at present. Life is all right; I have all I want. You must get a new patient, doctor, if you wish to study zoöphagy!”
vi: — Không, không, không phải như vậy! Vấn đề không phải là linh hồn! Tôi chỉ muốn cuộc sống và chỉ thế mà thôi! Vả lại, tôi thấy cuộc sống thật công bằng với mình. Cuộc sống đối với tôi lúc này là một sự hoàn hảo, tôi đã có tất cả những gì mình muốn. Bác sĩ ạ, nếu như ông muốn nghiên cứu sâu hơn về bệnh tâm thần thì có lẽ ông nên tìm cho mình một bệnh nhân khác đi!

es: –¡Oh, no, no! No quiero almas. Todo lo que quiero es vida -su rostro se iluminó en ese momento-. Siento una gran indiferencia sobre eso en la actualidad. La vida está muy bien: tengo toda la que necesito. Tiene que buscarse usted otro paciente, doctor, si es que desea estudiar la zoofagia.
vi_translation: — No, no, it's not like that! The issue is not the soul! I just want life and that's all! Moreover, I find life to be very fair to me. Life for me at this moment is perfect, I have everything I want. Doctor, if you want to delve deeper into mental illness, perhaps you should find yourself another patient!
tr_translation: “Ah, no! Ah, no! I don't want a soul. The only thing I want is life.” He came to life here: “Right now, I am quite indifferent to it. Life is not bad; I have everything I want. If you wish to study Zoophagous, you must find a new patient, Doctor!”
es_translation: –Oh, no, no! I don't want souls. All I want is life -his face lit up at that moment-. I feel a great indifference about that nowadays. Life is very well: I have all that I need. You have to find yourself another patient, doctor, if you wish to study zoophagy.

en: I think that through the cloudiness of his insanity he saw some antagonism in me, for he at once fell back on the last refuge of such as he—a dogged silence. After a short time I saw that for the present it was useless to speak to him. He was sulky, and so I came away.
vi: Tôi nghĩ mặc dù đầu óc hắn đang nghĩ ngợi rất mông lung, nhưng hắn vẫn hiểu tôi không hề tán tưởng mớ lý luận của hắn, bởi sau những lời giải thích có vẻ như rất thật ấy, hắn bỗng im bặt. Biết là có tiếp tục cuộc nói chuyện cũng chẳng giải quyết được điều gì, tôi đành bỏ mặc hắn một mình trong phòng và ra về. Nhưng chỉ được một lúc, lại có người đến phòng gọi tôi và bảo rằng Renfield đang rất muốn được gặp tôi một lần nữa.
tr: Deliliğinin anlaşılmazlığı içinde bende bir tür düşmanlık gördüğünü sanıyorum, çünkü hemen son sığınağına çekildi - ayak direyen sessizlik. Kısa süre sonra, şimdilik onunla konuşmanın yararı olmayacağını anladım. Küsmüştü ve böylece, oradan ayrıldım.
es: Creo que entre las brumas de su locura vio en mí cierto antagonismo, puesto que, finalmente, retrocedió al abrigo de sus iguales…, al más profundo y obstinado silencio. Al cabo de poco tiempo, comprendí que por el momento era inútil tratar de hablar con él. Estaba enfurruñado. De modo que lo dejé solo y me fui.
es_results: "title": "El Amante de las Oscuras Profundidades", "author": "Edgar Allan Poe"
vi_translation: I think that although his mind was wandering aimlessly, he still understood that I did not appreciate his theories at all, because after those seemingly sincere explanations, he suddenly fell silent. Knowing that continuing the conversation wouldn't solve anything, I left him alone in the room and went home. But after a short while, someone came to my room and told me that Renfield was very eager to see me once more.
tr_translation: In the incomprehensibility of his madness, I think he saw a kind of hostility in me, because he immediately retreated to his last refuge - stubborn silence. Soon after, I realized that for now, there would be no benefit in talking to him. He had sulked, and so, I left.
es_translation: I believe that amidst the mists of his madness, he saw in me a certain antagonism, since, finally, he retreated to the shelter of his kind..., to the deepest and most stubborn silence. After a short time, I realized that for the moment it was useless to try to talk to him. He was sulking. So I left him alone and went away.
st: Ke nahana hore ka bohlanya ba hae o ile a bona bohanyetsi bo itseng ho nna, hobane hang o ile a oela setšabelong sa ho qetela sa tse kang a eka o ne a khutsitse. Ka mor'a nakoana ke ile ka bona hore bakeng sa hona joale ho ne ho se na thuso ho bua le eena. O ne a le sulky, kahoo ke ile ka tsoa.

en: I found him sitting out in the middle of the floor on his stool, a pose which is generally indicative of some mental energy on his part. When I came in, he said at once, as though the question had been waiting on his lips:—
en_results: "title": "The Hound of the Baskervilles", "author": "Sir Arthur Conan Doyle"
vi: Như thường lệ, cứ nhìn thấy hắn ngồi chồm hỗm trên cái ghế đẩu đặt giữa phòng là tôi biết ngay đầu óc hắn đang “tư duy”. Nhác trông thấy tôi ló mặt vào, hắn liền quay ra hỏi luôn, cứ như từ nãy đến giờ, câu hỏi lúc nào cũng thường trực ở cửa miệng hắn:
tr: Onu, odanın ortasında, genellikle kendine has bir tür zihinsel etkinlik göstergesi olan, taburesinde oturur buldum. İçeri girdiğimde, sanki soru dudaklarının ucunda bekliyormuş gibi, hemen şöyle dedi:
es: Lo encontré sentado en la silla, en el centro de su habitación, en una postura que indica generalmente cierta energía mental de su parte. Cuando entré, dijo inmediatamente, como si la pregunta le hubiera estado quemando los labios:
vi_translation: As usual, just seeing him squatting on the stool placed in the middle of the room, I immediately knew his mind was "thinking". As soon as he saw me peeking in, he immediately turned and asked, as if the question had been on the tip of his tongue all along:
tr_translation: I found him sitting on his stool in the middle of the room, usually an indication of a kind of mental activity peculiar to him. When I entered, he immediately said as if the question had been waiting on the tip of his lips:
es_translation: I found him sitting in the chair, in the center of his room, in a posture that generally indicates a certain mental energy on his part. When I entered, he immediately said, as if the question had been burning his lips:
st: Ke ile ka mo fumana a lutse ka ntle ka har'a mokatong setulong sa hae sa setulo sa hae, se bonts'ang hore na ke eng e bonts'ang matla a kelello ka lehlakoreng la hae. Ha ke kena, o ile a re ka nako e 'ngoe, joalokaha eka potso eo e ne e emetse molomo oa hae:
yo: Mo rí i tí ó jókòó síta ní àárín ilẹ̀ lórí àga rẹ̀, ipò tí ó jẹ́ àfihàn agbára ọpọlọ díẹ̀ ní ọ̀dọ̀ rẹ̀. Nígbà tí mo wọlé, ó sọ lẹ́ẹ̀kan náà, bí ẹni pé ìbéèrè náà ti ń dúró lórí ètè rẹ̀:-
tn: Ke ne ka mo fitlhela a le fa gare ga ntlo ya gagwe, mme ka kakaretso ke ne ka mo fitlhela e le selo se se rileng se se bontshang gore o na le maatla a tlhaloganyo. Fa ke goroga, o ne a bua jalo ka bonako fela jaaka e kete potso e ne e ntse e letile mo molomong wa gagwe.
ty: Ua ite atura vau ia'na i te parahiraa i ropu i te tahua i ni'a i to'na parahiraa, e tapa'o faaite te reira no te tahi puai o to'na feruriraa. I to'u tomoraa'tu i roto, ua parau mai oia i taua iho taime ra, mai te mea ra e te tia'ihia ra te uiraa i ni'a i to'na na utu:—
mai: हम हुनका अपन स्टूल पर फर्शक बीचमे बैसल देखलहुँ, एकटा मुद्रा जे सामान्यतः हुनक दिससँ किछु मानसिक ऊर्जाक सूचक होइत अछि। जखन हम भीतर अएलहुं तखन ओ तुरन्त कहलखिन, जेना प्रश्न हुनक ओठपर प्रतीक्षा कऽ रहल होइ:-
mg: Hitako nipetraka teo afovoan'ny tany teo amin'ny sezany izy, fomba fijery izay maneho ny herin-tsaina sasany amin'ny ankapobeny. Rehefa niditra aho, dia niteny niaraka tamin'izay izy, toy ny hoe efa niandry teo amin'ny molony ilay fanontaniana:---

en: 3 October.—Let me put down with exactness all that happened, as well as I can remember it, since last I made an entry. Not a detail that I can recall must be forgotten; in all calmness I must proceed.
vi: • Ngày 3 tháng 10 Tôi xin phép được kể lại chính xác tất cả những gì đã xảy ra - trong chừng mực có thể nhớ - kể từ khi cuốn nhật ký này tạm được gấp lại. Tôi sẽ cố gắng không bỏ sót một chi tiết nào còn vương lại trong ký ức của mình.
tr: 3 Ekim. - Buraya son kayıt yapışımdan bu yana olan her şeyi, hatırlayabildiğim kadarıyla ve eksiksiz kaydedeyim. Anımsayabildiğim tek bir ayrıntı bile unutulmamalı; tüm soğukkanlılığımla işe başlamalıyım.
es: 3 de octubre. Déjenme expresar exactamente todo lo sucedido, tal y como lo recuerdo desde la última vez en que escribí en el diario. Debo hacerlo con toda calma, ya que no debo pasar por alto ni uno solo de los detalles que recuerdo.
vi_translation: • October 3 I would like to recount exactly everything that has happened - as much as I can remember - since this diary was temporarily closed. I will try not to omit any detail that still lingers in my memory.
tr_translation: October 3. - Let me record everything that has happened since my last entry here, as completely as I can remember. Not a single detail that I can recall should be forgotten; I must begin with all my composure.
es_translation: October 3rd. Let me express exactly everything that happened, just as I remember it since the last time I wrote in the diary. I must do it calmly, as I must not overlook a single detail that I remember.

en: “Do not fear, my dear. We are here; and whilst this is close to you no foul thing can approach. You are safe for to-night; and we must be calm and take counsel together.” She shuddered and was silent, holding down her head on her husband’s breast. When she raised it, his white night-robe was stained with blood where her lips had touched, and where the thin open wound in her neck had sent forth drops. The instant she saw it she drew back, with a low wail, and whispered, amidst choking sobs:—
vi: — Đừng sợ gì cả, các bạn ạ, đã có chúng tôi ở đây, chừng nào cây thánh giá còn ở bên các bạn thì chừng đó các bạn sẽ chẳng thể bất hạnh được. Đêm nay, các bạn đã được che chở. Đừng lo nghĩ nhiều làm gì, chúng ta còn phải bình tĩnh để suy nghĩ về những việc cần làm chứ. Mina ngả đầu vào lòng người chồng yêu dấu và không than vãn gì thêm, nhưng người cô run rẩy như phải sốt. Khi cô đứng dậy, tôi chợt nhận ra mảnh áo sơmi trên ngực Jonathan có dính vết máu từ môi cô và những vết máu khác chảy xuống từ cổ cô. Như sực hiểu ra mình vừa nạn nhân của lão bá tước, cô giật mình lùi lại trong tiếng nấc nghẹn ngào:
tr: “Korkmayın, canım. Biz buradayız ve bu sizin yakınınızdayken hiçbir kötülük size yaklaşamaz. Bu gecelik güvendesiniz, serinkanlı kalmalı ve bu konuyu birlikte görüşmeliyiz.” Başını kocasının göğsüne yaslayan ms Harker, titredi ve sessiz kaldı. Başını kaldırdığında, kocasının beyaz geceliğinde, dudaklarının değdiği ve boynundaki açık yaradan kan damlayan yerler kanla lekelenmişti. Bunu görür görmez, güçsüz bir iniltiyle geri çekildi ve boğazını düğümleyen hıçkırıkların arasında şöyle fısıldadı:
es: –No tema usted, querida señora. Estamos nosotros aquí con ustedes, y mientras este crucifijo esté a su lado, no habrá ningún monstruo de esos que pueda acercársele. Está usted a salvo esta noche, y nosotros debemos tranquilizarnos y consolarnos juntos. La señora Harker se estremeció y guardó silencio, manteniendo la cabeza apoyada en el pecho de su esposo. Cuando alzó ella el rostro, la camisa blanca de su esposo estaba manchada de sangre en el lugar en que sus labios se habían posado y donde la pequeña herida abierta que tenía en el cuello había dejado escapar unas gotitas. En cuanto la señora Harker lo vio, se echó hacia atrás, con un gemido bajo y un susurro, en medio de tremendos sollozos:
vi_translation: — Don't be afraid of anything, my friends, we are here, as long as the cross is with you, you will not be unfortunate. Tonight, you are protected. Don't worry too much, we need to stay calm to think about what needs to be done. Mina rested her head on her beloved husband's lap and did not complain any further, but her body trembled as if with fever. When she stood up, I suddenly noticed the piece of Jonathan's shirt on his chest stained with blood from her lips and other blood stains running down from her neck. As if realizing she had just been a victim of the Count, she startled and stepped back with a choking sob:
tr_translation: “Don't be afraid, dear. We are here and no harm can come to you while we are near. You are safe for tonight, stay calm and we should discuss this matter together.” Ms. Harker, resting her head on her husband's chest, trembled and remained silent. When she lifted her head, the places on her husband's white nightshirt where her lips had touched and the open wound on his neck were stained with blood. Upon seeing this, she recoiled with a feeble moan and whispered amidst the sobs that choked her:
es_translation: –Do not worry, dear lady. We are here with you, and as long as this crucifix is by your side, no monster like those can come near you. You are safe tonight, and we must calm down and console each other. Mrs. Harker shuddered and fell silent, keeping her head resting on her husband's chest. When she raised her face, her husband's white shirt was stained with blood where her lips had touched and where the small open wound on her neck had let out a few drops. As soon as Mrs. Harker saw him, she recoiled with a low moan and a whisper, amidst tremendous sobs:
st: U se ke ua tšoha, moratuoa oa ka. Re teng mona; Le ha sena se le haufi le uena, ha ho letho le ka atamelang. U ikutloa u sireletsehile mantsiboea; Re lokela ho ba le mamello 'me re nke keletso hammoho. " 'Me o ile a khutsa' me a khutsa, a beha hlooho ea hae holim'a sefuba sa monna oa hae. Ha a e phahamisa, seaparo sa hae se tšoeu sa bosiu se ne se tšoailoe ka mali moo molomo oa hae o neng o amme, le moo leqeba le lesesane le bulehileng molaleng oa hae le ne le rometse marotholi. O ile a bona hore o ne a se a ntse a e-na le moiteli oa hae mme a e-na le hoo a ileng a lla ka mor'a hore a se ke a e-ba teng.
yo: "Má bẹ̀rù, olùfẹ́ mi. A wa nibi; Bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé èyí súnmọ́ ọ kò sí ohun burúkú tí ó lè súnmọ́. O ti wa ni ailewu fun to-night; ati awọn ti a gbọdọ wa ni ipalọlọ ki o si mu ìmọràn jọ. " Ó bẹ̀rù ó sì dákẹ́ jẹ́ẹ́, ó di orí rẹ̀ mú lórí ọmú ọkọ rẹ̀. Nígbà tí ó gbé e sókè, aṣọ alẹ́ funfun rẹ̀ kún fún ẹ̀jẹ̀ níbi tí ètè rẹ̀ ti fọwọ́ kàn, àti níbi tí ọgbẹ́ tí ó ṣí sílẹ̀ ní ọrùn rẹ̀ ti rán ìsàlẹ̀ jáde. tn: "Se tshohe, kgaitsedi. re le mo; 18Mme fa dilo tseo di le gaufi le wena, ga go sepe se se ka go atamelang. Dare mo ga shiranai, Re tshwanetse go nna re ritibetse e bile re tshwanetse go nna re ritibetse mmogo." O ne a didimetse mme a didimala, a inaa tlhogo ya monna wa gagwe mo tlhogong ya gagwe. E rile a sena go e tsosa, kobo ya gagwe e tshweu ya bosigo e ne e sweufaditswe ka madi a molomo wa gagwe, kwa molomo wa gagwe o neng o amile teng, le fa leswe le lesesane le le bulegileng mo molaleng wa gagwe le ne le ntsha marothodi. O ne a bona fa a ne a le kwa tlase, a bo a le kwa tlase, a lela, a fefolwa ke go fefolwa ke ditshika.

mai: "डरो नहि, प्रिय। हम अईठाम छी; आ जखन ई अहां के नजदीक अछि तखन कोनो गलत चीज नहि आबि सकैत अछि। अहां राति के लेल सुरक्षित छी। आ हमरा सभ के शांत रहबाक चाही आ एक संग सलाह लेबाक चाही। ओ कांपि उठलीह आ चुप रहलीह, अपन माथ पतिक स्तन पर राखि लेलनि। जखन ओ एकरा उठौलनि तखन हुनक उज्जर रात्रि-वस्त्र खूनसँ दाग गेल छल जतय ओकर ओठ छूने छल, आ जतय हुनक गर्दनमे पातर खुजल घाव बूंद छोड़ि देने छल। जहिना ओ एकरा देखलनि ओ पाछू हटि गेलीह, कम विलापक सङ्ग, आ फुसफुसाएली, दम घुटबाक बीच:—
