en: “There are here some who would stand between you and death. You must not die. You must not die by any hand; but least of all by your own. Until the other, who has fouled your sweet life, is true dead you must not die; for if he is still with the quick Un-Dead, your death would make you even as he is. No, you must live! You must struggle and strive to live, though death would seem a boon unspeakable. You must fight Death himself, though he come to you in pain or in joy; by the day, or the night; in safety or in peril! On your living soul I charge you that you do not die—nay, nor think of death—till this great evil be past.” The poor dear grew white as death, and shock and shivered, as I have seen a quicksand shake and shiver at the incoming of the tide. We were all silent; we could do nothing. At length she grew more calm and turning to him said, sweetly, but oh! so sorrowfully, as she held out her hand:—
vi: — Có một người đã quên mình đứng giữa bà và thần chết. Bà không nên chết như vậy. Không có bất cứ bàn tay nào có thể đẩy bà đến với cái chết, trừ phi là bàn tay của chính bà. Cho đến ngày kẻ đã làm vấy bẩn cuộc sống của bà bị chết thực sự, bà sẽ không thể chết được! Bởi chừng nào còn một kẻ bất tử còn sống để gây tội ác như lão, thì cái chết của bà sẽ làm cho bà trở thành một kẻ giống như lão. Bà phải sống! Bà phải chiến đấu, chiến đấu vì cuộc sống, kể cả khi bà tưởng rằng cái chết sẽ là một điều thiện nên làm. Bà phải chiến đấu chống lại chính thần chết, cho dù nó đến với bà trong lúc bà đau khổ hay vui sướng, ngày hay đêm, bình yên hay lúc gặp nguy hiểm! Để giải thoát cho tâm hồn của bà, tôi đề nghị bà hãy đừng chết... hoặc đừng bao giờ nghĩ tới cái chết, cho tới khi con quỷ kia bị hủy diệt! Toàn thân Mina run bần bật như phải sốt, mặt tái nhợt như một xác chết thực sự. Chúng tôi vẫn ngồi im, bởi chẳng ai biết phải nói gì vào lúc này. Phải một lúc sau, khi đã trấn tĩnh lại, cô mới ngẩng mặt lên nói với giáo sư, giọng buồn buồn:
tr: “Burada sizinle ölüm arasında duracak bazıları var. Kimsenin eliyle ölmemelisiniz; hele ki kendi elinizle. Tatlı yaşamınıza kötülük eden o öteki, gerçek ölümü tadana kadar ölmemelisiniz, çünkü o hâlâ yaşayan Ölü Olmayanlar’ın arasındaysa, ölümünüz sizi ona daha çok benzetir. Hayır, yaşamalısınız! Ölüm, ağza alınamaz bir nimet gibi görünse de yaşamak için savaşmak ve çabalamalısınız. Size acıyla ya da neşeyle, gündüz ya da gece, güven içinde ya da tehlike içinde gelse de, Ölüm’ün kendisiyle savaşmalısınız! Bu büyük kötülük geçmişe gömülene dek, yaşayan ruhunuza bu görevi yüklüyorum; ölmemelisiniz - dahası, ölümü düşünmemelisiniz.” Zavallı sevgilim ölü gibi beyazladı, gelgitte yükselen sularla titreyen bataklıklarda gördüğüm gibi titreyip sarsıldı. Sonunda biraz dinginleşti ve Van Helsing’e dönüp ona elini uzatarak tatlılıkla, ama büyük üzüntüyle şöyle dedi:
es: –Hay aquí varias personas que se levantarían entre usted y la muerte. No debe usted morir de ninguna manera, y menos todavía por su propia mano. En tanto el otro, que ha intoxicado la dulzura de su vida, no haya muerto, no debe usted tampoco morir; porque si existe él todavía entre los muertos vivos, la muerte de usted la convertiría exactamente en lo mismo que es él. ¡No! ¡Debe usted vivir! Debe luchar y esforzarse por vivir, ya que la muerte sería un horror indecible. Debe usted luchar contra la muerte, tanto si le llega a usted en medio de la tristeza o de la alegría; de día o de noche; a salvo o en peligro. ¡Por la salvación de su alma le ruego que no muera y que ni siquiera piense en la muerte, en tanto ese monstruo no haya dejado de existir! Mi pobre y adorada esposa se puso pálida como un cadáver y se estremeció violentamente, como había visto que se estremecían las arenas movedizas cuando alguien caía entre ellas. Todos guardábamos silencio; nada podíamos hacer. Finalmente, Mina se calmó un poco, se volvió hacia el profesor y dijo con dulzura, aunque con una infinita tristeza, mientras el doctor van Helsing le tomaba la mano:
vi_translation: — There is someone who has stood between you and death. You should not die like this. No hand can push you towards death, except your own hand. Until the day the one who tainted your life truly dies, you will not be able to die! As long as there is an immortal being alive to commit crimes like him, your death will make you become like him. You must live! You must fight, fight for life, even when you think that death would be a good thing to do. You must fight against death itself, whether it comes to you in times of sorrow or joy, day or night, peace or danger! To liberate your soul, I suggest you do not die... or never think of death, until that demon is destroyed! Mina's whole body was trembling violently as if she had a fever, her face pale like a real corpse. We remained silent, as no one knew what to say at that moment. It was only after a while, when she had calmed down, that she looked up and spoke to the professor in a sad voice:
tr_translation: “There are some who will stand between you and death here. You must not die by anyone's hand; especially not by your own. You must not die until that other, who has wronged your sweet life, tastes true death, for if he is still among the living Undead, your death will make you more like him. No, you must live! Even if death seems like an unspeakable blessing, you must fight and strive to live. Whether it comes to you with pain or joy, by day or by night, in safety or in danger, you must fight against Death itself! Until this great evil is buried in the past, I charge your living soul with this duty; you must not die - moreover, you must not even think of death.” My poor darling turned as white as a corpse, trembling and shaking as I have seen in the marshes with the rising tides. At last, she calmed a little and turned to Van Helsing, extending her hand to him sweetly but with great sorrow, and said:
es_translation: –There are several people here who would stand between you and death. You must not die in any way, and even less so by your own hand. As long as the other, who has poisoned the sweetness of your life, has not died, you must not die either; because if he still exists among the living dead, your death would turn you into exactly the same as he is. No! You must live! You must fight and strive to live, as death would be an unspeakable horror. You must fight against death, whether it comes to you in the midst of sadness or joy; by day or by night; safe or in danger. For the salvation of your soul, I beg you not to die and not even to think of death, as long as that monster has not ceased to exist! My poor and beloved wife turned pale as a corpse and shuddered violently, just as I had seen the quicksand shudder when someone fell into it. We all remained silent; there was nothing we could do. Finally, Mina calmed down a bit, turned to the professor, and said sweetly, though with infinite sadness, while Dr. Van Helsing took her hand:
st: Ho na le ba bang ba tla ema pakeng tsa hao le lefu. U ke ke ua shoa. U ke ke ua bolaea ka letsoho le leng le le leng; Bonyane ke ntho e 'ngoe le e' ngoe ka uena. Ho fihlela e mong, ea ileng a thetsoa bophelo ba hao bo monate, o 'nete o shoele, u se ke ua shoa; Etsoe haeba a ntse a le ka potlako Un-Dead, lefu la hao e ne e tla etsa hore u esita le joalokaha a ntse a. Che, u tlameha ho phela! U tlameha ho loanela le ho loanela ho phela, leha ho le joalo lefu le ka bonahala le sa khonehe. U tlameha ho loana lefu ka boeena, leha a ka tla ho uena ka bohloko kapa ka thabo; Bosiu kapa motšehare; Polokeho kapa kotsing! Ka moea oa hao o phelang, Ke u laela hore u se ke ua shoa, kapa ua nahana ka lefu, ho fihlela bobe bona bo boholo e fetile. " Moratuoa ea futsanehileng o ile a hola a tšoeu joalo ka lefu, 'me a nyahatsoa le ho thothomela, ha ke ntse ke bona lebelo le sisinyehang ebe ke shaver nakong ea leqhubu le kenang. Bohle re ile ra khutsa; Ha ho letho leo re ka le etsang. Ha a le moo, o ile a khutsa le ho feta mme a re ho eena: "Oh, oh! 'Me o ne a sareloa ka mor'a hore a mo tšoere ka letsoho la hae.
yo: "Nibẹ ni o wa nibi diẹ ninu awọn ti yoo duro laarin rẹ ati iku. O kò gbọ́dọ̀ kú. O kò gbọ́dọ̀ kú pẹ̀lú ọwọ́ kankan; ṣùgbọ́n ju gbogbo rẹ̀ lọ fúnra à rẹ. Títí di ìgbà tí èkejì, tí ó ti ba ayé dídùn rẹ jẹ́, ó jẹ́ òkú tòótọ́ o kò gbọ́dọ̀ kú; Nítorí tí ó bá ṣì wà pẹ̀lú Aláìkú kíákíá, ikú rẹ yóò sọ ọ́ di àní bí ó ti wà. Rárá, o gbọ́dọ̀ wà láàyè! O gbọ́dọ̀ tiraka kí o sì tiraka láti wà láàyè, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ikú yóò dàbí àfààní tí kò ṣe é sọ. ty: " Te vai ra i ô nei te tahi pae o te ti'a mai i rotopu ia outou e te pohe. Eiaha roa oe e pohe. Eiaha roa oe e pohe i te hoê noa a'e rima ; eiaha râ na roto i ta outou iho. E tae noa'tu i te taime e pohe ai te tahi, tei faaino i to outou oraraa, e ore roa ïa outou e pohe; no te mea, mai te mea e, tei piha'i iho noa oia ia'na, e faariro to outou pohe ia outou mai ia'na atoa ra te huru. Eita, e tia ia outou ia ora! E tia ia outou ia aro e ia tutava i te ora, noa ' tu e e au ra e ua riro te pohe ei haamaitairaa aita e faaauraa. E ti'a ia outou ia aro ia'na iho, noa'tu e e haere mai oia ia outou ma te mauiui aore râ ma te oaoa; i te ao, aore râ i te rui; i roto i te pe'ape'a ore e aore râ, i roto i te ati ! I ni'a i to outou varua ora te parau atu nei au ia outou e, eita outou e pohe—eita outou e pohe, eita atoa e mana'o i te pohe—e tae roa'tu i te taime e ma'iri ai teie ino rahi ". Ua uouo roa te feia veve mai te pohe, e ua hitimahuta e ua ruru noa vau, no te mea ua ite au i te hoê aueueraa fenua vitiviti e te ruru i te tereraa mai o te nanuraa miti. Ua mamû noa matou paatoa ; aita e ti'a ia tatou ia rave i te hoê noa a'e mea. I te pae hopea, ua tupu te hau rahi i roto ia'na e ua fariu atura i ni'a ia'na ma te parau mărû e, aue ! ma te oto rahi, ua faatoro maira oia i to'na rima:—
mai: "अईठाम किछु एहन छथि जे अहां आ मृत्युक बीच ठाढ़ हेताह। अहां के नहि मरबाक चाही। अहां के कोनो हाथ सं नहि मरबाक चाही। मुदा कम सं कम अहां अपना सं। जा धरि दोसर जे अहाँक मधुर जीवनकेँ दूषित नहि कयने अछि, सच्चा मृत नहि अछि अहाँकेँ नहि मरबाक चाही; किएकि जँ ओ एखनहु शीघ्र अन-डेडक संग छथि तखन अहाँक मृत्यु अहाँकेँ ओहिना बना देत, जेना ओ छथि। नहि, अहां के जीबए के चाही! अहाँकेँ संघर्ष करबाक चाही आ जीबाक प्रयास करबाक चाही, यद्यपि मृत्यु एकटा वरदान अकथनीय प्रतीत होयत। अहां के स्वयं मृत्यु सँ लड़बाक चाही, यद्यपि ओ दर्द या आनन्द मे अहां लग अबैत अछि। दिन या राति के; सुरक्षा मे या खतरा मे! अहाँक जीवित आत्मा पर हम अहाँसँ आरोप लगबैत छी जे जाबत धरि ई पैघ बुराई अतीत नहि भऽ जायत ताबत धरि अहाँ नहि मरैत छी-नहि, आ ने मृत्युक बारे मे सोचैत छी।" बेचारा प्रिय मृत्यु जकाँ उज्जर भऽ गेल, आ सदमा आ काँपि उठल, किएक तँ हम ज्वारक आगमनपर एकटा तेज बालु हिलैत आ काँपैत देखलहुँ। हम सभ चुप छलहुं; हम किछु नहि कए सकैत छलहुं। लम्बा समय धरि ओ बेसी शान्त भऽ गेलीह आ हुनका दिस मुड़ि कऽ कहलनि, मधुर, मुदा ओह! एतेक दुख सं, जहिना ओ अपन हाथ बढ़ा लेलक:—

en: “Ah, my child, that I do; and indeed there is no wish of me to add to your anguish. But just think, what can we do, until all the world be at movement. Then will come our time. I have thought and thought, and it seems to me that the simplest way is the best of all. Now we wish to get into the house, but we have no key; is it not so?” I nodded.
vi: — Anh bạn ạ, tôi rất hiểu tâm trạng anh! Và tôi đâu có muốn làm cho anh nặng đầu thêm kia chứ. Nhưng anh cứ thử nghĩ mà xem: chúng ta có thể làm gì được trong lúc ngoài phố có đầy những ánh mắt tình cờ? Đành rằng đã tới lúc chúng ta phải hành động, nhưng tôi cũng nghĩ nhiều rồi, cứ tin ở tôi, anh bạn ạ, cách đơn giản nhất bao giờ cũng là cách tốt nhất. Chúng ta muốn vào ngôi nhà đó trong khi chẳng có trong tay chiếc chìa khóa nào! Đó cũng là một vấn đề, đúng không nào? Tôi gật đầu trả lời. — Thế đấy.
tr: “Ah, çocuğum, biliyorum; gerçekten de, acını artırmak gibi bir arzum yok. Ama tüm dünya eyleme geçene kadar ne yapabiliriz onu düşün. İşte o zaman, sıra bize gelecek. Düşündüm taşındım ve en kolay yolun en iyisi olduğunun kanısındayım. Şimdi, eve girmek istiyoruz, ama anahtarımız yok, öyle değil mi?” Başımla onayladım.
es: Y créame que no tengo ningún deseo de añadir todavía mas sufrimiento al que ya está soportando. Pero tenemos que pensar antes de actuar, hasta el momento en que todo el mundo esté en movimiento. Entonces llegará el momento oportuno para entrar en acción. He reflexionado mucho, y me parece que el modo más simple es el mejor de todos. Deseamos entrar a la casa, pero no tenemos llave. ¿No es así? Asentí.
vi_translation: And I don't want to make things harder for you. But just think about it: what can we do when the streets are full of curious eyes? Granted, it's time for us to act, but I've thought about it a lot, trust me, my friend, the simplest way is always the best way. We want to get into that house without having any keys! That's also a problem, isn't it? I nodded in response. — That's it.
tr_translation: “Ah, my child, I know; truly, I have no desire to increase your pain. But think about what we can do until the whole world takes action. That's when our turn will come. I have thought it over and I am convinced that the easiest way is the best. Now, we want to enter the house, but we don't have the key, do we?” I nodded in agreement.
es_translation: And believe me, I have no desire to add even more suffering to what you are already enduring. But we have to think before we act, until the moment when everyone is in motion. Then the right moment will come to take action. I have thought a lot, and it seems to me that the simplest way is the best of all. We want to enter the house, but we don't have a key. Isn't that so? I nodded.
st: "Oho, mora oa ka, seo ke se etsang; 'Me ho na le ha ho na takatso ea ka ho eketsa matšoenyeho a hao. Empa nahana feela, re ka etsa'ng, ho fihlela lefatše lohle le sisinyeha. Ebe re fihla nako ea rona. Ke nahanne ebile ke nahana, 'me ho bonahala eka tsela e bonolo ka ho fetisisa ke eona e ntle ka ho fetisisa. Joale re batla ho kena ka tlung, empa ha re na senotlolo; Ha ho jwalo?" Ke ile ka e-na le eona.
yo: "Ah, ọmọ mi, ti mo ṣe; Dájúdájú kò sí ìfẹ́ fún mi láti fi kún ìrora rẹ. Ṣùgbọ́n kàn rò ó, kí ni a lè ṣe, títí gbogbo àgbáyé yóò fi wà ní ìgbésẹ̀. Nígbà náà ni yóò wá àkókò wa. Mo ti ronú mo sì ti rò ó, ó sì dàbí ẹni pé ọ̀nà tó rọrùn jù ni ohun tí ó dára jù nínú gbogbo rẹ̀. Bayi a fẹ lati wọ inu ile, ṣugbọn a ko ni bọtini; Ṣé bẹ́ẹ̀ kọ́ ni?" Mo tẹríba.
tn: Ngwanaka, ke dira jalo; Ga go na keletso epe ya me ya go oketsa tlalelo ya gago. Akanya fela gore ke eng se re ka se dirang go fitlha lefatshe lotlhe le tswelela le tsamaya? Jwale re tla nako ya rona. Ke ne ka akanya e bile ke akanya gore tsela e e motlhofo ke e gaisang tsotlhe. Jaanong re batla go tsena mo ntlong, mme ga re na senotlolo; Ga go jalo?" Ke ne ke iteile.
ty: " E ta'u tamarii, o ta'u ïa e rave nei ; e oia mau, aita roa e ti'a ia'u ia faarahi atu â i to outou pe'ape'a. A feruri noa na râ, eaha ta tatou e nehenehe e rave, e tae roa'tu i te taime e tere ai te ao atoa nei. E tae mai ïa to tatou taime. Ua feruri au e ua feruri au, e mai te mea ra ia'u e, te e'a ohie roa a'e, o te e'a maitai roa a'e ïa. I teie nei, te hinaaro nei tatou e tomo i roto i te fare, aita râ ta tatou e taviri; e ere anei ? Ua taueue noa to'u upoo.
mai: "आह, हमर बच्चा, जे हम करैत छी; आ वास्तव मे हमरा कोनो इच्छा नहि अछि जे अहां के पीड़ा के बढ़ाउ। मुदा बस सोचू जे हम की कऽ सकैत छी, जा धरि पूरा दुनिया गतिशील नहि भऽ जायत। तखन हमर समय आबि जाएत। हम सोचलहुँ आ सोचलहुँ, आ हमरा लगैत अछि जे सबसँ सरल तरीका सबसँ नीक अछि। आब हम घर मे घुसबाक इच्छा करैत छी, मुदा हमरा लग कोनो चाबी नहि अछि। की इ ओहन नहि अछि? हम डोलावलहुं।

en: “Now suppose that you were, in truth, the owner of that house, and could not still get in; and think there was to you no conscience of the housebreaker, what would you do?”
vi: Bây giờ hãy giả thiết anh là người chủ của ngôi nhà, nhưng lại không có chìa khóa vì một lý do gì đó, thì anh sẽ phải làm gì nào?
tr: “Şimdi, gerçekte o evin sahibi olduğunuzu düşünün ve içeri giremiyorsunuz ve düşünün ki, bir hırsızın bilincine de sahip değilsiniz, ne yapardınız?
es: –Supongamos ahora que usted fuera realmente el dueño de la casa, que hubiera perdido la llave y que no tuviera conciencia de delincuente, puesto que estaría en su derecho… ¿Qué haría?
vi_translation: Now, let's assume you are the owner of the house, but you don't have the key for some reason, what would you do?
tr_translation: “Now, imagine that you actually own that house and you can't get inside, and imagine that you also don't have the consciousness of a thief, what would you do?”
es_translation: –Suppose now that you were really the owner of the house, that you had lost the key and that you had no criminal intent, since you would be within your rights… What would you do?
st: "Joale, hopola hore u ne u le, ka 'nete, mong'a ntlo eo, 'me ba ne ba sa khone ho kena. 'Me u nahane hore ho na le ne ho se na letsoalo la ho ba ntlo, u ne u tla etsa'ng?
yo: "Bayi ro pe o wà, ni otitọ, awọn eni ti ile, ati ki o ko si tun le wọle; Kí o sì rò pé kò sí ẹ̀rí ọkàn ẹni tí ń fọ́ ilé fún ọ, kí ni ìwọ yóò ṣe?"

en: “And now, my friends, we have a duty here to do. We must sterilise this earth, so sacred of holy memories, that he has brought from a far distant land for such fell use. He has chosen this earth because it has been holy. Thus we defeat him with his own weapon, for we make it more holy still. It was sanctified to such use of man, now we sanctify it to God.” As he spoke he took from his bag a screwdriver and a wrench, and very soon the top of one of the cases was thrown open. The earth smelled musty and close; but we did not somehow seem to mind, for our attention was concentrated on the Professor. Taking from his box a piece of the Sacred Wafer he laid it reverently on the earth, and then shutting down the lid began to screw it home, we aiding him as he worked.
vi: Chúng ta sẽ phải làm mất tác dụng của lớp đất đựng trong các thùng gỗ. Đó là thứ đất đã bị thánh hóa bởi những ký ức sùng đạo và được con quỷ Dracula cho chuyển tới đây làm nơi trú ẩn. Sở dĩ lão chọn thứ đất này là bởi nó đã được thánh hóa. Việc lão có thất bại hay không một phần cũng tùy thuộc vào tác dụng của các thùng đất. Bây giờ, chúng ta sẽ trả lại thứ đất này cho Chúa! Đoạn ông rút trong túi xách ra một chiếc tournevis và một chiếc clef vạn năng để mở các thùng đất. Một nắp thùng được mở tung. Đất trong thùng lập tức bốc ra một mùi khăm khẳm lẫn mùi mốc bay xộc vào mũi. Tuy nhiên, điều khiến chúng tôi chú ý hơn cả vẫn là việc giáo sư đang làm: ông lấy một mẩu bánh thánh đặt nhẹ nhàng lên lớp đất trong thùng và đậy nắp thùng lại như cũ với sự giúp đỡ của chúng tôi.
tr: “Ve şimdi dostlarım, burada bir görevimiz var. Böyle korkunç bir amaç için uzaklardan getirdiği bu toprağı, kutsal anılardan arındırmalıyız. Bu toprağı seçti, çünkü kutsanmış. Böylelikle, onu kendi silahıyla yeneceğiz, çünkü bu toprağı daha da kutsal duruma getireceğiz. İnsanın böyle kullanması için kutsanmıştı, şimdi biz onu Tanrı için kutsuyoruz.” Konuşurken, bir yandan da çantasından tornavidayla somun anahtarı çıkarttı, kısa süre sonra sandıklardan birinin kapağı açılmıştı. Toprak, küf kokuyordu; ama bir şekilde buna aldırmıyor gibiydik, çünkü tüm dikkatimiz Profesördeydi. Kutusundan kutsanmış ekmekten bir parça çıkartıp saygıyla toprağın üstüne koydu ve sonra kapağı kapatarak vidalamaya başladı; çalışırken biz de ona yardım ediyorduk.
es: –Ahora, amigos míos, tenemos aquí un deber que cumplir. Debemos esterilizar esta tierra, tan llena de sagradas reliquias, que la han traído desde tierras lejanas para poder usarla. Ha escogido esta tierra debido a que ha sido bendecida. Por consiguiente, vamos a derrotarlo con sus mismas armas, santificándola todavía más. Fue santificada para el uso del hombre, y ahora vamos a santificarla para Dios. Mientras hablaba, sacó del bolsillo un destornillador y una llave y, muy pronto, la tapa de una de las cajas fue levantada. La tierra tenía un olor desagradable, debido al tiempo que había estado encerrada, pero eso no pareció importarnos a ninguno de nosotros, ya que toda nuestra atención estaba concentrada en el profesor. Sacando del bolsillo un pedazo de la Hostia Sagrada, lo colocó reverentemente sobre la tierra y, luego, volviendo a colocar la tapa en su sitio, comenzó a ponerle otra vez los tornillos. Nosotros lo ayudamos en su trabajo.
vi_translation: We will have to neutralize the soil contained in the wooden boxes. This is the soil that has been sanctified by devout memories and was transported here by the demon Dracula as a place of refuge. The reason he chose this soil is because it has been sanctified. Whether he fails or not partly depends on the effectiveness of these boxes of soil. Now, we will return this soil to God! He took a screwdriver and a universal key out of his bag to open the soil crates. A lid of a crate was pried open. The soil in the crate immediately emitted a musty, pungent odor that assaulted our noses. However, what caught our attention the most was what the professor was doing: he gently placed a piece of sacramental bread on the soil in the crate and closed the lid again with our help.
tr_translation: “And now, my friends, we have a duty here. We must cleanse this soil, which he brought from afar for such a dreadful purpose, of its sacred memories. He chose this soil because it is blessed. Thus, we will defeat him with his own weapon, for we will make this soil even more sacred. It was blessed for man to use in this way, now we are blessing it for God.” As he spoke, he took a screwdriver and a wrench out of his bag, and shortly after, the lid of one of the chests was opened. The soil smelled musty; but somehow we didn't seem to mind, because all our attention was on the Professor. He took a piece of blessed bread from its box and respectfully placed it on the soil, then began to screw the lid back on; as he worked, we were helping him.
es_translation: –Now, my friends, we have a duty to fulfill here. We must sterilize this land, so full of sacred relics, which have been brought from distant lands to be used. He has chosen this land because it has been blessed. Therefore, we are going to defeat him with his own weapons, sanctifying it even more. It was sanctified for the use of man, and now we are going to sanctify it for God. While he was speaking, he took a screwdriver and a key out of his pocket, and very soon, the lid of one of the boxes was lifted. The soil had an unpleasant smell, due to the time it had been enclosed, but that did not seem to matter to any of us, as all our attention was focused on the professor. Taking a piece of the Sacred Host out of his pocket, he placed it reverently on the soil and then, putting the lid back in its place, began to screw it back on. We help him with his work.
st: "Jwale, metswalle, re nale mosebetsi mona hoka etsa seo. Re tlameha ho tlosa lefats'e lena, le halalelang la mehopolo e halalelang, eo a e tlisitseng naheng e hole bakeng sa ts'ebeliso e joalo e oeleng. O khethile lefatše lena hobane lea halalela. Kahoo re mo hlōla ka sebetsa sa hae, etsoe re etsa hore e be e halalelang haholoanyane. E ile ea halaletsoa ho batho ba joalo, hona joale re e halaletsa ho Molimo. " Ha a ntse a bua, o ile a nka mokotlana oa hae screwdriver le wrench, 'me kapele haholo ka holimo ho e' ngoe ea linyeoe e ile ea lahleloa e butsoe. Mobu o nkhang hamonate le o haufi; Empa ka tsela e itseng re ne re sa nahane, hobane re ne re tsepamisitse maikutlo ho moprofesa. O ile a nka lebokose la hae e le sekotoana sa Mohalaledi Wafer, a se bea lefatsheng, mme a koale sekwahelo sa qala ho seha hae, re mo thusa ha a ntse a sebetsa.
yo: "Ní báyìí, àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ mi, a ní ojúṣe níbí láti ṣe. A gbọ́dọ̀ ṣe ìdàrúdàpọ̀ ayé yìí, èyí tí ó jẹ́ mímọ́ fún ìrántí mímọ́, tí ó ti mú wá láti ilẹ̀ jíjìn fún irú ìlò bẹ́ẹ̀ tí ó ṣubú. O ti yan ilẹ yii nitori pe o ti jẹ mimọ. Nítorí náà a fi ohun ìjà tirẹ̀ ṣẹ́gun rẹ̀, nítorí a jẹ́ kí ó di mímọ́ sí i. A sọ ọ́ di mímọ́ fún irú ìlò ènìyàn bẹ́ẹ̀, nísinsìnyí a yà á sí mímọ́ fún Ọlọ́run." Bí ó ṣe ń sọ̀rọ̀ ó mú ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé àti wrench láti inú àpò rẹ̀, àti pé láìpẹ́ òkè ọ̀kan nínú àwọn ẹjọ́ náà ni wọ́n ṣí sílẹ̀. ilẹ olfato musty ati ki o sunmọ; Ṣùgbọ́n kò jọ pé a rò ó lọ́nàkọnà, torí pé àkíyèsí wá dojú kọ Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n. Gbígbé láti inú àpótí rẹ̀ ẹ̀yà Sacred Wafer ó gbé e kalẹ̀ pẹ̀lú ìbọ̀wọ̀ lórí ilẹ̀ ayé, lẹ́yìn náà títì ìdérí náà bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní bà á jẹ́ sí ilé, a ràn án lọ́wọ́ bí ó ṣe ń ṣiṣẹ́.
tn: "Bagaetsho, re na le tshwanelo ya go dira jalo. Re tshwanetse go tlosa lefatshe leno, le le boitshepo la dilo tse di boitshepo, tse a di tlisitseng mo lefatsheng le le kgakala gore le dirisiwe. O itlhaoletse lefatshe, ka gonne le ne le le boitshepo. Ke ka moo re mo fenyang ka sethunya sa gagwe; gonne re sa ntse re le boitshepo go feta. E ne e itshepisiwa mo bathong ba ba ntseng jalo, jaanong re e itshepisa mo Modimong." Fa a ntse a bua, o ne a tsaya lebokoso le lennye le lennye le lennye, mme go ise go ye kae, go ise go ye kae. Lefatshe le ne le okeditswe, le bo le le gaufi le lone; Le fa go ntse jalo, ga re a ka ra nna kelotlhoko ka gonne re ne re tlhomile mogopolo mo morutising wa rona. O ne a tsaya karolo e e tswang mo ntlong ya gagwe, a e baya mo lefatsheng, a e baya mo lefatsheng, mme morago ga moo a simolola go e robatsa ntlo ya gagwe, a mo thusa fa a ntse a dira.
ty: " E i teie nei, e to'u mau hoa, e hopoi'a ta tatou i ô nei ia rave. E mea ti'a ia tatou ia hi'opo'a i teie fenua, no te mo'a o te mau haamana'oraa mo'a, ta'na i afa'i mai mai te hoê fenua atea roa no te faaohipa i te reira. Ua maiti oia i teie fenua no te mea e mea mo'a. No reira, te pau nei tatou ia ' na na roto i ta ' na iho mauhaa, no te mea te faariro nei tatou i te reira ei mea mo'a roa ' tu â. Ua haamo'ahia te reira no te faaohiparaa i te taata, i teie nei te haamo'a nei tatou i te reira i te Atua ". A paraparau noa ' i oia, ua rave maira oia i roto i ta ' na pute i te hoê tao'a auri e te hoê afata, e aita i maoro roa, ua taorahia ' tura te niaraa o te hoê o te mau tupuraa. Ua hau'a e ua piri ho'i te fenua ; aita râ matou i mana'o i te reira, no te mea ua faatumu matou i to matou mana'o i ni'a i te orometua. Ma te rave mai i roto i ta ' na afata i te hoê tâpû raau mo'a, ua tuu atura oia i te reira ma te tura i nia i te fenua, e i muri iho, ua tapiri atura oia i te tapo'i fare, e ua tauturu atura matou ia ' na a rave ai oia i te ohipa.
mai: "आ आब, हमर दोस्त, अईठाम हमर एकटा कर्तव्य अछि। हमरासभकेँ एहि पृथ्वीकेँ बाँझ करबाक चाही, जे पवित्र स्मृतिसँ एतेक पवित्र अछि, जे ओ एहि तरहक उपयोगक लेल दूर देशसँ अनने छथि। ओ एहि पृथ्वीकेँ एहि लेल चुनने छथि किएक तँ ई पवित्र अछि। एहि तरहेँ हम ओकरा ओकर अपन अस्त्रसँ पराजित करैत छी, किएक तँ हम एकरा एखनो बेसी पवित्र बना दैत छी। ई मनुष्यक एहन उपयोगक लेल पवित्र छल, आब हम एकरा भगवानक लेल पवित्र करैत छी। जहिना ओ बजलाह ओ अपन बैगसँ एकटा पेचकश आ एकटा रिंच लऽ लेलनि, आ बहुत जल्दिये एकटा मामलाक ऊपरी भाग खोलि देल गेल। धरती के गंध आबि रहल छलइ। मुदा हमरा सभ के कोनो तरहेँ मन नहि लागल, किएकि हमर ध्यान प्रोफेसर पर केन्द्रित छल। अपन बक्सासँ सेक्रेड वेफरक एकटा टुकड़ा लऽ कऽ ओ एकरा श्रद्धापूर्वक पृथ्वी पर रखलनि, आ फेर ढक्कनकेँ बन्द करब एकरा घर खराब करय लागल, हम हुनका सहायता कयलहुँ जखन ओ काज करैत छलाह।
mg: "Ankehitriny, ry namako, manana adidy eto izahay. Tsy maintsy manadio ity tany ity isika, izay masina tokoa amin'ny fahatsiarovana masina, ka nentiny avy any amin'ny tany lavitra mba ho azo ampiasaina toy izany. Nisafidy ity tany ity Izy satria masina. Ary dia hanodidina anao sy Manodidina anao manodidina. Nohamasinina ho amin'ny fampiasan'ny olona toy izany izy io, ary ankehitriny dia manamasina izany ho an'Andriamanitra isika." Rehefa niteny izy dia naka screwdriver sy wrench tao amin'ny kitapony, ary tsy ela dia nisokatra ny tampon'ny iray tamin'ireo tranga. Ny tany dia manimbolo sy manimbolo; Toa tsy nieritreritra anefa izahay, satria nifantoka tamin'ilay Mpampianatra ny saintsika. Nalainy avy tao amin'ny boatiny ny ampahan'ilay Fehezam-boninkazo Masina izay napetrany tamim-panajana teo amin'ny tany, ary avy eo dia nanakatonany ilay saron-tava dia nanomboka nandrovitra izany tany an-trano, nanampy azy izahay rehefa niasa.

en: “I want you to read the Burial Service.” She was interrupted by a deep groan from her husband; taking his hand in hers, she held it over her heart, and continued: “You must read it over me some day. Whatever may be the issue of all this fearful state of things, it will be a sweet thought to all or some of us. You, my dearest, will I hope read it, for then it will be in your voice in my memory for ever—come what may!”
vi: — Tôi xin mọi người hãy cầu siêu cho tôi ngay bây giờ. Jonathan bỗng nấc nghẹn một tiếng, khiến cho vợ anh bị ngắt lời. Cô nắm tay anh đặt vào lòng và nói tiếp: — Sẽ có ngày anh phải đọc lời cầu siêu cho em. Cho dù cuộc phiêu lưu này có kết cục như thế nào đi nữa thì đó cũng chỉ là một tín ngưỡng mà thôi. Người chồng thân yêu của tôi ơi, em hy vọng chính anh sẽ là người đọc lời cầu siêu cho em, chính giọng nói thân thương của anh sẽ khắc sâu trong hồi ức vĩnh cửu của em, cho dù đó là một vĩnh cửu như thế nào.
tr: “Cenaze töreninde okunan duayı okumanızı istiyorum.” Kocasının derin derin içini çekmesiyle sözü kesildi; kocasının elini ellerinin arasına alarak yüreğine götürdü ve sözlerini sürdürdü: “Onu bir gün bana okuyacaksınız. Olayların bu dehşet verici durumu nasıl sonlanırsa sonlansın, bu dua hepimiz -ya da bazılarımız- için tatlı bir düşünce olacak. Umarım sevgilim sen okursun, çünkü her ne olursa olsun hafızamda sonsuza dek senin sesinle yer alacak.
es: –Quiero que lean ustedes el Oficio de Difuntos. Un fuerte gemido de su esposo la interrumpió; tomó su mano entre las suyas, se la llevó al corazón y continuó: –Algún día tendrás que leerlo sobre mí, sea cual sea el final de este terrible estado de cosas. Será un pensamiento dulce para todos o para algunos de nosotros. Tú, amor mío, espero que serás quien lo lea, porque así será tu voz la que recuerde para siempre, pase lo que pase.
vi_translation: — I ask everyone to pray for my soul right now. Jonathan suddenly hiccuped, causing his wife to be interrupted. She took his hand, placed it on her lap, and continued: — There will come a day when you have to recite a prayer for my soul. No matter how this adventure ends, it is just a matter of faith. My dear husband, I hope it will be you who recites the prayer for my soul, that your beloved voice will be etched deeply in my eternal memory, no matter what kind of eternity it may be.
tr_translation: "I want you to read the prayer that was read at the funeral." Her words were interrupted by her husband's deep sigh; she took her husband's hand in hers, brought it to her heart, and continued: "You will read it to me one day. No matter how this horrifying situation ends, this prayer will be a sweet thought for all of us - or some of us. I hope you read it, my love, because no matter what, it will forever be etched in my memory with your voice."
es_translation: –I want you all to read the Office of the Dead. A strong groan from her husband interrupted her; she took his hand in hers, brought it to her heart, and continued: –Someday you will have to read it about me, whatever the end of this terrible state of affairs may be. It will be a sweet thought for all or for some of us. You, my love, I hope you will be the one to read it, because that way it will be your voice that is remembered forever, no matter what happens.
st: "Ke batla hore o bale lebitla." O ne a sitiswa ke ho feheloa ke ho bobola ho tebileng ho monna oa hae; 'Me o ile a nka letsoho la hae, 'me a mo tšoara ka pelong ea hae, 'me a re: "U tlameha ho e bala ka letsatsi le leng. Ntho efe kapa efe e ka 'nang ea e-ba taba ea boemo bona bohle bo tšabehang ba lintho, e tla ba mohopolo o monate ho bohle kapa ba bang ba rona. O, moratuoa oa ka, ke ts'epa hore o tla e bala, hobane ka nako eo e tla ba mohopolong oa hau ka ho sa feleng,+ tloo se ka etsahalang.+
yo: "Mo fẹ ki o ka iṣẹ isinku." Ó dá a dúró nípasẹ̀ ẹkún tó jinlẹ̀ láti ọ̀dọ̀ ọkọ rẹ̀; Ó mú ọwọ́ rẹ̀ sínú tirẹ̀, ó mú un mọ́ ọkàn rẹ̀, ó sì tẹ̀síwájú pé: "O gbọ́dọ̀ kà á lórí mi ní ọjọ́ kan. Ohunkóhun tí ó bá lè jẹ́ ọ̀rọ̀ gbogbo ipò ìbẹ̀rù àwọn nkan yìí, yóò jẹ́ èrò dídùn fún gbogbo ènìyàn tàbí díẹ̀ nínú wa. Ìwọ, olólùfẹ́ mi, ṣé mo máa retí láti kà á, nítorí nígbà náà yóò wà nínú ohùn rẹ nínú ìrántí mi títí láéláé - wá ohun tí ó lè wá!"
tn: 'Ke batla go bala lebitla' - I want you to read the burial service 'O ne a fegelwa ke monna wa gagwê' - She was interrupted by a deep groan from her husband O ne a tsaya seatla sa gagwe mo pelong ya gagwe mme a tswelela a re: "O tshwanetse go e bala ka letsatsi lengwe. Le fa e ka tswa e le kgang ya maemo otlhe a a boitshegang ano a a boitshegang, e tla nna mogopolo o montle mo go rona rotlhe kgotsa bangwe ba rona. 21Moratuwa wa ka, ke tla o bala, hobane lentswe la hao le tla nkgopola ka ho sa feleng!

mai: "हम चाहैत छी जे अहां दफन सेवा पढ़ू।" पतिक गहींर कराह सँ ओ बाधित भऽ गेलीह; हुनक हाथ अपन हाथमे लऽ कऽ ओ एकरा अपन हृदय पर पकड़ि लेलनि, आ आगू बढ़लीह: "अहाँकेँ एकरा हमरा ऊपर कोनो दिन जरूर पढ़बाक चाही। एहि सभटा भयभीत स्थितिक मुद्दा जे होइ, ई हममे सँ सभ वा किछु गोटेक लेल मधुर विचार होयत। अहाँ, हमर प्रियतम, की हम एकरा पढ़बाक आशा करब, किएक तखन ई हमर स्मृतिमे अहाँक आवाजमे सदाक लेल रहत-चाहे जे हो!"

en: “Now you shall speak. Tell us two dry men of science what you see with those so bright eyes.” He took her hand and held it whilst she spoke. His finger and thumb closed on her pulse, as I thought instinctively and unconsciously, as she spoke:—
vi: — Bây giờ, bà hãy nói đi, hãy nói cho chúng tôi biết bà thấy những gì trong ánh mắt long lanh kia đi. Ông khẽ đặt ngón tay cái và ngón trỏ lên cổ tay cô gái để bắt mạch, một cử chỉ như vô thức và theo bản năng của một thầy thuốc.
tr: “Şimdi siz konuşacaksınız. O ışıl ışıl gözlerle neler gördüğünüzü biz iki kuru bilimadamına anlatın.” ms Harker’ın elini ellerinin arasına aldı ve o konuşurken elini tuttu. ms Harker konuşurken, başparmağı ve işaret parmağıyla nabzını tutuyordu - ki bence bunu içgüdüsel olarak ve bilinçsizce yapmıştı.
es: –Ahora debe hablar. Díganos a nosotros, a dos hombres secos a ciencia, qué ve con esos ojos tan brillantes. Le tomó una mano y la sostuvo entre las suyas mientras hablaba. Su dedo índice y su pulgar se apoyaron en su pulso, pensé instintiva e inconscientemente, al tiempo que ella hablaba:
vi_translation: — Now, please speak, tell us what you see in those sparkling eyes. He gently placed his thumb and index finger on the girl's wrist to check her pulse, a gesture that seemed unconscious and instinctive for a physician.
tr_translation: “Now you will speak. Tell us two dry scientists what you saw with those sparkling eyes.” He took Ms. Harker's hand in his and held it as she spoke. While Ms. Harker was speaking, he was feeling her pulse with his thumb and forefinger - which I think he did instinctively and unconsciously.
es_translation: –Now you must speak. Tell us, two men thirsty for knowledge, what you see with those bright eyes. He took her hand and held it between his own while he spoke. His index finger and thumb rested on her pulse, I thought instinctively and unconsciously, as she spoke:
st: "Joale u tla bua. Re bolelle banna ba babeli ba omileng ba mahlale seo u se bonang ka mahlo a khanyang haholo. " A nka letsoho la hae, a e tshwara ha a ntse a bua. Ha a ntse a bua ka menoana ea hae le menoana ea hae, ke ne ke nahana ka tlhaho le ka mokhoa o sa tsebeng, joalo ka ha a ne a bua:
yo: "Nísinsin yìí, ìwọ yóò sọ̀rọ̀. Sọ fún wa àwọn ọkùnrin gbígbẹ sáyẹ́ǹsì méjì ohun tí o rí pẹ̀lú àwọn ojú tó mọ́lẹ̀. Ó mú ọwọ́ rẹ̀ ó sì mú un nígbà tí ó ń sọ̀rọ̀. Ìka àti ìka ọwọ́ rẹ̀ pa lórí ọpọlọ rẹ̀, bí mo ṣe ń ronú nípa ìmọ̀lára àti àìmọ̀kan, bí ó ṣe ń sọ̀rọ̀:-
tn: "Jwale, o tla bua. Re bolelele banna ba babedi ba ba omeletseng ba saense se o se bonang ka matlho a a phatsimang jaana." O ne a tsaya seatla a bo a se tshwara fa a ntse a bua. O ne a le mo tseleng e e neng e le mo teng ga gagwe, ke ne ke ikutlwa ke sa akanye sentle e bile a sa itse gore o ne a bua ka tsela e e gakgamatsang.
ty: " I teie nei, e parau oe. A parau mai ia matou e piti na taata ite ihi i te mea ta oe e ite ra e taua na mata anaana ra ". Ua rave a'era oia i to'na rima e ua tape'a a'era i te reira ma te ta'i. Ua tapiri to'na manimani rima e to'na manimani rima rahi i ni'a i to'na opu, a feruri noa ai au ma te papû e ma te ite ore, a parau ai oia e :—

en: “Then, as he is criminal he is selfish; and as his intellect is small and his action is based on selfishness, he confines himself to one purpose. That purpose is remorseless. As he fled back over the Danube, leaving his forces to be cut to pieces, so now he is intent on being safe, careless of all. So his own selfishness frees my soul somewhat from the terrible power which he acquired over me on that dreadful night. I felt it! Oh, I felt it! Thank God, for His great mercy! My soul is freer than it has been since that awful hour; and all that haunts me is a fear lest in some trance or dream he may have used my knowledge for his ends.” The Professor stood up:—
vi: — Thế này nhé, xét dưới góc độ tội phạm thì lão quả là một kẻ rất ích kỷ. Khi sự thông minh còn có hạn và hành động chỉ biết dựa vào tính ích kỷ, lão đã tạm bằng lòng với một mục đích duy nhất và không hề tỏ ra ăn năn hối lỗi. Ngay cả khi tái vượt sông Danube tấn công nước Thổ Nhĩ Kỳ một lần nữa, - khiến không biết bao nhiêu người lính của mình phải bỏ mạng nơi chiến trường - cho đến thất bại vừa rồi, lão cũng chỉ nghĩ đến việc làm sao trốn thoát và không hề nghĩ đến những việc còn lại. Chính sự ích kỷ đó đã ít nhiều giải phóng hồn tôi khỏi thứ quyền năng khủng khiếp mà lão đã ám vào tôi đêm nọ. Ơn Chúa, lúc này, tâm hồn tôi quả thực đã được tự do hơn. Chỉ còn một nỗi lo ám ảnh tôi: không hiểu trong lúc co vòi tìm nơi ẩn náu này, lão có tìm cách lấy thông tin qua tôi trong lúc tôi bị thôi miên không? — Có chứ, lão đã làm như vậy.
tr: “O zaman, suçlu olduğu için bencil; aklı küçük ve eylemleri bencilliğe dayandığı için kendini tek bir amaçla sınırlıyor. Bu amaç acımasız. Savaşçı güçlerini bozguna uğramaya terk ederek Tuna üzerinden kaçtığı gibi, hiçbir şeye dikkat etmeksizin güvende olmaya kararlı. Bu yüzden, kendi bencilliği beni, o korkunç gece üzerimde elde ettiği güçten kurtarıyor. Bunu hissediyordum, ah! Bunu hissediyordum. Merhameti için Tanrı’ya şükürler olsun! Ruhum, o korkunç saatten bu yana hiç olmadığı kadar özgür; peşimi bırakmayan tek şey, trans halindeyken ya da rüyada bilgilerimi kendi amaçları için kullanacağı korkusu.” Profesör ayağa kalktı:
es: –Entonces, como es criminal, es egoísta; y puesto que su intelecto es pequeño y sus actos están basados en el egoísmo, se limita a un fin. Ese propósito carece de remordimientos. Lo mismo que atravesó el Danubio, dejando que sus tropas fueran destrozadas, así, ahora, piensa en salvarse, sin que le importe otra cosa. Así, su propio egoísmo libera a mi alma, hasta cierto punto, del terrible poder que adquirió sobre mí aquella terrible noche. ¡Lo siento! ¡Oh, lo siento! ¡Gracias a Dios por su enorme misericordia! Mi alma está más libre que lo que lo ha estado nunca desde aquella hora terrible, y lo único que me queda es el temor de que en alguno de mis trances o sueños, haya podido utilizar mis conocimientos para sus fines. El profesor se puso en pie, y dijo:
vi_translation: — Here’s the thing, from the perspective of a criminal, he is indeed a very selfish person. When intelligence is limited and actions are solely based on selfishness, he temporarily settled for a single goal and showed no remorse. Even when he crossed the Danube again to attack Turkey once more, causing countless of his soldiers to die on the battlefield, up until his recent defeat, he only thought about how to escape and did not consider anything else. It is precisely this selfishness that has somewhat freed my soul from the terrible power he cast upon me that night. Thank God, at this moment, my soul is indeed freer. There is only one worry that haunts me: I wonder if, while hiding and seeking refuge, he tried to extract information from me while I was hypnotized? — Yes, he did. - Van Helsing replied. -
tr_translation: “Then, because he is guilty, he is selfish; because his mind is small and his actions are based on selfishness, he limits himself to a single purpose. This purpose is ruthless. Just as he abandoned his warrior forces to defeat and fled across the Danube, he is determined to be safe without paying attention to anything. Therefore, his own selfishness frees me from the power he gained over me on that dreadful night. I felt it, oh! I felt it. Thank God for His mercy! Since that dreadful hour, my soul has never been so free; the only thing that haunts me is the fear that he will use my knowledge for his own purposes while I am in a trance or dreaming.” The professor stood up:
es_translation: –Then, since he is a criminal, he is selfish; and since his intellect is small and his actions are based on selfishness, he is limited to one end. That purpose lacks remorse. Just as he crossed the Danube, letting his troops be destroyed, so now he thinks of saving himself, without caring about anything else. Thus, his own selfishness frees my soul, to some extent, from the terrible power he acquired over me that dreadful night. I am sorry! Oh, I am sorry! Thank God for His enormous mercy! My soul is freer than it has ever been since that terrible hour, and the only thing I fear is that in some of my trances or dreams, I may have used my knowledge for his purposes. The professor stood up and said:
st: "Ha a ntse a le boithati, o ntse a le boithati; Mme joalo ka ha ts'ebetso ea hae e nyane mme ketso ea hae e ipapisitse le boithati, o itlamme sepheo se le seng. Morero ona o ke ke oa ikoahlaea. Ha a ntse a baleha dane, a siea mabotho a hae ho khaola likotoana, kahoo joale o ikemiselitse ho lula a sireletsehile, a sa tsotelle bohle. Kahoo boithati ba hae bo lokolla moea oa ka ho tloha matla a tšabehang ao a fumaneng holim 'a ka bosiung boo bo tšabehang. I feelin' ho ho ho! Hahaha, I feelin' it! Kea leboha Molimo, ka mohau oa hae o moholo! Moea oa ka o lokolohile ho feta ho tloha ka hora eo e tšabehang; Le tsohle tse ntsamaisang ke tšabo ea tšabo, kapa toro, o ka be a sebelisitse tsebo ea ka bakeng sa lipheletsong tsa hae. Moprofesa o ile a ema a re:
yo: "Nígbà náà, bí ó ti jẹ́ ọ̀daràn ó jẹ́ ìmọtara-ẹni-nìkan; Àti pé bí ọgbọ́n rẹ̀ ṣe kéré tí ìgbésẹ̀ rẹ̀ sì dá lórí ìmọtara-ẹni-nìkan, ó fi ara rẹ̀ pamọ́ sí ìdí kan. Ète yẹn kò ronú pìwà dà. Bí ó ṣe sá padà lórí Danube, tí ó fi àwọn ọmọ ogun rẹ̀ sílẹ̀ láti gé sí ẹ̀yà, nítorí náà nísinsìnyí ó ní ìpinnu láti wà ní ààbò, láìṣọ́ra gbogbo rẹ̀. Nítorí náà ìmọtara-ẹni-nìkan tirẹ̀ dá ọkàn mi sílẹ̀ díẹ̀ kúrò lọ́wọ́ agbára burúkú tí ó gbà lórí mi ní alẹ́ ẹ̀rù yẹn. Mo ní ìmọ̀lára rẹ̀! Oh, Mo ní ìmọ̀lára rẹ̀! Ọpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Ọlọ́run, fún àánú ńlá rẹ̀! Ọkàn mi ní òmìnira ju bí ó ti wà láti wákàtí burúkú yẹn lọ; ati gbogbo awọn ti o haunts mi ni a iberu lest ni diẹ ninu awọn trance tabi ala o le ti lo imo mi fun awọn opin rẹ. " Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n náà dìde:-
tn: 13 [...]Jaaka a ne a le modiramolato, o a bo a le bogagapa; Le fa go ntse jalo, go na le dilo tse di sa tshwaneng le tse dingwe tse a di dirang e bile o na le boikgatshego jo bo sa tshwaneng le jwa gagwe, o ne a itewa ke bopelotshetlha. Boikaelelo joo ga bo na go ikwatlhaya. Fa a ne a le kwa morago, a tlogela masole a gagwe gore a se ka a kgaolwa, ka jalo o batla go nna a babalesegile, a sa tlhokomele botlhe. Ka jalo, bopelotshetlha jwa gagwe bo golola moya wa me mo nonofong e e boitshegang e a e boneng mo bosigong joo jo bo boitshegang. Ke ne ke ikutlwa jalo! Ke ne ke ikutlwa jalo! Re leboga Modimo, ka boutlwelo-botlhoko jo bogolo! 10Moya wa ka o lokolotswe go feta ka nako eo; Le fa go ntse jalo, go ka tswa go na le sengwe se ke se dirang gore ke se ka nna ka nna le poifo e kgolo mo go nna ka ntlha ya dilo tse a di dirileng kgotsa tse di sa ntseng di dira gore ke se ka nna ka di dira gore ke nne le kitso e e molemo." Master: Go Go Gadget
ty: " No reira, mai te au i to'na iho huru mau, e mea haapa'o noa oia ia'na iho ; e no te iti o to'na maramarama e ua niuhia ta'na ohipa i ni'a i te pipiri, e tape'a noa oia ia'na iho i ni'a i te hoê tumu. Aita e hopearaa to taua opuaraa ra. A horo ai oia i muri na nia i te mou'a o te mau mou'a, ma te vaiiho i to ' na mau nuu ia tâpû - hu'ahu'a - hia, te hinaaro ra ïa oia i teie nei e paruru ia ' na, ma te haapao ore i te mau mea atoa. No reira, na to'na iho miimii i faaora i to'u varua i te mana ri'ari'a tei roaa ia'na i ni'a ia'u i taua pô ri'ari'a ra. Ua ite au i te reira ! Auê, ua ite au i te reira ! Mauruuru e te Atua, no To'na aroha rahi ! E mea tiamâ a'e to'u varua i to taua hora ri'ari'a ra; e te mea noa e haape'ape'a nei ia'u o te hoê ïa mata'u o te ore roa e mo'ehia ia'u e aore râ, i roto i te hoê moemoea, ua faaohipa paha oia i to'u ite no ta'na mau opuaraa ". Ua ti'a a'era te orometua haapii i ni'a:—
mai: "तखन, जेना ओ अपराधी छथि ओ स्वार्थी छथि; आ चूँकि हुनक बुद्धि छोट अछि आ हुनक कर्म स्वार्थ पर आधारित अछि, तेँ ओ अपनाकेँ एकटा उद्देश्य धरि सीमित रखैत छथि। ओ उद्देश्य पश्चातापहीन अछि। जेना-जेना ओ डेन्यूबक उपर भागि गेलाह, अपन सेनाकेँ टुकड़ा-टुकड़ा कऽ देलनि, तेँ आब ओ सभसँ सुरक्षित, लापरवाह रहबाक इरादा रखैत छथि। तेँ हुनक अपन स्वार्थ हमर आत्माकेँ ओहि भयानक शक्तिसँ किछु हद धरि मुक्त करैत अछि जे ओ ओहि भयानक रातिमे हमरा पर प्राप्त कयलनि। हम महसूस केलहुं! ओह, हम महसूस केलहुं! भगवान के धन्यवाद, हुनकर महान दया के लेल! हमर आत्मा ओहि भयानक घड़ी सं बेसी मुक्त अछि। आ जे किछु हमरा सताबैत अछि ओ एकटा भय अछि जे कोनो ट्रान्स या सपनामे ओ हमर ज्ञानक उपयोग अपन उद्देश्यक लेल कऽ सकैत छथि।" प्रोफेसर ठाढ़ भए गेलाह:-
mg: "Ary amin' izany, amin' ny maha-mpanao heloka bevava azy dia tia tena izy; Ary satria kely ny faharanitan-tsainy ary mifototra amin'ny fitiavan-tena ny zavatra ataony, dia mametra ny tenany ho amin'ny tanjona iray izy. Tsy misy nenina izany tanjona izany. Rehefa nandositra an'i Danube izy, namela ny tafiny ho tapaka, noho izany dia mikasa ny ho voaro sy tsy hitandrina ny rehetra izy ankehitriny. Noho izany, ny fitiavan-tenany manokana dia manafaka ny fanahiko amin'ny hery mahatsiravina izay azony tamiko tamin'io alina mahatsiravina io. Tsapako izany! Tena tsapako izany! Misaotra an'Andriamanitra, noho ny famindram-pony lehibe! Ny fanahiko dia afaka kokoa noho izay efa nisy hatramin' izay ora mahatsiravina izay; ary izay rehetra manenjika ahy dia tahotra sao ho nampiasàny ny fahalalako ho amin'ny zava-bitany na tamin'ny nofy. en: “All is dark. I hear water swirling by, level with my ears, and the creaking of wood on wood. Cattle low far off. There is another sound, a queer one like——” She stopped and grew white, and whiter still.
vi: — Tất cả tối om. Tôi nghe có tiếng nước xoáy tầm ngang tai, tiếng gỗ va gỗ lộc cộc. Thấp hơn là tiếng súc vật kêu từ xa vọng tới. Còn một âm thanh khác, kỳ lạ... phải nói là... Cô lại chợt im bặt, mặt mày mỗi lúc một xanh mét. — Còn gì nữa, âm thanh gì nữa?
vi_results: "title": "Trăng sáng trên vườn rau", "author": "Nguyễn Nhật Ánh"
tr: “Her yer karanlık. Kulaklarımla aynı hizadaki suyun sesini ve birbirlerine sürten tahtanın gıcırtısını duyuyorum. Uzaklarda sığır böğürtüsü. Başka bir ses daha var, tuhaf bir ses; sanki...” Durdu ve rengi gittikçe bembeyaz oldu.
es: –Todo está oscuro. Siento pasar el agua cerca de mis orejas, al mismo nivel, y el raspar de madera contra madera. Oigo ganado a lo lejos. Hay otro sonido, uno muy extraño, como… Guardó silencio y se puso pálida, intensamente pálida.
vi_translation: — It's all pitch dark. I hear the sound of swirling water at ear level, the clattering of wood against wood. Lower down is the sound of animals crying from afar. And another sound, strange... I must say... She suddenly fell silent, her face growing increasingly pale. — What else, what other sound?
tr_translation: “Everywhere is dark. I hear the sound of water at the same level as my ears and the creaking of wood rubbing against each other. In the distance, the bellowing of cattle. There is another sound, a strange sound; as if...” He stopped and his face turned completely white.
es_translation: –Everything is dark. I feel the water passing close to my ears, at the same level, and the scraping of wood against wood. I hear cattle in the distance. There is another sound, a very strange one, like... She fell silent and turned pale, intensely pale.
st: Tsohle li lefifi. Ke utloa metsi a ntse a lla ka litsebe tsa ka, le ho hlatsuoa ha patsi patsi. Likhomo tsa hau li fokola haholo. Ho na le molumo o mong, queer e 'ngoe e kang ena.'".'" O ile a ema 'me a tsoela pele ho ba tšoeu, 'me a ntse a tšoeu.

en: “I’ll be tellin’ ye quick!” he answered, and, stepping down to his cabin, produced a receipt signed “Immanuel Hildesheim.” Burgen-strasse 16 was the address. We found out that this was all the Captain knew; so with thanks we came away.
vi: — Tôi sẽ nói để ngài biết ngay đây... Viên thuyền trưởng bước xuống cabin lấy một tờ giấy biên nhận có chữ ký Emmanue! Hildesheim, số 16, Burgenstrasse. Biết là không thể biết thêm được thông tin nào từ viên thuyền trưởng, chúng tôi bèn cảm ơn ông rồi tiếp tục lên đường.
tr: “Size çabucak söyleyeceğim!” diye yanıtladı kaptan ve kamarasına inerek “Immanuel Heildesheim” tarafından imzalanmış bir alındı belgesi getirdi. Adres, Burgenstraße, 16 numaraydı. Kaptanın tüm bildiğinin bu kadar olduğunu anladık; böylece teşekkür ederek oradan ayrıldık.
tr_results: "title": "The Shadow of the Wind", "author": "Carlos Ruiz Zafón"
es: –¡Voy a decírselo enseguida! – respondió y, bajando a su camarote, nos mostró un recibo firmado por "Immanuel Hildesheim". La dirección era Burgenstrasse 16. Descubrimos que eso era todo lo que conocía el capitán, de modo que le dimos las gracias, y nos fuimos.
vi_translation: — I will tell you right away... The captain stepped down to the cabin to get a receipt signed by Emmanue! Hildesheim, number 16, Burgenstrasse. Knowing that we couldn't get any more information from the captain, we thanked him and continued on our way.
tr_translation: “I will tell you quickly!” replied the captain, and he went down to his cabin and brought back a receipt signed by “Immanuel Heildesheim.” The address was Burgenstraße, number 16. We understood that this was all the captain knew; thus, we thanked him and left.
es_translation: –I'm going to tell him right away! – he replied and, going down to his cabin, showed us a receipt signed by "Immanuel Hildesheim". The address was Burgenstrasse 16. We discovered that this was all the captain knew, so we thanked him and left.
st: "Ke tla o bolella kapele!" a rialo, a hata ka kamoreng ya hae, a hlahisa rasiti e saennoeng, "Immanuel Hildesheim." 16-16 ʻO ka ʻae ʻana o ka hoʻoholo ʻana. Re ile ra hlokomela hore sena ke sohle seo Mookameli oa rona a neng a se tseba; Thanks, re ile ra tsamaea.
yo: Ó dáhùn pé, "Mo máa sọ fún ọ ní kíákíá!" ó dáhùn, àti pé, ó fi ẹsẹ̀ sílẹ̀ lọ sí àgọ́ rẹ̀, ó ṣe ìwé ìwọlé tí wọ́n buwọ́lù "Immanuel Hildesheim." Burgen-strasse 16 ni àdírẹ́sì náà. A ríi pé gbogbo ohun tí Ọ̀gágun mọ̀ nìyí; Nítorí náà pẹ̀lú ìdúpẹ́ tí a ti ṣí lọ.
tn: "Ke tla go bolelela ka bonako!" ga araba Speedy, mme a fofela kwa kamoreng ya gagwe, a ntsha pônô ya gagwe e e saenilweng e e reng:"Imanuel Hildesheim." 16-16 Go Go Gadget! Re ne ra lemoga gore seno sotlhe se ne se le teng, e ne e le go itse gore ke eng se se neng se siame. Thanks We're Gone

en: I knew that there were at least three graves to find—graves that are inhabit; so I search, and search, and I find one of them. She lay in her Vampire sleep, so full of life and voluptuous beauty that I shudder as though I have come to do murder. Ah, I doubt not that in old time, when such things were, many a man who set forth to do such a task as mine, found at the last his heart fail him, and then his nerve. So he delay, and delay, and delay, till the mere beauty and the fascination of the wanton Un-Dead have hypnotise him; and he remain on and on, till sunset come, and the Vampire sleep be over. Then the beautiful eyes of the fair woman open and look love, and the voluptuous mouth present to a kiss—and man is weak. And there remain one more victim in the Vampire fold; one more to swell the grim and grisly ranks of the Un-Dead!...
vi: Tôi biết mình cần phải phát hiện ra ít nhất là ba nấm mồ - ba nấm mồ có người nằm. Vì thế, nhiệm vụ đầu tiên là phải xục xạo, xục xạo, cho tới khi phát hiện ra một ả đang nằm ườn trong giấc ngủ của “ma cà rồng”, thân xác tràn đầy nhựa sống và toát lên một vẻ đẹp nhục dục khiến tôi rùng mình như tưởng mình sắp phạm tội đến nơi. Thế đấy! Tôi dám chắc rằng nếu rơi vào tình cảnh như tôi, thế nào cũng có kẻ rạo rực trong lòng để rồi đánh mất cả lý trí của một người đàn ông. Anh ta sẽ chần chừ, chần chừ, chần chừ cho tới khi bị cái sắc đẹp quyến rũ đầy ma lực của ả đàn bà kia hút hết hồn; rồi anh ta sẽ đờ đẫn, đờ đẫn, đờ đẫn cho tới khi ông mặt trời chìm vào giấc ngủ và thế là bóng ma tỉnh dậy. Người đàn bà trẻ đẹp sẽ mở to đôi mắt chan chứa khát vọng yêu đương, đôi môi mọng đỏ nhục dục sẽ đặt vào đâu đó trên cơ thể anh ta một nụ hôn đê mê, và thế là gã đàn ông trong anh ta sẽ biến mất dần. Vậy là thêm một nạn nhân trở thành kẻ đồng lõa của quỷ dữ, thêm một kẻ trong đội quân hắc ám đáng sợ của những kẻ bất tử!...
tr: Bulunacak en az üç mezar olduğunu biliyordum, kullanılan mezarlar; bu yüzden, aradım, aradım ve birini buldum. Vampir uykusundaydı; öyle yaşam dolu ve bedensel istek uyandıran bir güzelliğe sahipti ki, sanki cinayet işlemeye gelmişim gibi ürperdim. Ah! Eski günlerde, böyle şeyler olurken, benimki gibi bir görevi yerine getirmek üzere yola çıkan pek çok erkeğin, sonunda yüreğinin ve ardından da sinirinin onu yarı yolda bıraktığını anladığına kuşkum yok. Böylece, hafifmeşrep Ölü Olmayan onu hipnotize edene kadar görevini erteleyip durur ve günbatımı gelip Vampir’in uykusu sonra erene kadar orada bekler, bekler. Sonra, o alımlı kadının güzel gözleri açılır, sevgiyle bakar ve şehvetli dudaklarını öpücük için sunar; erkek ise güçsüzdür. Böylece vampir sürüsüne bir kurban daha katılır; Ölü Olmayanların acımasız ve tüyler ürpertici safları bir kişi daha artar.
es: Sabía que había al menos tres tumbas que encontrar, las cuales estaban habitadas. De modo que busqué sin descanso, y encontré una de ellas. Estaba tendida en su sueño de vampiro, tan llena de vida y de voluptuosa belleza que me estremecí, como si me dispusiera a cometer un crimen. No pongo en duda que, en la antigüedad, a muchos hombres que se disponían a llevar a cabo una tarea como la mía les fallaran el corazón y los nervios. Por consiguiente, se retrasaba hasta que la misma belleza de la muerta viva lo hipnotizaba; y se quedaba allí, hasta que llegaba la puesta del sol y cesaba el sueño del vampiro. Entonces, los hermosos ojos de la mujer vampiro se abrían y lo miraban llenos de amor, y los labios voluptuosos se entreabrían para besar… El hombre es débil. Así había una víctima más en la guarida del vampiro; ¡uno más que engrosaba las filas terribles de los muertos vivos…!
vi_translation: I know I need to discover at least three graves - three graves with people lying in them. Therefore, the first task is to search, search, until I find a woman lying sprawled in the sleep of a "vampire," her body full of vitality and exuding a sensual beauty that makes me shudder as if I am about to commit a crime. That's it! I am sure that if someone were in my situation, they would feel a stirring in their heart and lose all the rationality of a man. He would hesitate, hesitate, hesitate until the enchanting beauty of that woman drains his soul; then he would become dazed, dazed, dazed until the sun goes to sleep and the ghost awakens. The young beautiful woman would open her eyes full of yearning for love, her luscious red lips would place a passionate kiss somewhere on his body, and the man within him would gradually disappear. Thus, another victim becomes an accomplice of the devil, another one in the terrifying dark army of the immortals!...
tr_translation: I knew there were at least three graves to be found, used graves; so, I searched, searched, and found one. The vampire was in its sleep; it had such a beauty so full of life and bodily desire that I shuddered as if I had come to commit murder. Ah! In the old days, when such things happened, I have no doubt that many men who set out to fulfill a duty like mine eventually realized that their hearts and then their nerves failed them halfway. Thus, they would keep postponing their duty until the frivolous Undead hypnotized them, and they would wait, wait there until sunset and the Vampire’s sleep ended. Then, the beautiful eyes of that charming woman would open, look lovingly, and offer her lustful lips for a kiss; the man would be powerless. Thus, another victim would join the vampire horde; the merciless and terrifying ranks of the Undead would increase by one more.
es_translation: I knew there were at least three graves to find, which were inhabited. So I searched tirelessly, and I found one of them. She was lying in her vampire sleep, so full of life and voluptuous beauty that I shuddered, as if I were about to commit a crime. I do not doubt that, in ancient times, many men who were about to undertake a task like mine had their hearts and nerves fail them. Consequently, it was delayed until the very beauty of the undead woman hypnotized him; and he stayed there until sunset came and the vampire's sleep ceased. Then, the beautiful eyes of the vampire woman opened and looked at him full of love, and the voluptuous lips parted to kiss... Man is weak. Thus, there was one more victim in the vampire's lair; one more that swelled the terrible ranks of the undead...!
st: Ke ne ke tseba hore ho na le bonyane mabitla a mararo a ho fumana li-otas tse nang le baahi; Kahoo ke batla, 'me ke fumana e' ngoe ea tsona. O ile a robala borokong ba hae ba vampire, a tletse bophelo le botle bo thata hoo ke neng ke le motle joalo ka ha eka ke tlil'o etsa polao. Oho, ha ke belaele hore nakong ea khale, ha lintho tse joalo li ne li le teng, monna ea neng a ikemiselitse ho etsa mosebetsi o joalo joalo ka oa ka, o fumanoeng qetellong pelo ea hae e mo hloleha, ebe oa hae oa moahela. Kahoo a lieha, 'me a liehe, 'me a liehe, ho fihlela botle feela le ho lisoa ke motho ea sa shoeng bafu ba hypnotise mo. 'Me o lula, ho fihlela letsatsi le likela, le vampire robala. Joale mahlo a matle a mosali ea hlokang leeme a buleha 'me a sheba lerato,+ 'me molomo o nonneng o hlahisang kako++ 'me monna o fokola. 'Me ho na le e' ngoe ea lihlatsitsi tse eketsehileng ka har'a li-vampire fold; ʻO ka hoʻohaʻana i ka ʻo Un-Dead...
yo: Mo mọ̀ pé ó kéré tán ibojì mẹ́ta ló wà láti rí - ibojì tí wọ́n ń gbé; Nítorí náà mo wá a kiri, mo sì wá ọ̀kan nínú wọn. Ó dùbúlẹ̀ nínú oorun Vampire rẹ̀, ó kún fún ìgbésí ayé àti ẹwà ńlá débi pé mo bẹ̀rù bí ẹni pé mo ti wá ṣe ìpànìyàn. Ah, Mi ò ṣiyèméjì pé ní àtijọ́, nígbà tí irú nkan bẹ́ẹ̀ jẹ́, ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọkùnrin tí ó ṣètò láti ṣe irú iṣẹ́ bẹ́ẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bíi tèmi, tí wọ́n rí i ní ìgbẹ̀yìn ọkàn rẹ̀ kùnà fún un, lẹ́yìn náà iṣan rẹ̀. Nítorí náà ó ṣe ìdádúró, àti ìdádúró, títí tí ẹwà kan ṣoṣo àti ìfẹ́ àwọn tí kò ní òkú yóò fi mú un bínú; ó sì dúró lórí àti pé ó ń lọ, títí ìwọ̀ oòrùn yóò fi dé, àti pé oorun Vampire náà yóò parí. Lẹ́yìn náà ojú obìnrin tó rẹwà náà ṣí sílẹ̀ tí ó sì jọ ìfẹ́, ẹnu ńlá náà sì wà fún ìfẹnukonu - ọkùnrin kò sì lágbára. Àti pé ẹnìkan ṣì wà tí ó ṣẹlẹ̀ nínú vampire fold; Ọ̀kan sí i láti ṣe àfikún àwọn ipò burúkú àti burúkú ti Un-Dead...
tn: Ke ne ke itse gore go ne go na le diphupu tse tharo tse di ka nnang teng fa go na le diphupu tse di ka nnang teng. Ke batla, mme ke fumana e nngwe ya tsona. O ne a robetse, a bo a tletse bontle jwa me le bontle jo bo maswe jo ke bo dirileng gore ke se ka dira gore ke se ka ka nna le motho yo o neng a le mo go yone. Ke belaela gore mo motlheng wa bogologolo, fa dilo tse di ntseng jalo di ne di le dintsi, monna mongwe yo o neng a dira tiro e e ntseng jalo jaaka nna, yo o fitlhetsweng mo pelong ya gagwe ya bofelo, mme morago ga moo a mo tlogela. A diega, a diega, a diega, go fitlha bontle bo bo monate, le go kgatlhiwa ke yo o sa mo rateng. O ne a tswelela pele, go fitlha letsatsi le phirima, le fa letsatsi le phirima, le fa go ntse jalo, le fa letsatsi le phirima, le fa go ntse jalo, le fa go ntse jalo 18Foo matlho a mosadi yo o siameng a a bona lorato, mme molomo o o monate o o nang le kwa morago ga katla, mme motho o bokoa. 15 Go setse go na le motho yo o sa tlholeng a le mo go lone; Go go to the gros un-and-the-one of the un-dead...
ty: Ua ite au e te vai nei e toru a'e menema e ti'a ia imihia—te mau menema e vai nei; no reira te imi nei au, e te ma'imi nei, e te ite nei au i te hoê o te reira mau mea. Ua tarava noa oia i roto i to'na ro'i Vampire, tei î roa i te ora e te nehenehe, e ua ri'ari'a roa vau mai te huru ra e, ua taparahi pohe roa vau ia'na. Aita vau e feaa nei e, i te tau tahito ra, a tupu ai taua mau mea ra, e rave rahi taata tei opua i te rave i te hoê ohipa mai ta'u i hinaaro, tei ite i te pae hopea i to'na aau i te oreraa e haapa'o ia'na, e i muri iho, to'na inoino. No reira, e faataere oia, e faataime, e e faataere, e tae roa'tu i te taime e riro ai te nehenehe e te mana'o anaanatae o te taata faatupu i te parau hau ei faainoraa ia'na ; e ua faaea noa oia, e tae noa'tu i te taperaa mahana, e ua hope te taoto Vampire. I reira te mata nehenehe o te vahine nehenehe e araara ai e e hi'o ai i te here, e te vaha anaana e vai ra i roto i te hoê apa—e e paruparu te tane. E te vai noa ra hoê taata i roto i te Vampire ; te tahi faahou no te faarahi i te mau mana'o ri'ari'a e te ri'ari'a o te mau taata tei ore i pohe...
mai: हम जनैत छलहुं जे कम सँ कम तीनटा कब्र भेटबाक अछि - कब्र जे निवास करैत अछि; त हम खोजैत छी, आ खोजैत छी, आ हमरा ओहिमे सं एकटा भेटैत अछि। ओ अपन पिशाच निद्रामे पड़ल छलीह, जीवन आ स्वैच्छिक सुन्दरतासँ एतेक भरल छलीह जे हम काँपि जाइत छी जेना हम हत्या करय लेल आयल छी। आह, हमरा संदेह नहि अछि जे पुरान समयमे, जखन एहन काज छल, बहुत रास आदमी जे हमर सन काज करबाक लेल निकलल, देखलक जे अन्ततः ओकर हृदय ओकरा विफल कऽ देलक, आ फेर हुनक तंत्रिका। तेँ ओ देरी करैत अछि, आ देरी करैत अछि, जा धरि मात्र सुन्दरता आ अवांछित अन-डेडक मोह ओकरा सम्मोहित नहि कऽ दैत अछि; आ ओ सूर्यास्त आबए धरि रहैत छथि, आ पिशाच सुतैत रहैत छथि। तखन गोरी स्त्रीक सुन्दर आँखि खुलैत अछि आ प्रेम देखैत अछि, आ स्वैच्छिक मुँह चुम्बनक लेल उपस्थित होइत अछि - आ पुरुष कमजोर भऽ जाइत अछि। आ वैम्पायर फोल्ड मे एकटा आओर शिकार बनल अछि; अन-डेड के गंभीर आ भयानक रैंक के फुलाबए के लेल एकटा आउर...
mg: Fantatro fa misy fasana telo farafahakeliny tokony ho hita—fasana izay misy mponina; Ka dia nikaroka sy nikaroka aho, dia nahita ny iray tamin'izy ireo. Natory tao amin'ny Vampire izy, feno fiainana sy hatsaran-tarehy be dia be ka nihorohoro aho toy ny hoe tonga hamono olona. Ah, tsy isalasalako fa tamin'ny andro fahiny, rehefa nisy ny zavatra toy izany, dia maro ireo lehilahy izay nanapa-kevitra ny hanao asa toy ny ahy, nahita tamin'ny farany fa reraka ny fony, ary avy eo ny hozany. Ka dia mitaredretra sy mitaredretra ary mitaredretra izy mandra-piposaky ny hatsaran-tarehy sy ny fitiavan'ny olona tsy manan-tsiny azy; ary mitoera ao izy, mandra-pahazavan'ny masoandro, ary ho tapitra ny torimason'ny Vampire. Avy eo ny maso tsara tarehy ny vehivavy tsara tarehy misokatra sy mijery ny fitiavana, ary ny vonton'ny vava ankehitriny ny oroka-ary ny olona malemy. Ary mbola misy iray hafa ihany koa ny niharam-boina ao amin'ny vala Vampire; Mbola misy ihany koa ny mampiaka-danja ny isan'ny tsy maty sy ny tsy maty...

en: “Come!” she said, “come away from this awful place! Let us go to meet my husband who is, I know, coming towards us.” She was looking thin and pale and weak; but her eyes were pure and glowed with fervour. I was glad to see her paleness and her illness, for my mind was full of the fresh horror of that ruddy vampire sleep.
vi: — Lại đây đi, - Cô bảo tôi, giọng đau đớn khiến tôi không thể cầm lòng - chúng ta sẽ cùng nhau rời khỏi cái nơi đáng sợ này. Cần phải tới gặp nhà tôi. Tôi biết anh ấy đang hướng về phía chúng ta mà. Trông cô gầy rộc, nước da xanh mét, tiều tụy hẳn đi, chỉ còn đôi mắt là vẫn trong sáng long lanh. Tôi cảm thấy vui khi nhận ra cái xanh xao và nỗi ưu phiền của cô, bởi chỉ mới đây thôi, tôi còn bị ám ảnh bởi nỗi ghê sợ giấc ngủ li bì của “ma cà rồng” trong cô.
tr: “Gelin!” dedi, “gelin, bu korkunç yerden uzaklaşalım! Bize doğru geldiğini bildiğim kocamla buluşmaya gidelim.” Zayıf, solgun ve güçsüz görünüyordu, ama gözleri saftı ve coşkuyla parlıyordu. Solgunluğunu ve hastalığını gördüğüme memnun oldum, çünkü zihnim al yanaklı vampir uykusuna ilişkin taze korkularla doluydu.
es: –¡Vámonos! – dijo-. ¡Alejémonos de este horrible lugar! Vamos a salir al encuentro de mi esposo, que ya está en camino hacia nosotros; lo sé. Tenía un aspecto frágil, pálido y débil, pero sus ojos estaban puros y brillaban con fervor. Estaba contento de ver su palidez y su aspecto enfermizo, ya que mi mente estaba todavía llena del horror producido al ver aquel sueño de las mujeres vampiros.
vi_translation: — Come here, - She told me, her voice so painful that I couldn't help but feel moved - we will leave this dreadful place together. We need to go meet my husband. I know he is heading towards us. She looked emaciated, her skin was pale, and she appeared haggard, with only her eyes remaining clear and sparkling. I felt happy when I noticed her paleness and sorrow, because not long ago, I was haunted by the terrifying thought of the "vampire" sleep within her.
tr_translation: “Come!” she said, “come, let's get away from this dreadful place! Let's go meet my husband, whom I know is coming towards us.” She looked weak, pale, and frail, but her eyes were pure and shone with enthusiasm. I was glad to see her paleness and illness, because my mind was filled with fresh fears about the rosy-cheeked vampire's sleep.
es_translation: –Let's go! – he said-. Let's get away from this horrible place! We are going to meet my husband, who is already on his way to us; I know it. He had a fragile, pale, and weak appearance, but his eyes were pure and shone with fervor. I was glad to see his paleness and sickly appearance, as my mind was still filled with the horror produced by seeing that dream of the vampire women.
st: 'Me a re ho eena, "Tlohang ho sebaka sena se tšabehang! A re yeng ho ya kopana le monna wa ka eo e leng, ke a tseba, a tle ho rona." O ne a shebahala a le masesane, a fokola; Empa mahlo a hae a ne a hloekile 'me a phatsima ka fervour. Ke ne ke thabetse ho bona pale ea hae le bokuli ba hae, hobane kelello ea ka e ne e tletse tšabo e ncha ea vampire eo e robetseng.
yo: Ó sọ pé, "Wá!" ó sọ pé, "Wá kúrò ní ibi burúkú yìí! Jẹ́ kí á lọ pàdé ọkọ mi tí ó jẹ́, mo mọ̀, tí ó ń bọ̀ wá sí ọ̀dọ̀ wa." Ó fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ fẹ Ṣùgbọ́n ojú rẹ̀ mọ́ tónítóní ó sì ń dán pẹ̀lú ìtara. Inú mi dùn láti rí àwọ̀ rẹ̀ àti àìsàn rẹ̀, nítorí ọkàn mi kún fún ìbẹ̀rù tuntun ti oorun vampire ruddy yẹn.
tn: O ne a re: "Tswang mo lefelong leno le le bosula! A re yeng go kopana le monna wa me yo e leng ene, ke a itse gore o tla tla kwa go rona." O ne a lebega a le mokima e bile a le bokoa. Le fa go ntse jalo, matlho a gagwe a ne a le phepa e bile a phatsima ka go phatsima. Ke ne ke itumetse thata go bona bolwetse jwa gagwe le bolwetse jwa gagwe, ka ntlha ya gore tlhaloganyo ya me e ne e le e e tshosang e e sa tswang go robala mo go yone.

en: “I am only too happy to have been of any service! Oh, God!” he cried suddenly, struggling up to a sitting posture and pointing to me, “It was worth for this to die! Look! look!”
vi: — Tôi cảm thấy rất vinh hạnh vì đã làm được một điều gì đó. Ôi! Chúa ơi, - Anh thốt lên và chợt dựng người dậy chỉ vào tôi - cho dù tôi có phải chết cũng không có gì phải hối tiếc! Xem kìa, mọi người nhìn xem kìa?
tr: “İşe yaramış olmaktan ötürü çok mutluyum! Ah, Tanrım!” diye bağırdı birdenbire; oturmak için doğrulmaya çabalayarak ve bana bir şey göstererek, “Bunun için ölmeye değerdi! Bakın! Bakın!”
es: –¡Estoy feliz de haber sido útil! ¡Oh, Dios! – gritó repentinamente, esforzándose en sentarse y señalándome-. ¿Vale la pena morir por eso? ¡Miren! ¡Miren!
vi_translation: — I feel very honored to have accomplished something. Oh! My God, - He exclaimed and suddenly sat up, pointing at me - even if I have to die, I have no regrets! Look, everyone, look!
tr_translation: “I am so happy to have been of use!” “Oh, my God!” he suddenly shouted; struggling to sit up and showing me something, “It was worth dying for this! Look! Look!”
es_translation: –I am happy to have been useful! Oh, God! – he suddenly shouted, struggling to sit up and pointing at me-. Is it worth dying for that? Look! Look!
